review: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds. Battle Royale. Jumping out of planes parachuting into a vast empty state with many great loot and weapon options everywhere. Claiming loot before the 100 other players just like you. Sharing attachments with friends or hording them all for yourself just in case you get that Kar 98k. What's not to like?The physics of PUBG are amazing. Without a doubt the best FPS/TPS experience I have had among the genre recently. Occasionally the vehicles glitch but I'm sure that will be fixed soon. My biggest request recently would be adding an offline play mode with AI as your opponents. This would be great for playing when the servers are down or when you are just trying to figure some basic things out.The biggest issue I've had with the game is the amount of cheaters who have surfaced with the official release of the game. Until the game was officially released it was great fun to hop into a game with friends or by yourself and fight shoot and claw your way to getting that Chicken Dinner. However recently I have not had a single death by someone who wasnt across the map shooting through walls hills trees and cars to headshot me 4 times in a row with a fully automatic rifle.With that problem in mind I am hopeful it is swiftly remedied and I can head back in and enjoy my murderous rampage. All in all definitely worth the $40.00 purchase. Especially should they add in an offline mode and get rid of the aimbot/cheat/hacks.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Game is being ruined by hackers and poor servers. These can be easily fixed with regionlock and such but no they just use our money to release an even work console version. I originally recommended this game but the hackers and worsening performance has flipped me. If the devs atleast put region lock into the game then i'll adjust my review with recommendation but I can't recommend this "Get ed by Hackers Simulator"(Original Review Below)So much fun especially with friends. It can be an adjustment when you start playing the game if you havent played games like ARMA or H1Z1. If not you'll have no problem with controls. This game and the community constantly throw new experiences at you even if you drop in the same general area at the beginning of matches. I think any gamer who likes survival type games needs to experience this game and do it with atleast one friend.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Update 5/13/17Optimization has gotten a lot better. Haven't noticed any frame skipping anymore or rubberbanding. In general things have gotten a lot smoother.Still not a huge fan of the circle speed/timings...but I think I can live with it since everything else in the game has become a lot more playable. Also Devs have added cool things like custom matches. Started playing this game more in Duos than Solo and having a lot more fun that way. So I've changed my recommendation from a No to a Yes.Pre 5/13/17Can't recommend this game in its current state. Optimization is insanely bad frame skipping with a top of the line rig... combine that with rubberbanding servers and you sometimes have games where it's near impossible to hit anybody consistently. Audio cues in general are pretty bad as well. The circle timings seem really poorly thought out. So many games I've played running simulator for the entire game. You don't have time to engage in any fights in between phases or you risk dying very quickly in the "gas".I know optimization updates and other changes are in the pipeline... so I can revise my recommendation if those prove to improve quality of life across the board. The Battle Royale genre has such potential... but I think PUBG misses the mark just like H1Z1. Looking forward to what Islands of Nyne can bring to the table. This genre really needs a AAA developer polish. If only Valve or Blizzard would pick it up.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

I was very worried about the bugs that I always hear about and while there might be a few minor ones I wasn't hampered by any. My only gripe is that the game punishes anyone with a computer powerful enough to run it on ultra as the framerate and graphics are fine but my visibility is terrible compared to players with low settings and no foliage. Which means in order to have less of a disadvantage in the game I have to play on reduced settings making the game look worse than I would like.

review: I just recently changed my review since improvements have been made to the game. The game is now better optimised additional features have been added and the rampid cheating problem has been limited (so far). This is honestly an amazing game. A well deserved win is one of the most rewarding and exhilarating moments in any game I have played. My previous review is listed below to reference my frustration from before. My friends and I started to enjoy this game for a few days until we started getting killed by cheating players. The community seems to believe its Chinese hackers and idgaf who it is this game is not playable if u consider yourself a somewhat competitive player and actually want to try and win the game. Getting shot from 300 yards away by a full auto AR in hip fire happens to frequently for me. Now that kill cams are visible it seems we get killed by blatant hackers about 50% of the time. Also you'll see these hackers with crazy numbers letters or Chinese BS names. So if youre stupid enough to buy the game at its current state (like I was) than look out for that. Have fun taking this game serious with the intent on enjoying a win.

review: This is a great game however it is completely ruined by the sheer volume of cheaters. Right now I just queue'd up in squads on North American servers and I had to rejoin 8 different games to get a single teammate that spoke English or Spanish. Every single game is filled with Chinese hackers right now. The game is also incredibly communication dependent and even if by some miracle your Chinese teammates aren't cheating they have such high ping they are completely useless and are unable to communicate any relevent information. That being said the gameplay is extremely fun but its ruined by no region locking and a terrible anti cheat. I wouldn't currently buy it right now until the developer fixes these issues.

review: So I am very new to pc gaming (xbox guy) so take this review for what it's worth.I'll go ahead and start with the cons.There are some minor bugs.Things like being dead spectating your friends and your friend is shooting someone but there is no gun in his hand. The game will on occasion crash and you have to hit up the task manager to reset it. These bugs have been very far and few between for me and my group of friends that play the game. They are not worth of your consideration unless you want your "early access" game to be perfect.The Pros are outstanding.The map is huge and very detailed. It's very refreshing to play a game that isnt "run and gun". The guns are real life guns. The sounds of the guns firing are some of the best I've heard. This game is GREAT if you have 3 other friends to play it with.I've read a few negative reviews that peg the game as boring. To me it's one of the more intense games I've played. Any door you open could be someone waiting for you to enter so you always have to be on gaurd. Attacking someone and seeing their teammate start to flank you is nerve racking. This game is one of the best games I've played in a long time. For only $30 I would highly recommend this game for anyone looking for something different in the shooting genre.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: When you're one of three left in a solo match is the most intense gaming I think I've had. review: Considering how big this game got in 2017 even with all the negative feedback/reviews I was expecting something half decent. 10 hours in... fairly disappointed. Not from the gameplay balance or anything like that the performance of the game is just horrible. This is clearly a rushed piece of nothing. This game is barely animated the physics are beyond horrible I've only been playing it for a couple of days and the issues are already getting on my nerves. Can't connect to the servers for hours now with what seems to be a typical "servers are too busy" error. Not sure how that works seeing as this game's population is a fraction of what it was last year. Honestly not worth the $20 (that's on sale). Gameplay's fun and at least the guns are cartoonish or inaccurate which at least fits my preferences but the issues are ridiculous for a game that's been our for ages (midway through 2018 now). Save yourself the money wait for a better battle royale. Also the studio seems to be more busy with making DLC nonsense other games "mobile" or trying to sue Fortnite. Based on what I've seen and read it's highly unlikely this game will ever get significantly better.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So.. PUBG to make a good start yes it is a good game fun and freaking big (which is very nice) but it also has its downsides. First of all the lag and no it is not my fault. I have a steady connection of 200mbps 25mb/s and still just after landing at the map I can't open a door without lagging for 5 seconds which is exactly the time for an enemy to grab a weapon and shoot me. Further more some kills from players in the game are very. very. doubtful getting shot at from 50m and while watching back the deathcam you can't even see your own persona like HOW DID YOU HIT ME??Conclusion It could've been better optimised although I know i dont have the latest hardware some kills are doubtful BUT The map is so beautiful has a lot of detail is huge and with a lot of players check your corners!

review: well Bluehole has done awesome at ruining a game before release and what they have released for a out of a box game has been horrifiic. Still ended up dealing with hackers quite often. Dont feel like it is as bad as it was before but is still pretty prevelant. The Game play seems extremely Laggy compared to what it was before. On top of it they have changed the gun mechanics so much that it has become beyond to try and kill anyone on top of the lag that happens constantly. I littlerly just finished a game where I was on the inside of a open door enemy came up the stairs to the other side of the door. I stepped into the door way and blasted him square on( hell the barrel was in his stomach) before he had a chance to pull the trigger. Lets face it video game or not that close with a sawed off shotgun should leave a gaping hole in his stomach. But no he was able to let off a couple rounds off a S12 kill me and continue like nothing even happened. I know I hit him cause he did use a health kit after but seriously bluehole figure out your gun mechanics already cause that situation alone was beyond and its not the only one. I realize this isnt real life but seriously a full shotgun round at less then a foot away doesnt kill someone. Give your heads a shake and fix your broken game. youve made enough sales now you should be able to get someone who know what the hell they are actually doing on the job. will try to keep this updated as bluehole fixes some issues but lately it seems like they have broken more then they have fixed and called it a official release. Sad but unfortunatly the way gaming has gone. People dont care just get it out there. COD has been a prime example of this since around 2007 or so. Im not going to look up actual time frames so take that as you will. Unfortunatly we are the poor saps on the other end that hope companys will finally get it right and end up supporting companys that have no business being where they are. Unfortunatly bluehole is falling into this category so I have very little hope this game will get better then it was at certain stages in alpha/beta. Crossing fingers to hope this changes though.

review: This is the first review I have ever given for a title even more so an early access title. I had been seeing a lot online about this game and never thought much of it. "Its just another king of the hill style game." Boy was I wrong. This game is something to be appreciated. The combat is fun the gunplay is fun the scavanging to get the gear to find a gun to last is fun. The game looks really good graphically the game plays even better. Granted there are some issues with lag and some very questionable kills. But all in all I kept wanting to dive back in try and make it to the last one alive. Closest I have got is #2. If you are on the fence about the game understand this its King of the Hill nitty gritty plain and simple but theres something to it that makes it unique that draws you in. The future for this game is bright I look forward to what is in store for it. For $29.99 its well worth the money it is arguably more enjoyable than some AAA titles at $59.99. Give it a chance you wont be disappointed.(UPDATE AFTER PATCH 1.0)This game was a good solid game plagued by ridiculous issues however it was still challenging and fun to play. After the 1.0 patch its unplayable. I have tried 4 times now to get into a match. All are met by me being stuck staring at the damn logo while I hear my character being active and the game running. However im not able to actually do anything with this. Forcing me to alt+tab out and close the game just to exit. I once recommended this game. I cant do that again not right now.

review: Product received for free. At first I wasn't going to buy this game. I thought it was just a clone of King of the Kill and since I already had that...I didn't feel the need to actually purchace it. But friends were getting into it and raving about how good it was. So I wanted it too. So a friend gifted it to me on easter and I must say...It's way better than h1z1. Here's why Pros Lower tier weapons don't feel utterly useless like h1z1. That's not to say you shouldn't try to get better weapons when you find them but I've found that I could kill someone who has a better weapon without feeling like I'm getting outgunned.The map feels a lot more dynamic. In h1z1 I felt like I was looking at the same stuff over and over and over but in PUBG It always feels new when I go in. That's not to say you won't visit parts look familiar. It's not that dynamic...But it feels nice compared to the map in h1z1. You will get weather changes like rain once in a blue moon. It's nice but can be a bit distracting sometimes or slow your pc down a bit if you have a poopy cpu like me. Vehicles are done right. You don't have to worry about keys or hotwiring cause they are right there. And there are a lot more of them scattered about on the map. You will probably do a lot better in PUBG than in H1Z1. I don't know why but you will. The game feels...polished even though it still has stuff that needs to be worked on. I might just be bad in h1z1 cause I can't make it no where nears the top 10 but I've made it in the top 3 in PUBG. It feels balanced to say the least.There is an actual map. Not a page with red squares to indicate where you are. You can actually see where you're going and even set up waypoints. It's a breath of fresh air.More interactive than H!Z!. You don't get bomb zones when you go near pacakges unless it's in a red zone. Red zones and package drops are seperate and you could get a red zone at any time.Cons Optimization is pretty eh. Then again I have a really computer...So that might be more me? But I do have friends that have more than exceptional pcs and yet they have to run it with the settings lowered. They did come out with a patch for optimzation though. So if your computer is lowwerish end. You can run the game somewhat well with a few stutters and pauses. Hasn't really gotten me killed yet.Small bit of hackers. They're pretty rare and you shouldn't assume you died to one. But they're there.A few glitches. Not anything gamebreaking like H1Z1. You might not even get them.You can get bad drop spwns in certain games.Campers but that's personally me. It's to be expected in this game and you're probably going to need to camp. But it can feel unsatisfying to be on a killing spree and close to winning until you're just offed by a camper. I give it 9/10. It has a extremley small portion of stuff that needs to be fixed but it feels complete for an early access game. You can tell the devs actually care about it and it gives you a better run for your money than H1Z1. So far it's only the game getting prioritized and not a bunch of skins.

review: This game is VERY hard to give a score to so as of the 'official release' of PUBG (coming out of early access a.k.a PC version 1.0) this is my review.What did they do right?In the grand scheme of things Bluehole did a PHENOMENAL job in marketing by incorporating Twitch (much better than H1Z1) and the viewablity of this game makes this excellent for streamers and therefore free advertising for their game hence why it is the most played game on steam in less than 10 months. The gameplay (when it works) is also VERY nice to play with and losing a game doesn't feel as bad as you can just hop back into a game within a minute and get right back into the action. It is addicting but they shouldn't excuse of them of...What is wrong with the game?This should of NEVER left early access at this state this game is still a unpolished disaster that has a ridiculous amount of bugs and glitches for a out of early access game. Without a doubt they did this so they could fulfill their promise of coming out of early access within the year. The game is littered with cheaters but they have banned many of them so credit where credit is due.In conclusion this game is fun hell it's addicting as hell BUT lack of paying attention to game breaking bugs and them STILL being there in the 'released' out of early access version is horrid. If they can improve this game by optimizing it as well as paying attention to game breaking bugs PUBG can go VERY far in terms of popularity within the community.

review: Nearly 300hrs played and I love this game. The Battle Royal concept is awsome!! I am overall happy with the update at launch.Unfortunately the fun is all but gone for me and here's a few reasons why#1 I Can't play TPP random duo or squad on NA server unless you basically want to play a round of solo squad with people from anywhere but NA. The number of none NA players on NA servers is just unacceptable. I bet I wouldn't need all ten fingers to count how many NA english speaking matches I have had in random TPP in my 300hrs played.FPP is much better but me personally FPP just doesn't compare to this game in TPP.#2 Solo has really been the only thing that got me to 300hrs but frankly it's a big stinky pile to. I drop in fight for a good loot spot. Get geared out make it to the end just to get hacked or try to shoot a guy thats not there because he's got 200 300ping.(I'd say 6 7 out of every ten replays either show hacking or sever lagging) I'll probably continue to play and stay hopeful that they will work to fix the issues and make this game the Battle Royal King it was meant to be but I know in my heart they will likely drive this game into the dirt as a huge wave of Battle Royal tittles crashes over just in time to fill our empty hearts with more sadness.

review: Fun when it works but it rarely works. Seems like every time either PUBG updates or windows updates the game is rendered unplayable until the next patch. It's just another generic "battle royale" game honestly. If you've played H1Z1 KOTK you've played this. PUBG just has shinier graphics. Problem is that you can't play with the great graphics because then it puts you at a disadvantage from the other players (including most streamers) playing on low with the brightness cranked up. Things like that will eventually kill off the "battle royale" genre even though it's fairly new. I'd suggest waiting for the alpha to be over before throwing away $30 on this.EDIT I found out that my crashing issues have actually been caused by a conflict between PUBG and Bitdefender. I can now reccommend this game simply because it works and is a grerat time despite all the flaws listed above.

review: So far...The Good Huge Playerbase (you find games instantly) Cool tactical gameplay (3rd and 1st person) Devs that actually listen!The Bad Rubberbanding GPU Hog (usually requires higher end rigs to make the game look and run great) Lots of bugs (still in early acces pls forgive) Huge Chinese Playerbase (cough cough *hackers*) Lack of incentive (rack up BP points so you can get dirty shoes? Then spend another few hours just to die and do it all over again?)I'm honestly having a tough time spending more than 2 hours on this game per day without getting frustrated firstly at my performance and secondly how the game rewards you for playing it. There's not really a hook that pulls me back or some sort of goal to work towards.TL DR If you want a buggy battle royale game with solid gunplay with virtual character clothing as incentive by all means go ahead and buy the game! Just not for me /

review: Game has a lot of potential as its not the first but best looking and performing battle royale game out there.Gameplay is repetitive but all games are.As a fan of storylines this game is not for my taste but I did enjoy playing it.If you were expecting something new every time you play well... don't expect it.Also server region should not be by player's choice it should be based on ping and connectivity.Like H1Z1KOTK it disables you from shooting when you have high ms.Ping hacks has been noted during my gameplay and other videos from people so they need to work on that too.Overall good game to pick up but the priceline is pretty high for a repetitive shooter game.I am recommending this since a lot of people like repetitiveness(like CS GO I hate that game) but its not for those who likes stories adventure customization and survival(like the forest rust or ARK.)

review: This game has poor servers hackers and suffers from people from other parts of the world (mainly China) using EU servers as it gives a large advantage due to the game design. They teleport around and bullets do't hit basically. I enjoy playing this game with friends but the charm is wearing off due to this very poor performance. I hope the developers sort this out soon and it works for release however I am not optimistic it seems that these days developers are happy leaving a game half finished as they have made so much money in early access. I imagine there is a team of 1 or 2 developers working in this now and there will be no real improvements to the PC game they are just popping out small updates so the concolse gamers aren't completely put off. It's a shame but it's business. Early access sucks.I recommend the game because I enjoy it but it is terrible performance wise at the moment.

review: This game is far from perfect but well worth its money for the enjoyment you get.Having played the original PlayerUnknown's Battle Royale Arma III Mod for quite some time I was impressed by just how much better the standalone felt. The gameplay is unique exciting and strategic with all kinds of humor and intensity to be experienced.Surprisingly the game runs quite well on my laptop (A Dell 7559 w/ an i5 6300HQ 8gb of RAM and a GTX960m). I'm able to play at medium settings on average (some high some low) and get smooth competetive performance. Unfortunately there are still a lot of bugs and glitches from time to time but nothing game breaking.I haven't noticed as many hackers as others seem to have but for some reason most of the people on Squad NA servers don't know how to speak English. It's obviously frustrating when you can't communicate with your teammates so I highly suggest plaing with friends or joining a clan for squad and duo matches.In conclusion even in the relatively small amount of time I've played the game I've gotten more than my money's worth of good times. The game has a great pace and (almost) every match is exciting and different. There are cetainly drawback and many things to fix and improve but it'll be a great game!

review: Don't waste your money. Wait until a competent developer pushes out another tactical battle royale game on a real engine (frostbite snowdrop idk) that's already built for large maps high player count higher tick rate servers and real anti cheat. Maybe they could have 2 modes a ranked ping locked competetive mode that pays out the currency with some kind of progression system and an unranked open mode that doesn't pay out. Just spit balling here.Honestly I had fun with this game when it was new and fresh but all I see now are its flaws. Rather than doing something about the state of the game the devs seem content to push out content nobody asked for rebalances that break everything and new cosmetics that require the purchase of keys and encourange an influx of cheaters and bots in the game. Whatever new content they put out just isn't fast enough to save this game they simply cannot innovate at the pace of its competitors and they wouldn't have to if the foundation of the game was solid.

review: Arma 3 BattleRoyale was a terrific game who doesn't think so. Who would blame Brendan Greene if he wants to make a few bucks on it now? In the first hours of PUBG I was unsure how to judge the game. I would so much like to give him a good rating.... I'd be so happy if we could finally get a BattleRoyale without the disgusting ArmA bugs and glitches. Without the disgusting jumping. With proper weapon sounds. With a decent inventory. With a neat control without 4 different running modes. With proper weaponry. Without that silly "oh it's got to be realistic." But after some time it became clear to me Unfortunately there are too many corners and edges which make the game to nothing more than a cheap Arma clone. It's a real pity. It could have been so nice. A BattleRoyale in better. But no we only get one Battleground in as bad as ArmA.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Im not big on this game at all I find it somewhat slow and boring to be honest.But that appart its a great game and it is possible to make it more fun by playing with a friend or why not 3 others.I can honestly say that I have had really fun when playing with some friends and even after dying early or mid game its still fun.Sure there is room for improvement but what game dont have that space?I recommend to play this with other people so you can get more fun out of it but If you like to challenge yourself its probably just as fun for you solo. My Creterias Grapichs 3/5gameplay 4/5annoying 100/5fun (solo) 2/5fun (duo/squad) 5/5 up to 10/5 (this is NOT because of the game at all thou)Now a while after the 1.0 release there is a couple of changes in my opinion.As it where before it was a good game (for early acces).for a full 1.0 release this game is lacking and I cant call it competetive at all the hacks that are out is not being adressed as it should be the frame rate is fixed but what does that matter when the hitboxes are whacked? and that some people still stands even thou they are at litteraly 0 hp?these things have been since the last test server and is not adressed at all in any of the updates since.I can still take cover behind a car and aim straight at a persons head and hit the car instead but take a shot in the head even thou the other person is behind a rock. There is TONS of troubles with this game.... so there is the problem of liking and hating the game at the same time nowEDIT This game has now been on market as a full release for quiet some time...Still there is invisible walls on maps to blow up your MC and a ton of crap thats just wrong.Armor and "protective" gear is just a joke I have full lvl 3 and still gets downed/killed by a single shot from Kar98 och M24 there is so many problems with this game that dont get adressed and they add more crap to it just to earn money... bluehole aint taking their time to adress the right things and just add more problems to the game.So the dev is the biggest reason I DONT recommend that anyone BUYS this game unless its below 5 (in current state 1 is about right)In complete honesty am I only playing this now since I have paid for it... and somewhere I still hope that they will take action against the problems that exist in the game.(and there is several BR games out there with much less problems and similar gameplay and better servers...... so this should be the last one bought considering that several titels is f2p)

review: UPDATED 20180605 Hugely disappointed with where this game has gone still hasn't received the optimization it desperately needs. Netcode is still terrible bugs are everywhere. The fact that PUBGCorp still haven't hired skilled developers to improve the core elements of the game is sad. PREVIOUS REVIEW This is a fantastic game featuring Last Man (or Team) Standing Battle Royale that has been seen in Arma 3 and H1Z1 KOTK. You can go solo or team up against others to fight to the death across a unique map with various weapons &amp pickups. Even though this is early access it has lots of potential for expansion and improvement. Pros Very quick matchmakingLarge but not too sparse mapVariety of weaponsLots of potential for competitive playWell balancedHours of playabilityInventory management is fantasticEasy to learn controlsGood balance between arcade run 'n' gun and slower paced tactical play Cons Occasional sound glitches/stutteringMay require mid to high range graphics card to run optimallyOccasional game crashesNot a whole lot of initial character customizationOverall I would highly recommend this game. The developers are actively updating it to make it a smoother better experience. I've run the game on both a slightly below minimum requirements meeting computer and a higher end rig and they are both playable. However I would recommend having a better than average GPU for optimal gameplay. There is plenty of potential for updates optimization new maps/weapons/vehicles and overall improvements but as it is the game provides hours of fun. I am excited to see where the developers further take the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is a fresh newer survival game that has taken the Steam store by storm. It has really been an enjoyable game and a fresh new experience in which i have spent over 200 hrs on. Originally Battlegrounds was a fun to play early access game which millions of people have participated in it being the top in survival genre. However ever since the weekly and monthly patches has stopped I am sad to say the game has quickly gotten stale. While I appreciate that the devs put a lot of time and work into pushing new content I am concerned that the XBOX version of PUBG has taken priority over say optimization which affects most of the community seeing as the majority of players are on PC. So while I am glad to see PUBG on other consoles I would prefer they fix optimizations and glitches in the game first before starting a venture into XBOX. Overall I would recommend PUBG to people who are looking for a fun enjoyable time with friends That being said since optimization for the game is taking so ridiculously long I have not been enjoying the experience recently so I would not recommend the game as of now.All in All 4/10

review: Been back on for a few weeks. Having a great time again. Lots of new features a 3rd map new weapons events performance is bearable now. Enjoying the game again. Not a game you can just jump into and do well if you get frustrated easily just know that the average gamer won't be good at this game until they put several hours in to get acclimated with everything. Even then if you go for action all the time you will not consistently win games so it can be tough to get used to sometimes playing it safe if you really want to go for a win. I also find the game is more enjoyable when you can play with a friend or 3. Solos are nice once and a while but working as a team and sharing a win is super rewarding.

review: This game was meant to be the chosen one....I'm so sad about this game. I still recommend it its still really good buuuuuuuttttttttt its a shadow of what it could have been and everyone knows it. Pros Fun for anyone new its exciting addictive fairly well designed progression to high skill cap involves improvisation and decision making. Realism combat. Built upon the foundations of Arma 3 and Arma 2 DayZ mod a good sign for anyone who liked either of those games.Cons Proper progression systems dont exist a proper ranked system doesn't exist hacking is rife every update is "too little too late" and the damage is done at this point. Devs suffer from the problem most other "sudden success" devs suffer from. Blinded by their success they lose sight forget the core of whats good ruin their own game with "fixes" miss every opportunity fail to listen to the community and inevitably kill their own game. It wasnt fortnight bluehole it was you.Dev seemed focused on attacking community at one point. Rather than intelligently mitigating the issues they were screaming to fix they gaslit the communities concerns ney they straight up insulted the community. In fact the hacking issues were the devs fault. This is because in a bid to get some steam market transaction action they added crates with the ONLY cosmetics/progression pathway in the game game cosmetics which players paid a lot for which MASSIVELY incentivised hackers as winning was the fastest way to make money. The anticheat engine failed to meet the demands the game fluctuated in price around the world (making it cheap for hackers to buy) and simple decisions such as region locking could have isolated and contained the hacking whilst anti cheat was developed.Some better community modding could maybe bring the game back to life but really this game needs some serious sudden anti cheat measures and a massive out of nowhere update of maps guns progression systems and mechanics an update that doesnt take 6 months too long to arrive to return to its glory. The most recent update has brought a spark back but it needs more (or maybe it really is too late) and the progression system still has a paywall behind it.9/10 that could have become a near perfect 10 forever but became a disappointing 8.5/10. Region lock oceanic pls.

review: This is by far the best player v player game since counter strike. The setup the loot the map the tension of getting into the last 100 is extreme. It is early access so expect bugs but having been totally disappointed by DAYZ this has now brought hope to the survival genre. The aim is simple 100 people jump out of a plane you loot stuff and then the circle space starts closing in forcing you all together for a battle to the last player. Its a great concept that has been really well executed and hopefully will just continue to improve.I swear you wont pump as much adrenaline as when you get to last 10 on this its worth it just for that buzz

review: Avoid buying this game. It can be fun but there are serious issues with the developers which will ruin the experience for any players looking to have fun. In short any complaints users have or express are dismissed for whatever reason. I tend to avoid this drama but I can't help but notice how ready they are to dismiss and denegrate half of their userbase. If you don't know what I'm talking about then do some research but the essential issue is the developers are conflating geographical complains (distance of users from servers causing serious ping and network issues) with ones based on other factors. I don't want to discuss the details in this review but it is pretty simple to find articles or commentary on it so I would recommend referring to those.Largely though it is seriously odd when developers of a game gloat about how many users they have banned. It is kind of ridiculous when users ask for a mechanism by which users with higher pings be prevented from playing and they are met with hostility by their team.Look the issues never plagued me much mostly because I'm terrible at the game but I cannot support a developer would cannot understand and separate the legitimate complaints from illegitimate ones.These complaints too avoid the shady business practices made by this company wherein they are trying to supress any competition through frivolous legal means or the terrible attitude they have to the regular users compared to the streamer elites. They aren't on the normal users' sides.TL DR It's a pretty good game but the developers are not on their userbase's side. Don't give money to this company.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I was very reluctant in buying this game due to the many negative reviews but after update #1 i decided to risk it and buy this "unfinished" game as so many people call it and all i can say is that the game is pretty good actually... runs 75fps avg 1080p on high ultra with my GTX 780ti 3GB (almost 6 year old architecture).Lag wise i cant complain... those are very very rare... Concerning the cheaters i can say that i only found 1 with 18 hours of gameplay... so either im lucky or people are exaggerating a bit.The only small thing i can complain about is the unoptimization of the Desert map where i feel this micro stutter almost all the time even though i got v sync on and a steady 60fps but than again... i got an old card so maybe its my system.

review: I want to give this game my recommendation.... I really do because i see it's potential and it will kill any battle royale game that comes out. But as of right now the game is very very very very very poorly optimized. Any encounter you come across will result in FPS drops thus leading to your quick death that you can't even control. Forget picking up items with any kind of ease because you have to wait a full second for it to register to even get anything. So if you are an F key spammer your going to get boned. This game will get my recommendation once they fix those optimization issues. 30 bucks for an early access game with those bugs is ridiculous. Look to pick it up cheaper.If this game was 15 or 20 then it'd be recommended but not for 30.Review Update 4/22/2017Recently added a patch to improve play and it definitely has improved. review: This is my review of PBUG thank you for reading!First let me say..I have not played H1Z1 KOTH Ark SOF or any Battle Royale at all before this review is not influenced by comparisons to what I just stated nor influenced by any expectation I may have had when buying the game cause I did not have any.Now over to the review..Playerunknown's Battlegrounds or PBUG for shorts is a great game for anyone who likes shooting games. This is Battle Royale nothing more nothing less. It is as simple as that and that's one of the reasons why this game is amazing. Second reason? Well matchmaking. It just swoops you into a match on the second no waiting! As I am writing this it is still Early Access but it honestly feels like a complete game (minus the bugs here and there I barely notice them though) hadn't it been for the developers high expectations of their own product. The community also seems to be nice I just registered on the forum and there is a lot of activity discussions and good vibes going around.I like how the game looks the graphics are decent (although I have tweaked them a lot for performance) and the game runs well for a pretty old computer arguably (mine is 3 years old) but as mentioned in the brackets I did tweak a lot of settings and installed ReShade (which is allowed) to get better performance and thus an advantage on the battlefield.I must say the game looks a bit washed out with my current configuration but nothing is more enjoyable than having a game that runs smoothly. Highly recommend you check out the tweak guides for PUBG on Steam!

As a Chinese player I quite believe this company would not to do this until the Tencent successfully obtain Chinese gov's operating permission. I know it sounds a little bit ridiculous that most of cheating tools will not functioning after its Chinese Tencent version start operating but we have some examples. Leagues of legends is still meeting cheating and script problems in OC region but marjority of Chinese servers do not have such problems coz Tencent has created its special monitoring addons.I do admitt most of hackers of PUBG are from China and I hate them so much as you guys. Not all Chinese players are hackers and believe me cheating tools are so expensive that 99.9% of players could not afford it (More than 1000USD/mth). So there is the problem who are using cheating tools? In China there are a lot of platform doing the same thing as Twitch. Those guys earn millions of dollars a month by acting as a professional player. Some of them are respected LOL players some are swithched from CS and OW. In just no more than half a year all those players become quite professional and some of them had never played FPS or TPS before! review: So I originally gave this game a big fat thumbs up due to how amazing the gameplay was and devs seemed at the time... this was around a year ago when Early Access was still here I look at this game now in 2018 and am absolutely appauled by the business decisions and practices made by Blueballs. While the gameplay is still exceptionally fun intense and even down right scary at times everything else has got down hill.First let me get the general positives out of the way The gameplay is very fun if not addicting the graphics are fairly alright... and that's about it. Just because the gameplay is good doesn't make for a good game and I'll explain why.Now the negatives. First of all the sound design in this game is ing awful. Many of the gun shots sound in one direciton even though the person is the total opposite direction. Also apparently your game is only able to pick up a certain amount of gun shots at the same time and so audio will just cheaply cut out on one of the people just so it can load in the audio for other gun shots... in 2018 this is mind ery on how this even exists.Now the REAL negatives for this game (yah as if the issue with the game above wasn't enough). While the gameplay is good... the development team not so much. They have been makng choice after choice for like the last year now. Here is a comprised list of many of the horrible/shady stuff the team has done within the last year. They catered to twitch streamers by locking off custom servers only to them The first real problems arose in August of 2017 when Blueballs was banning non stream snipers due to essentially being on a twitch streamer's stream. After the stream sniping controversy in a bold and move they added paid and locked off crates while STILL in early access They then pushed the game out of early access at least A YEAR if not two early The Miramar map was rushed out of the door and was generally negatively recieved due to being optimized for only long range play styles. The rough terrains and overall ugly look and emptiness of the map led many to try and avoid the new map at all costs. Speaking of miramar the playerbase demanded that a map selection were to be added... after 4 MONTHS they finally released a map selection but then essentially ROLLED IT BACK due to three maps now existing. The devs have not yet fixed many of the cheating problems optimzation or bugs in the game. BUGS GALORE by the way. And finally the icing on the cake... a ing $10.00 season pass. I literally don't have to say anymore comments than that.Final notes As much as I don't even like Fortnite it's clear that Fortnite at least has a dev team thats passionate about their work unlike Blueballs corporation. The MANY poor choices they have made during development and release is essentially what made be thumb this down. On top of that optimization (while slightly improved) is still a problem hacking STILL remains a HUGE problem and there are so many bugs that are not even being resolved due to the dev team spending their "precious" time on E SPORTS microtransaction crates and LOCKED OFF CONTENT due to a season pass. It's an absolute shame what is happening to this game and is upsetting to see a once giant fall to its knees during its final days. If the devs decided to actually do something to fix many of these problems I almost gurantee much of the playerbase would come back. Unfortunately its been made clear that the dev team was never meant to develop such a huge and demanding project.PS The Sanhok map is actually really good but unfortunately was almost completely ruined by the season pass that was added in the very same update

review: I've played for 1 week with some friends and solo and all I have to say is this game is a huge step up from H1Z1 glad I finally got on board.+ you can costumize your weapon with attachements+ everyone's playing so you probably won't have trouble to find a friend to play+ fast paced and short matches+ kinda decent price without discount+ great graphics+ controls are great I recommend having a great PC or you're gonna have a bad time sometimes everyone glitches and lags for around 30 seconds after hitting the floor IMO the loot system should be more like diablo so you could see whats on the ground instead of having to hit tabPick it up and try it if you enjoy battle royales you're gonna have loads of fun!**UPDATE**+ the game's not glitching anymore when you hit the floor+ got used to the loot system so it's decent now+ more attachements and more weapons I have 32 friends who own the game but hardly find 2 or more online (not sure if you're going to have that problem) the game is losing it's player base for fortnight (F2P) but the mechanics are totally different again player base was hitting 3 million last December but hardly hits 1 million concurrent players now (still no problem finding matches) I recommend having 16GB RAMStill recommend picking this up if you're ok spending 30 but the game should be selling for 15 and sale for 10 . PUBG is releasing new crates every month probably trying to grab as much money as they can before the game dies out.P.S. if you need friends to play add me I play on EU mostly by the end of the day
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Updating my review. Game runs poorly I was forgiving of the issues because it was in Early Access however that is no longer the case and has not been since Decmber. And since official launch my opinion of this game continues to decline. Poor netcode Poor optimization Poor hit detection Continued loot crate support and unnecessary added content no one asked for (except for Sanhok that map is admittedly really good) while the community begs for actual fixes to the gameFor reference I'm running the game on these specs NVIDIA GTX 1060 6GB VRAM16GB RAM1TB HDD + 256GB SDDIntel i7 7800HQ 2.8GHzIt's not top of the line but it should not be having issues on the graphics settings I have which are Very Low save for Ultra Render Distance Medium Post Processing and Anti Aliasing.The devs clearly don't care about this game only the profits they could make. And it's because of that they are losing to Fortnite. I don't enjoy Fortnite as I feel the building mechanic makes the game imbalanced and too random (also I'm just not good at it). And I'm certainly not the best at PUBG but there are very clear issues that many players have been screaming in BlueHoles face asking to fix please.Players Optimize the game.Bluehole Hmm loot crates?Players No optimize and fix.Bluehole Gun skins?Players Noo. Fix the ing game.Bluehole OH! NEW MAP!Players ... screw this I'm playing Fortnite.Bluehole Ahh c'monnnn! NEW GUNS! STAY FOR THE GUNPLAY GUYSSSSOnly reason I am still playing is because I want my BR fix and Fortnite doesn't do it for me. And H1Z1 is just... *shudder*Got plenty of playtime out of this game though so definitely got my money's worth.7/10 thanks for the Chicken Dinners and go yourselves Bluehole.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a battle royale game. Yeah that is essentially it. It is crazy fun but if you have Arma III you already have the original PUBG. The only thing you are getting is one game mode that has already been around for 15 years. You also get 2 nice 8x8 km maps but I do not think that is worth $30. However I loved getting back into battle royales and I REALLY like the maps. They feel like they were designed for a battle royale. This is an arma mod standalone done right (I am looking at you DayZ) but it seems like the millions of people who bought the game don't know that you can get ARMA III for $40 with tons of other game modes with 3 cool maps for battle royale. I would recommend getting ARMA III before PUBG I would only recommend PUBG if you have $30 lying around and want to get back into battle royale. I will still recommend it overall because I am judging how fun it is.

review: I got this game long before it's release. In fact when it released I only played around 5 games before not touching it again. Maybe I got my fill of the game wile it was still in early access but even so I didn't really play it that much in early access. I returned to the game when it released because I wanted to see how the game was in a (apparent) finished version.The most obvious feature to bash on is the poor optimisation. While the game was going through its development it did feel like that was improving. I noticed less and less frame drops as the game came closer to it's official release. When it actually did release the game actually felt like it was in a playable state in terms of optimisation. However a patch update not long after release suddenly reversed the progress made on the optimization. It's no lie when every one says you need a computer that you would have to break the bank in order to acquire in order to play this game . Even so you could still experience poor performance due to no fault of your computer. The game just isn't optimised for the engine in runs on. From what I hear since that patch that reduced the performance (some how) I hear it still lingers. So I don't know what's happening there.Gameplay wise it's actually pretty sound. It's basic for shooters and works well enough. But most players came to this game for the experience the premise offers. It can keep you entertained for a bit however once you feel you've experienced it all you're almost ready to move on to the next thing. Well at least I was.But probably the biggest turn off for me was it's reward system. Now this might be the common bash on loot boxes however I never really liked the loot boxes even before the game was fully released and started adding paid loot boxes. The loot boxes in this game are the grindiest ones you will ever find in any video game. I almost dare you to find worse (Hold my beer). The odds are stacked so much against you 99 times out of 100 you're going to unlock the same pair of blue skinny jeans each time you open a loot box. Even though I never opened them that many times the reason I strongly believe that was the case was because ever time I was in the lobby before a game started I didn't see players trying to draw attention to themselves because they wanted to show off their cool cosmetics. No I saw every one either wearing the exact same top and trousers or just going naked. Simply because it was loads more interesting then the "rewards" the loot boxes gave you.There are probably more interesting items in their paid line up of lootboxes but given loot boxes reputation I reckon most people would avoid them. Plus the amount of reward you get for finishing a game in 1st place isn't even enough to unlock two loot boxes. adding to that there is very little reward for doing more things then just surviving for a long time. If you kill another player it only gives you 20 of the in game currency. Considering you need 700 in order to unlock the first lootbox (and it double with each unlock) There is no point risking killing other players and potentially getting killed yourself when you're better off just surviving. That gives you loads more in game currency and it's easier. But as a consequence it's also loads more boring.In that regard the game does a terrible job in encouraging the player to try and better themselves. Because the rewards for being better is next to nothing. Sure you can try and improve through personal resolve but considering most players don't have that resolve the game will only be able to hold onto those players who do. As a consiquence to that the player base will drop and soon those players who do have the resolve will leave as well. Because there arn't as many players to play against. (battleborne any body? Though I'll give you battleborne happened faster and had more going against it) I've always thought (aside the optimisation) one element the game desperately needs to improve is it's reward system. But that has not changed since I first bought it.Over all I'd say in it's current state this game is a bit more miss then hit. Many of it's early players had high hopes for this game while it was still in early access. But it seems many of the features plays have pretty much demanded be improved hasn't been improved. Laughably the mobile version plays much better and many players who still play PUBG and getting an emulator and are playing that version because it runs better. But this game lost me before that. So I'm likely to never touch this game again. And if I do it's probably because something happened that made every one still playing say "look they've improved something" (And I don't think adding new maps count). So far I've only been hearing negatives with what blue hole has been adding to the game. So we'll see on that regard.

review: Its an Ok Game for a round here and there not more not less.Pro Gunhandling is very enjoyable Kills feel rewardingCons Game is based on "Modquality" levels everything feels (from movement to driving parachuting etc.) clunky and unpolished. Desert Map is awful extremly trash Netcode This game obviously has packetloss can nail enemys with like 10 bullets and nothing happens at all. Lack of a Serverqueue Rounds take too long looting takes too long Maps are just way too big too much quantity instead of quality. Badly balanced maps especially the desert one is doomed by too many buildings at the same place making it extremly chaotic cant turn shadows off entirely giving an extra lack of vision and awareness. directional sound sound in general isnt very well in fact its terrible audio across the lines. the pan blocks bullets from all direction even when shooting into enemys face with a shotgun youll hear the block sound of the pan on his backpack. massive amount of bugs ingame.Overall ... ya well its good to sell lootboxes thats it the game has a terrible quality and its impossible to have action going on since its so full of campers and flickering low quality graphics that give you eye cancer.Aswell as the devs obviously have stopped improving the game since 1.0 came out no bugs fixed desert car window flickering still happening and whatever...Most likely you should call it Camper Cheater or permaloot unknown battlegrounds.I think the name "unknown" just comes because that person actually always has been unknown because he was bad at video games and is bad at making them aswell cant notice a camper hence "unknown" and thats the "Camper Royale" Experience you got here.

review: *UPDATE*Yesterday I was banned today I'm unable to connect. Thats some BS.*UPDATE*Ban was apperently a bug and got lifted.*UPDATE*Just got globally banned for no reason. No cheats no tools NOTHING. It doesn't even say why or for how long I'm banned. This sucks big time. As long as I'm banned this review won't be changed.The game constantly develops and devs are really trying to improve it. However the speed of making improvements could be higher. Given a moderate platform it performs okay but the "fluidity" lacks behind the actual FPS.Pros never gets boring each round is different the gunplay and fights are just fun. Hitting some sick headshots is really satisfying right mix between realism and game only BR game I know to have more than one map stupid amount of keyboard/mouse settings lets you set up the game how you want itCons performance and fluidity still not great game/lag hinders you picking up loot in a fast manner sound is still kinda weird there is a bad balance between several soundeffects ground movement is bad sometimes you get unexpectedly stuck or you can't go prone for no apparent reason the game menu is too laggy setting up a game or opening crates is annoying the time to actually get into the game is too long waiting time in the lobby (60 s) + flighttimeOverall I think the game is going in the right direction. I would really appreciate if the devs would fight existing issues/bugs rather than just pumping more content into the game. I can recommend this game to any BR/FPS fan. clorky

review: I refunded it. But I still recommend this game though question is why?Pros+ All of this "Battle Royale" kind of game this one look the most promising. Dev update it every weeks major update every months.+ Gameplay. Modding. Dressing(?)+ More realistic. Not like we have to survive zombie apocalypse in near future anyway.+ Thx for Price optimization in every region.Cons Optimization. I mean I knew it still in EA but it doesn't have to be this bad. The problem wasn't in FPS though lastest update made it flow already but in rendering. The feels when you have to wait the game to render the door and you have no weapon than your punch. **This is what made me refund.For anyone curious my pc could run GTA V in High 40fps and Watch dogs 2 in High 30 fps. No Render problem. Some Cheated player. Just like CS GO. For SEA Player it's painful to play on AS server which located at HK. You've to deal with that lag and "China Numba Wan". If dev can relocate or create SEA Server at SG or PH that would be great.TL DR If your PC is godlike good enough not fear of early access game like survival tps game. This is for you. But your system has to be "THAT" good.

All for not liking people who micspam cheat and teamkill.Any developer that treats the playerbase like this should not be tolerated or funded. The game is buggy broken and in its current state it is closer to a pre alpha release rather than a full game. The creators refuse to fix technical problems with their games refuse to improve their dedicated servers for the game (even after implementing microtransactions and selling over 30 million copies) and then ferry players from those servers over to western servers which are now full of people with ping well over 300. There is no reason why any of this should be taking place and by now we should all assume that it will *NEVER* be fixed and will remain an utter mess until the day they turn off servers.Which I'm predicting to be in 3 years after they release a sequel with even ier optimization and crappier servers.

review: At first i decided not to buy the game due to the bad reviews. After some time i came back to say " it" and bought it expecting the worst game full of cheaters. After a couple rounds i have to say that i do not understand why people rate this game so bad.Let me start off by pointing out that most of the people who do or did these negative reviews have between 40 to 200 hours playtime. Mostly claiming that the game is not worth it even though they spent half the price of a tripple A title and played it for a fair amount of time to say 'they got their bang for the buck'.Like in every game that includes a ranking system you will reach a elo that will match u against other good players so at some point you will meet better players that might stomp you.My conclusion If you enjoy BR games and dont like the cartoonish show that is so popular right now then buy this game instead. Especially playing in squads will make the game much more fun to play. Due to the matchmaking system you dont really rquire to have friends to play the squad mode so you might just find your new gaming buddy on the way.

Until another realistic BR game comes along this will be my go to game.

review: A solid FPS with some faults..Severs are very unreliable as well as the UI. There's tons of RNG involved as well as reaction times and lots of luck. The game has seen tons of changes over the last year and continues to produce lots of content. Very much a good time with friends or even just by yourself. If you enjoy FPS this is a must have. You choose if you want to play agressive or passive. It truely leaves you with many different apporaches in game therefore giving you a very diverse and rich experince in every game.I hope for the continued development and content. I do believe the game was released too early for 1.0 however they seem to be constantly implimenting new content to which I don't think a release ready game should be.Overall I'd recommend this game to anyone who enjoys shooters and survival games.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Yes I recommend this game but ONLY when you make the War Mode permanent. Don't have many hours with the game but lets just say about 40hrs was during the public testing for the new mode.Regular mode is very boring in my opinion. Everyone mostly camps and prone with 4x or 8x. Too afraid to come out and play. Thing I like most about War Mode is constant action. 15min games. 200 points. Respawns. I love it! Tired of long dull matches that go to the Top 10 or Top 5 just to get sniped from 200 300m out.Bottom line is War Mode is very addictive and fast paced. If they're really pushing for eSports then this is the ticket. Regular Mode 6/10 Due to slow gameplay through most of the game except when you first land loot and get your first kills.War Mode 10/10 Perfect concept and with more polish within the game I see this as being the new mode to play

More platforms.Not only that none of the platforms performed remotely well they completely ignored that fact and started working on more crates and more in game purchases.Since I could go about this all day long and considering I'm actually rating a game here and not it's thirsty developer I'll focus on it now Pros Fast queue times due to high player base SOLID graphics. Good ballistics (Sniper and AR bullet drop)Cons Fully released game with performance of an early alpha game. HACKERS HACKERS EVERYWHERE! Bluehole is doing nothing to fix this issue despite saying they are. Over the time I've seen NO improvements in this domain. review: I really wish I could write a better review of this game. I want to like this game so much more than I actually do. The core concept is fantastic but the developers can't seem to get out of their own way. It seems like each patch that's released fixes one issue and simultaneously breaks three other things. To be fair technical issues are much more noticeable in a game like this due to the higher stakes. When you've been playing for 20 minutes then get killed by someone after you're completely behind cover it stands out. Other times I've been killed by someone who was just peaking out around a corner. Then when I watch the killcam they were sitting there staring at me for 2 3 seconds but never showed up on my screen. There are definitely looting strategy and maneuvering aspects to this game. However this game at its core is a shooter. Over the past year the shooting mechanics have been broken fixed broken fixed and broken again. I'm out of patience for a product that fails to deliver a consistent experience on its core game mechanics. I've actually evangelized several people for this game. I keep telling people to wait it out and that things will get better. At patch #15 common sense has to start playing in a role in my opion.

review: On the first day God created the dog. God said "Sit all day by the door of your house and bark at anyone who comes in or walks past. I will give you a life span of twenty years." The dog said "That's too long to be barking. Give me ten years and I'll give you back the other ten." So God agreed. On the second day God created the monkey. God said "Entertain people do monkey tricks and make them laugh. I'll give you a twenty year life span." The monkey said "Monkey tricks for twenty years? I don't think so. Dog gave you back ten so that's what I'll do too okay?"And God agreed. On the third day God created the cow. "You must go to the field with the farmer all day long and suffer under the sun have calves and give milk to support the farmer. I will give you a life span of sixty years."The cow said "That's kind of a tough life you want me to live for sixty years. Let me have twenty and I'll give back the other forty." And God agreed again. On the fourth day God created man. God said "Eat sleep play marry and enjoy your life. I'll give you twenty years."Man said "What? Only twenty years? Tell you what I'll take my twenty and the forty the cow gave back and the ten the monkey gave back and the ten the dog gave back that makes eighty okay?" Okay " said God "You've got a deal." So that is why the first twenty years we eat sleep play and enjoy ourselves the next forty years we slave in the sun to support our family the next ten years we do monkey tricks to entertain the grandchildren and the last ten years we sit on the front porch and bark at everyone. Life has now been explained to you.

review: NEW REVIEWHaving gotten back into the game after a considerable break I think I can finally reccomend it. Some things I've learned that will make the game more enjoyable 1. Play with friends (or other people) the solo rounds can be quite boring after a while2. Don't always play to win change up your play style to keep things fresh (go for kills airdrops etc.)3. Don't drop into an area where you won't see anyone. This negates my previous issues of not seeing anyone the whole game and getting killed from out of nowhere. OLD REVIEW I am very unsure of how to feel about this game. Right now hacking poor opimization and server lag makes many matches very frustrating. But I can't help but feel like fixing these current issues will make it THAT much more enjoyable. I've found that once the initial novelty of the game wears off it becomes very tedious. Most of the time spent in the game will be looting and running to stay within the blue circle. When you are repeatedly only seeing 3 5 people a match (if you're lucky) the adrenaline rush you get from the firefights or making it to the top 10 becomes outweighed by the tedium. The worst is when you make it to the top 10 haven't seen a single person and then get sneak attacked out of nowhere. People will say "git gud" but I don't care how good you are you cannot watch 360* around you 24/7 it's literally impossible. So while I will probably still play this game in small doses I am disappointed in it overall. It's not a horrible game but it's really not all that enjoyable at this point either.

review: Now for those chaps who recently started playing this game after starting with the PUBG Mobile game and thought 'hey if the Android game was so much fun maybe the PC game is worth the hype ?' you aren't wrong. It is much harder compared to the mobile game and to be honest one has to practice umpteen times before getting any kills in. Sure there are some kills that make you believe that it can only be the work of a hacker but there are many games where I genuinely had fun coming in the last 8 for a change and understanding the ins and outs of survival in each map. As an added bonus it helps that my GTX 1060 did justice to the graphical prowess of the Unreal Engine and I felt I was in the vast expanse of Far Cry 4 instead of a 8 8 Battle Royale map. A must play for all you fans of this gaming genre and I hope the developers deal with the biggest problem I have noticed in the game hackers. Instead of customizing the skins and the exterior it would be better to hit the problem in it's core so this game can go back to No. 1 again. Sincerely A loyal fan.

review: This game was once perfect but PUBG did not care about this game at all. As an FPS game they should focus on the fluency of the game the handling of the trajectory and the overall playability and fairness. I don't think they're aware of that at all. They have no ability to fight back against plug ins and they frequently update game data affect players 'normal entertainment and close personal transactions causing losses to many players. The amendment of the firearms ballistic also does not issue a public announcement. What the hell is going on? I don't want such a good game to eventually become the second H1 Z1. I hope that PUBG can listen to players 'feedback more often give players a stable and secure game environment and let us work together to make the game better! I will expect the game to get better and I am willing to work hard for it but I will not log on to this game until the game becomes better!

review: This game first released as a buggy poorly optimized mess...about a year later things have changed. Now its a poorly optimized mess with microtransactions and an even worse console port. It's only redeeming factor is that RIGHT NOW on 1/14/17 you can sell a certain crate for like $5. Once this hype dies however I see no point to playing this game anymore due to my pros cons list.Also I've noticed that most of the positive reviews of this game are kind of joke reviews where the person makes fun of the games terrible quality but still gives it a positive review for some reason... I guess its like one of those jokes where its soo bad that its funny in its own way.Pros Never takes more than 2 seconds to find a gameGives you a nice shot of adreneline when you get into fights and get close to end gameCons Looks pretty terrible (some may try to defend it but in all honesty everyone know this game looks like crap)microtransactions (also there is currently no way to choose which case to buy. Microtransactions wouldnt be a problem if I could just choose to buy the crates that dont require actual money to open. Its common sense really I dont want to have to spend 3 4 games worth of BP to buy a crate I can't even open period.)Unless you have top teir guns everyone feels like a tankPoorly optomized (fps should scale to your GPU I have a 1080 ti and I only get around 5 8+ fps when compared to my other computer that has a 1070 when they are on the same settings looking at the same view. If the game were optomized I would expect to see at least a 20% frame jump)BIGGEST COMPLAINT There is no progression system. No reward for spending time on this game other then maybe some good highlight reels of you winning or something. Bluehole...give me a reason to play your game....thats all I'm asking. Crates don't count unless you follow in H1Z1's footsteps and make almost every skin from crates look really good. I havent spent a dime on H1Z1 and my character still looks frekin awesome where on PUBG you'd be lucky to get a hat instead of another pair of plane jeans or something stupid like that.

review: Product received for free. Pros It's a pretty nice game which is built from the ground up compared to it's origins.Solid gameplay which is rather fun as long as you're in a group from my experience. Co op feels very rewarding and even when you lose it's pretty okay. A large array of strategies you can take from running over people with vehicles to hiding away until the roster of enemies dwindles enough. The level of strategy is interesting and doesn't get old very fast from what I've seen. Cons When playing solo it can get pretty bitter from time to time. The requirements to obtain lootboxes is pretty steep for beginners with 700 BP being well over 15 matches at least if you don't get lucky and score higher rankings. Makes customization rather annoying especially when you're playing 15+ matches for something you probably don't want. If you play to win expect to have an unpleasant experience. On that topic there seems to be a lotta trolls and hackers in the game. I had to mute public voice chat because people would blair loud music and make rude statements 95% of the time. Additionally aimbot is SUPER common with random cases where there'll be 20 left after the first circle and just a list of people some random guy with an Uzi headshotted in 3 seconds. I'd say the game is okay. There are plenty of better games but if you want a nice team game PUBG is a good title.

review: This game showed a lot of promise when i bought it and in december. Ever since then it's been down hill. Performance is at an all time low since patch 1.0 came out and then throw in some people that play on the wrong server so they get 500 ping and get a massive advantage. Do you like getting shot when you've been behind cover for 2 seconds? Neither do I. Beyond that this was a great game with a great feel ruined by disgusting microtransactions. You have paid crates skins you can buy straight from the marketplace and now an event pass ($10 for ing one month this is ridiculous) that was horribly bugged. You will have a lot of fun playing this game until you start to consistently win. Then you'll just spend the rest of the time getting dissapointed from the change logs that only add microtransaction garbage or frustrated enough to stop playing for the night from the servers.

review: Original Comment Summary of the GamePlayerUnknown BattleGrounds or otherwise known as PubG is one of the most explosive games to come of all time. The Battle Royale genre has never been so enthusiastic about a game so large and free. The game that came out in Mid December of 2017 is a great game everyone should at least play a few times over. The shooting is done fantastic and could not be better with the current variety of weapons and the new scopes that came earlier this week as of March 2018. Their roadmap is fantastic and gives the players a resource to speculate the upcoming updates. The game is exciting at parts and dull at others but that was the intent for the design of the map. As well as the other 2 new maps coming in mid late 2018 and maybe in early 2019 from my speculation I am excited to see how this game will come through development in the coming years.Before 7/16/18 Rating7/10P.S.(If there are any typos please tell me. Thank you!)Didn't mean to make this a long review but sorry if it ended up being one. Had to go through all the major points in this game that I think are the most critical.More Critical Thoughts as of 7/16/18 Note Before whining in the comments below this is suprisingly my own opinionAs of late PubG has been by far one of the worst experiences for an avid gamer such as myself. Deciding on taking the route of EA PubG Corp wants to focus more on money than their own playerbase.Pros Sanhok This has easily been one of the most enjoyable maps I've played since the release of the game. This breathes a new feeling into the game in which every drop you do is a hotdrop or is filled with players. Not only does the map feel unique the devs actually listened to how the players wanted the map and enjoyed the feedback from the map. Lets hope the Winter Map does the same thing.Cons Battle Pass One of the largest disappointing "content" updates was the addition of the battle pass. Much like Fortnite's Battle Pass PubG offers less content and less cosmetics than what Fortnite's System does for a heavier price tag. The Battle Pass has had more issues than their own servers at this point and when it releases for the second time later down the road we can only HOPE for better. Desync I don't know how but god damn it PubG you sure ed up this time. Desync was an issue back when the gun changes released. Eventually they fixed it but boy o' boy do they sure hate their customers. I don't know which dev thought it was a great idea to add this back into the game but you obviously love shooting players behind walls you cheeky . Hit Registration Oh what to say what to say. This great peice of artwork is what happens when the devs are lazy enough to add the most simple mechanics from the UE into their own game. If you've played this game for more than 10 hours you'll know that hit registration in this game is utter t. Not only can you hit players in the hand and do mediocre amounts of damage but tihs can happen multiple times over the course of you just trying to win a gunfight. Bullet Blocking A system that was never introduced to this game even though they wanted to fix it over 6 months ago. I don't know why this system has yet to be tested or even made but if you want a balanced game you sure aren't doing it right. SMG Buff/b The weapon before the buff was already pretty good but now you want to add no recoil to the UMP and give it more damage? I thought the weapon balancing update was supposed to reduce overpowered weapons. Warmode This gamemode shows how out of touch the PubG devs are with their community by adding the same garbage gamemode back into the next week of "content". Just a sorry excuse for trying players to rejoin their game to give it another shot. Latency Server Sided Issue that I know can't be fixed instantly but this has been a problem since I've started playing back in December. Its unreal that they can let a problem go on for so long and have yet to be fixed. FPS/Stuttering This game is by far not for lower end systems. Hell I can barley play on a 1060 6GB. The FPS issue has been there since the beginning but has declined in the recent March update in which I hope they continue to improve as it can still be a problem here and there but overall it needs to be one of their number 1 priorities besides cheaters.After 7/16/18 Rating4/10As much as I enjoy this game for newer players coming into the game wait until the devs get their together and fix their game. As much as I love this game the devs break the game with every update and don't even attempt to fix the bugs anymore. These hotpatches that are half a gigabyte in size is an absolute joke and the way the PubG team is handling this game makes me sick. They imply they care but they are just slowly letting their game die off while Fortnite is actually trying new stuff even though I'm not into it. As much as PubG hates the customers this will still be one of the best experiences of a game before the Desync happened.(I will change my recommendation if they fix this game)

review: The idea behind the game is great but almost nothing works as intended. Each patch they push out has microtransactions but very few bug fixes. If your character is turning in any way it is very difficult to tell where sounds are coming from. There is frequent desync and the hit registration is inconsistent at best. Although this game is a Full Release it is actually still an early access title. Once they have added their intended content hopefully they will start working on a sequel with an entirely different engine. Until then play this game only if you are willing to accept one out of three games to be ended early by an unintended game mechanic.
