review: I almost never post reviews but this game is worth it. Many people think this game is overpriced well in its current state it is. But once this game has mod support and there are multiple maps it will be underpriced and could easily be worth $40 $60.Many people complain about performance and they rightly should but it is early access. Some people have lower end computers and play it fine while others with higher end computers struggle at 20 fps. This game will keep getting optimized until release and it is one of the main points on the dev's plate. Personally I have a mid level computer and have a fairly consistent 50 80fps.GAMEPLAY The gameplay is great a perfect mix between h1z1's arcade feel with Arma 3's realistic approach and gunplay. If you like Arma 3 s battle royal I highly suggest this game if you are sick of h1z1 I would suggest this game. Coming from Arma 3 the gunplay feels exactly the same and many of the same mechanics but without all of the random BS you can live without for a battle royal game. The queue is almost instant (for me a big selling point). The gameplay is a bit difficult to explain if you haven t played Arma so before making a decision I would suggest watching a match to better understand the game as a whole.

review: I've watched a fellow Youtuber play the CBT of this game which is what influenced my chocie to buy this game.At the time of writing this review please keep in mind I have not played many hours into it.First There are issues this is to be expected so if you choose to purchase this game and want very few issues I would wait several weeks. If you purchase this game willing to assist the devs in reporting issues so they can better fix this game then here ya go. Welcome to Early Access.I've noticed when I first got in there was some interesting "Hiccups" as far as graphics. This was mainly when I got into the lobby. Sometimes it would happen during game play. Speaking of game play it is enjoyable. Unlike KoTK I can at least 1 kill almost every match (yea yea I suck). There is some "Lag" when I go to pick up equipment and weapons which in a situation of being RIGHT next to someone makes things almost yell worthy. People seem to complain about the price. $30 is worth this game. Seriously if you help the Dev's who have ties in Arma Battleroyal building this is truely worth each and every penny thus far. I'm looking forward to seeing this game improve and get better.In closing as of right now. If you dont want to play a game with issues (which thus far on my rig are responce time issues) Dont buy it just yet.If you dont mind the bugs and issues then buy all means get this game. Learn become good and rekt people.

review: Lets begin.One day i was enjoying a perfictly healthy life when my best freind came to me and said"hey bruh come play PUBG with me!"Then I was like"sounds good bruh!"So i went home made my donation to the cause and downloaded the mystic PUBG.The End.Jk Jk... There is no addiction story.In reallity I have spent more than 100hrs killing people and for argument sake i will consider myself a subject matter expert. During my 100hrs i learned a few lessons and for you (a perspective buyer) i will list them! Lesson 1. Never underestimate the pan. This tool is often overlooked but can be used to kill protect and make a cool "thoink!' sound. Lesson 2. "Nehow" It is no secret that there are literally tons of chinese players but that is not always a bad thing.They can be pretty cool (even if you can't understand them) and they usually know where all the good stuff is so if you run into some of these players just say "Nehow" and let them do their thing. Lesson 3. Headshots This one is obvious headshots... you get it?... Yeah you get it. Lesson 4. Be the Legend. Any time you are playing with people you dont know it is your time to shine. These matches don't really matter so just run out do some crazy S %! and revel in how your teamates freak out. Worst case senario you die but in the end being a legend is more important. Lesson 5. Hackers!!.exe Lets be honest there are very few hackers on this game and if you are unfortunate enough to run into one well that sucks tough the ods are somewhere in the ballpark of 1/715 562. If you think you were killed by a hacker just report it after death otherwise you are probably just less skilled than the guy who got a headshot on you from 600m away behind a wall with a revolver. it happens! Lesson 6. Fun In the end this game was intended for recreation. There are some who dedicate their entire life to being number one on the leader board (power to them) but if thats not you just have fun. No need to fight or scream or cry or get divorced or sell your house or... nevermind. Just remember to enjoy yourself!

review: I love this game.I REALLY love this game. I have a ton of fun on this game.It's incredibly fun dropping in on the military base finding a shotgun and then gunning down 4 people getting to end game and getting snipped in the head as you have to run across an open field because you got RNG screwed by the ever collapsing circle. Honestly that's fun! It's that little rush of adrenaline that you have knowing that IF you can get across that field you are going to obliterate that Sniper with your UMP9.With all of that said there are issues.The servers are a hot mess right now you will get a great server that responds really well and then the next server you drop 5 shotgun hits on a guy only to be killed by a hip fire headshot from the same guy who should be dead.The game isn't optimized at all and honestly that's not a huge deal. I get about 30 FPS and 22 27 FPS in large towns. I've never noticed this affecting my game play though.So buy at your own risk. But so far the devs contrary to some reviews actually do seem very responsive. There are weekly patches to clean small things up and monthly patches to fix bigger issues. End of June is when they are targeting a server fix to clean up some of the lag issues. If you're questioning if you should buy this game and you're on the fence you may just want to wait until the end of June.However I still enjoy it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So let me start by saying that this game is awesome. Just so you understand my state of mind I came from another BR game and this one has everything I was looking for. Stealthy tactical violence of action tense battles oh crap moments and not to mention is effin battle royale!Please keep in mind the game is still early access and bugs will still exist. That said I am going to proceed with this review as it being early access.My friend tried to play this game and had a hard time. I suspect it was due to his rig and not the game.My Rig i5 6600k16GB 1600 RAMSSDGTX 980 Ti 6GB RAMMy computer plays the game just fine on Ultra. I get about 60 80 FPS with this setting. I have not changed anything in the settings. The game crashes every now and again but for the most part no crashing.My other rigFX 835016GB 1600 RAMSSDR9 390 4GBThe game plays just fine on High settings (was auto set that way). Although I had some trouble after I adjusted everything to medium and changed a couple other settings to low. After the change my game crashes alot. This isn't really that much of an issue. I know someone else with the same video card (R9 390) and they have alot of crashes as well. Now for the Gameplay The last round I played was nothing but running away from the blue circle (don't know what that is? It slowly kills you) and using all my meds to stay alive. I crossed into the good zone and ran into someone camping it waiting for people to cross. I was pretty much instantly killed. This does happen alot on this game but don't let it discourage you. Just click play again and keep it moving.Majority of my games are fairly eventful and I get at least 2 4 kills. I would say most of the kills in the game are opportunistic in nature and from people not checking behind them or their surroundings. The best part of this game is playing in Squads. Squad play goes alot like solo but its way more fun. Lots of teamwork and strategy going on. Nothing like taking out a hole squad by yourself and then reviving your hole team!Summary buy this game if you think your computer will run it. I would seek out forums to see how other similar computers do on this game before taking the plunge. Thanks JimminieCrikets
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is by far one of the worst of the "battle royal" games.It's laggy as buggy unstable servers throughout the entire game. Rubber banding. You can shoot someone 7 times and "knock" him out and then you have to shoot him up to 4 more times just to kill him. Bodyarmours and helmets can be found in different "tiers" (1 3). As always the #3 is very overpowerd. It's also badly optimized and a lot (fps). There's a lot of t factors like you clearly aim above the ground or ledge but still the bullets go into the object infront of you(DickShots). Bullets travel at a speed up to 900km/h and still you have to "lead" your shots quite a bit at just 100meters. Do not buy this game unless you want to get aids and cancer at the same time. This game has almost the same "problems" that H1Z1 had in it's early days with bad hitreg and crap servers with a lot of t factors and bad FPS.

review: Yes its a good game but the ing game keeps freezing/crashing**EDIT**the game has gotten better**2nd EDIT (15/1/18)**Alright lemme start of with this.This game is 70% worth the money.BUT it really needs to solve some main issues before it is really worth what you are paying.(THESE ARE MY OPINIONS FEEL FREE TO DISAGREE OR STATE YOUR OWN IN THE COMMENTS)1st problem Hackers. Not only Chinese people from China but just hackers in general there are too many of them for someone to enjoy a match 3.5/5 times I get a hacker in the match.2nd problem The Lag. Yes it is bearable but there are some moments where you pick up items and it doesnt go into your inventory causing a player to die cause they did not pick up a weapon or something else.3rd problem Fps. Yes it has been better optimized but I still get really horrible fps spikes from time to time ( Even more so after Patch 1.0) &lt I am not sure whether this is due to my PC or something else. Feel free to give your review about it in the comments&gt I also feel that the game can be opitimized to be even better for better fps.Final Notes I don't think we should region lock any country from playing but instead improve on the banning and anti cheating system (Make it harsh or something along those lines)(Please rate the review if you find it helpful so we can help other players or people wanting to buy this game and ADD ON to this review in the comments I would love to see everyones opinion)

review: I played a lot on the test server before 1.0 and reported lots of bugs with videos and explanations as proof but Zork was the only one on the forum that replyed to ONE of my topics saying that he would inform the Devs about the bug.I was disappointed at the lack of response on the forum at the time but was hoping they were seeing what I was seeing and that they were on it!And when the day came for 1.0 I hoped that all the bugs I and others had reported since the test server came up would be fixed. BUT not only were no bugs fixed old bugs suddenly came back with new once as well. I have now been on their forum and twitter and tried to get someone who can confirm that they know about the bugs and that they are working on them to no avail.The game worked better in beta than it does now and the day the game got its full release the PUBG team went silent. I belive they know what storm they made and just want to make another porly made game to earn money and just jump on to the next project at hand. But first they have to release the OH so precious "pay to get" loot crate so they can milk even more money from us.Thank you for being SO responsive when players document bugs. For taking their time to make videos and going through what happend step by step posting pictures and explanations just wanting the game to get better!You should at least have the heart to admit that you dont care about our reports and stop wasting our time with false hope that you will someday fix any of it.

review: Played the game through the early acess period and i can say it is definitely worth your money.Even though there are rendering issues and frame drops performance is great (unless you have an Nvidea car which seem to halt and catch fire every time you drop in) The gameplay and its sheer volitility make this game endlessly fun and i can guarantee that it will provide a good time for you and your friends.Ever since my first Chicken dinner i have savored every moment every kill every loot hotspot. Truely a magic feeling. Although this game has bugs and a bit of a cheater problem on some world servers it offers a solid 8/10 gaming experience and is worth buying.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I want to like this game it still has great potential. Mid to long range fights are not bad close range is absolute garbage. The dsync netcode and overall laginess is a huge problem. Its not an FPS issue thats fine 100 130 rubberbanding getting shot while in cover infuriates me to no end. Its not about "git gud scrub" how would anyone want to get good at a game that is so sluggish in the movement? It feels like you are tied down to the ground and every move you make something just feels off. I will say so far out of all other BR games this is still king I just wish some things were fixed. This is a game that is an insult to its fans and player base they promise optimazation and tons of content but all they can do is be greedy and ad expensive and ugly camos. This game is still borderline unplayable on a vega 64 and optimazation has never come. They took something great and imediatly ruined it. Fortnite may be a joke by now but at least their developers care about their fans and do everything they can to make the game better while tastefully adding cosmetic items.

review: I do not ever write reviews but recently I have felt the urge to do so this game is without a doubt a unique experience in terms of gameplay however there are a great amount of issues that need to be addressed The amount of hackers/cheaters on servers is laughable It is so unoptimized that playing on a computer with the highest calibre still doesn't cut it An influx of chinese players migrating to OCE NA &amp EU servers (most hackers i've seen are chinese) The lobby menu is unresponsive 65% of times Bizzare game mechanics (on certain terrains vehicles etc) Infrequent updates and maintainence for servers and issuesThere are more but I can't think of it on the top of my head. This game used to be so much fun but now I feel as though it is dying out which is upsetting due to the fact of the of the fundamental gameplay design being unique It feels like Bluehole is not paying enough attention to the major issues but instead adding microtransactions and maps. To conclude blueballs get your ing together and fix it other than that I would not bother wasting money on this game until those issues have been fixed.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game itself is awesome. The idea has been done before but there's something that draws you to play this. I do have some issue with it though. There is no region lock so most of the time you get some other region players (like China). Most of the time its ok but sometimes they do kill me for my gears. Another problem is the aiming (to me it seems). Sometimes you can unload a whole entire clip of bullets and not hit them at close range. And I'm talking about within the same house. Another one is the clothes spawn. Clothes does nothing for the most part so why not limit them and increase weapon spawn. I wish there was more maps. It gets tiring playing the same one over and over again.Overall if you can get past these few issues then get it. I believe its more fun with friends than going solo.

review: CONS Chineese invaded all servers even NA servers. Hackers everywhere. The Anti Cheat system is a joke. Unoptimized laggy game. Boring when playing solo. At least 5 15 AFKs in every game instead of 100 Alive per game it's more like 80 90 Alive. Requires an Above Average PC to run 60 FPS at decent resolution / quality.Counter Attack To CONS Overall if you wanna have a great time playing this game. Just play with your friends you'll enjoy the game WAY more and usually the cons that are in this game fade away while playing with your friends. It may not seem like much but when you're playing with a squad full of friends that actually speak English and can communicate you tend to look away from the cons a lot more. So I recommend you try this game but do keep the cons I listed in your mind.

Flying out the air and 50 people landing all in this same spot. First couple people get their heads bashed in with fists and pans and whoever grabs the first weapon (probably won't get lucky enough to get one) owns that city or spot.OR2. Flying out the air and landing completely out of sight out of mind... FAR AWAY FROM CIVILIZATION just to camp a house for the first 10 mins and wait for everyone to die until you're the last one alive to get CHICKEN DINNER TRASH with your 1 pathetic camping kill.SOUNDS FAMILIAR? OH WAIT H1Z1 WITH BETTER GRAPHICS. OH WAIT WELCOME TO I CAN WIN FIRST PLACE WITH 0 KILLS BECAUSE THIS GAME IS FUN. Yes very "livid" because I don't see how people can enjoy camping with their friends for 30 mins to just get gunned down like the degenerate they are and get 1 kill and say "Lets queue again"After 3 games of 40 mins camping I'd rather play League of Legends RANKED with 4 of the worst players possibly even an afk. NO THANK YOU PUBGS You took my money good job but sadly will not recommend. UPDATE Does not matter when game finally has achievements... makes playing an RNG shooter worth it.

review: My original review was positive and I listed a few issues that I thought were a little annoying but the more I play this game I can't forgive the ridiculously un polished nature of the gameplay. Between lag inconsistent hit registration and the general buggy nature of the game there is almost no desire left for me to play this game after the initial novelty wore off. And instead of fixing bugs this developer is more concerned with adding more micro transactions an obvious money grab given that their game still feels like a beta or worse. The in game friends list and invite system doesn't even work right. I can be in a party with my friends and they still show up as offline in my list. I can still buy "random crates" with battlepoints though. Granted practically every other case requires a $2.50 key to open....thankfully there are no bugs in the game where there is money to be made. Don't get me wrong the game is a great concept but they don't seem terribly concerned about doing what needs to be done to make their game a quality experience. If you can get this game on sale it might be worth it but unless you're down for some incredibly annoying experiences don't bother.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

(I love the grand scale of the maps)It's quite a simple premise which is really nice I do like the odd army sim but this just allows you to have a simple run and gun game (or hide in a corner and cower!!) just all around fun without having to read a 200 page manual! This game is going to become HUUUGE!!!!

review: The game is rampant with cheaters and really toxic players in matchmaking you have no chance with being paired with an english speaking player but hey that happens in online games the devs went on banning runs through out the early days banning people for steam sniping or team killing but now they don't even lift a finger to try and ease the hacking if you live in OC or AS then you're pretty much done for due to the huge ammount of hackers from china (not saying they all do it but there has been a huge bump in cheating since its release there) the new map Miramar takes three times longer to load then the old one does there are loot crates that require keys in them and some that don't but for real the second they become a bit less sought after that free one will become worthless.There are some good points about this game the rush you get when you're pinned down or when you're crawling around at the #10 spot the guns are also pretty satisfying and when you play with friends it is extremely fun but the cheaters and the useless anti cheat just makes it so un fun.I don't hate this game I don't think anyone who put more then 50 hours into this really does its just that these new problems that PUBG Corp won't fix really drags down this legitimatly fun game which is a shame since the new fixes to the hit detection and BP system seem to be pretty legit but the cheating really needs to be dealt with and china needs their own server not saying region lock but I think their own server would really bring this problem down since the sheer ammount of players there need their own space that the AS and OC servers can't give them.

review: I love this game but there is no way I can moraly endorse it. There are so many problems and what encouraged me to write this review is not what I've seen in other reviews about cheating and desync and lag and other BS. Those issues have been made aware of and if the devs arent already trying to fix them they probably never will. But two days ago halfway through a match all game audio for me disapeared and no the game is not muted and I've looked through my computer settings for the audio output and mixer says its not sending any noise so in gam settings are not muted and reinstalling hasnt done anything and well I've played a few games without audio since then and it is very difficult but not unplayable what is unacceptable though is that this can happen at all and not be fixable. I looked on forums and there have been multiple cases some caused by ignorance and other cases like mine unsolved and I will continue to play the game when I feel like it untill it miraculously works at some point because thats how all the other probles ive had went away they didn't.I cannot ecomend this game for $30 because I don't think its worth that much and honesty should still be in beta.

review: UPDATED REVIEW While the game is still getting updates none seem to revolve around bug fixes and optimization. There is still lots of server lag (plane goes forward and back etc) and the game stutters often. For a while the buggy nature of this game was part of the charm but given the sales numbers and amount of time on the market its becoming unacceptable. Adding on to that every update seems to be just a cash grab. Every single crate needs a key the event pass was worthless and its becoming clear that all they care about is money. I really liked this game but unfortunately without the devs giving more TLC to how the game runs I think I'm out. ORIGINAL REVIEW This game keeps getting better. It seems they've cut down on the cheaters a bit I'm not seeing nearly as much as I have in the past. The game still has its jank which can be part of the charm at time but in no way it the game broken. I still can't get enough after 200+ hours of play. If you haven't given it a shot yet do.

review: In early access this game showed a lot of promise. It was the first BR game my friends and I tried and we loved it. Unfortunately there have always been some pretty poor hit registration and netcode. The game is buggy with people killing you around corners or soaking up several shotgun spreads to the face being a frequent occurrence. This isn't helped by the mechanics being generally quite clunky with not a lot being done about that (they added the vaulting stuff which helps) and the performance being patchy at best.Rather than fix this the developers have constantly released crates and cosmetic items to milk more cash out of people.Overall I don't feel compelled to keep playing and would recommend you look for alternative BRs that care about maintaining the game rather than adding more rubbish to try and make a quick buck.

review: Lemme get this out of the way. I love PUBG. It's a wonderful way to meet people learn new phrases like "ur mum gay" and check that your blood pressure medication is working.The gunplay is phenomenal and quite realistic. Just like in an actual combat setting 9/10 times I die from a suppressed sniper two counties over and the other time is because I went flying first into a tree after my motorcycle hit a 0.00001mm pebble and went from 100km/h to a dead stop instantly. It's quite true to life.The circle also represents the fact that on any given day 1/100th of the people are going to come out on top because they start where they need to end up and they coast through on easy mode with the game literally handing them everything they need in a cloud of red smoke occasionally placing a boot print on someone's face when they get too near. Meanwhile everyone else has to scratch for the barest of essentials and fight over the single spot where they can contend with Fate's Chosen One.My only complaint is these two guys who follow me everywhere. Sometimes they're in a big team rarely they're solo but usually they're in a group of about four in solo mode. Their usernames always change but I can tell it's the same two people because they're always talking to one another. They're apparently called "Cow Knee Ma" and "Chai Nanum Bawun" or something close. They're in roughly 3/4 of my games and they must have some secret DLC because sometimes they move like greased lightning or have Superman style X Ray vision scopes.Anyway PUBG is a great game so long as you can get past the few small issues.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I am updating my review since I returned to the game recently and many of my issues with this game have been cleared up. This by no means states that they have done EVERYTHING but they have done enough that I believe I can recommend this game now.The early game issues stated in my previous review have been lessened. I am now able to load in land and am much more likely to consider landing aggressively now that I can fight early on (most of the time).The circle has become signifanctly less of an overbearing problem with it's previous high speed short timer and heavy damage. The travel speed of the circle has been reduced significantly early on so it doesnt feel (as much) like you are just getting eternally f**ked by the circle. The timers have been altered somewhat as well. The damage is still as heavy as it was before but I am fine with that personally.I am very happy that the developers took the time needed in order to fix the vast majority of issues when it comes to cheating. I feel this has helped the health of the game in far many more ways than I believe the developers realized.This game feels far more like it is a released game especially with the recent addition with the "event" game modes which I absolutely love as a concept. I hope that this rotating game mode is constantly active and rotating between different modes rather than how some other games do their special modes. Example of this 'A special game mode but only on weekends'. I would much rather see each event mode be constantly available until a new/rotated event replaces it.I still have a few concerns and complaints however. The biggest complaint at the moment being the implementation of "Teaming" being a reportable offense. While I can somewhat understand this being implemented for pros and streamers. I find that this takes away from what makes PUBG organic. If 2 squads of people meet in the battlegrounds and instead of instantly shooting eachother decide to make a peace and work together until the final battle I believe they should be able to. The threat of betrayal is always present and they will have to fight eachother eventually. Added on top of the extremely low chance of 2 groups have friends happening to be in the same game together. This seems like a negative aspect on something that would make the game far more interesting all because of the very few.Lastly something I didn't consider but am pleasently surprised about. With the rise of other games taking away some of PUBG's spotlight this game has started developing an interesting lax and fun community. I have been having a lot more fun playing this game with random people rather than just my friends. I believe this is the shining point for me to enjoy playing this game again.Overall I believe this game is now worth buying. I just hope the continue to improve and fix the issues I have that have yet to be addressed.I left my previous review intact below.Previous Review("I love this game. I honestly do. I really want this game to do well but it first needs to do better. There are more bugs and issues with this game than modern day Triple A titles.""The early game being one of the most painful experiences you can have.First you get stuck because the parachute fails to register that you landed. Then wait there for 3 5 seconds until the game decides to give you mercy and allow you to cut the line. After is a rapid run to grab guns that the game is unable to register being picked up. There is nothing more frustrating than being on a time restraint and clicking 17 times to pick up a gun that only appears in your inventory after death. Not to mention the intense latency that occurs in any early game combat.""General issues such as randomly dying while walking and the game claiming you "died by falling" and being randomly ejected from a moving vehicle.""I also have several issues with things like the circle but that is much more understandable and necessary.""I don't feel like going too deep into the loot boxes but I do feel like the latest 'key required' box heavily pushes a cash grab image.""This game should not be released from early access in its current state. All praise from people that are happy that it came out of early access are people that just have a bad taste for the title "Early Access".""Bottomline I can not recommend this game at this time. Not until some of these blatant problems are solved in at least some capacity.""Side note there are still many issues that I don't have on my mind at the time of writing this review but I will be interested in updating this when something significant occurs.")
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is like russian roulette. You can have a fun fantastic game where you do very well and in another you encounter a cheater or your game crashes. True story here. Once I was playing this mess and my game crashed when I was doing very well. I was annoyed but I was willing to give it another chance. I opened PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS and it gave me an option to join the same game again. Yes! I was very excited. When I loaded into the game I saw something strange. I was stuck underwater. Dead. With my death box thing floating next to me. What? I was incredibly dissapointed. A crashing game is bad but want to know whats worse? A game that crashes and that doesn't work when you join back in. It could have only me who has ever experienced this but it soured my view of this game. Now I am unmotivated and I don't want to touch this game in a long time.The game runs way better than it used to in its early access stages. I can now run this game flawlessly.5/10

review: 4/10 of the games I join are trying to stay alive within the forcefield... which that part sucks because it moves way too often in my opinion. The game becomes a running simulator until you run across a guy camping who originally parachuted within the circle who has had time to arm himself well. Basically I was the camper guy and the unequipped person charging me in the house fleeing the forcefield only had a smoke grenade and his fists. We stood face to face knowing what was about to happen. I dropped my weapons and raised my hands he tossed his smoke to fill the room and we settled things like men. Blind men but men nonetheless. After the smoke cleared his body was laying on the floor and my health was low as the forcefield was now way past my position and my health was bleeding out. I starting looting him just to find out there was a skillet on the ground by his body then I was killed by a stray bullet to the that originated from a dispute I could hear going on several houses down through the balcony door.0/10 should've equipped the pan to cover my faster.Meh kinda fun sometimes...

review: This is my go to game not going to lie. I have had hours of fun playing this every game is different in some shape or form. The game can be slow but thats just like H1Z1 and any game in this category. It has a full range of weapons to use rather than H1Z1 for example where it mainly is one or two. I'd also say the community is much better and the game is updated regularly to keep the game on top level. I purchased the game ages ago and actually got a refund just becuase it was unplayable for me at the start but like i said the devs listen and work with the players to get the best the game has come on massively over the past months. You can play Solo Duo or Squads and i'd honestly say you get so much more enjoyment out of it playing as a squad with mates who you can communicate with and coming up with ways to win the game and kill players.Solo is also good but can get boring over time as you're just on your own. Overall i would have to rate this game a solid 8/10 for everything.

review: This game is addictive. However the early access has a lot to improve. Controls are bad huge difficulties breaching/climbing walls cannot escape out windows etc. Everyone familiar with BF know how it should be. The sound allows you to hear a person walk on the floor inside a building miles away which is unlikely but you dont hear someone driving behind you and kill you in the last minute. Sound in not 3D and is important in a game like this that it is accurate and just right. You often die due to a bug or strange thing in the game. So the developers should focus on improving sound and making the character move better.

review: 8.5/10 9/10 if a few non game breaking issues are fixed.I purchaced this game a few months ago and i have loved it since the start at the start i had no idea what i was doing but i quickly picked up and understood how to play the game has alot of possabiltys going into the future I LOVE the intence feeling of the top 5 people and the relef when you finally kill the last man while the mid game can be a little bit slow i really enjoy playing every minunet of this game.a few things that should be noted before playing this game. NOTE THIS GAME IS AMAZING IM JUST LETTING YOU KNOW OF A FEW ISSUES1. I am playing on a 2011 GPU at 30 fps so any newer system 'should' easly hit 60fps2. There are a few bugs they can be irritating but they dont happen too often so they are not game breaking as many reviews say3. Cheaters are present but the issue is not as big as it is layed out to be in my 400 hours i have seen 6 cheaters 4 where in a squad and we downed 3 of them before loosing (was kinda fun tbh) but bluehole and battleeye are putting effort into solving these issues. 4. in getting this game you have to be prepared to loose a fight by not finding a gun it happens but it also happens the other way alot too many people complain about not getting a gun but then laugh when they do and the other doesnt over multiple games it is close enough to fair.5. there are a few server issues near the start of the game but again not game breaking you might just have to press f on an item 2 3 times instead of once to get it.Be prepared to go into the game and experiance a few odd things with glitches e.t.c but you cant expect perfection no game is glitchless for example csgo still has odd things found by the community regually. What matters is that you can enjoy this unique game. Side note. Please Dont get trashy at my grammar and stuff i cbf writing formally.

review: The most over rated game of all time.I've been #6 on na solo leaderboards in 2017 June. #2 on duo NA test server november 2017.Top 100 countless times I don't try to leader anymore.With that said I'm a good experienced player from 2012 Arma 2 BR days ( PlayerUnknown's humble beginnings as a modder) and as of christmas eve 2017 this game is still complete Just luck based. I and other pros win only 15% of games played. There are too many uncontrollable elements like 'hey I got nothing and he got a ing m416. Cool I lose.' Easily fixed by code forcing every ing building to atleast spawn a pistol. Atleast. And the circle.. I could write paragraphs but I wont about how unfair/luck based it is as of 12/24/17. Wouldn't recommend the most overrated game of all time.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Hackers. Hackers? Hackeerrrrrrs! Chinese hackers!Want to see a hacker get b*tch slapped in public?? Go watch the following video.https //www.reddit.com/r/PUBATTLEGROUNDS/comments/78sl5o/this_is_how_pubg_hackers_are_treated_in_chinese/I would NOT recommend PUBG in its current state. Now is definately not a good time. Hackers have recently INVADED the game.Pros Addictive and satisfying gunplay Looting adds to the thrill Map design is good Vehicles are fun to operate Micortransactions are strictly cosmetic When the match is clean the game is really entertainingCons Optimalization Lags issues Desync Door Hackers Terrible net code Intercontinental connections make the net code break completely Chinese player base is taking over North American servers and most of them are hacking (fact) Devs are not focusing on the most crucial aspects of the game like the ban system/anti cheat/net codeNever before have I seen a game thrust into the lime light like this one when it's so obviously broken. It's popular because it's fun......when it's working properly. Unfortunately right now it's a hot f***ing mess. The devs seem to be focusing on the least important parts of the game and it's severely obvious like a turd on a concrete sidewalk. Instead when they should be fixing these issues they are pushing for the esports arena because of how popular it has gotten and they want to capitalize on that I get it!! But this is one thing that baffles me in it's current condition it is NO WHERE NEAR qualified for esports. It's still in alpha for Christ's sakes. How is it ready for a leap into pro competitions?As of today the servers are over run with hackers. When I first started playing it wasn't so bad but now it's every match. The leaderboards make that fact crystal clear. Even though over 150 000 bans have been handed out it's not stopping the epidemic. It's now said that around 42 000 bans are made each day. It makes you think at that rate how many legit players are actually playing? 42 000 a day? So technically I guess you could chalk up it's popularity to cheating/hacking f**cks who wish only to ruin your experience. Also if you think about this as well some of these people are repurchasing the game just to hack it again. Sounds like money in the bank for Bluehole to me. UPDATE 11/7/17 PUBG Corp. has vowed to make good on the hacking situation but whether they do so remains to be seen. I for one am not going to hold my breath and neither should you. My initial review opinions remain the same. Give this game more time to develope.PUBG is fun and addictive when it's a clean match but the net code and hacking are tearing it down. Bluehole er excuse me PUBG CORP. for some ungodly reason saw fit to allow foreign connections as well for example Asia to North America in a game where the net code is already bad enough with NA to NA connections. Because of this the hacking epidemic is not only affecting Asian servers but every other server North America being the hardest hit. Expect lag at the beginning of the game expect lag when a foreign connector enters your network bubble expect lag when the moment is most crucial. Broken. Simply put PUBG is spiraling the drain at the moment. If you like the abuse of frustrating games then go ahead and give them your money if you prefer a clean gaming experience then I would honestly steer clear right now until Bluehole gets their sh*t together. If these critical issues are resolved then and ONLY then would I rewrite my review and give it a thumbs up because it really deserves it. It's a fun game all quarrels aside. I have more of an issue with the degenerates hacking it than I do with the devs making it. Without this plague it would be on track to major success.

review: Player Unknown's Battleground is a fantasitc game.I have played enough to understand the mechanics and basics of this game as I am nearing 400 hours. Recently It might just be me but I have noticed a decline in hackers. This may be due to the devs' efforts or something else. NA servers used to be riddled with Asian players and I simply want them gone from NA. This is not 'xenephobic' or 'racist' as devs have previously described It's just me and thousands of other NA players who don't want our gameplay hindered by Chinese hackers and trust me when I say the vast majority of hackers are Chinese. The recent additions of event modes have added an exhilirating twist to the game and offers us new content to explore and enjoy.The new map in development 'Savage' will be a great addition to PUBG as I find myself bored often of the repetitiveness of current maps. I played it on experimental servers and it proved to be great the new map offers a shorter game time allowing for more frequent gunfights between players and an overall faster game.I do enjoy new skins being introduced ect but by adding crates and skins the devs are creating a new source of income and thus inviting more hackers who will make a profit off of these items. I am mixed on my opinion of skins and cosmetics but I know many players feel negatively about it. devs have also hinted an M416 and and other AR rifles nerf. I do not think they should nerf such guns and aswell as removing the level 3 helmet from spawns and putting it in crates. This is just unnecesary. Instead of nerfing guns why not tackle the hacking problem haunting PUBG servers? PUBG will stay a popular game for a while as long as new maps and event modes keep on coming and the hacking problem is fixed. The experiences I have had on PUBG have been very fun and I enjoy playing this game alot. Note Mostly whenever I play games with randoms I get friendly/co operative teamates which Is something I appreciate alot about PUBG. I do not like it however when I am paired with an Asian who lacks the ability to speak English. Thank you PUBG for bringing me so many thrilling and worthy hours of gameplay. Keep on imrpoving the game devs and your playerbase will be thankful. (

review: Having logged over 400 hours and going through many cycles of excitement and disappointment with this game I completely understand why other BR games are growing while PUBG is fading.Over the last few patches my overall game performance has somehow gotten worse despite the devs proudly announcing optimizations and other performance fixes. It s getting harder and harder to win fire fights bc my game chunks out whenever a close quarters battle breaks out. This is almost a game breaking issue for me and it s shocking that it s actually getting worse with each patch.In comparison with other BR games the wait time to get into a game in PUBG is dreadfully long. Add in plane and parachuting time and the wait between periods of action is way too long. This makes dying even more of a punishment so it discourages aggressive play. Other BR games have already learned from this by incentivizing players to actually seek out and engage enemy players.Unlike many people I actually like Miramar but agree the map needs more prime looting areas and more vehicles. Otherwise it is very much a running simulator.I feel that PUBG is at a cross roads. They are trying to give us more content but at it is coming at the cost of other essential fixes that should ve been made long ago. We re not gonna wait around forever Bluehole!

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I don't have to mention Region LockThat is an issue for experienced players that somehow enjoyed this mess...This isn't a good game. And i mean it. I have a friend who pratically me off to play this game to the point he bought the game himself and shipped off to my account. And I hope he reads this. You'll spend about 2 minutes to get into the game. Then after you land down you'l walk and walk and walk and walk and walk looting weapons armor backpacks and all kinds of things. Then after minutes of endless walking/looting you'll come across a single player. You will either kill him while he is looting stuff or the other way arround.... then back to lobby back to queue and it starts all over again. Run loot and ocasionaly get a kill from someone that can't see you. I know they had a bold and realist idea for the game concept but it is just not fun. Good ideas don't make the game by itself. it is required more than that...The map could suport about 1000 players and it would be still a low demographic situation.... For a shooting game there isn't much shooting. There's a lot of looting. That's about 80% of what you do in a shooting game.... And there are many games with massive number of players on huge maps with vehicles (like battlefield for instance) with much more action fun and playablilityThere are also a lot of features that make the game much more complicated than it shold really be for instance having a buttong to switch the fire type (can't we just pick weapons and shoot? have these dudes played counter strike? call of duty?) multiple amuniton types scopes and add ons that are randomly spawned multi level kevlar backpack and helms (really? what for?) that really make up for the true nature of this game bad programingI played the last game and after 5 minutes of loneliness i was harassed by misterious shots. I'm not an shooting expertise but when something hits me from behind or anyother direction (like a stone or a slap) i know where it came from. Well not in this game. You'll be totally lost about where the shots are coming either it hit you or not. then i forced the auto run and rotated the camera (with alt button) 360º twice and slow and still couldn't find the shooter till he finaly had me. I turn on the death cam and guess what. the dude was visible from a point that i checked like twice. i could even see my avatar facing his direction before dying. So you'll need a top GPU if you hope to even find the enemy. I have a GeForce GTX650 Ti 1GB. I know it isn't much nowadays but that GPU allows me to play OVERWATCH Call Of Duty Need for Speed and other games at medium/low graphics at top performance. Well for PUBG i've set the graphics to very low and the game still crashes ticks freezes and don't render the enemies b4 they kill me. I'm about to install Fortnite to see how bad this game really isDON'T BUY IT. NOT WORTH IT at least for PC.

review: I've played dozens of rounds in this game both solo and duo and I've never once had a bad game. Sure I've died really early on in a few but I still had fun. It's exhilarating being thrown into a giant arena with up to 100 other people. It doesn't matter if you're new you'll soon find your own playstyle whether it's jumping head first into a firefight or tailing someone to wait for the perfect opportunity to off them or whatever. I know people are salty about a lot of things in this game and honestly people just want to find something to complain about. One day it's slightly buggy server issues (which TOTALLY warrants a bad review /s) the next it's Chinese people using NA servers (?). But really I've rarely had a noteworthy problem with this game. I've just had a bunch of fun.

review: So I originally picked this game up when it first launched on Steam. It was riddled with bugs. Game crashed on my first 2 matches other 2 had horrible hit registration. Leveled a shotgun at a dude as he walked through the door fired and the pellets just warped through him and hit the wall on the otherside of this person. Obviously I winded up dying shortly after even though I shouldn't have been the one that died. Winded up refunding it.Fast forward to last week and I got a coupon for GMG to buy the game for 22 bucks. Asked a couple of friends madly in love with the game if I should grab it and each time it was met with a resounding " YES. GIT IT"Game got better. Game got much much better. Plugged in 17 hours over the past few days I've only had one crash and zero issues with hit reg. With those issues solved the game is just fun. Like nothing is game breakingly new but the mixture of loot craze from years of CRPGS tense firefights the joy of getting the drop on someone since you heard them walking around a corner or hill it's that perfect cocktail of fun. Plus there are some vistas in the game that are just gorgeous to look at and consequently camp at. From the group of houses in some swamp lake the ruins of a castle to the multitude of rolling hills to duck in.My only complaint as of now is that the foilage just cuts off. For both a tactical reason and a "ooo this pretty" reason. Seeing the cornfields and cornucopia of colours that come with the abundance of nature in this game would be great to look at from a distance. But after a certain distance even on ultra it just stops. Takes you out of a game that's usually very immersive. Also no one likes to seem completely hidden in a field of wheat from their POV just for some jackass with an 8x scope noticing someone just laying down with zero cover. I know it'd be hard to fix due to optimization issues that would crop up which they're definitely hard at work at optimization this game but it's my only real grievance with the game. Just let me be hidden in my wheat fields like a Hobbit worthy of the name Took.

review: Let me get this out there. I enjoy this game it is really fun when everything works properly there is a nice challenge and the pacing from the zones is just right.Now I am going to state why exactly I cannot reccommend this game to anyone at this point in time.Cheating. There is such a large amount of people cheating. What I mean by this is that it is not even about how many individuals just how many squads have a designated cheater (exaggerating a little but not too much.) People use anything from an aimbot to a program that removes certain aspects of the game to gain an advantage (and by this I mean removing things trees rain or fog and other environmental factors that make the game more challenging.)Servers. When playing PUBG you can randomly disconnect from the server and not be allowed back into a game. This problem happens in both solo and team matches.Disconnecting is obviously more destructive when you play in team games due to leaving your friends/pubs with one less member. In my experince there also is an issue that arises when server connectivity is somewhat spotty assets. During periods of connection problems there seems to also be an issue of some assets not loading in. Weather this is a vehicle or character model it does not matter the fact is that it extremly hampers the enjoyment and playability of the game.Fun update If you like playing in North American servers with nothing but chinese players this is the game for you! You want a game that prioritzes the input of Asian players we got you. You want a game where you get shot through a wall because of lag? We got ya fam!With 1.0 being released you can tell how much of shill Greene is. He and the team rushed out the game so fast and is trying to include as many people in as few servers as possible. Do you want to chug along in a game for the first few minutes while the servers slowly hemorage? Great glad you like PUBGs newest feature! The only issues that actually are addressed by the developers are so minor that they do not even warrent mentioning. It is all just a cash grab.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game has a unique combination of third person action genre with survival elements that is well known in games like H1Z1 and the original ARMA 2 mod named "Playerunknown's BattleRoyal". The game is fun to play solo but the game's full glory is shown when you play with your friends in duo/squad modes. The game is buggy and physics are broken at this point but it's okay for an Early Access game. The reason I'm giving this game a thumb's down is that the developers are not focusing on fixing the game's problems and instead they are trying to add more content and e sport features to it. This is not what I paid Bluhole (now PUBG corp.) my money. When I pay for an Early Access title I expect devs to use my money to fix the game and then add extra content and features after the release or at least when the game became stable enough. The cheaters are flourishing and that's because many incidents in the game don't have server side checks. If you have a decent rig and don't mind to die from game's problems from time to time then buy it. If you can't take dev's neglections save your time and nerve and wait to see how this turns out.EDIT so after getting out of early access the game have seen some love on the performance front although it's not enough it made the game playable for me so i'll now give this game a tumbs up.

review: I initially gave this a good review. After seeing how the game grew with neglect to the actually players of the game I can actually see how shady of a company Bluehole really is. Suing the makers of their game engine not fixing connectivity issues cheaters LOTS of crates that require keys bought with real money and now the monthly PAID event pass. People wanted progression. They gave it to us but only those who are willing to pay for it (which isn't even great from what I hear). Just a money hungry company on their fans. I loved this game at first minus the cheater issue. I wanted to be able to keep talking good about this game but after all of this I really hope this game goes down in flames. The only reason I will even play it from time to time is because of my friends that I have made while playing it which I am actually trying to talk them into playing Ring of Elysium which is free. It is a shame to have to change my review like this.

review: I come from a longtime background of BR and open world survival games starting with DayZ mod Epoch Breaking Point etc. Overall I like PUBG in small doses but it's hard for me to really get into.One major downside for me is shooting someone a bunch of times while they freely run away. I enjoy realism it is inherent to this genre. I would like to see combat become less like an arcade game. Think of Call of Duty vs Squad. That's the best comparison I can make. Changing the base game isn't a necessity either They could add a "realism" or "hardcore" mode for people wanting a realistic experience. Options are always good and draw a wider player base.

review: I like the game a lot sometimes. I had awsome fun in Solo and with my mates. But it is a mess and you might just be better off to go with something similar and a studio behind it that can actually support such a game. Connection issues Cheaters overall clunkyness new bugs every patch just take a lot of fun out of it.The addition of lootcrates (for some you have to pay to open) and lazy ugly weapon skins just make all of this more annoying. I can understand that all those graphics staff need to get to do something while the rest of the team messes up the game even more but some of the skins look like a really untalented three year old had an fieldday with paint.Id advise to fo to another game if you can drag your mates away from this thing. It is addicitve fun once in a while but it might just not be worth the bitterness and frustration over how much this potentially ingenious game is handled.

review: Product received for free. I think that this is one of the greatest game of its kind but i have 4 cons 1. Cheaters This is the first game what I've played with so many cheaters there were approx 4 cheaters in 5 games. It's really demotivational when you try to chase ken dinner.2. English keyboard I am from Czech republic so I am using czech keyboard. In every game I have never had a problem with keyboards but this is the one. When I have czech keyboard I can't switch weapons on 12345...Yea you can simply shift + alt to change on english keyboard but when you play the game you often running with shift and looking around with alt so you change it back to czech and when you are in close fight and try to switch your weapon you are dead..3. Sound system A lot of time in this game I've got shot from nowhere in some situation you are not able to recognize"where the fu** is he shooting from"..sound of shooter is spread all around you and not on specific location. Sometimes I here it behind me but they are in front of me and it really pis**s me off. Another problem with sound is that I would like to have balanced sound I always must mute my sound in airplane or where airplane flyes around me or when redzone comes. I would appreciete in this situation lower down master volume to not destroy my ears.4. Bluezone balance This is the most game influencing and most rng element in this game between lose and win. I really don't like this randomness. I would like to win(or lose) my game on skill no on random zone. It would really help if you invent some algorithm to balance zone. Something like compromise between position of players possition on maps loot number of players etc etc.Please focus on these problems and make this game the best!Thanks but FOR NOW NO (

review: At this point in time it is hard for me to recommend the game. Hear me out though.With over 450 hours (I have 40 hours on test server as well) and around 65 wins... It's safe to say there's a huge love/hate relationship with this game. No other game has made me feel this way in a long time.The game is great nobody can deny that. Although there are many aspects that draw in a lot of negativity towards the game for example No recoil hacks are still kind of around. I see them every now and again on OC FPP in top 500. Desync still plays a major factor in many deaths that I have gotten e.g. Aiming around a corner really quick on your screen but on the server (Killcam) you are staring around the corner for more than 2 seconds. Red zones can be a huge problem due to how RNG they are. In my personal opinion they should be removed. Lootboxes are quite ridiculous at the moment and it pretty much forces you to buy what clothing item or weapon skin you desire through the expensive marketplace. They could fix this by implementing a system similar to Call of Duty or Battlefield where you can unlock new cosmetics by completing challenges.Suggestions Please get rid of clothing items in game. It's quite annoying when you pick up some boots instead of a rifle. Add a practice range/custom maps. FIX THE THREE SEATER PLS. Chicken dinner rewards A rare clothing item or skin. Add the ability to spectate after you have been killed. Reduce the time in pre game lobbies I don't want to wait 3 minutes for another game to start. Lastly WE WOULD LOVE A MAP SELECTION BLUEHOLE!Anyway there's just a couple of my thoughts at this current time. The game has so much potential it's just a matter of how the devs treat it. Right now I would probably give the game a 6.5/10 Slighty above average.

Bugs are reasonable since its early access but lack of something new makes it hard to enjoy. The new map and vaulting and guns should fix it for a while but if there doesnt become a goal for the game like a rank system or progression that is more permenent unlike the leaderboards it will be bland.

review: I've been waiting for the final release to buy this game. So the game runs really smooth on my system (GTX1080ti and i7 3770k) at around 100fps (min 80fps max 120fps) on Ultra settings 2560x1440 resolution. The craphics look nice nothing too special tho. I like the game scenes I just thing that it needs some work with the draw distance (long distances look too empty because of this also its really easy to spot enemies) and fill the game field with more details and stuff.The guns look nice and real they sound quite good and they are deadly enough (I would prefer them a bit more hardcore buts its ok).I haven't experience any bugs and glitches or performance issues that I head were common in pre release versions.The servers run perfect so far no lag.I haven't met any hacker so far (playing on Europen servers) but many people are companing so something should be done about that by the devs.One thing they need to fix ASAP is the grass draw distance. After a few meters there is no grass and anything on the terain and its so easy to see people and theres no cover.

review: The game is a decent early access battle royal game. With that being said it is early access and is plagued with issues still from performance to not being finished. Make sure to read rules of conduct before getting game if you enjoy stream sniping don't get game as it is bannable offense and they aren't afraid to bad at the drop of a hat.The "mininum" requirements are not accurate to get the game to run on systems with those settings I have had to help people go into settings files to cap FPS as it isn't an in game option. If you have a very hi end computer the game does look good but you will also see performance dips. Next has to do with the genre that this game doesn't do well currently to combat. RNG chance at loot and sometimes spending 25 minutes of your 30 minute game just running/driving to circle not having action can get old after a few games. Some other battle royales have done tweaks to map size/safe zone size/and spawn rates of vehicles to help combat this this game has not and could benefit from it.Finally early access not finished. This means all the previous issues could be fixed in coming months. The developer is pretty good about updates and releases. Hopefully it is a game that doesn't end up staying in early access and is actually fully released before the hype dies down and people no longer interested in game.I wouldn't buy this game on my own only reason I got was to play with friends as they got it because of hype. Fun game with friends for a few games but for me the game isn't flushed out enough to be excited to play solo or even push friends to hop on and play with me.

review: I never played any of the other Battle Royal games that were out until now (H1Z1 the Culling etc.) but I have always been interested in these type of games. After I finally bought it I was not disappointed I was instantly hooked into the game. Sure there are a lot of bugs but it's in early access so that is to be expected and I immediately saw them working on these problems in updates which is where I understand where the other games failed. Another thing that I really enjoyed about this game compared to the others was how well optimized it is. The game renders a distance rather than the entire map and buildings do not cause a massive lag spike. Even the beginning area where there is up to 100 people only drops like 15 fps and that is with all the explosions smoke fire and shooting going on.UPDATE Latest updates completely ed this game and now the servers are utter garbage do not get this game in it's current state. Maybe later they will fix this or maybe they will just screw us over take the money and run who knows? Never had a game this good go to utter this fast. Literally one unnecessary update screwed the game and people are leaving and refunding left and right. The subreddit is sucking on the devs nipples trying to smear anyone who calls this game what it is bad. Fix it or this game will die.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKNOWNS BATTLEGROUNDS Pros Very fun and addicting Fun when you find people who are alone in a duo match and you beat them to death at the start of a round Decently varied selection of weapons More vehicles spawning than H1Z1 King of the hill People try to kill you in a car as soon as they see you and fail DCons In development so only one map one gamemode Optimization is an issue Mostly everybody will be a br&gt Some weapons are very unbalanced Variations between dynamic maps is low eg. Stormy map Sniper suppresor is rarer than the actual sniper Sometimes there can be trash in supply drops orwhatever you want to call themOverall PUBG is a very good game definently a better alternative to H1Z1 i recommend this over that any day however due to the game being in dev stages it is lacking a lot of content and has a lot of bugs but if you can get over those facts it is very enjoyable especially with friends hovever friendly fire is still on when you're with friends or randoms and the chances that they might betray you are high oh and lots of the reviews im seeing are all HACKERS HAKCERS EVERYWHERE but so far i have not encountered a single hacker so dont pay attention to themOverall i give this game a 8/10 STILL CANT FIND THE APPLE THO PROBABLY REMOVED

review: PubG is a game that you should be playing with people. It is a lot of fun when you and your squad go through inconveniences and plan out your movements. The game has a First person and a Third person view. Third person is quite annoying when the enemy has an unfair advantage behind an object the can see all around them. First person is very balanced but driving vehicles is a very difficult thing to control. People do hack occasionally but it is hardly an issue. The amount of Asians on the NA servers is really annoying because they mic spam a lot and they have their own server which bugs me if you search for a squad you will probably find a good one because people don't like to team kill. The Game starts off with you flying in a plane and finding where you want to drop. The game pretty much is turtling a lump of dump through the first 60 seconds of landing and you cannot pick up anything or you can but you lag backwards 60 times. The game does crash sometimes (Even the crash report crashes) but it is probably a 1/100 issue hardly happens. The game should probably punish shooting macro users (even though i am one of them) because you can make a gun fire faster than it would in automatic mode. Lots of the vehicles are great The Uaaz Dacia Buggy Bike Pickup. but the Van is the worst thing in the history of games. I recommend the AKM UMP strategy because it works and an AKM can pretty much be a sniper and the UMP is a balanced close range weapon. I love this game and i think if you have friends and enjoy a challenge you should buy it too.

review: Really good game potential just lacking optimization which I can understand since the game is in Early Access. You get thrown into a match with approx 99 players and need to gather resources such as guns ammo and vests to survive from enemy players. Solo Duo Squad modes are available. No DLC's!!!(love games like this) now when I play squads people with other languages(chinese mostly) come up in our North American servers and that is really hard to deal with since we can't understand them so when you need ammo you have to say it like "ammo 9mm! ammo 9mm!" and most of the time I am ignored since they don't know english I don't blame them. They should make a option when you play the game for the first time to ask you your region and language so this doesn't happen. Optimization needs to be improved heavily we need a post processing option to turn it off completely so it doesn't lag I get a few network lag detected messages here and there so I end up getting shot and there is nothing I can do about it even thought my internet is good. Complaints aside really good potential as a multiplayer game. Just remember please don't introduce microtransactions for guns and stuff. Thank you Devs.

review: This game is unique in the sense that it has amazing gameplay but it's not optimized well enough for you to actually play it smoothly. There are so many bugs glitches rubberbanding and the occasional hacker that after the initial hype fades you find yourself with little motivation to start it up and play any rounds. I had hoped the 1.0 release would fix most of the these issues but it seems to have exacerbated the issues. If anything it plays the same as beta if not slightly worse. Even the main menu interface is extremely laggy and this is independant of what type of drive you use (HDD/SSD) or what your computer specs are seems to happen to almost everyone.It's not fun waiting around 5 minutes just going through post game lag screen and then having to deal with menu lag to only THEN be able to queue up for another game. This game really needs an option to reque right from the death screen. The game is very fun (albeit sometimes dull with long gaps of little to no action but that's something to be expected with the Battle Royale genre) when it plays well but at its current state I would highly recommend waiting for optimization patches before purchasing or else you're going to find yourself constantly frustrated.

review: PUBG is an amazing game... if you dont mind dying a lot.PUBG is an RNG (Random Number Generator) game where loot is very randomized on what you're going to get. Firstly You parachute from a plane after a small lobby island where no one can die with every player in the match a few people will be shooting at nearly every other player since there are tables that have one of every gun in the game this is also where i recomend muting player chat ince a lot of people like to 1. Scream into their mic2. Chant isis music 3. Scream racist homophobic hurtful things into their micsand 4. (which i have only encountered once) Literally sing the USSR national anthemNow once you have survived the toxic lobby island you will be teleported into a plane that flies over the map in a straight line either diagonally from corner to corner or vertically from top to bottom or side to side which also varies depending on the match once you have selected a good place from the map you jump and skydive to your selected location manually here is where the RNG come in depending on the place you have jumped to you could find anything from 1 peice of level 1 armour/ rubbish melee to an amazing level 3 peice of armour along with a lovely selection of assault rifles smgs pistols and a holy sniper rifle. Now this is why PUBG requires experience and tactics because you either hope that there is an unpopulated Meh area where you can find an AK with some level 2 stuff or choose to go with half of the match population to the military base or a city.First things first before you go into PUBG EXPECT TO DIE! Honestly there are some really sweaty tryhards that will always pop out of nowhere and blast you out of existance that or youll die by being outside of the blue area a glitch STUPID BIKE PHYSICS or your own silly little mistakes.PROS + Good graphics + Good Physics (except for the bikes(especially the three seater))+ Amazing gun play where you can attatch and detatch any compatible attatchment+ Alive devs+ Wide Range of guns+ Cool Dude Clothes+ Minor character customisationCONS Some glitches (being patched all the time) Tryhards and cancerous people RNG will let you down a lot (BUT that is kind of the point)Overall PUBG IS a good game (but you have to remember that you will die but it is worth it when you experience your first win) however i do recommend watching a few videos first.

review: I've been playing since May 2017 and have been waiting until 1.0 to make this review. First off I love this game. It's pretty fun crazy tough and really a good time if you have freinds to play with. I have been seeing alot of hate about hackers and game breaking bugs. I have not had these issues the only thing I've had issues with is when the textures don't load but that was due to my incredibly slow hard drive. After upgrading to an SSHD the game runs great! I play at about 40fps which isnt great but its workable. As for hackers I have ran into very few over the past 8 months. Also these game breaking issues people are having with the game just aren't there for me and my friends. If you like battle royales and want a good game that is constantly getting updates PUBG is for you!As for the specs on my system if you care AMD Fx 8320 Black EditionAMD Rx480 Strix Edition16Gb RAMand I have the game loaded on a seagate SSHD

review: So i have a few hundred hours on the game and figured i would write a review now that its fully released. Love the game first and foremost. Game is great while there are a few technical issues with it its a fun play and the sense of enjoyment when you win is amazing. the few technical issues i have with the game are the random crashes during matching or during a game. No where as bad as before 1.0 but it still happensServers I feel the "tick" rate is not low enough for a FPS as numerous times you can get shot around corners and you hear your shot go off but you die without that headshot that looked like it hit on your screen. when you first drop into the game depending on the server your in (not region just the physical server) the rubberbanding is unbearable then once about 20 30 people die it stops and you dont get it the rest of the game. I could be wrong but it seems to be a server issue not being able to handle the capacity of players and scale of the map. Since i cant really see how loot spawns im not sure if thats part of the issue too. Reccommendations are just get better servers with better tick rates and higher capacities. All in all great job on the game you guys have made amazing improvments in the last year and i congratulate you on that. Amazing work. Also would love to have your webpage updated and have an official list and specs of all the guns and such more work on that side(outside of the client) would be wonderful. or if you could work it into the game as well

review: Incredibly fun and intense game that keeps you on edge the entire duration of the match. Battlegrounds has managed to find a balance between the realism of Arma and the silliness of H1Z1 which I believe makes it significantly superior to the aforementioned games. I cannot wait for the new update that's going to add vaulting and climbing mechanics which brings me to my next point This game is insanely good considering it's only in early access and the developers have a goal of releasing it by the end of 2017 giving them plenty of time to work with. The only improvement that I can genuinely suggest that doesn't have anything to do with the actual gameplay is a fix for the network optimization as well as the game's resource intensive nature. It by no means requires a high end PC yet it tends to have poor FPS at times. The lag in the game is unbearable at times even going as far as not letting you enter buildings because you simply get teleported back out once you're in due to network issues. But both these issues can easily be overlooked due to the development status of the game.

review: My gameplay goes one of two ways 1. Drop in get into a firefight and get killed straight away. Spend more time in the queue than in game2. Drop away from the action loot for 30 minutes make it to the top 10 seeing nobody and then die shamefully.I don't have 5 10 years of shooter experiene to be competitve in this game. This makes the game unejoyable for me as I will predominantly lose to anyone I come against (after looting for some time). The game has too much looting and not enough action to be fun. It is unforgiving to noobs espicailly in solo. The game is fun to play with friends (particularily with ones who can carry). If you have a lot of active friends who play the game I would actually recommend it. However my overall experience has been depressing and I no longer have any desire to play this game.Pros Realistic Graphics Is fun when you're good Has very intense moments Enjoyable with friendsCons Long periods of no action Not 0ptimised at all Glitchy and laggy Play for 30 mins and see nobody then get one shot from 200m away No fun for noobs
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: ProsEndless amounts of RNG to make every game different. Large range of guns to choose from. Semi accurate to accurate fire depending on how long you spend learning the weapons. When you find a good team games are super fun. SS (Solo squads) is a great challenge. Devs communicate with the community often and listen. ConsPerformance is still a little rocky but improving daily. (GTX 970 and a FX 8750 w/ 32 gigs of ram I average 60 FPS on very low unless I'm in towns.)Server desync still exists there are times where you are firing directly on a person standing close and the bullets don't seem to register. Playerbase really deserves to go in both Pros and Cons for every good game you get with a team you'll get a troll in another. More often than not it's a good team though (RNG again). Overall I give this game a solid 8/10 for the replayability. You can get hours of fun out of it for a great price. Definitely worth picking up!
