review: Allow me to Make this clear This Game is GOOD. The problems lie in little things the core of the game feels good. The shooting feels tight the movment feels ok at best graphics are alright and i find the parachutes to be finicky at best cars feel like garbage. This game is like the fun parts of ARMA or Dayz when the shooting gets real. Problems begin to stem out from balancing issues with some of the guns the optimization and hackers and the map spots that get you stuck. Dont be fooled by most reviews This game is no mere shooter this is a TACTICAL SHOOTER meaning that gun fighting ain't your primary objective and if your not willing to wait up to 10 minutes for a fight to start look elsewhere. personal player issues involve how some guns feel the map zones while largely are ok i take issue with the final zones closing up in the middle of no where with no cover or anything and the zones that are often set in the dead center of the maps are common place while maps that are in any of the corners feel quite rare.On both maps this issue is prevalent its not the lack of cars i find that cover while traveling long distances is both rare and when you find it is bad.Hackers arent actually much an issue to me as to be HONEST i have only found a handful of hacker.Loot boxes ARE GARBAGE GARBAGE i hate skin economy's of any variety but here they serve an advantage! albeit not much but black clothing on the Forrest map (erangle) make a hell of a difference also to make myself more clear there exists CAMO CLOTHING while the rare clothing would have you sticking out to a sore thubClothing spawns before guns and other stuff Annoying as hell but honestly not an issue if you dont land 2 meters away from someone hitting the F button as opposed to dragging things in to your inventory is honestly a matter of situation If you need a gun hit F and you might pick it up if you open the invetory screen to pick stuff up your gonna grab it with no issue this is more time consuming tho. i find the issue lies with the pick up animation. Shooting as i said pravious no real issue here but what becomes an issue is when shooting near a wall your character has a tendency to point your gun Either up or down with a indicator that tells you if your gonna do that ( faint Red bubble) and what becomes an issue is when you crouch to shoot out of a window as you seem to be too tall to go all the way below the window but too short to fire out of the ing thing this annoys the hell out of me sure its a little better on the desert map(Miramar) but on Erangle is Un bearable.Guns The lack of a shooting range really annoys me as i lack the sufficient shooting experience with most of the crate stuff also i find the Kar98 is in a space where its too good for what it is aside from that everything is alright with the Pistols and Shotguns Pistols while good in a pinch lack variety to little to pick from. shotguns spread does have the chance to Miss the whole target with out a choke attachment. AR's are choice weapon nothing wrong here LMG's only 2 and both feel ok. Snipers Lordy these things are annoying as YOU CANT TRACK YOUR SHOT CAUSE THE GUY MOVES AWAY FROM THE SCOPE WHEN YOU SHOOT! Unless your running an SKS or Mini14 wich are free from this issue. SMG's Short to mid range they arent AR's but they can do the job until you get one no issues hereMap unique guns the Sawed off is pretty ok Rex pistol is a way better revolver DP28 When theres no AKM essentially Winchester Good gun 7.62 revolver good but bad shooting interval. Also the button to get out of the car is also the same as canceling stuff if your as reflexive as i am when it comes to cancling stuff you might end up dying when you hit the ground Crates as far as they go my only complaint is probably for them to have the camo item's match the map and for them to always have snipers bundled with high power scopes All in all Id Give PubG a solid 8/10With all the little things comes a hell of a good core that honestly makes me overlook everthing and a feeling of victory that is satisfying beyond words considering that for me anyway i take almost 100 losses before i get 1 win of any variety Oh yea also the networking is br&gt 5/8/2018Game hasnt changed much Crates are still Twisting my Nipples also Runs less assy and Plays a little bit better and sniper rifles are more annoying due to the removal of lvl 3 helmets from the overworld. Sanhook was Cool the event was basically just fortnites battlepass But worse alot worst actually it was downright terrible. Also the unshakeable feeling that this game is pretty much in late beta remains. also Guns seem to give off a little more recoil then i remember while Smg's seem to be basically lasers now with a high fire rate and way more range then i remeber them being able to shoot at.

review: Until it is Free to Play if you haven't already made the mistake and paid for PUBG I would not give Bluehole another dime. The game concept is fun though it does have very limited replayability. The game play performance is just too inconsistent to be fun. The DEV team is too worried about monetizing the game than addressing major performance issues. The sad part is the mobile game is better optimized and has more features than PC (Mobile has better HUD and minimap) which is absolutely sad. I don't understand why I would build up Battle Points (BP) to purchase a crate that I can only open if I pay real money. That is complete BS. I can see if they want to have some unique skins etc for people who want to pay for them but making me pay to open a crate that I bought with in game currency is ridiculous. You already took my money when I bought the damn game I should be entitled to at least open the crates I buy.Summary Good concept bad developer/publisher inconsistent game play and performance pay system is ludicrous do not buy.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: A game I would call begrudgingly "iconic" in short if you play FPSs !!!with friends!!! this game is a necessary experience culturally and in general gaming. I daresay another experience as communally important to streaming/gaming audiences is a long way off. Its not polished like Halo its not full of story like Halo but it is pervasive. Gameplay is both intense and relaxing and that mixture is important. It can be hilarious it can be serious. The breadth of the emotions and experiences of this game are insane. This was an accident this game wasnt meant to be played by millions so early. And regardless of the call of hackers galore or performance issues Bluehole is taking the game into a state where it will be played by millions. Please give this game a chance refund it if you hate it or feel cheated but give it a chance with you and another friend and I bet most people will be convinced. 8/10

review: I have over 2000 hours in game so ive been here for the whole ride. The game is fun and intense and has a good competitive feel to combat especially near the final circle. However while the game is great when things go right it can be horrible when they dont. The biggest problem in the game right now would be hackers. I have played 6 NA squad games today so far and in 5 of them my whole team died to a guy with a asian name that had a aimbot insta downing us at 500 meters... adding a simple region lock would solve the issue of people with 300 ping that kill you behind trees due to latency and the hackers that are mostly from Asia countries. Now i know that not all asian players are hackers but anyone that has played the game for even a while knows that a vast majority of hackers are from Asian countires if the region lock doesnt become a thing then at least work on your anti cheat. There is nothing more annoying then playing a full game getting into the top 5 to just die to a hacker with a aimbot. So while i do recommend the game i will admit that it needs alot of work done.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a fantastic entry into the battle royale genre that has been gaining followers in recent years. Overall I would give the game in its current state an 8/10.Despite being in Early Access PUBG has wonderfully exceeded my expectations and provided hours upon hours worth of content. Though with the dev team being as committed as they are (weekly updates community interaction active social media a laid out schedule for new features etc) I can easily predict hundreds more hours of content and playtime. Though as with any Early Access title there are a few problems. For instance most lower tier rigs from two years ago may not be able to run the game adequately FPS drops in large towns are common and there is usually server down time once a month. Though this is not meant to scare you as I said before the dev team is fully committed to making sure these problems are fixed.If you are on the edge about buying this game I say commit to it afterall you can refund it if you don't like it. I wasn't a battle royale type of gamer but after buying PUBG I cannot say I regret the purchase.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG one of the most fun games I've ever played. I'll explain the game as best I can before giving my personal review on it.To start off about 100 players are in a single game which makes victory that much harder. You begin on a plane (as do all other players) and can choose where on the massive island you wish to parachute to. Upon landing you have to make a quick dash to the nearest house to find a weapon(s) among other things. Each player can have 2 primary guns a secondary pistol a melee weapon and a grenade. There are weapons that are more effective than others so try to find those. For example I usually go with a shotgun (for entering houses) a rifle (for long range engagements) and a pan. (because pans can literally deflect bullets) There are also weapon attachments (for the guns not grenades or melee) such as scopes or quickdraw mags. At a certain point in the match the "circle" will appear you must get to it quickly for anyone outside of it will eventually die due to a death barrier that slowly closes in. At this point you want to start looking for a car which could help you later in the long run. Assuming you've sayed alive this long and you made it to the safe zone you'll probably start meeting some resistance. As the match goes on (and you hopefully survive) the safe zone will get smaller and smaller until the final person standing is declared winner. BUT WAIT you dont have to take 100 people on by yourself because there are more game modes to choose from that allow you so have a partner or a team of 4 but be careful because if you choose one of these game modes everyone else has a team to. Don't forget matches that you play give you coins to purchase in game loot crates to customize your character.My opinion on the game holy moly its amazing. I play a lot of 4 person team mode and I can't get enough! The competition is fierce so i have yet to win a game but i really dont care! I'm having so much fun beating people with a frying pan that victory is just a side thought. Plus the full game isn't even out yet! I can't wait to see what the devs do next!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

I was hooked instantly! i love the tactical aspect and being 4 people in a squad trying to survive til the end. i've had many laughs and screams with this game. For people who say it's buggy Update your computers drivers and GPU drivers they must always be the latest for this game. I have 3 computers running this game (that's how much i love it!) and they all handle the game fine without crashes or hickups. you should have seen how buggy it was when it was first launched it's MILES ahead now in stability. review: This is the saddest official release of a game that i have ever witnessed seriously. Here are my issues with it First you get no option to pick the map you want. Second When landing the lag is horrible especially for someone who looks for early kills like going to school and trying to pick up a weapon fast its bad in early access such things like early game lag rarely happened (at least to me). Third the map choosing is stupid idk how but for the last 6 games i had miramar at least make it 2 games one map 2 games another this random choosing part is bad i want to play erangel not miramar if i at least knew when it will be it would've been better but having to play this wasteland for 6 consecutive matches is stupid and i hate it call me a cry baby if you want but i was having fun going to school to get destroyed 5 rounds in a row and then win the 6th. Everything else aside from that i like in the game but its really sad that after the official release it became even more broken ... I hope this changes and that the game will be stabilized because before this happened i had lots of fun with this game now it just bacame frustrating.UPDATE seems like most problems i had changed to good so i appvote the game tnx for listening to community &lt 3

review: I see this game pop up quite a bit so I thought I would buy it. I have never played a game where the player movement is so heavy and clunky like it is in this game. Huge disappoitment.The entire movement system feels like I am playing as an even fatter version of myself. It is almost like the developers looked at every other game that has a standard movement system that are all about the same and said "Nope we want this to feel like you are moving in water".That is exactly what it feels like it feels like you are playing any other game but someone put invisible water everywhere and you have to wade through it.This is my first game review / first review I have ever felt I needed to post about a game.

review: 1.0 Review. Desert map is really cool. A combination of Joshua Tree and Mexican/Texan desert. No vegetation means more FPS and more visibility to get shot from long distance. Very different playstyle from Russian map. Cool addition and a refreshing change.It has recently come out that PUBG runs at 17hz tick rate on the server.So regardless of you 120FPS you're still getting a rate below 60ms from the server. It is actually 8hz at the beginning of the game. This may be ok for online chess or poker but not for FPS.This explain the inability to pick up items and general unresponsiveness. It feels like molasses compared to CS.If you're ok with it go play TF2 which runs at 66hz (15ms update rate) on the server. You'll know what "e sports" experience is supposed to feel like.This is a generally a crappy corporate decision by bluehole to own their server network. This prevents individual users from running high performance dedicated servers like TF2 or CS and creates an environment of penny pinching cloud fee dependant lowest cost wins infrastructure. There is little reason for this aside from just corporate greed. And that is standard with money first companies which bluehole obviously is. PUBG isn't WOW just let people play on their own servers which they can run without concern for the cost of it because they love the game.I still cannot recommend this game. Wait for 2018 to see AAA studios release their versions of Battle Royale with much more optimized experience. With the rate and overall direction PUBG has been going it is paced to be the mega hit that DayZ was in the beginning followed shortly by titanic collapse into obscurity.Just like DayZ creator who luckyly stumbled on a winning formula and immediately proceeded to mess everything up with additions and gameplay changes no one cared about ignoring crucial server performance and user experience PUBG is going in the exactly the same direction. But that is ok bluehole already made their $.UI has easily fixable problems that have been ignored for months. Why doesn't it remember that I selected FPP and switches to TPP between games? Are you bluehole guys familiar with UE4 system of saving to config files? Its really easy. Look it up. It will take 2 hours of research and development time by a junior dev.LOD is still glitchy and weird.Server matches are still across continent. So if you're in California you'll end up playing in NY. You might get better ping to Asia.I have to take a break from games for 2 3 days after playing TF2 because this game is virtually unplayable in comparison.

review: I've got 94 hours on Battlegrounds so I feel I can write an accurate review.So much potential last year Pros Deep weapon mechanics and realistic gunplay. One of the deepest rushes of adreniline at the moment and their are few other multiplayer experiences as intense and satisfying as getting a chicken dinner with your friends. Intresting weapons which all have a unique feel. Combat flows and is intresting. Frequent updates adding weapons.Cons No matter what type of PC you've got and no matter the internet speed 1/10 games crash lag out or give you a cryptic error code. The afformentioned intresting and rich combat experience only shows in 2/5 engagments. Often times the only kills you get are A You sit in a house and someone stumbles in and immediatly gets sprayed by a splurge of 7.62's from your erect AKM. B You see someone sitting behind a tree and melt them with steaming hot lead. The intresting gourmet pubg combat only REALLY takes place at 75 100 meters away with each party having either a bush rock or a tree to shoot from. Vehicle physics are completely Bull**** with people getting killed by a car rolling .0001 mph.However the biggest most glaring issue is its hilariously bad progression system. Ok say you just spent 27 minutes playing a full match of pubg winning through skill and stratedgy. You excitedly return to the main menu to claim your spoils. Using the the 1200 coins the game awarded you you purchase 2 randomized crates. Thinking of all the intresting colthing and skins you can get you attempt to open them. However the crates require 2.99 dollars to buy a COMPLETELY SEPERATE KEY. You are not deterred. You are not going to waste the 27 minutes of your life you spent in a video game. You pay 6 dollars. You open the case and you eagerly await your prize! Ahh could it be a bandana or gold weapon skin you could sell?. It shows your reward. A RED SHIRT. 1 COMMON RED SHIRT. See? This is what the game pulls ALL. THE. TIME. Or you could spend 8 bucks on the games insulting "Sanhok Pass" Which is a shameless and poorly done ripoff of Fortnite Battle Royales "Battle Pass". (No I'm not just trying promote fortnite)Conclusion Though their are many thrills to be found near the end to much crap happens to get their. Plus you are rewarded with goodwill clearance items when you do! I would not recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Ever since the release i've been enjoying this game early on in this game i've encountered small bugs and sometimes there is this bug where you could see through buildings and shoot through them that only happened very rarely. Personally for me it was 2 3 times but after several updates and now with the new map and optimizations i never really see it. I can now say that the game feels very stable and as always very fun to play especially with friends now the only thing that is left is server latency rubberbanding and so on its not so often it happens but i feel like its on of the "major" problems right now. Overall its a solid and fun game to play solo or with your buddies.

review: This was a really great game at first and I used to love playing it. Sadly that's not the case anymore at this point the game is next to unplayable. Bluehole priotized in game cosmetics and a port to Xbox over fixing and completing their game. They allowed a Chinese company (tencent) to buy a 5% stake in the company and now they sell cheats to Chinese players off the back end and Bluehole does nothing about it. They spend their time banning people for "stream sniping" (though they were more just banning people who killed streamers than actual stream snipers) and team killing or being "mean". They allow hackers to run the game and now and this is no exaggeration at least 8/10 if not more games have hackers in them. Add to it the fact that Tencent now has devolopment rights for PUBG in China and says that they will be working on game development to help bring the game more in line with socialist core values I'm afraid to see what this game is going to turn into. Save your $30 play a finished game that have devs that are present and care because you won't find them in PUBG. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.UPDATE Allow me to add to this review. I just played a game today where I shot a kid 4 times from 5 feet away with a shotgun while he had no armor and no helmet he lived through it all looted an AR and killed me in two shots while I had a level one vest. You'd think if you were going to sell a game you would atleast TRY to make a half decent game but not Bluehole because the only thing that matters them is their bottomline and ripping off their community in order to increase their income. OVERALL TRASH GAME AND TRASH COMPANY NOT WORTH A PENNY.

review: First off the people complaining about the paid crate system are blowing things out of proportion. Sure the devs said there'd be no micro transactions during early access but I doubt anyone was ready for the sheer number of players that would flock to this game and maintaining servers for such a large player base would need a steady flow of income. The current system is to insure it'll have all issues ironed out before release.As for the game review itself the game is a gem honestly. I haven't enjoyed a game this much in so long.The devs release updates and patches very regularly. Some of the physics can be janky at times but it's to be expected but the base gameplay and mechanics is excellent. Shooting is realistic while avoiding being cumbersome and the entire game is very easy to get used to. The highlight of this game is the fact that you're free to chose everything from where you land where you position yourself in fights and where you loot and these choices will either lead you to victory or have you melt away trying deperately to reach the play zone. It makes each match completely different and fresh. If you've the money and enjoy a good battle royal you won't regret it!NO WORK NOW BAD GAME FORTNITE BETTER Not really thoNO MARKER MAKE GAME BAD REEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE

review: I may not have the most hours into this game but I have played sporadically since early access. While the game has come a long way in terms of content and fixes since release it has hit a wall of unbearable and has clearly been surpassed by Fortnite. There are they typical gripes you see all over the place (framerates rendering ping server issues etc....) but the worst thing has to be there is no sense of progression of accomplishment. Sure if you win a match you get a nice "WINNER WINNER CHICKEN DINNER!" and a sizable amount of BP tokens. But your only option is to spend those tokens on crates which is layers upon layers of gamble. It is randomized what crate you will receive and further a random loot drop out of that crate. But worst of all is now so many loot crates are LOCKED by a micro transaction key! So not only are you paying to play the game in the first place but if you want to unlock anything for the crate you earned you must spend more money. I can get games having a micro transaction system it adds revenue that can be used to better the game but when you make it a requirement to get nearly anything you earn and add that it is a random drop as well there is officially no point to play other than do your best to win and end up dying and earning squat for points. This was the standard for battle royal gameplay but has sadly taken a major downward spiral and is no longer worth playing. I do not recommend this game even if on sale. Just go play Fortnite if you want a Battle Royal experience. At least its free and you can earn your goodies or at least if you buy them you know what you are getting.

review: As a person who has put 70 hours in 4 days I can easily say this game is great. Pros The gunplay is good. The hitboxes can be improved slightly but over all it has a very solid combat system almost comparable to ARMA 3. The Teamplay is great. If you have a group of 4 friends this game is an absolute gem as teamwork is essential to winning and when you do win it feels very gratifying. If you do not have anyone to play with you can easily head to the PUBG Discord and you'll find hundreds of people to play with. You can also queue up for matchmaking and be put into a squad with random people. The Graphics are very decent compared to other Battle Royal/Early Access games. The game is stunning when the graphic settings are turned up. If your PC is not strong enough to run the game comfortably you can used the SM4 launch command to degrade the graphics/shaders to make the game run slightly better netting you more fps. The Map is fantastic. As an avid ARMA player having a good map is everything and this game delivers well. The map is well balanced has everything from small cities to big ones open fields to tight corridors and CQC beaches and mountains and most importantly loot. Going to military bases shooting ranges unground bunkers is very risky but is also very rewarding getting you all the high grade weapons attachments and equipment. The element of surprise reward and excitement is very strong. This game is packed with action especially in the early and late game. You are never guaranteed safety in risky situations but if you do them correctly you will be rewarded well with loot positioning vehicles and maybe even winning the game. High risk High reward. The DEVs are actually good. Most Early Access games' DEVs are very money hungry charging money for skins by the first update. This is not the case here !So Far!. It's quoted by the DEVs that there will be daily patches for server/client optimisation weekly patches for client/game optimisation and bug fixing and monthly patches for new content and weapon/equipment/vehicle/gameplay balancing. Cons The optimisation is really bad. the fact that a friend of mine with an i5 and a GTX 1070 has the same performance as me with an i7 and a GTX 960 shouldn't really be valid as he clearly has the superior rig when it comes to gaming. In short it seems the game is CPU heavy From my experience . You can do a couple of things to make the game work better like optimising your own settings and used Steam launch commands but there really shouldn't be a need to do all these things. The midgame is very boring. Unlike the action packed early and late game the mid game is uninteresting and stale. You will spend most of the time either just looting or simply camping in a building waiting for the next circle update. Rarely you'd be able to fight another person/squad but with the circles being so big in the early stages it is very uncommon unless there is a high amount of people alive. Some of the car physics are a bit over the top. You can flip your car really easily from the slightlest bump if you're going anything over 40KPH. This point is very subjective because some of the people I play with think otherwise. Their counter argument is that it makes it less forgiving when you hit max speeds without any caution. The Servers aren't the greatest. Now this like the optimisation is probably going to be temporary as the game is already being patched. In the early game there is A LOT and I mean a lot of lagging and rubber banding due to the 100 player count. The lag will decrease as players die and will eventually stablise at around 50/60 players. This makes the early game slightly difficult to handle.All in all I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who enjoys action games and/or has played ARMA/H1Z1. The game is definitely flawed albiet not as flawed as other early access games but it sure is fun and competitive. I will rate this game a solid 8/10 in its current stage.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Decided to pick up this game a few days back. I didn't come accross any bugs until last night. Many people complained about not seeing buildings etc on landing however that was not my problem. Allow me to tell the story of the eating rock. It was saturday morning roughly 3 AM when me and my norwegian friend were under some heavy fire near the airfield. The barrier was closing in on us so we had to travel towards the zone. After 2 minutes of sprinting we made it only to be shot at by a kar98k. The guy was a half decent shot and hit me a few times but backed off once the next zone started to come inwards. We made another run for it and in doing so we killed a few more people. We came under some more heavy fire near the bridge and my friend got knocked out. He decided to get behind a rock to where i could revive him however we didn't realise it was a trap. As i picked him up i began to run towards the next area but realised something was holding me back. It was a rock. I did everything i could to get out of its grips. My friend even shot me in an attempt to revive me outside the rock. This was not the case. The rock had a firm grip on my assh*le and would not release me. My friend said something in norwegian as he ran off into the sunset leaving me to die. The barrier slowly came inwards and took my life. A not so amazing way to end a game. Unfortunate to say the least. Best of luck to anyone who also finds themselves stuck inside this rock. Tugg Speedman

review: If you can get a game started and actually start playing the game is great. It's a lot of fun.The problem is that's nearly impossible. In my 90 minutes of playing I've had maybe 20 minute of gameplay. I've joined maybe 6 games and have gotten to the ground 3 times. The other 3 times I've been disconnected or my game crashed while in the lobby or plane. 2 times I got to the ground all the buildings weren't loaded properly and didn't have any textures so I couldn't see doors or anything on the ground. I got inside a building one of these times by seemingly walking through a wall. My game froze and when it was working again I was dead.I did get to actually play one time. I landed on a roof and 2 minutes later the buildings started working properly. so I could actually walk through them and find stuff. I was in a squad of 4 and we were in the watery town. I found a shotgun and pistol. Me and another guy were walking through town when an enemy walked right in front of us. I downed him in the water and we couldn't shoot him after that because bullets apparently don't go through 2 inches of water. We had to wait until he bled out to loot him. After that the game worked perfectly and we actually ended up in 4th place. It was a fun experience but not worth the pain of trying to find a decent game.If they fix this I'll edit my review. As of now I would not recommend the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have been playing PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS from early access. I know there are lots of negative reviews out there and I do understand why. This game did not start off as a polished game. Even after version 1.0 came out it has been like a beta. But you have to take into accont that this game is not expensive you are not forking out over $100 like you would for Battlefield 4 etcWhats great about this game is the level of competativeness that comes with the battleroyal format. You need to take this game with a level of seriouness otherwise you will just die round afrer round with little to no reward.Even with all it's faults (which slowly get fixed with every update) I find this game way more challenging than the average FPS. Working your way to the top 10 is very exciting and rewarding in itsself. Something you just can't get from spawn &amp die spawn &amp die type of games.Keep in mind it can be hard to match a game in some regions like OC if you want to play Solo or duo in FPP which is extreemly disapointing. I wish this game never came out with TPP.If you can spare the money give this game a try.

review: I don't know if you'll read this but i hope you do. For all you pubg devs out there... I really do legit think that this is the best fps game ever until this very moment that has ever existed. But please fix your BIGGEST problems first before you update it anymore.I'll give you a hint of what it is your server.I don't know anything about developing games. But i do know that if you want this game to keep being this popular you'll at least need a strong enough server to contain your massively growing player base because your server right now sometimes suck. review: This is a crap game. Don't believe the trailer that Steam has up. You will NEVER experience gameplay like that. It's only #1 played because a game can last 30 minutes. Player interaction is what makes a game. In that 30 minutes you may not even see ANY other players until you die and you still may not see them. A typical game consists of 98% alone time where you're scavenging for weapons and accessories. It's completely up to chance whether the person you run into has a better weapon than you. I strongly dislike that luck determines the outcome in what is seemingly advertised as a tactical game. If you don't like snipers or people who don't play the obj in battlefield you won't like this game because it rewards that type of play. There is no obj. You basically hide until you're forced into a small area by the blue kill zone. So it's 25 minutes of trying to scavenge a good weapon only to be shot in the back of the head by someone who's already camping under a tree. The game mechanics are very poor. No precision. To me it's pretty much like being the victim of lag all the time. There is realism and then there's just poor game making this is the ladder. If you're a battlefield sniper who isn't a team player and never goes for the obj and camps 100% of the time then you will love this game. Also no one likes you.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: "Well that's tough."Was the main comment running through my head each time I played this game. After 60 hours and 2 wins and unfortunately no more than 2 kills per match it should come as no suprise that this is a difficult game relying on considerable skill and developed skill. Despite this the game is extremely rewarding. To kill 2 people on the same team in CQC is an adrenaline pumping experience thats hard to match. Definately worth the price tag.

review: After 24 hours of playing I can safely say this is one of the best Battle Royale games I have played! When you join a game you must jump from a plane land and gather supplies to stay alive and win the illusive 'Chicken Dinner' The game has a lot of In Game Customisation You are able to attach sights and other gadgets to your weapons at any time and you can find armour and helmets to keep you from harm The vehicles are fun to drive around in but most of the time you will be driving away from the barrier that is slowly coming towards you The game keeps the match progressing by using the barrier like all battle royale games and if your lucky you can try grabbing loot from an airdrop but its a risky challenge.The game is at it's best when you are playing with friends in a squad match using teamwork and coordination to survive.To wrap up this review I would recommend this game to anyone who is a fan of the FPS genre and Battle Royale games.Good luck And see you on the battlefield.CHICKEN DINNER FTW

review: I'll preface this by saying I really like the game in general. The dealbreaker for me and maybe for you is the gunplay if you've ever played Arma and the sluggish and odd gunplay is not for you then don't buy this game. The game mechanics are sound it's an interesting game the circle adds tons of tension during late game and everything seems to be decently balanced the only problem is how strange the gunplay feels. Weapons are sluggish bullet spray from hipfire is completely and totally random (no patterns) so it can be extremely hard to hipfire while ADS is not reliable either against a moving target because of how strange and jerky the movement can be. It's very much arcade style movement and Arma style gunplay with very low tolerance for mistakes. At the moment with how cruddy the gunplay tends to be and the weirdness of the movement that's a dead breaker. You'll die more often in close quarters gunfights to wonky gunplay than you will to an enemy with more skill than you.Edit 5/10/2018 gunplay still sucks I've played a lot because my friends play but gunplay is seriously ing terrible.

review: Here are the stage encounters you're going to experience.1st Encounter Looting Simulator and/or refer to 5th Encounter2nd Encounter Walking Simulator3rd Encounter Hunting Simulator4th Encounter Camping Simulator5th Encounter Trolling SimulatorIt's a very slow paced game. Yes it's tactical but the boring kind. There is no sort of tension what so ever imo. If you're used to fast paced games like myself you're frustrated either because you can't find anyone to frag (kill) or because you're the one who got fragged (killed) from some trolling player who's camping outside the blue zone. Other than that it needs more game modes.Overall you better off playing a tactical game that has lots of action. Such as Insurgency and Day of Infamy. But if you want something to chillax play PUBG.

review: My guide to somehow "winning" a game. Method The School Shooter1. Always place your map marker on the school.2. When near the school proceed to eject regardless even if there are more than 20 people also going to the school which is a highly likely possibility.3. Land on the roof of the school and hope there is a gun around. (RNG at its finest)4. Proceed to murdering more than 3 people in a span of 10 seconds.However you will die 99% of the time so try again. Try until you able to massacre everyone like the hidden psychopathic maniac you are in real life and have the school to yourself. This will guarantee you to be placed in the top 5.However again you proceed to lose and come 6th and you blame it on luck. No it's just that you are bad at aiming you already have all the loot from the school what more could you ask for?*Disclaimer* When solo queueing 80% of the game is RNG 15% is skill and 5% is you hoping the game doesn't ing teleport you even though you have perfectly stable internet connection randomly drop 100 fps to like 30 fps and miss a point blank headshot because of some ing t hit registration issue however you ain't lucky and you proceed to get 360 noscoped which ends up in you uninstalling the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Overall there isn't much too it guns people killing survival big map. Kinda like a lot of survival games that have come out and either failed or did okay for a while. But PUBG has something I haven't found in any other and that's suspense. It's the will he see me? Will he hear me? Can I make a run for it? Is this an ambush? Moments that make you come back again and again. It's those moments that make your heart race as you stay alive while so many others have fallen it's those moments that make you wake up early from sweet dreams of PUBG ready for more PUBG! Really great game when there's more maps in the future it'll mix things up a bit but for the time being there's enough content mixed with your own fears to keep you playing for a long time.

review: This game has taken concepts from other games such as Dayz and H1Z1 and polished it a tiny bit to make it playable. The game falls short in most areas in terms of playability. Moving around objects is a hassle. You can't climb small objects. The aiming can go crazy sometime resulting in a player who is looking out a window shooting directly down and hitting the window instead of shooting straight. You can't lay down in places that more than enough space for you to lay down on. You can't even pistole whip with your weapon for some reason. Now the life of this game is heavily dependant on the community...which is bad. The lobbies are filled with kids screaming the N word or just screaming into the mic. When you join a squad game most of the time they just betray you and take your items because there is 3 of them and only one of you. The game doesn't have a punish or report system for teamkilling so you are screwed. Unless you want to play solo on the same map with a unposlished shooter wait till they fix the game if they ever do.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Still some work needed to be done to the game but other than that it is becomming a great game
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's a terrible game in it's current state. The hint counters are still not accurate. The death screen tells me I received a headshot by someone while the only thing he could hit me were my feet. Not to mention that a SCAR is supposed to insta kill you when on full health with level 1 armor when someone hits your feet. And regardless of the complaints on the forums the developers do not give a damn about it.The gameplay is just plain boring in my opinion especially if your computer is running at the minimum requirements to play the game and all your settings are low. Close quarters combat 9/10 times you're dead before firing a single shot because your enemies see you before you see them due to the FPS difference I would assume. Sometimes it's possible to just get killed without seeing the guy who shot you.The recent 25 000 player banwave the devs did doesn't seem to really help. Or my computer stopped loading in players (?) considering I've had multiple occasions where someone ran up to me in an open area I hear their footsteps hear them firing at me but they do not show up till the last second.Overall game has potential if you have a high end gaming computer. For homegrown potato computers this game is trash. Rich kids will have an advantage over you and unless you're playing with friends who can carry you you probably won't win because every single game eventually ends in close quarter combat. The fact that you die early game isn't that bad but it becomes bad when you die five times over because you end up in close quarter combat with someone with a much better computer than you.Although I'm aware that this game obviously states Battlegrounds. And is made for Battle Royale I'd much prefer to see some kind of survival mod or game mode in this game that'd atleast make it a bit more fun for me personally because there'd be less PvP and rather PvE content with a survival aspect where hopefully you have the feeling of progressing somewhere. As the current clothing system doesn't feel very progressive. (Keep getting the same items).
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is so flawed that its so frustrating. Sure I'll still play it but there are so many broken features they need to fix. First off the hit registration. This game's hit boxes are so inconsistent that it is infuriatingSecond the vehicles. This game's physics is the most demented thing i've seen. You drive straight on a cornfield and then randomly do a flip and instantly die. Not only that if you try to fit some cars through small gaps 40% of the time they get stuck 20% of the time they actually get through and the other 40% they just randomly blow up.Third (this isn't the game's fault) is the community. Every player in this game abuses the third person perspective so much that it makes it simply not fun. About 90% of the deaths by players in this game will because the person who killed you saw you the whole time while hiding behind a wall so they're not visible to you. Personally if you want to keep your sanity i reccomend either have friends to play with or just don't install this game. At least not until they fix the hit registration and the physics. Oh and also making it so that North American players don't default into the Asian servers would be nice too

STILL this is fixable and regular lag is usual a delay or phantom bulling. However back to the other point shooting in a game is NOT impossible or hard..so what's the fun in not even trying when it feels way better to do it all on your own? review: Having bought the game Day 2 when it came on Steam I can definitely say for a cheap like me with a GTX 660 the game actually runs way smoother now and buildings actually render on time. That is a massive improvement compared to before when everything looked like Play Doh and buildings never appeared.But this cheating problem which I'm guessing has started because China wants to prove that "They are number 1." is really hurting the game and experience for many players. If the majority of cheaters are from China then region lock them (and other regions tbh) so they can see whose cheats are better who has the better programming skills or the fattest wallet if you're not going to fix the Anti Cheat.Other than that the game is still as addictive and fun as ever with each update polishing the mechanics to make the game better. I reckon it's still better than Fortnite with the tactical gameplay especially in Squad mode. So as a tl dr... And we're all good!

review: I can't ing stand this game..11/10EDITLets write a real review. Playing this game for 200+ hours has been a mixture of nightmares and. Mostly nightmares.But I've never played a game with such great interest. Typically I play a competitive game for 150 hours &amp it gets boring to me but this game never changes. It's always something new EVERY single game. It's had its ups and downs and still has a few bugs. But the development team has been very consistant at fixing whatever has been thrown at them. The graphics are pretty well a little more optimization wouldn't hurt at all. When you first start playing the game you should really expect to play like for the first couple hours until you get the mechanics down. The game runs smooth around 50 FPS however my machine runs it at about 110FPS (i5 6500 &amp GTX 1060 ultra settings). This game has so much potential and I think it is a must have for every steam library. Gameplay 8/10Graphics 7.5/10Playerbase Edgy as Bugs Few here &amp there but nothing game breakingOverall Rating 8/10Heres ANOTHER edit Don't buy the stupid ing game. Developers seem to not be able to fix issues that have been around since THE ING LAUNCH. Can't believe I rated this game a 8/10 at one damn point.

review: I believe I have enough hours in to give a review so here it goes....Bugs I've found two issues. One is after a match I never go back to the main menu. It just hangs at the background and I have to End Task. The other is lagging out. I think the servers may be crashing out because in twos it happens to both of us. It starts lagging bad then kicks us out.Guns like everything so far but haven't had enough time to fully get a feel. Attachments are awesomeCars love all the vehicle spawns... easy to find and not OP.Loot Balance in KOTK I can loot 5 houses in the time I can loot one or two in PUBG. Sometimes I will go to 4 before I find a backpack and/or helmet. It would be nice if the loot was tweaked. I feel like KOTK is more geared around giving an advantage to who gets good stuff and PUBG is more geared to give advantage to those that are more tactical and cautious. I don't thing RNG has a place in this gameGameplay everything is smooth... I love it. Looting feels natural and weapons/attachments are cool. I get very bored mid game however. Everyone just goes in a building and hides. In two games I drove all over the circle twice and never seen anyone or got shot out. Eventually I seen a person in a window. They hid once I stopped. I've only made it to the end twice because I get bored and start rushing houses.I don't know how to solve my major complaint... I don't want any major rule changes... maybe some sort of incentive to get out and about but not necessarily any kind of penalty. I don't like penalizing a play style but it would be cool if there was a reason that made u want to get out.It's easy to say "don't go in houses mid game" but damn I get bored after sitting around a few minutes. Earlier I stopped in a car in the middle of the circle for about 3 minutes. Went and made a margarita and I was still alive. Any other game I would have died the second I stopped

review: PUBG was one the first ever Battle Royale game i've ever played had lots of laughs great times and an amazing gaming experience. But over the past few months i got very bored of it and the content coming out wasn't sparking my interest.Would i recommend buying this game? Yes and no Yes because it is a realistic shooter and alot of players like myself love realism. No because of the price and the content that the devs are producing it just isn't tasteful and gets really stale even though the gun fights are amazing and alot of factors such as the vehicles and the healing system gives it such a realistic feel i'm still very Iffy on prefering this game over other games. Maybe if the price came down yes but bascially 30 bucks for a game that has gone down the drain isn't worth it in its past days yes but with all the other Battle Royales coming out and with the pre exisiting game Fortnite that is skyrocketting in perfomance and player base and great content PUBG is struggling at the moment and there reviews aren't getting any better if you wanna try the game do so YES IT IS VERY POSSIBLE TO STILL HAVE FUN ON THIS GAME it's still one of my favorite games on steam just it got kinda boring and is in a rut will i come back to it? Yeah some day but not too soon. So i do recommend Maybe trying it. who knows maybe one day PUBG will make a return and smash the leaderboards for being one of the best shooters on steam as it stood previously Over all i'd give this game a 6 or a 7 out of 10.

review: Oh PUBG It started out great and its had its ups and downs but remained generally stable. I had high hopes for this game and simply lived with the problems it had (hackers lag bugs etc.). But as time went on the devs stopped worrying about gameplay and PUBG started to turn into a cash grab. Instead of getting crates that could be opened for playing the game now you have to buy overpriced keys to open crates that you EARNED from BP. Don't even get me started on the "event pass". The devs do NOT care about its players or the game anymore they are now trying to squeeze the last bit of money out if their dying game. This game had great potential in its early stages but instead of making the game better the devs decided to make some quick money by adding cosmetics.

review: Should have seen this one coming when I broke my common rule of not buying games that are in Early Access. This game is a complete joke at this point. I don't regret buying the game when it was new and interesting I regret that my money helped cement in the devs' minds that they can let their game go to and still make a profit. You may as well be spending your money on a game like Goat Sim if you want a game as buggy and unfinished as this. In Goat Sim that was intentional but here it's just lazy. All you'll find here is unreliable mechanics mixed with grabage optimization and a team of devs who realized a long time ago that they dont have to actually improve the game for it to do well. This game just feels like and emptier buggier version of any other Battle Royale on the market. It's a shame this BR game came out before the others because the unique appeal of the game when it was first available actually made the game sell well. Now that every other verison of this kind of game feels just about finished you're left with what is pretty much DayZ Battle Royale. Saying this game isn't early access is the worst part of the whole game. Just admit your game isn't ready yet and work to improve it instead of rushing it out as a "finished game" and never adding neccessary changes again. What happened to PUBG is an example of why you should wait to buy any new popular game. The success can often cause the game improvement to stagnate and then all the copy cat games end up being 10x better in the end. The only reason this game has any playtime on my account anymore is that I continue to let other people play the game on my account. Personally I've drifted away to other games and the shiny new toy that once was the Battle Royale Genre is now a smoldering pile of garabage.Just stop giving these people money. Please. I no longer care about PUBG or its development but I really do hope this review can help someone save $30 dollars. So what else could you spend that $30 on? Here's just a few suggestions. If you're a fan of large world exploration games that aren't linear and have some challenge behind hack n' slash mechanics look into Hyper Light Drifter . It's a really great game and it's soundtrack is just wonderful.Did you enjoy Super Mario 64 Banjo Kazooie Psychonauts and other 3D open world platformers of the sort? A Hat in Time is a great modern game that fits right into that category. It's also got a great soundtrack as well as fun and polished mechanics that envoke the best parts of classic platformers. There's some really passion behind the game. Celeste was a pretty big game for a while and if you enjoy 2D platformers of any kind you'll likely enjoy it. It never feels too hard or too easy and there are plenty of ways to get through the game no matter how skilled you are. If you enjoy simple mechanics but difficult games Getting Over It with Bennett Foddy is a great. Your first time playing through the game will take many hours and will challenge you a lot but once you play through the game you want to go again. I've fully beaten the game 109 times and now take roughly 5 minutes to play all the way through. For just $8 dollars this game provides plenty of entertainment. And to end all this Yeah Fortnite has cartoony graphics and minecraft style building but at least it's free runs well is fast paced and ACTUALLY WORKS most of the time. It's basically everything this game lacks. If you are really so turned off by the visuals and typically younger community of Fortnite that you won't even try it I don't see why you'd settle for a game in its Alpha build that claims to be a finished product. I think Fortnite is objectively a better experience than PUBG and I'm not even a huge fan of their game in the first place.Not gonna proofread this. I just had to get the salt out.//End Pointless Rant//

review: The game is good not perfect. For every two steps forward they take one step back. So while they are improving on the game it is taking a long time but it has gotten significantly better since the beginning. I experience some FPS drops and net code issues (not a ton) but everyone's experience seems to be subjective. Anyone who plays this thinking it will run as smooth Fortnite is in for a bad surprise.I like this game because it seems to be the only option out there that has gun/bullet physics. Bullet drop and recoil are real and if you can't properly adjust to them you will shoot like a potato.Cons Bad optimization Bad netcode Quality of life changes seem to take forever and some bugs/glitches seem to still be in the game The team seems to be more focused on loot boxes Communication has been mediocre overall but has been getting better recently.Pros Gun play requires skill and is very satisfying Slowly but steadily improving Once the new map is released (Sanhok) they will have three maps with very distinct enviornments.In conclusion I have fun playing the game but if another developer comes out with a BR game that runs smoother and has gun/bullet physics I will jump ship.

review: After 150 hours played I feel confident enough in my opinion of this game.Is it a perfect game? No it is not but as of right now it is the best existing game for the battle royale genre which much better netcode and gunplay core mechanics than H1Z1 and more depth than others. The gunplay is quite realistic the guns sound exactly as they should sound adjusts itself dynamically to the distance it has been fired from. The bullet drop takes a very important place in the game and is consistent along with a gun given effective range. The gunplay mechanics overall are pretty consistent avoiding the frustrations of a bug related loss.The gun variety is definitely there you will rarely end up with the same weaponry every game unless looting multiple bodies. This forces the player to adjust to the loot and is exactly what makes the charm of this game. In PUBG everything is about adapting to the situation the zone shrink cannot be predicted to an exact perimeter the loot cannot be predicted the outward movements of other players can be anticipated but not predicted. This whole makes for a unique and different experience every single game.The community is fairly great so far toxicity levels are low compared to most multiplayer pvp games I have played I have very rarely assisted to team killing even in random teams nobody will T Bag your body.While graphics and optimization are not at their best yet the gamer did make some major improvements over time with developpers being transparent about their work releasing weekly patch notes with bug fixes new features etc. Obviously for those looking for the best graphics and the best performance then this game is definitely not for you. Surround sound implementation is "fine" as of right now. While it may not be the best I have ever seen you are still able to tell roughly where a close enemy is moving from around you using surround sound as well as hear vehicules and shots from afar.Overall for it's price you are getting a lot of hours of gun it is only fair that I would recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Nothing special about this game. I've seen better with the same price tag. Frankly I'm disappointed. I only bought it due to my friends having it and wanting me to play with them. I feel scammed out of my money. To start off the game logs you into a lobby full of 99 other people. This is probably where you will get the most fun out of the game. Not only do you get the priveledge of hearing 12 year olds advertise their twitch streams to everybody on the server. But you also get to hear third world baboons scream obscenities and racial slures every five seconds on a North American server no less. Why Brazilians and Russians will never stick to their own servers? I'll never know. After a minute or so. Everybody teleports into what it appears to me to be an AC130 where you are forced to parachute and jump down onto a remote island and where you want to jump and where you want to land is up to you.When you hit the ground one or two things will happen to you. You will either fight other people over a pair of pants and a red bull or you will land so far away from everyone else that you spend the entire game running to a mark location on the map without getting your handed to you by some kind of invisible geo storm hoping the enemie doesn't shoot you in the back of the ing head. There is nothing fun or amazing about parachuting into a deserted town and ransacking a two story building only to find a frying pan and a pair of boots when the guy in the house 30 feet away from you already has a level 2 helment backpack bullet proof vest shot gun ak and a revolver. Oh and he happens to get every med kit that happens to spawn within a mile radius. I guess to some people the scavenging for this is fun. To me it's not. Luck should not be part of any shooting game. And if you happen to land too far off from the "circle of death" I like to call it. Well kid you will need to put your running shoes on or you will be killed in this circle of death that forces people out of camping and into the center of the map. I played for 2 hours and only saw one vehicle and when I finally did get to ride it it handled like an air boat from half life 2. When it comes to guns. The only time you can actually practice with them is in the ing lobby. How the hell are you suppose to get good at shooting if you can't practice in the game without giving away your position instantly? So when the game gets to a point when everyone is in the middle of the map because of the death circle forcing them to. Everyone is just lying prone on the ground hiding or behind a tree camping waiting for someone else to pop up. That isn't fun. None of this is fun. All you do in this game is scavenge for items and run to a generated spot on the map while you try to avoid getting killed. And it's the same thing. Each and every time. After I played my fourth game I realized I wasn't going to experience anything new. The only reason why people would play this game is because they are either trying to be the next twich celebrity or they just have horrible taste in video games and are ok with playing this years game of running through an open field and getting shot in the back of the ing head simulator.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Spent countless hours playing PUBG with friends. Unfortunately I followed this game from its infancy and with the rapid growth of population came greed. The company ended up prioritsing cashing in on the game by trying to release as much content as possible without double checking if it was release ready. This meant two new maps and multiple different platform ports before they decided it time to actually focus on fixing the game and optimizing it. Even the Xbox version was unplayable with rendering being below 30 fps. Now after all this time after the population hit approx 600k they decide to launch a "lets fix the game guise" campaign. Too late to fix a turd now that the avg wait time for a game is between 8 50+ min on OCE servers.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples peeled cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double crust pie Directions 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10 inch circle. Cut into 8 (1 inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter sugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing

review: This game runs way better than it used to looks great and is generally a great experience if you like multiplayer short burst shooting action. HOWEVER If you speak English (which Im sure you do) dont expect to be able to play squad or duos without friends filling the lobby. If you dont you will ALWAYS get a Chinese person or 3 in your team. Along with that theres hackers that seem to be a Chinese players a majority of the timeThere is no Region Lock and thats sad for a game of this size. In my opinion the lack of Region Lock ruined this game. It was very fun even addicting up until a few months ago. Now you cant even take the game seriously. If I could refund this game I would have already. Very dissappointing. If you want to have some Battle Royale fun play Fortnite its free and theres a lot less hackers and you can expect to at least have English speaking teammates. If they update the game with Region Lock and better anti hacks then I would highly recommend this game to any FPS fan.

review: I know this is in Early Access So Ill change my review if the "cons" are sorted.I got this game because Ive been looking for a stable and fun equivalent to H1Z1 and I herd this game ran well.The gameplay is awesome and addictive I did not expect to like Battle Royale as much as this the weapons feels good the driving is actually good depite the odd hiccups some really tense moments funny and frustrating moments in Duo and Squad overall the gameplay is great but my issues are performance.The countless times that I have to force restart my PC crash to desktop infinite loading screen buggy textures etc... it feels more like a server connection issue but some of my friends dont get these issues as often as I do it might be my hardware (listed bottom of page) but when the game decides to run it runs like a dream.Pros Tense and exciting moments Weapons and Vehicles feel good. Map is well designed (besides the odd issues with polygons sticking out making my car flip) Solo is a tense slow and stealthy Duo is a little easier but still tense and Squad can be chaotic at times best played with mates. Can look quiet pretty even on Low. Weapon accessories and inventory management is simple but fluid.Cons It can run perfectly at times for couple of hours or sometimes your crashing to desktop every 5 mins. Sometimes infinite loading screens (which freezes my PC when I try to do anything about it) Playdough buildings when first landing basically the LODs havent loaded and you cant raid buildings unless you TAB can take between 30 seconds to a few minutes. UI needs work Sound glitches (sometimes rain doesn't work or the sound of the plane) Lobby can crash your game if everyone decides to spam the grenades.System.i5 4460 3.2GhzGTX 750 Ti.8gb RAMHDDEdit After 6 months of not playing I got a new set up.i5 4460 3.2GhzGTX 1050 Ti 4gb.8gb RAMHDDIt works alot better no loading issues can have much higher settings and everything seems to be loading properly you still get the odd tipical bugs that everyone else gets but its playable now my main issues are the fact they took out rain and fog because kids couldnt handle it.

review: Playerunkown Battlegrounds is set to release soon. I think that this is an incredibly foolish step for Bluehole to take as this game is not nearly as finished as they think it is. It's still very VERY buggy. It isn't optimised at all I have a GTX 1060 6GB and this game very rarely gets a constant 60 fps. In fact I don't think I've EVER gotten a stable 60 fps it's just 40fps and sometimes 30. And for the love of god it's not ing eSport ready. Theres one hundred people in one server how can the casters possibly be keeping track of everything that goes on?Bluehole please this game isn't ready for release and it certainly isn't ing ready for eSports. Delay it and fix all of it's problems before you release this hot garbage (but fun hot garbage) of a game.That was my original review.The game has now released and my opinion has changed. They have mostly fixed the optimisation issues and polished the game to the point where its now an enjoyable experience to play with friends. I do recommend buying and playing this game.There is one issue however. There are many asian players in Oceania which have access to hacks and have other issues. Why there are asian players on an Oceania server is beyond me and while this wouldn't really be much of an issue if they didn't hack and lag and whatnot it is an issue. Just be mindful abtout this if you play in this region.

review: The aiming isn't accurate you either die right after parachuting into the game or minutes into the game (seriously it's a 1/90+ chance you'll win) there's really bad reloading glitches (dropping a gun to pick up another will cause the magazine to be emptied and opening doors right after reloading will CANCEL the reloading) the overuse of open environments is boring and could benefit from SOME (not too much but some) corridor areas like facilities and whatnot as there's way too much ground to be shot at also helicopters would've been nice (they don't have to be Apaches or nothing but SOMETHING to take advantage of that airspace). Also the inventory screen is not as efficient as it really could be and takes too damn long to equip stuff with the whole drag and drop thing...It's somewhat fun and had a lot of potential but really think this game NEEDS more work to make it more interesting (especially with aiming and reloading). As it is you're probably just gonna get sniped in the open or shot at from atop/beneath the stairs by people camping the location until the next play zone opens up...

review: This is a great game. Period the concept is great and it's quite entertaining... But it does have some major flaws1) The servers sometimes lag out and you can time out of a game for no reason also I know i chose the NA sever but for some reason in my 30 hours of playing (at the time of writing this) I've only seen 2 players on my team in squad (and most of my time is on squad) That can speak english and one of them couldnt really even speak idk if that is just me or something with the servers2) It's not really worth getting if you dont have a higher end PC because if you cannot run this consistantly then you will never win on ur own3) I cant really say that much about this but Cheating in my 30+ hours of playing ive died to only one cheater but the problem was it was so blatant it was painful to watch the death cam 4) ing inventory splitting PLEASE add this if I could tell you how many times i've had to turn down a teammate to give them ammo just because you cant split it is in the hundreds Bluehole pls get on that5) The drift on cars is TERRIBLE if you turn just a little bit and then try to straighten yourself out you will drift uncontrollably Also Bluehole you think you can get away with these maps i mean the locations are fine but come on the terrain looks like you took the mountain tool from unity and just randomly put hills and mountains around the main towns which leats to you clipping on the ing tiniest rock that you should be able to drive over Also AGAIN with the cars is the damage they do I was in a match and our car was parked by a building and i got in to drive next thing you know im telling my friends to get in because the barrier was about tom hit us I start to barley move and barley tap my teammate with Full ing health and he got downed6) The aim. The ing aim is so bad once again i was with my friends and he sot at point blank range with an akm and missed all 6 shots while the enemy and him were standing still (it also wasnt rapid firing either)7) If you do NOT have friends to play this game with then you will be so ing bored Anyways thats all that i can remember but if i were to rate this game id rate it... 8.631/10 Good game

review: Its a highly controversal game and now I understand why. I was bored and wanted to try a new shooter. I bought this and played for a couple of hours both in duo and solo games. Its very difficult shooter to get into for new comers and will punish you in many ways. Dont have high expectations for this game I know I didnt and I dont regret buying it as much and the low price tag. Dont expect to win or get over 5 kills either. Youre matched against 100 players all surviving to get that chicken dinner the odds are really stacked against you. Its an okay shooter but dont fall into the hype. Either try to have fun with the game for what it is or save your money for something else. Here are my criticisms of the game.The gun play is alright but the hit reg/connection is horrible. Probably one of the worst since DayZ. There should be another game mode besides the battle royale.They should work on region locking which I dont think they are going to do no matter how many complain.The sound isnt optimized right very hard to pinpoint where the sound of gunfire is coming from even if you do turn up the volume. You are only damaging your ears. This game shouldnt be out of early access dont know why they took it out to begin with. The game is still very flawed.

review: The game sounds really awesome! Perfect concept!Last man standing on a gigantic 2 part Island with 100 contestants. It couldnt be better right?Awesome game to play with friends but ohhh wait...there was something...right...It WOULD be really nice if there werent these points Cocky DevelopersTerribly buggy (even on high end machine)lame HURR DURR EARLY ACCESS excusesUnoptimized at all ControlsToo often the textrues wont load...too often I wasnt able to pick up an item...too often the game crashed.I really tried to love this game but I just cant....its a weird mess. After a kill I dont feel satisfied because of the laggy controls the frag feels like an "accident". Sometimes it happens that I hit the enemy without even pointing at them correctly...but sometimes it happens that I dont hit a single bullet even though I have him clear in my sight...I uninstalled this thing. For streamers its a goldmine ...but for casuals I dont think its the perfect game.

review: &gt Enter the game&gt See that your party from yesterday game in lobby&gt Exit party manually&gt Lets explore starting island&gt Plane time game crashes&gt Open game again&gt Manage to land this time game constantly rubber bands you.&gt Try to open a door door disagrees with you.&gt Get shot trying to get inside the building.&gt Play again&gt This time you got the weapons hot battle action&gt Peek around the corner shoot enemy retreat... Die in cover from bullets coming from same enemy.&gt Play again&gt This time you are inside a house. You see an enemy outside.&gt Lets kill him then but what is that your arch enemy bars at the windows.&gt Cant find correct angle because of the height adjustment of your characters and house design. Get killed again.&gt Play again&gt Wow you are in last circle&gt 2 enemy left. You throw a grenade to take one and shoot another.&gt CHICKEN DINNER OW YEAAAH&gt Play againgGame has its own problems. It is definitely not a perfect game. It has server issues and according to me some design issues. However game is enjoyable and you always want to return for another round. Developers seems like working to fix issues and bring new content. So i recommend this game. I think that if you buy this game you will find something you enjoy.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: this guy for building the foundation of this game with a small team. And despite accumulateing millions of dollars and gathering a larger team that can support the game are unable to deconstruct the game and build it into a more stable product within a matter of months. Why don't you just buy more servers with your money? Or just buy a better game? And HOW ING DARE YOU ADD MICROTRANSACTIONS made of cosmetics TO HELP FUND A TOURNAMENT! I havn't been this mad since Valve did that for X number of years with DOTA and CS GO. Don't they know they should just put in all the money we gave them to fund things that require event staff location broadcasting etc. when all it REQUIRES is the game. GAAWWWWWWWWWWWWWDDDDDDDDDD!That's basically what you get from most of these bad reviews. Granted PR and responding/cattering to streamers is kind of trash. But that is the only fault I have found with the game as I am a level headed individual who understands you can't just reboot a game in a matter of months.Do you have mates to play with?Are you okay with 1/100 1/50 or 1/25 odds with a flat denominator assuming you are on the same level as everyone else?Do you like FPS?Then it is a good game. I only play with friends who are better than my trash I enjoy almost every game because I like the thrill of knowing that at any given moment I could have a minor chance at outplaying the person who is about to me up.

review: Blue Hole needs to fix two major flaws in my opinion. 1 Dont have players take drop damage during the entry phase. There are too many instances where you get screwed over by the parachute getting "caught" on something (or not at all) and you take fall damage. Remove fall damage while the parachute is still attached to the player. 2 Fix the vehicles spinning out of control for no realson and doing ridiculous crap while driving. Players die way too often from a motorcycle hitting the smallest of micro terrain and the bike going Evel Knievel on them and killing the person. This game would frustrate me as a play much less if these 2 things were changed. I still recommend the game but it could be more enjoyable.

review: Liked this game before 1.0 came out it got many things right that H1Z1 didnt Pros Quick matchesBig player baseWeapons are good and accurateConsGraphics very dated with bland textures which is frankly hard to do on the unreal engine (I'vre developed in unreal)NO real content or play based improvements just a new main screen which made the relaeae a bit MehNew map is terrible too open and doesnt allow for terrain camouflage causes lag issuesLAG rubber band lag all the time this is not my connection this happens to many players and makes it impossible to play (this reduces as more players leave the game so its a capacity issue) I wouldnt buy this now I didnt mention the accuasations of Chinese hackers etc because I havent seen any proof of this but alot of people are pointing out the same old suspects and they are there on the leaderboards after being banned multiple times

review: PUBG is definitely became my favourite competitive game as soon as I played through it. The concept will let you keep playing as you battle for first in the best battle royale available on pc. You can also bring your buddy along with the whole squad to fight for number 1. Just remember to record each wacky moment ). On the other hand the devs just introduced a payed system in which you can by keys to open specific boxes. However there are free boxes for you to earn too. Personally I didn't like this new idea as it will milk the game just like csgo. I do recommend this game for you and your friends. Just don't buy any keys it ain't worth it. It will just tempt the devs to ruin the game with micro transactions

review: This game is mostly stable but it does have its bugs and performance issues (which u would expect to have been already ironed out with the amount of money the developers have made) besides that the worst problems with the game are atm the gunplay (which is still very clunky and mostly devolves into who can get an assualt rifle/submachine gun first as those are the arguebly the best guns in the game atm). The other worst problem is the Chinese hacking problem....since the unlock of the Chinese into the European and US servers the hacking problem has increased 10fold. Majority of players in any game are Chinese majority use the same weapons (UMP) and are usually at the top of the leaderboards. If u can tell that I am salty about the Chinese problem its because I am. The rampant cheating that goes ignored by the chinese playerbase in US and European servers is the biggest problem with this game atm and is what has soured my enjoyement of the game. Id rate this game a 8/10 but with the Chinese Problem a 6/10.
