review: Very fun work in progress. Best played with friends in Duo or Squad.Read up a little on it if you pick up so you don't rage quit after a few losses.Update after 1.0 01/22/2018Crashes once per gaming session. I won&lt t lie the ability to join back my squad after your game crashed is neat. It's a pain this crashes so much since 1.0 vs before (I hardly ever crashed)Still lots of things that feel out of balance. Walking away 2 m from a vehicle should not negate the explosion damage 100%. Grenades still feel useless. At this point I'd almost welcome an RPG.Sk12 balance it or remove it from the game please it's useless.Remove ALL clothing except coats masks and helmet from loot. It"s useless and everyone would benefit from a gun or melee weapon for the boots and shirts plus it hides loot underneath in some environnment.The lootcrate gambling debacle sorry look up gambling in a dictionary the current situation is pretty close to the definition. Making players who bought the game pay for keys? Really?If you cannot sell the most common desperado items for the price of a key you hav NOT created scarcity correctly.Please allow players to select the map they want to play on not everybody enjoys your new map and it"s a constant pain to hear teammates complainPlease fix the replays so people don't show any recoil or any skill whatsoever looks like a lot of from the hip BS kills.Again still a fun game with many flaws.

review: This is one of my most played games on Steam. I enjoy this game a lot because of the overall gameplay. To me the looting is satisfying as is killing people. However getting a chicken dinner is probably one of the best feelings in the world. Because in the end you bested 96 to 99 other people and you're just like "heck yeah man let's go my dude". Then you get coins and buy crates and hope to get good stuff but you usually don't. That is probably one of my only complaints about this game is the RNG with getting aesthetic items from the crates. I have spent over four hundred hours in game and do not have much to show for it. I guess I take off my clothes anyways to help me not stick out but idk man. I play this game on my garbage computer on ultra low settings and manage to win still so you can too probably. Bluehole is currently working on combatting aimbotters but they are still very apparent and losing to one is pretty horrible. Once aimbotters get taken care of it won't be nearly as infuriating. $29.99 might seem like a high price tag which is what my initial thought was but after putting in quite a bit of time to H1Z1 I am very glad I got this game and started to play it more than the other.

review: ** EDIT** Reinstalled after a few months to check out game improvements. First time launching game. Crashed. Second time tried to load a mini royale solo game error and cant search for a game. THIRD time Finally get it to search for a game in peak time OCE 12 17 minutes wait time for a game..... Nope. Uninstalled again. Cya. I have waited for a long time to start getting into this game the fact its still a early access game that charges $30 something USD for something with SOOO MANY issues is just mind boggling dumb. Obviously my opinion means nothing to these guys because theyve made millions thanks to twitch but this is a game. Its fun on occassion dont get me wrong. Had some fun moments but its issues are absolutely out doing anything positive about this game.If theyd have kept ot FTP optimised it made it run smooth with less issues and add basic mechanics like vaulting (took nearly 12 months to add the upmost basic mechanic in 2017 btw lol) THEN when its all good release it at a full priced game done. Absolutely great job take my money. Any skins? Sweet ill buy some of them too. But no. As it shouldnt suprise any consumer money bags filled where their passion should be. I might play it a bit more probably not stick to fornite its fun and plays at least 10x smoother. PlayerUknown can eat a Greedy bastard.

review: So I made a review in June of 2017 and it went a little like this..."Biggest problem for this game is what seems like server integration of EU NA Pacific etc. and if thats the case then it's not good tbh. Noone can understand each other and it results in poor communication and fun over all gameplay. Other than that con GREAT GAME&gt "Now I must take back that last comment..."great game." The game has gone to total now more than ever and as if problems were bad back then and still in a fixing stage they got progressively worse and more came on board as well as the lack of performance development and other strategies generally taken by good game devolping companies...key word "good."The streamers are a big issue and devs. should not base their opinions nor focus on them because they are not the soul for the games nor the true "real" money behind them either...in fact if a study were to be made the game would still have been bought by a ton more gamers whom wouldn't have needed to watch streams of this game or any sort of streaming just plain want to play a game hands down guaran****ingteed.The bans oh my have the bans sucked. Banning for the wrong reason no true replay system involved no really needed bans being done its plain horrible. The average amount of hacking in this game has sky rocketed in the past 6 months and again progressively getting worse.Let's talk about my previous review real quick server integration good or bad? It's good for when trying to maximize the server populations for games to start and the bloodshed/carnage begin but horrible for team comms strategy all across the board when you can't speak another language or have to bust out a translator. Being able to pick and choose your domain of gaming such as EU NA KO etc...still smart but integrating them...nah.Mr.Grinch I mean Green..........Get off your actually run a good dev. team and give some orders for once to fix your broken game that is still well in a premature state and not even ready.

review: Just like other survival titles like "Day Z" for example. You scavenge through homes and buildings for ammo weapons and armor. You try to stay inside a certain area and its kill or be killed. Love the gameplay and the interaction with the other players online. When you get into the last 10 people alive since it is a free for all style match you feel the excitement and adreniline pumping. But there are still players out there that utilize an "Auto Aim Bot" because they cannot play the game. When I lay into someone with 30 rounds and they look at me and fire one bullet that makes me furious. If you cannot play any game without cheats especially multiplayer titles then don't play the game. It ruins the enjoyment of the title for other people!If you can get into a lobby without them then awesome! Hope you enjoy bullets coming from who knows where! Happy Hunting!

review: The game was fun at first when I viewed it as "this is an alpha/early access game and the glitches and bugs will be worked out." However after months of playing this game waiting for things to be fixed it's clear that Blue Hole's primary objective is no longer player satisifaction and is all about revenue. Glitch and bug fixes? No way. Event pass for sale? Sure. Invitational tournament tickets for sale? Sure. New locked loot crates that you have to buy keys for? Absolutely. Literally every day when I log onto steam the newest steam news article about PUBG is something they're launching or rolling out that Blue Hole can try to make money off of.Is the game worth $30? Yeah frankly it is. I've logged enough game time to more than say that I've recouped my money invested. However at this stage in the game it's already feeling old and phased out due to Blue Hole's lack of urgency in fixing issues and prioritization of profit. If it were a $60 game I'd pass at this stage as there are already free royale genre games on steam that are quickly becoming much more fun (and functional) than PUBG.

review: At the state this game is in now I would not recommend buying it if you don't already own it.This game had and still has the potential to be a good game but bluehole doesn't care at all about what their playerbase has to say about the bugs and rather than fixing their optimization or the fact that the threeseater bike flips over nothing they release more crates they even sold out to the fact Shroud and DrDisrespect are the two biggest people keeping this game alive which is why they created skins crates for them which are overpriced for just two skins each. Bluehole had stopped caring about their game realizing that people are dumb enough to buy their lootboxes and make them money. And while having a new map is fun and all they really need to fix all the bugs on the old one first even the very first map is covered in bugs. Hackers are everywhere in the game that it might as well be CoD Mw2 at this point. review: I've been playing PUBG for a couple of hours now and in my opinion the game is greatBUTthe amount of chinese players and frequency of meeting hackers is beyond the level of russian hackers in cs go...the game is great to play and a lot of fun with friends... probably the most long lasting fun game to play with your friends on the market right now even with all the hackers. Although the physics especially when driving any kind of vehicle are literally garbage this also leads to a lot of hilarious moments! So when you start the game for the first time and you get into the first couple of games you'll be REALLY disappointed as you'll probably loose your first 50 60 games without getting any kills if you are coming from games like Battlefield 4 or even CS GO. This game has a steep learning curve and is heavily reliant on team work and knowing the map the game physics the different types of guns etc. but once you know all of this you'll have an awesome time and easily get into the top 10 or even win a game every now and then.The steam market is also actually a lot of fun in this game! You can earn crates for free by playing matches and surviving them for as long as possible ("battle points" as they are called are being calculated by some other things like amount of kills hitpoints etc. as well!) so if you are clever about it you can even earn some cents by playing the game! During the gamescom time i even got so many gamescom crates that i was able to buy PUBG for another friend of mine just from the revenue of the crates! Also none of the items on the steam market are necessary for the game they are like in overwatch purely cosmetical (yet awesome!)So if you like games that are hard as hell are 100% focused on team work look graphically pleasing and you have an i7 6700k and maybe something like a GTX 960 4GB version lying around as well as 16GB of ram (the game uses 10GB on my pc with medium settings on 1080p!) then this game is definitley for you. As for myself I can only say that i fell in love with this game! There is definitley a reason why this is the currently most played game on steam (afaik) and why i put over 100 hours in 2 weeks into it!

review: A good in between game. Solo Duo (with a friend recommended) or squad (here you have to be either very lucky or have 3 friends).1. When on the plane open map and pinpoint where you wanna go (depends on you want an early brawl go rather middle and big places if not outside but you will need to run into the "middle" soonish anyways otherwise the "inclining" field will kill you gradually)2. Jump of the plane3. Loot places try to stay hidden/kill people4. Survive either by hiding killing or camping it out XDPro or Con? Well for the price it offers too little. What it offers though is fun. I'm a bit undecided and will for now give it a thumbs down until it comes out with more options.Updated yeah staying with no. Cheaters are ever present (especially Chinese) and aiming out of a window makes you shoot the frame really?

review: Im going to start of first and foremost If you're here to play this game competitively to want to tryhard every game and get as many wins and kills as possible you're in for a bad time. because every little bug or issue or slight random thing that happens will just cause you to get angry. This game doesn't do that. this game as an Esport or a competitive game does not work. At least very much not in its current state. Many games can be one or lost purely by the luck of where the final few zones spawn often forcing one team in a good position to move through the open to get into the zone and thus get killed by the team that had the zone spawn on them. HOWEVER! if you're in to have some fun. have a good high tension time get some kills and maybe get lucky and win a few games you'll have a blast. This game excells at heart racing action good teamplay and tactics tense moments and exciting firefights with a little bit of Micheal Bay ness thrown in for good measure. That is what PUBG excells at. I have played with friends who are super serious and tryhard. they hate it they rage. they call the game trash. I then go and play with friends who just play to have fun and we have a blast. That is what this game is best at.There is also this Hackers. yep. there are a lot of them. HOWEVER a good 90% of hackers in this game play in Third person mode only. I can play a week of first person games without meeting a hacker or a cheater on any server. But the second I play third person Its hacker after hacker after hacker. Along with this third person tactics of hide behind walls looking over them and whoever tries to poke or push first loses is legitimately terrible and completely unfun. First person is MUCH better for gameplay overall Which is unfortunate seeing as most people play third person anyway and I honestly don't know why.

review: The game started out with several issues but remained fun to play. Over time the developers have become incredibly greedy. They push more and more locked crates so you need to buy keys to get anything decent in the game. Then they made it so that you can get locked crates using your coins at random so you're not even guaranteed free items after spending dozens of hours playing the game. They fix minor issues and leave the glaring major ones in the game. They have yet to implement any decent anti cheat measures so you will watch replays of getting killed by someone on the other end of the map aiming nearly straight up to compensate for bullet drop and then watching the bullet travel across the entire map to headshot you through bars. I had fun with it every so often but it's become so much of a headache and crashes a lot despite having a really good gaming rig. The servers have hours long maintenance every so often that ends up taking several hours more than estimated because the patches always break something else. There's a reason the playerbase has dropped so sharply so they're selling the game at a discount for the summer sale in the hopes of getting more people to drain money from while pumping out even more locked content and releasing a new map to pretend it isn't all just to get more money. Honestly unless you're absolutely DYING to play a battle royale game I'd avoid this piece of trash that just keeps getting worse over time instead of better.

review: Been playing since release stopped when the Chinese hacker wave sparked and came back later only to find an un optimized game that had done very little to improve and was heading in the wrong direction.Today I can safely say that the devs are doing the right thing and finally listening to the community! The game has improved SO MUCH it's almost like a new game at this point and it makes me happy because now I can finally truly enjoy playing it. (Ignoring the occasional aids I acquire from overly sweaty try hards my only complaint is that there isnt a queue for ranked seperate from normal games I play this game with my friends always to win but we dont have the time to practice it enough to be top tier players so when you encounter them in game its slightly unfair and it makes the game not fun momentarily im sure we've all been there. There needs to be MMR based matchmaking and a ranked gamemode for sure I trust the devs to get there soon!)

review: Despite seeing a MOSTLY NEGATIVE review placement PUBG is really not as bad as people make it out to be.Does the game have some server issues?Yes sometimes I do have issues with servers but it's very rare usually they are fixed with a small patch. Does the game have optimization issues? I can run this game with everything at ultra except for shadows and view distance (which aren't needed at ultra)and get a respectable 70+fps stable.So why does this game have so many negative reviews? Most of the community try running this on potato hardware and expect to be pushing high/ultra settings The community is somewhat a bunch of idiots who troll about fortnite and other battle royale gamesIs this game dying? lol absolutely not. over 2 million players daily that's just on PC servers. I never have issues looking for a game. So should you buy it? IF YOU HAVE POTATO HARDWARE NOIF YOU HAVE A WEAK INTERNET CONNECTION NOIf those 2 do NOT apply to you go ahead and pick it up on another gaming site like gee two aye or simply catch it on sale. It's one of the only games since I got it I never put it down over a year ago and the game has seen MAJOR improvements in performance and also gameplay wise with constant new items such as GunsMapsNew items New attachementsNew lootboxes (cosmetic ONLY)and event passes to get special drops. usually a new patch with all new things happen every few months and you can check it out on their facebook page for updates. All in all this game is worth every penny to me don't let anyone else shape your opinion on something THEY did not enjoy. I made the same mistake at first.

review: Honestly i love this game something about it continues to draw me in. Every match is different. I love how every map has its own way to play effectively while letting you easily play it your own way to get that chicken dinner. Despite what people constantly say this game is done incredibly well and the constant updates people spend so much time complaining about are a step forward no matter how big/small they are. People also tend to complain that "The game isn't optimized". It isn't Bluehole/pubg corp/anyone elses fault you're trying to play this game on a pizza box with a mobo i2 cpu or someshit and GTX 200 series GPU in it. I have i5 3570k cpu rx 480 GPU and 16gb G.Skill DDR3 ram. My partner has a GTX 650 Ti 8gb of assorted ram and the same CPU and it runs fine for both of us. Graphics are excellent gameplay/gunplay is excellent the vehicles are fun the events are fun. I haven't got anything negative about this game to say. There's a reason it gained popularity so fast and has a loyal fanbase that play and it's because no other game battle royale or otherwise will give you such a unique experience as PUBG does.

In any case the idea is great and the game would be one of the best out there if it just did not have such massive technical issues.

review: Edit My original review is below but I'm changing this to "not recommended" because the devs are spending their time adding "micro" transactions instead of adding new content or fixing the many many bugs and performance issues that plague the game. Also frankly I've kind of gotten bored of the game at this point. There are so many other games I could be playing where I don't have to spend half an hour sneaking around a giant map and tediously looting everything. This game is buggy as and runs like even though I've got 2 GTX 980s in SLI a Core i5 6600K and 16GB of DDR4 memory. There are frequent issues with server lag occassional server crashes and sometimes you'll fall through the ground or find items spawned in weird locations where they can't be picked up....and yet I've already played for 40 hours. Simply put even though the game has a lot of issues in this early state it's so much fun that the issues are easy to overlook. It provides a gameplay experience and a level of engagement that most other titles can't come near even during their most elaborate scripted set pieces. It's one thing to breach a door and execute several enemies in a dramatic slow motion sequence in Call of Duty but it's another thing entirely when you and your squad actually coordinate to pull of the same thing in an open world multiplayer game against a competing group of players.There are two caveats first if you have a low spec system you should probably wait until more optimizations have been made. Second the game isn't nearly as fun when playing solo. You can queue up for squad mode as a solo player but it's much more fun to get a squad of friends in Discord/Steam voice chat so that you can really coordinate. Other than that PUBG is definitely worth playing.

review: This is one of those thngs where I want to say that I can reccomend a game but I can't which is a shame because the gameplay of PUBG is actually legitimately alot of fun. It's a different experience to your traditonal shooter and gets the pulse up considerbaly more. It can be a little frustrating but that's fine. The reason I can't reccomend it is because Bluehole is probably the single worst example of a company who see's their playerbase as cash cows who they can milk for every last cent rather than as valued customers. I don't have (that much of) a problem with microtransactions but what Bluehole thinks their microtransactions are worth is just straight up offensive. After playing the game to earn ingame currency to purchase a crate they then expect you to pay $2.50 USD for a key to open that crate and receive a random item. $2.50 per crate I'm sorry no. That's just a joke. Bl uehole your pixels are not worth that much. I'de pay a dollar for a pack of 10 keys maybe I'll certainly never pay $2.50 for one. Of course the blatant rip off's dont stop there. COD WWII may be using their events to peddle lootboxes using limited time but at least they have the decency to make the vent free. Not Bluehole though if you even want to participate in tge event you have to dish out another $10 for a ticket for the POSSIBILITY of earning rewards. I didn't pay for this game (a freind bought it for me thanks Adam _ ) but I still feel like I'm being ripped off every time I play it as I wade through the barrage of locked crates Twitch Prime exclusives and MLG event advertisments before I even make it to the game.

review: Where do I begin? The mechanics feel so fluid and nice. Aiming shooting even moving around is just pleasant to do. The game flows well the vehicles handle decently I could go on. It really is just an upgraded h1z1 which is well worth the extra money. Though the optimization is rather bad with stutters and frame drops occuring literally more often than not. I will uprade my rig soon but I know the stutters should not be so often. However I am not going to go out of my way to give it a negative review over optimization due to me having optimism that it will improve as it leaves early access to invite more players as many steam users do not have the strongest gaming rigs. Not to mention it would be difficult to since it has such fantastic gameplay at its core. As of the moment for users with mid range to low end AMD cards I would not recommend it until it is further improved perhaps after early access. As for Nvidia users I would recommend it as long as you have a mid range build or higher. I do not own both types of cards so don't take my word for it but I have heard stutters were much more common with AMD. As of now 7.5/10. It's difficult to give such a game a lower score than such due to the fantastic gameplay that will leave you glued to your chair for hours as long as you're patient and have had experience with this type of game before.

review: Synopsis of current patch Loot screwed up Banning 25k cheaters doesn't mean there aren't already brand new cheats for sale. Endgame circles spawn/move so fast that tactical play is essentially non existant after the first three circles. (either you get to camp or you have to run all the time) "Preventing that the server sends the client too much info" ( to reduce lag) essentially means invisible people spawned near you. Devs claim there are no cheats in the game and actively lock/remove threads stating otherwise. Third review.Each consecutive patch messes the game up more and more. Inconsistency seeps in at every turn. Either it becomes nigh unplayable due to poor optimization and server lag issues or the combat becomes highly inconsistent. An example After a recent patch I shoot people multiple times with assualt rifles ( 4 7 times) without downing them after more hits than should be required according to the damage statistics of the weapons. In turn I get downed by 1 2 shots max from the opposing end not even receiving a headshot. I'm not recommending this game until the devs learn to code properly.

review: early access review july 2017 i lost friends because of this game but its ok because the game is good review as of june 2018 i no longer recommend this game because bluehole failed as a company. in a span of 6 months there are barely any content coming out just some new guns and a new map and that's it. also in that timeframe bluehole barely fix issues within the game like hit registry cheaters and crashes. meanwhile its competitor fortnite keeps coming up with new content such as new guns new gamemodes and new building materials every two weeks. not to mention many fixes that come with those updates.PUBG is horribly unoptimized and often crashes without warning mid gameplay. moreover this game was never competitive in the first place. it's about who has the best rig of all. not to mention it has MICROTRANSACTIONS even though its a paid game. you progress through the game by getting new cosmetic items which can only be acquired from crates. said crates can only be opened by keys which cost THREE DOLLARS EACH. real classy.save your money my dudes. this game ain't worth 30 bucks at this current state.yeah imma go back playing R6S and Fortnite thankyouverymuch.

review: At launch the performance is a little unprodictable at times with occassional drops in FPS but is never unplayable and forgivable for an early access title of this price.Devs are regular in updates and content is fun and fresh. If you like H1Z1 type games but find it too arcadey this title is for you. It's like ARMA and H1Z1 had a baby.Shooting is fun and strategic and cooperative play and strategy will always win you the game with little randomness outside of the actions of the other players.edit Due to the recent attitude of the developers banning people for "stream sniping" without any evidence and for their utter lack of regard for the average player in comparison to these streaming "celebrities" I cannot recommend this game. You can be permanently banned just at the whim of a streamer without any proof or dialogue with you.

review: I've pumped a decent amount of hours into this game even if it's not a streamer's level of hours... (72 at time of post).It really doesn't take long to pick up this game and be playing like a pro. The hardest part for me has been the fact that the game isn't quite optimized out yet leaving my more than passable system to suffer struggling through low graphics settings and only getting 60 frames max. I'm not ready to upgrade to the top of the line hardware on the market so I just deal with it in this game. It will be much better once it's optimized.The game does not take long at all to pick up if you're already familiar with First Person Shooters. The most difficult part will simply be Positioning and making sure you pick your fights well. Even if you have the best guns and gear never get caught out in the open because a player behind a solid wall can peak around a corner and easily pick you off even if they have only a 9mm handgun.You will need to find a playstyle that suits you. I'm more of a passive player and I will run circles around other players until I have the advantage I need to take them down. Then there are the aggressive players who drop for School building every game and get 6 or 7 kills before the first playzone circle even shows on the map. Or you could be the camper that just hides and waits until there's one other player left.Yes I recommend this game. It's a lot of fun. Maybe too much fun... By the way I haven't even won a game as of this post. Just a LOT of unsatisfactory Top 10 matches. haha!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Do you like being ed by lag? Do you enjoy being absoulty face blasted by hit reg? review: I don't understand why this game is getting a lot of bad reviews all of a sudden. The servers (NA for me) are quick and have almost no lag. Yes they could be improved but just because they are making cosmetic items doesn't mean they wont fix it. Its a totally different dev team for chrissakes. Not every dev is working on servers so the cosmetic items aren't "Greedy technques" but its the graphical team getting ahead of the server team. Countering how its a "walking similator" and "1% shooting" os easy. When you are not in a gun fight say you drop somewhere by yourself from the plane you are probably in a constant fight trying to find guns or escape the blue barrier. When you aren't in a gunfight you are still thinking strategically and methodically. Your in a mindfight. And when you do get in a gunfight you are sweating in your seat and your heart is racing. This is a beatiful game that will only get better.

review: This is a really fun game when it works. i know it's beta but it shouldn't be this laggy at times. Everyone plays this game on the lowest graphics setting possible b/c it gives a slight advantage to see enemies and b/c it is laggy as f#*k on high settings. the game looks great on high settings but is unplayable and you are at too bad at a disadvantage on high graphic settings. Too many times i've been killed just waiting for the buildings to load. Now it is not b/c i have a low end computer i can play rift cs go wow wolfenstein rocket league etc on ultra/ max graphics while listening to podcast on itunes and downloading videos with no problem. but with PUBG i can't even run 1 podcast in the background without this game freezing up my computer. its so freaking weird. anyway this is a really fun game when it works but when it doesn't this game is just a power point slideshow. hope they fix this.on a positive the servers all went down today and almost immediately the devs were communicating on social media saying " we are aware of the server issues and are working to fix" less then 30 mins later they had fixed the issue. so they dev team is really on the ball and communicate with the community fast. so hopefully they will optimize this game soon because it is good when it works properly.side note if you buy this game watch some youtube vids on first time playing b/c there is NO tutorial and tons of stuff you would never know if someone didnt tell you. really weird for a 2017 game.Edit also a complaint this game does not like blutooth headphones. no idea why everything else i play works perfectly with bluetooth.

review: One of the best and most enjoyable games ever made to date gives you adrenaline rushes like no other game with the tense gunfights attempting to come out on top. Highly recommended most reviews complain about BUGS in a EARLY ACCESS game but even so the dev team is one of the best i have ever seen and always iron out as many bugs as possible on a regular basis while always bringing out new content which is why the game is so successful! I couldn't recommend a better game out there right now! Piece of advice don't teamkill or you may recieve a temp ban )EDIT A lot of negative reviews are also complaining about streamers getting them banned this is their own fault as if you read the rules of conduct on the battlegrounds page i quote "Do not stream snipe this is a form of cheating and you will be banned if you do it."I also have a lot more hours on this game and have 200+ I just family share it to my other account so this review is from quite a lot of experience

review: BEST GAME YOU SHOULDNT BUY. This is the best worst game I've ever played. I love the game idea but there are some glitches. Honestly the glitches dont get to me but... HACKERS. CHEATERS EVERYWHERE. I've had the game for awhile and the problem with cheaters only gets worse. Its the best shooter to come out in years and yet I would say DO NO BUY! Until the cheathing problem has been fixed this game is not worth playing. I have been on vacation and haven't played in awhile but played again today. I hav eplayed around 12 games today and 10 of them have been games with excessive amounts of hackers. Withing minutes of the game starting there will be 10 people left due to players getting head shots on targets moving in vehicls with pistols from 700+ meters away. Additionally this game might make you racist. 98% of the cheaters I play with in the NA server are from Asia. You can tell when they kill your squad with one clip of a 1911 pistol and T bag you while yelling at your in Chinese every game. A simple fix of only letting people of a continent playing on their own server would fix most of the hacking issues. At least for North America Europe Australia Africa etc

review: One of the greatest games I've ever played. This game is still rough around the edges but worth the cost all day! This game puts you in directly life or death firefights with only found objects. It encourages multiple fights throughout the game by decreasing the play area size and forcing people into close quarters. Game play and game mechanics are still lacking but I'm sure those things will be straightened out eventually.Many of the game shortfalls can be overcome by tweeking the video settings. Everything should be set to lowest with the exception of Anti Aliasing and view distance. Make those changes and you can see people from much further away without lagging.I highly recommend this game!60 hours in and I'm still pretty terrible. It takes a lot of practice so log in daily to get better. Team up with your friends and play in duo mode or as a squad of 4. Adreneline pumping and nerveracking awesomeness awaits!

review: Love the game. Fun gameplay refreshing new mechanics realistic yet balanced gunplay. Only problem is the development team can't figure out how to implement a single patch without ing the game. After every single patch the devs implement they break way more than what few bug fixes they bring. At times this game is simply unplayable due to the poor server connectivity. I've had rubber banding and lag in other games but this games lag issues has caused me so much frustration due to its competitive nature. Nothing is worse than entering a fire fight with a tree for cover with this kind of lag you rubber band and completely pop out of cover without noticing whilst your enemy is teleporting on your screen and is nearly impossible to hit. I have to admit this game is fun and a good chicken dinner gets my heart going. But in its current state I can't reccomend this laggy buggy over hyped mess to anyone. It has potential to be great but right now it's a laggy bug filled fever dream.

review: This last match I had went like this First guy I killed while he was doing inventory management. Second guy got the drop on me but I turned around and kicked his Third guy was about to run me over with a motorbike but I shot first. Fourth guy got the drop on me sniping from a hill but I out sniped his Fifth guy I sniped from exactly the same spot the fourth guy used to snipe me. Sixth guy got the drop on me but I killed the crap out of him.All the while I was solid snaking it all through neverending farmland muttering to myself "PLEASE. NO. DO NOT. AMBUSH ME AGAIN. MY HEART CAN'T TAKE IT!"Spoiler alert it did. The doctor perscribed me to medicinal mary jane. Long story short I got a lame hat from a box.This game is nonsense when you go solo and it tends to become a more fun kind of nonsense with friends.I would not wish solo play on my worst enemy. I only do it because even doing jack squat gets you battle points.You're better off going to the bar to build a real squad and get all the es.10/100. at least i'd pick this over running in the woods for half an hour only to get my urine pushed in and subsequently waterboarded.

review: Its quite fun although i don t see what the rave is all about. Its not the next Counter strike or Minecraft or anything. People seem to like it tho. Its a game version of the Movie Battle Royale and based on DayZ game but without the zombies. Grab a weapon run and camp! Theres a lot of tension and waiting bits so its not so full on action all the time a few pops in the distance and youre basically dead out of nowhere sometimes. Its avoidable by scanning your surroundings somewhat.I dunno what to say negatively only IMO its a bit bland and the gameplay rewards camping a lot thats what i dont like about it. Basically avoid all contact until youre in the top 10 thats the recipe for winning parachute away from the player horde and wait and thats easily a top 50 place right there for avoiding contact and camping. I prefer more action

review: I loved the concept and gameplay of PubG since I found out about it and when I got it even though I was regularly frustrated at times I had a lot of fun and thoroughly enjoyed myself often. This game and I however have a love/hate relationship. I couldn't tell you how many times I have died when I shouldn't have and how many times I experienced glitches and such and this includes the game and the UI where they are abundant. However this isn't what's making me write my review instead it's the development and business decisions of the company behind the game Bluehole or PubG Corp. or whoever is responsible for the terrible decisions being made. Not long after I got this game locked crates were released which really wasn't a big deal to me at the time since I could sell them anyways and still get my profit. BUT one wasn't enough and several locked crates later the entire market was horribly devalued leaving no crate above the $0.50 margin and most below $0.15 meaning selling the crates is almost not worth it at this point especially considering most locked crates are valued at $0.03 the bare minimum. The keys aren't though. They're $2.50. I don't know why they felt it necessary after all the money they raked in from the conglomerate of game purchases and partial income from steam market sales to demand money from players in order for them to reap the benefits of playing the game which they should be able to do with no tax. All of this still hadn't tipped my breaking point however because the developers were still using the money to seek out things they saw fit for fixing and throwing patches on them i.e. the overuse of assault rifles which are still the majority preferred weapon anyways and redoing grenades buffing and nerfing both as they saw needed and asked for. They still added some new content and they made a drastic effort to improve Miramar so more players found it enjoyable which I think worked because I like it more and my friends don't mind it as much. But now after the long sought after release of Sanghok originally Savage (way cooler name by the way) instead of recieving a polished map that we waited for the devs to work on for two months we find out what they were using their development money on instead which was a blatant equivalent to the battle pass of Fortnite. I absolutely could not believe my eyes when I saw that in the top right corner. On top of this the event pass blares in your face every time you open the store insisting you pay an extra $10 for a game you've already assumedly payed $27 $30 for depending on where you got it and it's not permanent DLC either. You might get certain fancy clothes or bonuses alongside it and these might just total to sell for about $10 or more but I wouldn't care. No fixes other than graphics and the insides of buildings were changed in Sanhok whatsoever since I last played on it. It still runs like hot and I've got a 1050ti but if you think that isn't a strong enough GPU my friend has the same exact frame issues and he has a 1080. They made no effort to actually fix the map they just made the buildings a little prettier inside and out and though I am thankful that they seem to have added more cover inside and out again they added loads of unnecessary objects and graphics everywhere without optimizing anything. All in all even though I really want to love PubG since I see it having so much potential these money whoring Koreans make it impossible for me to do so. They still haven't overhauled many bugged or unbalanced functions of the game inside or outside of combat and I figure the rest of that money we gave them ran towards "fixing the UI " which in my opinion even though it's not terrible is inferior to the previous one that they used which i thought was the best yet. You can't even choose between Erangel and Miramar anymore you have to play with both in your queue. I am very disappointed with the team responsible for the development in this game and until they pull themselves up by the bootstraps and start making important changes this review will remain negative. EDIT After some "hotfixes" I reopened PubG and went at it for a few games. Annoyed at the new map I went to the original Erangel and Miramar. Signs and banners have been put in place to notify players of the upcoming Global Invitational in Berlin and nothing else seems to have been changed. I noticed no other problems I didn't like what they did here because it shows where production on their dev team goes but I was relatively indifferent. Not long after this however another 6GB update comes along and supposedly various bugs performance issues and glitches as well as cheating has either been helped or fixed. I was on Erangel again today July 14 and I was having consistent frame tearing at the center of my screen which was very noticeable and annoying alongside this I could not run the map at more than 50 FPS with constant drops below 40 FPS and without regular terrible frame stutters if my graphics were held any higher than near absolute minimum (very low). This is despite the fact that even in February before various optimizations were made to the game I could still run both maps available at the time at 60 FPS consistently usually almost the whole game. The development team has not only made the UI and market worse but now they're actually tearing into the gameplay itself.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've never really been much of a FPS or PvP person but this is fun as balls. There's absolutely no pressure to be good (which is great for a relative gaming newb like me). Plenty of people to play any hour of the night. And you can leave/pick back up whenever. Especially love that as I've got a crazy work schedule and sometimes can't game for like a week and a half.100% happy with every penny the game cost. Well worth it for the entertainment especially as it's not a sub (last game I was big on was but just turned into a money drain).
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Take one part survival game plus one part shooter game and throw in about a hundred guys all hungry for a chicken dinner. Serve with a ticking clock that makes your world smaller. That's what you get in PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds. If you're looking for a quick battle with only one life to live that's reminiscent of Counterstrike but the grandness of Call of Duty with the realism of ARMA then this game is for you!

review: PUBG is probably one of the most frustrating yet most adictive shooter games I've ever played. The intencity of close quarters battle within a city or the nervousness when you run through an open field just waiting for the bullets to start flying towards you from an enemy you have not spotted in the distance. That strange puffing sound in the ground beside you and then seconds later the sound of a sniper rifle in the distance before you desperatly start looking around for cover and trying to figure out where the shots are coming from. The king of the hill concept is quite fun and nerve wrecking. You start off by being flown in over a area of 8x8 km of terrain with clusters of buildings you have to search for guns ammo and armour to defend yourself towards up to 99 other players (if you play solo). When you hang in the parachute looking around you can get shocked of the amount of other chutes around you or find yourself almost alone in the nearby sky. When you get geared up you will get pushed towards a random point on the map by ever shrinking circles of death and end up in a small circle in the end with a lot of other players all wanting to win the game by being the last to stand. You hear gunshots all around you while you see the player counter up in the corner slowly decreasing. You might die almost instantly after touching ground or you can be skilled enough to eliminate other players that cross your path to get to those final circles. Lots of rounds you will not get there but when you do its very satisfying to get that "winner winner chicken dinner" message at the end. And when you've been there once you want to be there again and again and again...Suit up and join this frustrating but excellent game. Biffinator a.k.a BiffsterB

review: The game can be crazy fun. When working well ish it gets a solid 9 on the fun factor. As far as the performance...it gets a 2. Poor servers processor hog memory leaks (have to restart game every once in awhile). It is "in development" but shouldn't be overly rewarded for not releasing a stable environment. I would say if you know people who play it and it is on sale grab it. The single player is fun and I have my share of chicken dinners...but there seems to be a disconnect between the money stream and product output. If Valve made the same game (obviously with some format options) I wouldn't touch this one by a mile...it currently fits the right niche though. It IS however the best indie Korean game I have ever played. Each game is more of a unique memorable moment. If you win you recall each one...it isn't just another meaningless ace (killing a whole squad solo in pubg I won't soon forget nor will I be able to perfectly recreate).

review: An awful game with an exciting concept. I played during "early access" and while there were a lot of bugs desync and overall issues then patches and hotfixes were frequent and it looked like the game was headed the right way. Ever since the official release of 1.0 though everything has turned to Updates stopped desync has gotten a lot worse more and more bugs appear and more and more hackers as well. It's gotten painfully hard to enjoy playing anymore and today I'm uninstalling until updates and fixes are being done.Hackers are present in probably every game whether you notice them or not. Some are blatant like headshotting half the server from across the map others like no recoil scripts you might not even realize or at least can't be certain cause of the buggy and unreliable replay/death cam system.By latest info that I could find PUBG has sold over 30 million copies. A few weeks ago there was a post that said there had been one million accoutns banned for cheating. ONE MILLION. If we say that all of those 30 million copies are active players which of course they're not then on average that is 3 cheaters per game. Every lobby you join hoping for a fair and fun game there are 3 cheaters on average and that is just being modest.But cheaters aren't even the biggest issue for me what's even more annoying is the ridiculous amount of bugs that are simply not being addressed. Let me list some of them on top of my head Bullets ignoring armor. Cars exploding from touching something at 1kmph. Bikes flipping from the smallest random bump on the road. Shots vanishing into thin air. Completely random damage on some weapons(shotguns(I blasted someone in the face from 1m 2/3 of his health not one shot another guy shoots me from across the yard from hipfire one shot dead)) Landing from your parachute you flip a coin whether or not you'll take damage. The air above the trees on Miramar is impenetrable you see someone's full body and shoot but your bullets hit the air around the tree. Grass and other objects not being rendered from a big distance making people that seem in cover fully standing out. Grenades damage randomly getting negated by an object on a table. DESYNC. My God the desync... You see someone in the open you go in a building close the door go in another room and BAM you get shot by the guy two walls and a door away from you. Game freezes and connection issues. ALL of my friends experience this at least once a day when joining a game where they hear sound but see just the PUBG logo on the screen and the game loads for them when the plane dumps the last people. It's even worse for me because the game doesn't load at all for me and I have to close it from task manager start it again and reconnect.All of the above issues have been in the game for MONTHS and nothing has been done to fix or even address them. Don't waste your time and nerves on this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Changing this to a thumbs down. First thing is the game is unplayable for me now. I bought this game a while back and it used to run really well even on higher settings. My system is aging but it easily surpasses minimum requirements and I can still run some pretty hefty games with medium/some high settings like Witcher 3 GTA V etc... But now a problem that used to happen once and a while has happened on the last 10 or so matches I've tried to play. EVERYTHING loads in fine except for the buildings. They look like PS1 buildings loading in and none of the doors or anything work so I'm stuck there helpless until they either load in at some point the game slows to a crawl and I have to open up task manager to quit or I get killed. Since it used to run well not sure if updates have made it even LESS compatible with my AMD card or if it's because the servers are now swamped with so many new players.The streamers getting people banned is part of the issue too. First off how about all the people who are forced to be included in these streams? Maybe it's not ok to ME if I'm included without asking. Secondly if a streamer is in a match and that causes people to either have to play differently or have less fun...BAN/SUSPEND THE STREAMER! Don't you see you have it backwards here...What's worse a handful of streamers whining like little girls...or the general gaming public who's game is effected? My guess is you're catering to the streamers because you don't want them talking negatively about your game??? But look now you have an amazing game with "mixed" review on Steam because of what you're doing....kudos I guess. You've created a problem where you're essentially randomly banning people since they can't even "see" who's a streamer. Then you actually made the game run WORSE over time for lots of people instead of you know optimizing it... How is it this close to release with still so terrible support for AMD cards?

They have finally made the servers acceptable though I wouldn't call the servers competetive it's atleast playable now.There are still some issues I have with the game There is no point in a redzone I assume they just copied what others did.Weapon spawns are bad (very low weapon count and not a lot of spawns).Other players with a high ping can give you a bad experience since they can shoot you while you are unable to see them (in some cases).If they will improve the servers/netcode further and adress the mentioned issues than I will recommend the game. But atm I can't it took them way too long to see what's wrong. I doubt they will go in the competetive direction and try to make this a good game. Which for me means less randomness and stable performance for client&amp server.

review: I have played this game since Early Access and have stuck with it just to see where it goes. I was supposed to be part of the group of Early Access players that would have gotten some keys and BP just for playing in Early Access. Never saw any of that. Now I want to know... what the hell is the point of playing and earning BP if you can't use the BP to buy keys?Since realeased I have gotten about 8 crates (I don't often have time to play so I don't play this game as much) that are just sitting there in my inventory asking me to pay money to unlock them even though I already played to get the BP to even get the damn things. What the hell is that? There should be an option that let's you use your BP to either buy keys (I feel like 1000 BP each is reasonable) or to use BP to buy ONLY the free crates. Why am I bothering collecting my damn points for if I have to spend over 5000 of them to then not even get something for the time I've already put into the game? Just this alone is grounds for not recommending this game. It falls under unfair land where you see cool skins and stuff online but can't get them unless you pay (think ARMA III if you will). I've already given you my money and my support PUBG Corps let me at least feel rewarded for playing your game.Currently this game feels like it is excerting a predatory system and I stand against such systems. I may continue to play the game since I already have it but I can't recommended it to new comers on the grounds of basic ethical sense. My review can be ammended or changed if PUBG Corps fixes this issue. Until then Not Recommended.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Season 8 and it's still broken... Lag/desync whatever you want to call it is still game breaking. What you see on your screen isn't what your opponent sees. Assault Rifles (which should be accurate and lethal up to 400 meters) are as accurate as potato guns and almost as useful. Hand grenades aim point constantly changes and they bounce like they're made out of rubber. Nothing loads until severral seconds after you land. I hope someone comes along and does this right.Insurgency Sandstorm is coming soon. I'll wait for that.When I play other fps games like Insurgency and the BF series it's a fun experience. I choose my weapon I spawn in I see an enemy I raise my weapon and fire and an amazing thing happens... They die. Somehow Bluehole can't make this happen. They can't even figure out how to make grenades go where you point them. That's how broken this game is.

review: i see a lot of negative reviews of this game but i'm not one of them. Does it have problems? Yes. Is it still fun? Yes. I play every day and though i do see some hackers now and again it is far less frequently than it used to be. I love the game. Regardless of the cons posted by others this game is a ton of fun and I think it's worth a shot. it wouldn't have so many millions of players if it was so god awful it couldn't be played. I will admit i have more fun with a squad of friends than i do just playing solo but thats just because of the stories we can tell after pulling off some stupid crazy #&amp !The game is just fun plain and simple. Even the negative reviewers often have hundreds of hours in. if you don't think hundreds of hours is worth 20 30 bucks...i dont' know what kind of game you're looking for. Do your own math.

review: When I first bought this game for almost $40 Canadian I knew what to expect. I was going into an early access game but it was very fun in the beginning. It was fun to experience the janky glitches with friends. But now after so much time this game has remained broken janky slow and disconnected for too long. I won't get into the politics of Blue Hole and other things as I am only interested in gameplay alone. Here are some pros and cons Pros Great atmosphere to sneak around be careful and tactical Shooting is alright but there are cons to how it feels. Cons Poor graphics Bad optimization and consistency Movement is broken completely unclean and difficult to act quickly Opening doors is broken Picking up loot is slow awkward and gets you killed Map is too big sometimes too long before you see action and you may get killedThe game would be better with lots of gameplay mechanics fixed as well as maybe smaller maps to keep rounds smaller and more exciting. The maps also feel too open with not many features. Very unfinished and it is crazy to think it's been like this for over a year.

review: Absolute bundle of greed. It was fun for a while and then it gets really repetitive. The same walking on the same textured grass whilst carrying the same weapons with the same tactics. This may have been alright if the servers were actually usable but sometimes it really isn't great. The amount of hackers in this game is astonishing in just under 19 hours i've seen some really dodgy plays far too many in fact.Then there's the skins paid DLC etc. It tarnishes the image for the game far too much to the point where I can say this game deserves mostly negative reviews on Steam. I hate to say this really I do but if you want a good battle royale play Fortnite or even Minecraft Hunger Games as while a lot of gameplay is great here the lack of updates and variation really suck the game dry of joy.

review: TLDR Stream sniping is against TOS its a fun glitchy broken intense as hilarious blast of a game.This game is amazing. It get its hype from all the highlight reels and streamers/pros doing insanely well. You dont have to be good at this game at all to enjoy it. If you are a terrible shot the game can still be a blast simply from the intensity of running around and trying to not die and make it into top 10 at the very least (which is not hard to do with no kills). And to all the reviews ing about getting banned for "harassment" they legitimently harassed streamers. Stream sniping alone is against TOS if im not mistaken but then to stream snipe and spam car horns around the streamers so they literally cant hear anything and have a bad time is harassment. You will not get banned for honking your horn you will get banned for stream sniping and being a jackass just to get on stream. The people that got banned did not do it once twice or even just three times but were regualr enough that the streamers KNEW THEIR NAMES.Something does need to be said about the game. its a horrible glitchy mess where you are bound to get stuck in a wall or have a car explode for no reason but when the game is playing finew which is most of the time its very fun. Part of it being a glitchy mess is what makes it so fun to play or watch because it just adds so many WTF moments. As long as people keep submitting clips to youtube and as long as streamers keep playing the game will remain the huge monster that it is in terms of playerbase. I dont see it dying off anytime soon.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It is Early Access but still better than a lot of games that have launched and the devs are actually actively improving the game. Fixing the game is going to take time (and there are problems current state) but for $30 you can't beat the deal.ProsFun game is extremely fun and it drops you right in on the action. No turtorial no hand holding its straight up go from the start. I love this aspect.Fast starts squad get wiped? Queue times are almost non existent most of the time. Dev updates while the Devs are no longer doing a set update schedule it is fairly fast and there are a lot of things they are working on like fixing bullet physics more vaulting fixing the grenades adding new maps etc. Price $30 is a great deal on this game EA or not. And its very likely to be selling for $60 when the game officially launchesConsOptimization Game isn't optimized (as of writing this review) so you need a pretty beefy computer to run it on high settings. Bugs Again early access so this is to be expected (some people don't understand what Early Access means though) but they are getting better. Streamers Some streamers are getting people banned for really stupid reasons like honking their horns or claiming to be stream sniped even if the odds of being on the server with a streamer is pretty low. Community the community has some great people but the idiots and the whiners seem to be the most vocal in it and it can really hurt the drive to playCommunity part 2 really wish they'd do more to limit someone from Asia being on the NA and other servers because its frustrating constantly being put in groups with people who don't speak English at all or don't have a mic at all. Even though there are more cons listed they aren't a huge deal for the most part. And the dev's are at least working on the bugs and optimization and hopefully they listen to the players and stop pandering so much to the streamers complaints all of the time.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've followed this game since beta and also played the mod and such relevant to its creation. And the game itself its gameplay is alright gradually becoming more varied however there is an issue when it comes to cost.The game itself is 26.99(GBP) That in itself isn't too expensive however you then discover how littered this game has become with micro transactions. Which I was hoping it wouldn't be. Perhaps it is the influx of Twitch Streamers perhaps its the fact that this game has become a contender for the Esports scene. I don't know.When I used to play this before you got BattlePoints or BP to spend on a crate you then opened it for free and got some cosmetics. That was fine.Now I shall give you a list of the microtransactions I have seen ONLY FROM THE STORE. Whether there is any others available I don't know this is PURELY from the STORE section in game.ALL PRICES ARE IN GBP.A collection of Cosmetic Hoodies and Weapon skins. 7.62 Each. EACH.Keys to open 5 of the 10 available crates. 1.91 EACH.Now the in game system for crates is an amount of BattlePoints that scales up per crate you buy (resets every week still as far as I'm aware.) Starting at 700 BP. You'll notice it says "A RANDOM CRATE" underneath. This is not a lie if you preview the random crate it shows 10 Crates and their potenital items. 5 of which have keys for in the store. Which means presumably the other 5 are free to unlock. Pretty generous you might say but that boils down to each time you open a random crate you have a 50% Chance to get a crate that requires a key. Fabulous.The gameplay itself is alright I'll often find myself wanting a more diverse system but then you could argue that it does what it was intended to well be a Battle Royale game. The mechanics are fairly polished now much more so than when I last played and the core gameplay is alright nothing spectacular. So in review of my review If you want a game that is a decent Battle Royale game is semi realistic in it's graphics and gameplay this is probably the better Battle Royale game on the market. However it is laden with Micro transactions. So if you have a tendency to buy them you might want to keep your aching wallet which has just had 26.99 GBP Deducted from it for the games purchase far away from reach. I wouldn't mind if it was F2P. Yet it is not. And it's not even that cheap."Decent game. However a micro transaction laden hell hole."

review: I've thought a lot about the pricetag but I bought it and I love it! I can absolutely recommend it. There is the refund thing but I guarantee you will not use it.I bought this game a while ago and now I can review it better than before. I didn't played any battle royale games other than PUBG. This was a new thing for me. The best thing was when I started playing the game and got to top 10. My heart rate was in the skies and when I won that match... Oh man that was a damn good feeling. Of course it's not that big of a deal after near 200 hours but it's still really intense and much more entertaining than e.g. CS GO or some older and better known games. At least for me. The developers do care about the players and they do their jobs as they can. After all the game is awesome. I can only recommend to buy it! Of course all of this is MY opinion.

review: ReasonUnknowns BanningGroundsGame can be so fun but seems to leave a sour taste many times after playing lag seems to attack at the worst times the player zone zeems to favour the biggest campers or the team with the advantage and the red zone is so pointless you can be having such a bad day to finally turn it around just to be killed by some random arty.Its far too luck based to be recommended and on top the odd cheater seems to be popping up now one classic was a guy sniping with a shotgun and a ump he took out 2 full squads at over 300m.Another sad note is the amount of people getting banned for reasons either stupid or unkown but im guessing not all the stories are true.Another crappy issue is the playerzone the area it makes you all go to is a great idea done rubbish it can make you run all game not having time to stop and if you encounter others you have to fight then it catches up but they made it faster than you can sprint so your doomed either way oh and they just tried to fix how people hate the blue by making it kill you quicker why not just make it not possible to shoot in the blue and slow it down a little but no they barley listen to the community and just fix the odd bit so they can keep taking money.On a plus the game can be serious fun when you get in a game with your mates or decent randoms and none of the bullcrap happenes its good even if you come in a crap place you still want more.Sadly its all spoiled by the little negatives that take away the positives and the devs seem more concerend with supporting youtubers and steamers and showing off than actually making the game fun for everybody and lastly personal attacks by the many toxic fanboys hides the games actually pretty decent community.I really hope they fix all the issues because it really is fun with friends.I would have rated the game neatral but without that option its going to be a positve.

review: Simply put the game isnt optimized at all and nothing has any sort of fine touches to it. Movement feels like your character is carrying 400 pounds of radishes in a wicker basket on his head. He has to slow down gradualy think Arma 2 but worse in every possible way. There are micro stutters everywhere and im on low settings on a 970 at 1080P. Sluggish not sure how to describe it its not the gameplay itself thats slow it just feels slow. Connection wise the game is lack luster in that as well people teleport and studder all throughout the map even if you have a good ping. I honestally didnt want to get the game at first because all the gameplay i saw of it was well bad and seemed not very well optimized. I was unfortunetaly correct. I honetally would just say to wait either untill the developer finally addresses the elaphant in the room and fixes this rather than releasing CSGO style cases and keys that you have to pay for. Not impressed in the slightest with this game or the developer.3/10 Would complain again.

IT'S ALPHACODE WITH "FULL RELEASE" LABLE!!!! PubG Corp has ZERO interest in fixing ANY game bugs or performance issues. They only care about selling more lootbox keys. MORE COSMETICS. On all 3 maps 90% of your games you either spend first 15 20 min trying to find a weapon or dive in a hot zone to fight for 1 pistol between 20 players. Game is getting worse and worse with every patch and all that is getting fixed every time is doors. Honestpy. Not a single gamebreaking bug fix but there was 7 8 door bug fixes. There are not enought weapons on a map. That's why in first 2 min of the game up to 70% of players die. No weapons crashes and freezes no vehicles to traverse distances extreamly poor hit registration cheaters in every single game and many many more gamebreaking problems.Trust me. review: I enjoy playing this game and have nearly 700 hours playtime. It is fun challenging and very competitive. BUT...1) They charge money to unlock challenges. I honestly don't know what they were thinking here. 2) Certain vanity items you unlock are on a timer and expire so you can no longer wear them after 30 days. WTF?3) Most chests you get require a $2.50 key to unlock where you get an ugly useless item.4) If you get a chest that does not require a key you still get ugly useless items.5) They don't care about NA players. Maintenance is always during prime time NA hours (9pm EST)6) Hackers love this game.7) Desync is a major issue when trying to shoot someone and trying to avoid being shot.I enjoy this game and it is fun to play with other people. I will even still continue to play it but I can't recommend it to a new player because it is so unrewarding and they ask for more money at every turn.

review: Battle Royale games have potential PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds has potential. From buying this game to playing it I haven't stopped playing it since. I always have that need to play games like this. But of course this is a review and reviews need to be compiled of constructive criticism. Korean developers Bluehole have done a good job of simulating a different unique type of game combining forms of group tactical play to the fast paced get out and survive thrill.The mechanics of shortening safe zones really does give off a tense vibe and I can see it was designed for that but also to stop campers! These mechanics of shortening safe zones has become the heart of PUBG and is what makes the game function. Dropping from the plane descending from the air and scouting out your drop zone makes you feel more in control of your surroundings and gives that extra feel of relief to find that SKS on the floor or a level 3 helmet. Playing within your own group of friends really does make the game more exciting and satisfying. Without taking it seriously we can run on the fields near butt naked one with his afro bouncing around like a rabbit on heroin. The tense feeling being held up in a building with your friends hearing a jeep or a bike louring near you really can give you some sense of fear or even the unknown footsteps that grow nearer and nearer to which could be your imminent end.All of these moments experienced is what makes a good game succeed. But of course the time to be critical is now.Never mind my over zealous descriptions of this game as with any 'Early Access' game problems will arise bugs will be found and unfairness will exist. Now i quote 'Early Access' for a reason from my experience i haven't come across major issues in conjunction to bugs or unfairness. The game has been incredibly smooth with hardly any issues now of course that can be down to my mad setup that i run on however it is very difficult to maintain a smooth experience when releasing games under the Early Access banner. And for that i do applause Bluehole Inc.The one thing that frustrates me more is paying for cosmetics. Saving money to buy the game and attempting to reach top 10 out of 100 is hard enough. Of course you may just say they're cosmetics however cosmetics that give some form of camouflage within the map can lead to an advantage over others. I've always disliked the 'Pay to Win' marketing strategies that nearly all major game developers force in our faces. I'd feel happier to pay a Monthly Fee if everything i get within the game is available to me. Content is important and limiting content for customers will always shed a bigger negative impact within the gaming community and it's something that needs to be considered and thought about regularly. If what Chris Roberts does with Star Citizen succeeds you can rest assure that many gaming companies like Bluehole Inc will go bust. It's important to develop in the eyes of a consumer rather than develop in the eyes of a developer!On the topic of cosmetics I can roam the world and find Gas masks and Protective goggles. Now I admit on the cosmetic side they look pretty bad however if certain clothing like Gas masks and protective goggles are to be shown within the game they should present more meaning rather than 'look cool'. I'd want to be able to defend myself from flash bangs with protective goggles or if poisonous gases were added defend myself using a gas mask. This would ensure a more tactical and survival thrill to when you hit that top 5 in a Squad.Overall I have to say despite some negatives the game itself as an 'Early Access' game has proven to deliver in the majority of it's goals. The tense combat and tactical elements Bluehole Inc wanted to achieve have been achieved the Safe Zone and Dead Zone features is what adds brings the game together alongside anticipating your perfect Skydive for the best tools to do the job. If BlueHole continue to deliver an exhilarating and fun experience to PUBG then i will be excited to see what the finished and continued updates this product has to deliver.

Bluehole Get your things done you're talking about weekly/monthly updates and the only things you patch are little things which you sell like a praised gift of game development. I'm playing this trash game since the BETA and the whole thing's going in a wrong direction. You had the opportunity to create a world wide known competitive game and already 7months after publishing the game on Steam the whole world is laughing about your product. If you're only in business for the money you should know that a working competitive game would bring you way more profit on a longer timeline than a highly sold game in the beginning.And last but not least don't forget that your game will be a one hit wonder and more projects won't bring you those amounts of orders. PLAYERUNKNOWN Sellout!RIP Bluehole Inc.

review: PUBG is stale. The developers focus more time and effort on ways to monetize the game rather than produce solid updates and optimization. The whole new map and $10 Event pass was nail in the coffin for me. There are still too many bugs performance/network issues hackers and cheaters. There are however plenty of paid crates for you to choose from and you will probably get a worthless white shirt. PUBG was fun and exciting at first even with the bugs I had a lot of fun. Development since its 'official release' has been painfully slow and inadequate in order to keep the larger player base interested. I got my $30 worth with this game I feel good about that. However given its progress since I started playing in June 2017 I would advise you to save your money and give it to a developer who won't try to bleed its player base for every dollar they can think of.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I don't know why there is so much hate for this game... I know that it sucks to pay a bunch of money for a couple of pixels on the screen (skins etc.) I think it's about the experience with the people u play with as a squad and the skill that you build up to get that first chicken dinner. I think it is not a pay to play but a game that gives everyone a chance to win based on skill not loot or skins... I give this game a 5 out of 5 no matter what due to the many fun and frushtrating times I've had online. Either way this game gave me memories that I will never forget it is the only game that stands out for me in my giant steam library. I reccommend rethinking posting the bad reveiws and enjoy the gameplay... )

If you are thinking about getting it don't.Update after 500 hours playing the game Pubg has made every other game I play feel more responsive. title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: To those of you who have refunded the game or simply uninstalled because it ran like trash I suggest getting it again and giving it another shot. Ever since full release the game has been optimized to a degree so that low end pc's like mine can run it properly. You still have a few bugs and glitches sometimes it still dosn't load but it is super rare now. The game still feels kinda early access having only 2 maps and you cant even pick which one you want to play but the gameplay is and always has been great. Game is as balanced as an rng sh*tshow can get and with friends it can be a huge blast and even solo this game is great. Not the best game ever but it is the best battle royal game to date imo.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. Its a good game. I enjoy playing it. Guns feel great to use and actually take time kinda getting used to. It is these things that drag the general experience down. Limb penetration is non existant and I have died many times to opponents blocking shots fired from my point blank shotgun blast with their arms. I feel hit reg could do with some tweaking The game still doesn't run as well as it could (low FPS) The game is poorly coded and there are some interesting *things* that do occur because of this There is a hacker problem (apparently? I don't see them that often)Even though the game faces these many issues I still enjoy the game a lot. I do not believe that Bluehole/PUGB corp will just abondon their game after all the money they have made Instead I believe that they will eventally fix these issues in the coming months/years/decades/centuries.Thank you for taking the time to read my review

review: This game is a reminder to everyone of the potential that battle royale had in the early 2018. When it was on Beta everyone lost their minds over how potent and exhilarating the game was.When it was released the realism of the game mixed with its glitches provided surreal and decent experience.But now after a year and a half despite the fame and the popularity the game never really changed. The bugs are still ever so present.This is just my opinion but I think this game doesn't know what it wants to be. It has grounded game mechanics and movements/settings but the cosmetics are silly and so are the events. Tonal contradiction is prominent.Even the devlopers admit the fundemental flaw of the game. And season passes for temporary cosmetics on a paid game ? PUBG please....If you like battle royale then this is THE GAME for you. If you don't like battle royale still give it a try but you won't find it entertaining after couple of hours. If you are a casual gamer who wants to try battle royale try Black Ops 4 blackout instead (they have their own flaws tho)In conclusion its a meh.

review: For those of you who still haven't heard of this game (I know there can't be many of you). I want you to watch the most recent trailer and notice how no one is hitting anyone. Well that sums up this game entirely. People always talk about the loot boxes or the asset flip and NON of that matters. If a game is fun then it's fun. The loot boxes are cosmetic only and I don't see any issues there. However the gunplay in this game is horrible. I understand they were going for a more realistic feel but being someone who used to train people to shoot I can tell you that is not an accurate way to portray realism. You can have your crosshairs on a stationary target burst firing and still hit nothing. I have run into situations where I had a shotgun at point blank range miss and vise versa I have had people shooting at me with a shotgun two inches from me and I was able to kill them with an m16. The gunplay in this game feels inconsistent and clunky for a game that revolves around you killing other people. Fixing the gunplay would skyrocket this game to the top and keep it there.
