review: This game had so much potential early on. In early access there were A LOT of issues that we put up with as it was "Early access". Then Bluehole started milking the community for as much money as possible. They got it as players loved the game and thought they were investing in the game for the future. The money would be put back into the game we thought.Then came Mirimar a disaster of a map. This map pushed players away in their drogues. Bluehole still pushed for sales of crates and inventory items. Very little bugs were fixed and the hackers were a nuisance. There were hackers / exploiters in every games. Bluehole did not cure the hacker issue but instead milked the community for more money.On full release the game was a disaster. A game with more bugs than the opening scene from Starship troupers and more cheaters than a Nigerian car boot sale. They wanted money thats all they cared about. Not the community only money.Now Sanhok came along. A nice little map with a totally different game play and tactics from the other two. It gave thje community a boost and the players inevitably followed. Bluehole foreseen this and introduced the even pass. They gave us a month of gaming at an additional cost. The should have went to jail for that. Its robbery!Nearly 1500 hours later and my thoughts are Give us free stuff that we can keep use and trade. Fix the bugs hackers and sack the management of Bluehole. They are running the game into the ground. If a good company had developed this game it would be a world beater. Instead it will disapear into the oblivion of unplayed games as the one that could have been so much more.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: *edit 2* 7 27 18This game finally feels like a game to lose yourself in. The graphics are more clean the weapons more realistic and the combat doesn't drop to 10 fps. This game is fun and is a must buy for a steam collection. Hacking even in TPP does not seem as much an issue.*Edit*Region lock china or figure out how to stop their cheating because it is killng a fun game. If you are excited by the possibility of being shot in the head from 400 Meters out by a guy who doesnt aim then this is the game for you. TerribleHaving considered the promises of the developer and the ludacrous amount of money they have earned since this game has come out ( 30$ a game and at the least 4 million copies sold) nearly 120 million dollars... It does seem absurd that they would seek funding for a tournament they could readily put on themselves. If this company seeks to continue with a strong fan base in the future they should consider the ramifications of their new position and financial leverage understanding that it is possible for all that to be gone with a few poor decisions leading to a lost fan base and distrust of any future developments.

review: This game is slowly starting to fall down the crap hole tbh. It's been a while now and you still have an immense amount of desync. For a game that somewhat relies heavily on sound with each patch it just gets worse and worse. Getting rid of being able to switch regional servers was a moronic thing to do because sometimes your game would automically start on asian servers. It sucks because when people post things that actually need to be changed the devs just chuckle and say "they're bad they're just complaining." Feels. Bad. Man. You usually will have more migrains then fun if you play this game but if you can see past ALL of this yeah i like the game a lot. The gunplay is awesome movement is a little slow so it takes some time getting used to. All in all if you're willing to put in the time its fun ish.

review: I believe I have enough hours in to give a review so here it goes....Bugs I've found two issues. One is after a match I never go back to the main menu. It just hangs at the background and I have to End Task. The other is lagging out. I think the servers may be crashing out because in twos it happens to both of us. It starts lagging bad then kicks us out.Guns like everything so far but haven't had enough time to fully get a feel. Attachments are awesomeCars love all the vehicle spawns... easy to find and not OP.Loot Balance in KOTK I can loot 5 houses in the time I can loot one or two in PUBG. Sometimes I will go to 4 before I find a backpack and/or helmet. It would be nice if the loot was tweaked. I feel like KOTK is more geared around giving an advantage to who gets good stuff and PUBG is more geared to give advantage to those that are more tactical and cautious. I don't thing RNG has a place in this gameGameplay everything is smooth... I love it. Looting feels natural and weapons/attachments are cool. I get very bored mid game however. Everyone just goes in a building and hides. In two games I drove all over the circle twice and never seen anyone or got shot out. Eventually I seen a person in a window. They hid once I stopped. I've only made it to the end twice because I get bored and start rushing houses.I don't know how to solve my major complaint... I don't want any major rule changes... maybe some sort of incentive to get out and about but not necessarily any kind of penalty. I don't like penalizing a play style but it would be cool if there was a reason that made u want to get out.It's easy to say "don't go in houses mid game" but damn I get bored after sitting around a few minutes. Earlier I stopped in a car in the middle of the circle for about 3 minutes. Went and made a margarita and I was still alive. Any other game I would have died the second I stopped
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The only game in its genre I've actually really enjoyed.I've had a lot of experience with this kind of game typically not out of my own intrest in them but my best friend who has always been intrested in the concept. But my friend and I don't play games often anymore so he found it pretty crazy to hear I've been playing this game considering the amount of ing I've done over these types of games in the past. But out of all the the buggy clunky and menotinious games that do this concept and similar styles this game manages to be the least of all of those things. It's by no means a finished product by many standards but I still enjoy this game 10x more than any of the other one's before it Lets hope the developeres stick with this one and get all the moniez that this genre is fortold to hold.

review: The gameplay is pretty known for those who have played Battle Royale games such as H1Z1 or DayZ this game is better than these in terms of realism. The price of the game is worth it.I have played over 30 games where you have to wait for a match to start no one of them can compete with PUBG's matching algorithm it finds a match for you with up to 100 players within seconds and sometimes immediatly. The playerbase is pretty big and most of the times you get a nice random teammate with microphone.Lately there have been a tons of hackers/cheaters in game using aimbot and speedhacks which makes some matches hard to win or even impossible to play. Cheats are not something devs can fix in few minutes and i'm sure they're already working on patches to prevent people from using hacks. If you happen to get in a match without a hacker you'll have tons of fun.

One friend was not even able to open up the game and every time he tried his gaphic settings on his PC would act very strange and would require recalibrating or even a reset. review: I wanted to be funny but only politically incorrect jokes comes in my mind.It's a nicely balanced game full of bugs but from an early access game less than a year old it's totally forgivable. Unreal engine rapes your GPU just as you would expect the physics are a bit clunky but overall the user experience is pretty good. I can totally recommend this game it really worths that 30 bucks and with a couple of friends it can provide endless amount of fun. Oh and about the micro transactions I really don't understand the whining about it. Skins does not give you any advantages and I see no problem with the current situation where rich people can spend thousands of dollars for worthless clothes they will throw away anyway on the battlefield by accident or put on bulletproof vest on the top of them.P.S. About the bans I haven't got banned yet nor my friends so I don't have bad experience at this topic yet. I made accidental teamkills just like my friends but we don't report each other. We are not communists.

review: I am kind of getting addicted in this game. I like the feature like real style shooting scenario. Quick decision making u can use your own intelligence. Very informative about the bullet rounds guns cars etc. I like the natural way of shooting around. Controls are good. Graphics are pretty good. But I do not like the movement of the character. review: A game for people who dont mind loosing Player Unknown's Battlegrounds is an arena shooter in which up to 99 players scavenge for loot / weapons to fight in a massive map in order to be the last one standing. Modes include Solo Duo Squad And First Person only in all these 3 modes Solo is self explanitory Duo has you team up with another player or friend against others. Squad has you divided up into groups against others.Also you are able to customize your player with use of the community market and you can buy crates through a currency called Battle Points you can earn up to 20 to 200 BP per game depending where you place in death. All in all I recommend this game. Its pretty difficult but it is 100% for people who are patient with learning the ropes of the map and how to play.. If anyone is having trouble with fps.. Put every setting to low Play in windowed fullscreen and go to &gt Steam Library&gt PUBG&gt Properties&gt Set Launch Options&gt and put " high"

review: This game really has a lot to show for an Early Access.Although there are hints of validity in some of these negative comments I think this game is profoundly impressive for its current state. Honestly I think this game is impressive period regardless of it being an Early Access.The Graphics 8/10On ultra graphics PUBG is visually appealing. Not stunning but again its not a finished game. The character textures are sharp although the hair modeling could use some work. Weapon and item textures are perfect in my opinion and don't realistically call for much improvement. Environment textures and modeling are decent but could improve. +1 for FOV adjustment!The Gameplay 10/10Having never played a "Battle Royale" type shooter before I have to say I'm quite pleased with the experience that Playerunknown's Battlegrounds offers. Even if I die before making it to the top 10 I still can't deny that I was killed fairly. From the beginning of the game when all 100 players can jump from the plane at their own timing each player is faced with the same disadvantage as the rest. No weapons no armor no medical supplies... sometimes no clothing... a perfectly even playing field. Players only possess the tactical wherewithal they've trained themselves to have and the instincts to make good decisions. This at the end of the game is what sets the player apart. No matter what you do to win or lose a particular game you can always walk away with a laundry list of things to improve upon. This game provokes the use of tactical decision making like no other shooter I've ever played. Every move you make every direction you turn every weapon you equip will be the difference between chicken dinner and death.The Performance 6/10Speaking of laundry lists PUBG has one when it comes to improving this game's performance. I have a machine that can run this game and other games at ULTRA graphics and still maintain at least an average 60FPS. However even with a high speed hard wired ethernet connection and graphics at VERY LOW I still drop occasional frames during certain parts of the game. (Especially the matchmaking island before the game starts and right after touch down when the game is loading up all its assets for the first time that session). For the most part the performance I experience during main gameplay is reasonably good. I'll still drop frames every once in a while and sometimes even right at the cusp of a fire fight depriving me of that glorious Chicken Dinner. Just remember this game is early access and can't be expected to perform like a AAA Title. For an early access game the performance is actually really good considering everything that's going on in game.OVERALL 8/10 GAMEcHInA nUmbR OnE!1!

review: Update 26.07.2018 (recommended)I kinda don't know how to start this...After I've reinstalled Pubg the graphics settings have been preset to high/ultra (in 1080p) and I haven't experienced low Fps while in game. The new map Sanhok (which I already played on the experimental servers) is nice and feels good to play on. Even though the map is four times smaller in size the map felt well balanced and I didn't felt like I'm being overrun by thousands and thousands of players.But there's still that one thing that bothers me a lot the selection of the maps. On the one hand I really like playing on Erangel but on the other hand I 'hate' Miramar and I was satisfied with the map selection field which was available for a limited time. This field was replaced and now I'm only able to decide between Erangel/Miramar or Sanhok and that's the only reason I'm only playing Sanhok for now. Please add this ing option.Reshade is still being blocked by the Anti Cheat and Nvidia Freestyle isn't working for me.++ fps gain+ New map (Sanhok) map selection Reshade still being blocked185h/ bought 10.07.2017i7 6700k at 4.3ghz/ gtx 1060 6gb/ 16gb ddr4 2133Older Update 30.03.2018 (Not recommended) The new "Anti Cheat" is now blocking Reshade what causes the game to look ugly af. I'm disappointed.Update 24.11.2017 (Not recommended)+The new test servers look great with the new vaulting.original Review 02.11.2017 (Not recommended)I kinda like the game but I can t fully understand what the developers are doin'...Instead of optimizing the game they are banning stream snipers and introducing microtransactions... I think it s ridiculous that they are banning stream snipers bc every streamer could just use a bigger delay and it s not acceptable that livestreamers get prioritized. They even promised they wouldn t introduce microtransactions while being in early access but they still done it.+I never had any problems with cheaters/hackers in my 110h of playtime. (Eu servers)

PUBG is a game that i have been playing for a few months now and i would have to say that i do recomend this game. they have very much improved on the optimization and server lag and they have fixed the scopes as well. the game will be worth your 30 bucks if you like games that are fun with friends involve tactics and games that are quite big. they have also improved on the pacing of the game from the past few months with the circle timings and what not so i think that we have seen a lot of improvments since the launch of the game and after seeing the dev roadmap for 2018. i am very excited for all of the upcoming content of the game. also fortnite is EDIT ive played the new map and i think that it is really great if you havent already pickup the game
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: At 26.99 for an Early Access game for what you get it is in my opinion not really worth it. In saying that I have had my moneys worth in hours of game play. However since I have been playing I have not seen any improvement in game play optimisation or quality. Desync plauges this game You'll move behind a tree and a second or two later you'll be dead from bullets that hit you earlier this becomes frustrating very quickly. Optimisation is poor at present granted this is an early access game so this is to be expected however as I have said no improvements have been made yet to this that have had any benefit to my gameplay. I average around 40 50fps playing this. I'm sure optimisation will come eventually but make this consideration when deciding to buy.The main tactic in this game is loot at the begining of the game and try stay clear of any conflict grab a car get to the centre of the incoming circle or roughly estimate where it will be camp until the very last stages of the game and then have a shoot out or whatever else comes of it. Once in a building and you're fully looted up just sit in a corner with a gun when someone comes simply shoot. The game will obviously develop however they're also putting focus on xbox version now so maybe some of the PC resources will go to them and PC development drop off?Overall in its current state I wouldn't recommend it the game has been fueled by streamer and youtuber hype which is the only reasons it has become so popular. Early access titles are always a risk especially at such a high price which this game is. You'll be more frustrated playing this game more than you will enjoy it in my opinion. Maybe by December it'll be worth it but to be honest keep a watch out for updates to optimisation when you see big optimisation updates and fixing of server/dsync issues then go ahead and purchase as I'm sure the fun will outweigh the issues eventually.Update 26/07/2018 8 Months on has anything changed. No game is still terrible. There have been some improvements to optimisation. It is now easy to achieve 60FPS although the game does not feel smooth. Everything else pretty much remains the same. Death cam is useless as it shows a different representation to what you as the player actually saw and did. A game with so much potential so it is a shame to see it still be so poor.

review: Being a pure online competitive gamer this game is almost exactly what I have been wanting. So after more optimization I am sure this game will run well on lower ends computers.....Cant wait to see where this game goes.

review: Product received for free. PUBG is hands down one of the most fun games you can play today. I wrote a small list of pros and cons that will hopefully help out those deciding whether or not to buy this game. ______________________________________________________________ Pros Strategic gameplay that creates interesting skill gaps but nothing new players cant go up against. Satisfying learning dynamic. Huge map that puts you in different situations each game. Wide variety of guns to choose from. Great character customization through crate drops bought with in game credit system. Cons Somewhat poor optimization (but updates are released weekly to fix that!) You can't shoot through water which makes players who are swimming invincible. The Super Man style punching is overpowered and is a one hit kill. (Although in some ways it's understandable. It gives players without a gun a fighting chance against those that do).______________________________________________________________Keep in mind that PUBG is an early access game and isn't perfect. You will run into odd bugs every now and then and you will find some mechanics to work against you every now and then (I'm looking at you jumping over small walls!). The devs are amazing and listen to the community on such an admirable level. The gunplay is pretty great and definitely something that will take getting used to if you arent accustomed to bullet travel/drop. This creates a really fun learning dynamic that keeps you coming back to the game as well as the extreme satisfaction from eliminating up to 100 other players and being the last man standing ultimately winning a nice Chicken Dinner.

review: Despite the recent influx of negative commentary centered around banned players and microtransactions I will still argue that this is one of the most enjoyable games I've played in a very long time. I can think of few other games where every kill (or every encounter for that matter) feels so rewarding. Would I like to see more content/maps/weapons/bug fixes? Absolutely. More variety would give PUBG some serious staying power in a world flooded with survival crafting clones and AAA first person shooters. As it stands it is still an absolute blast though and I do hope that the future of this game isn't muddled by pay to win content and developer abandonment. Until then I will still strongly recommend PUBG to anyone without a heart condition.

review: Let me start out by saying this is a fun game and has really great potential if they fix a few problems. 1st off the constant loading error where it just stays on the loading screen you can hear all of the sounds and everything but it never leaves the loading screen so you have to exit the game and you are forced to sit through another lobby hoping it works. Sometimes the buildings dont load for 5 minutes or so and you pretty much just have to run around until they do. Also there are tons of invisible rocks that you either get glitched into and take fall damage or you run into them with your vehicle and take damage. There is a horrible loop that needs to be fixed with the airdrops. Me and a buddy were playing and we were both going up the stairs we somehow managed to get stuck on each other and it just showed the animation of constantly falling until we both were knocked out from the fall. I feel like instead of working on releasing some new content so soon they need to fix some of these problems. That being said it is a very addicting game and a good time killer and will be very good if they fix those few things.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is excellent. If you liked King of the Kill you're gonna love Player Unknown's Battlegrounds. It's more of the same just better. Smoother graphics more realism overall. The game was a culmination of all the good ideas put together in a close to flawless attempt at good gameplay mechanics. This game is not for low end computers. You will not enjoy this game if your system can't handle it. Seems to be made for the pc enthusiast who's willing to shell out the bucks on a 1000+ system. If you have one you're gonna want this game. It's high anxiety the moment your feet hit the ground. Heart racing interactive and ridiculously thought out. The only thing that doesn't make it flawless is the inability to take hostages. Very well done.

review: I love this game.I was a H1Z1 player before I jumped on the PUBG train and the main problem I had with H1Z1 was the lack of anything but iron sights (aside from the sniper rifle) and the horrible weapon balancing. Never in my life have I won a game of H1Z1 the closest I've come was a 1v1 where I was gunned down instantly.However it's a different story in PUBG.I love the fact that you can find attachments during the game and mix and match them on your weapons especially because you can get suppressors for your guns.It feels a lot better to have anything from a red dot sight to a 15x scope instead of being forced to use iron sights only across long distances.To me the guns feel quite balanced right now.PUBG feels like anyone has a chance of winning mainly because it comes down to luck with looting and safezone placement but also requires basic gun skill and good judgement. You could hide for most of the game and still end up within the top 10.Not only is the gameplay decent but this game is semi playable on terrible hardware. Before I bought a gaming desktop I used to game on a 5 year old Dell laptop. When I played PUBG on the lowest settings (Which looks decent for low) I was still about to pull about 40+ FPS on a Geforce 840m 1GB with 8GB of RAM and a pretty terrible CPU. I did have trouble with buildings loading in slowly and I'm pretty sure I cut that laptop's lifetime down by playing the game but it was playable and it's where I got my first squad win (On the day I bought the game).Overall I've had a lot of positive experiences in this game but I've also had experiences where my friend thinks it's hilarious to smack me with a pan it usually ends with him on the ground at the end of my gun or with me having to use a first aid kit but I'd do it all again because we get some great laughs out of our misadventures and a lot of funny/crazy stories that we recount.

review: Guys....i'm sorry....i have H1Z1 KOTH played it a few times didn't like it so mush saw this game HYPED AF for it because i like the idea of King of the Hill Survival thing decided to buy the game.......What i didn't like laggy gameplay picking up items opening doors un/crouch gun play shooting aiming reloading changing weapons it turned the game off for me the gun play is rage inducing aiming has a very subltle acceleration and deceleration that is super stupidWhat i LIKE about this game graphics i know that some ppl have issues but man the game looks great cant wait for optimization updates fast MM and loading never had a issue with them normal imo love the customization reward system i like that u can get a feel for the guns when u are in "lobby" areaConclusion i am subjective ofc but i do try to be as correct as i can i REFUNDED the game i had to decide if i was goona try and get good with the gun play and all the delay that there is in it unfortunately in 88 minutes u can't do that i really tried and tried and tried i was so dissapointed maybe its me and i play bad but for me the price tag does not reflect the quality the game is in.Tips (if by chance some dev reads it) appart from all optimizations that all the people are making in comments and UI improvements and all that please make the game play lag free (pick in item fast not after 0.5 sec your character starts to pick it up after you pressed the button) and please repair the gun play make it more arcade (Rainbow Siege) style and without that stupid mouse acceleration and like that MAKE IT EASY TO PLAY BUT HARD TO MASTER.Thank You.P.S will (re)buy on sale just to support and maybe get lucky and things change

review: I like this game but the company cares more about adding loot crates to get people spending more money (after they already paid for the game) than actually fixing things. I have a very good PC setup and can run this game at 144 FPS capped with a mix of Ultra and Low settings but it crashes quite often since the last patch there are issues with ping when Asian players are in the NA servers and it has a ton of glitches that they fail to fix such as how buggy the parachutes are. Also since the last patch I have once teleported from one side of the map to another. It was on the map Myanmar and I teleported from close to Impala all the way to Prison after I landed. Overall I'd give this game a 6.5/10 potential to be a really good game and I still enjoy it but they need to clean up their act and fix the issues the community is talking about.Edit I've since stopped playing the game due to ongoing bugs and terrible optimization almost completely ruining the game and experience.

review: Product received for free. I've followed PUBG since the very beginning. This game could have been the next TOP hit in the gaming industry. It all went downhill with the lack of optimization updates and the many hackers each match has. It seems the devs only want to take the money and throw the game and their supporters away. They don't seem to be working on fixing the many bugs the game has or getting rid of the hackers at all. The competion (Fortnite) has been doing an amazing job on keeping hackers away from the game and are frequently updating the game with new stuff to try. Take it from a guy who has 400+ hrs on record I used to hate Fortnite and loved PUBG but I realized who was doing the better job. Hope the devs make something about it. I still have some hope.

review: EDIT2 It's a fun game once you get use to the way it plays.Game breaking issues Memory leaks causing the game to crash at any given time (i5 12GB RAM GTX 970) Rubber banding making your character teleport on foot and on vehicles this causes some serious mindf ck in first person jerks the camera in random positions too.What more to say about this? They are trying hard to keep up with demand but it doesn't seem their willing to expand their team to handle the strain. Graphical issues such as lighting render distance grass and textures are just hard to look at. Vehicles feel like the map turns into a treadmil and the vehicles just stay in place while the map rolls under them very stiff controls and the cars glide on rough terrain as if it's an ice ring. There's a specific moment when you start the game and everyone is loading in a SOUND BUG that literally earrapes you unless you take off your headset completely. The sound of every gun shot and explosion just loops into an infinite static this has been around since launch and they couldnt give 2 f ucks to fix it yet even though its the most annoying thing in the game!! &gt &lt ! Voice chats Unless you're on steam chat with your buddies dont bother with the in game chat. THE MAIN MENU &gt &lt ! The Main menu UI and the Matching Lobby are so badly done For some reason its a MUST to download the Main menu textures and UI EVERY. F#CKING. TIME At the end of every match its like the game restarts from the developer logo cutscenes its annoying just dont!Good things about the game It can be fun with a friend or two. Guns and combat is actually fun atleast they have that going for them. Attachments and obtainable items are pretty cool and work well.What it still needs A better incentive to keep playing maybe a level system that allows you to drop faster to the ground at start run faster or even hold your breath longer while aiming. Gathering points to open an RNG crate that gives you randomly colored clothing is just flat out ret rded i'd like to know who thought that was a good idea. 2006 called they want their graphics back. Seriously the "High" settings are a joke it still looks like everything was made from Lamberts phongs and blinns with 100% glossiness and reflectivity get your updated please. Better main menu. Vehicles feel like their flying on ground add bobbing to them ffs. day / night time cycles (i've played almost 8 hours and its only been day time unless there is night time but ive never seen it) Attack dogs let players send out their dog to scout. traps A better incentive then airdrops a supply truck that leaves point A and gets to point B in the process you can try loot it on the move. BETTER OPTIMIZATION. Forget the rest and fix your servers and game client then do other things.EDIT Servers have been improvedRubber banding seems to happen a lot less

review: yes it has it's annoyances like any game but it is funny to play and provided me hundreds of hours of entertainment. the devs also continually update things i have been playing since early access release and the game is much better now than it was before.RE the performance issuesI played it on a couple of PCs first of my laptop Dell XPS15 on a GTX1050.Ran fine aside from some thermal management issues once under volted CPU and got consistent 40 50FPS at 88 screen scale 1080 high AA medium textures low shdows high view distanceOn a new built GTX1060 PC Intel i5 8400 8gb ram on ultra everything aside from shadows and averages over 100fpsI get maybe one or two crashes per week and I average around 40 hours of gameplay per week.Decent updates it's honestly a decent game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Worst gaming experience I've had in a very long time. This game suffers from so many issues that it is not worth playing. Too many hackers too much server lag too many glitches. Two small maps with the same dozen copy&amp pasted buildings not comparable to something like the maps from Arma 2 OA. Inbuild VPN for no good reason you can choose the servers you want to play on. No region or ping lock. Way too much RNG in form of bad loot and zone luck. The sound engine is trash. Quality and intensity of the sound fluctuates way too much. Sound sources are sometimes off their actual positions by several meters Definitely not something I can tolerate in a game where I fully need to rely on my ears to find out where exactly the enemy is.shiny shiny graphics but i would so much rather play arma 2 again. too bad that it's practically dead since 2014 and the successor doesn't live up to the expectations.Update 31.03.2018 This game is still a ing joke. Despite having a good computer by modern standards the game laggs for no apparent reason when someone nearby starts shooting. Half of my shots that hit the enemy don't get registered blood sprays all over the place but no damage is dealt. Motorcycles are death traps which put you into the matrix before you fall of and hit the ground at 100 km/h on flat surfaces. More than the half of my deaths can be assigned to bugs glitches and a ton of cheaters. The aimbots and no recoil mods are so ing obvious in the deathcam. Sometimes the cam doesn't load due to 'unusual movements which have been detected' as you try to review the footage.Oh and I should mention that I need 20 30 shots fired from the AK47 or M416 to knock out and kill a player from a distance less than 5 meters. This is in the full auto mod and 80% of the bullets hitting. yeah no that's t especially when considering that at least 5 of those shots go straight into the head. Meanwhile the cheaters can kill me with their Kar98k with a heatshot through a level 3 helmet. This game is rigged as hell.Instead of addressing the real issues with the game awful hitscan due to clientside detection inbuild VPN allowing chinese cheaters to join wherever they please cheats in general unbearable server lag making bullet leading next to impossible predetermined safe zones no map selection broken vehicle physics and tons of other stuff I'm too lazy to list they keep adding game mods items a new map and now also weapon skins similar to the stuff known from CS GO. Nothing of real value is done the developers are only on their mission to get as much money out of this crap as possible.Update 20 minutes later After reading a few reviews I can safely say that this simply isn't worth my time. I played 11 games today blatantly obvious cheaters killed me at least 4 times. We won a single game as a 4 men squad. This game isn't fun it's only addictive and something I thought was great to play with my friends as everyone had bought it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The premise of this game is excellent. The execution unfortunately is terrible. Between the lack of optimization the buggy shooting and the hackers I feel as though I have completely wasted my time in this game.After 324.4 hours in this game I am uninstalling. I guess I got my money's worth but I feel sorely short changed after my experience over the past 150 hours. The developers of this game do not know what they are doing. Developing a working bypass cannot be as difficult as they are making it out to be. Millions of people are playing this game which means Bluehole has enormous revenues more than they know what to do with clearly.This evening I queued into duos 8 times with a friend and save for the two games in which we died almost immediately we were killed by hackers each time. Bluehole cannot detect speed hacking they cannot find work arounds for ESP and they certainly can't create a bypass that can stop aim hacks. this game.

review: It's a really fun game especially with friends. This is the game that you will get hooked on 100%. There are some bugs where you don't see your friends who are online in the game this makes it hard to actually get into a lobby with teammates. In addition there are some unfortunate areas in the new map where your car just randomly flips. This happens rarily in the first map but my friend and I randomly flipped on our motorcycle and the bike actually landed on us and killed us. This doesn't happen that often though as long as you drive properly. I give this game a 8/10. 2 points because of the bugs lobby making and the fact that you mainly play on the new map. Note that this is the first day of the game's actual release though.

review: WELL AIN'T THIS A PIECE OF CRAP. Yesterday i was playing this game then suddenly it crashed and it says unauthorized steam? When i already bought this game a couple of months back and most of everytime i restart the game and play it it says i'm already in the game like wtf dude seriously? I thought backing up the game to steam and unistalling it to reinstall it only to come up with a piece of thing the devs just did. After getting to the last point of restore backup game file i come up with an error saying i can't continue the update since its content lock and there is this "WindowsnoEditor.apk" that won't allow me too. Like are you serious? Because of a crash i cant play the game now because it thinks im illegally playing the game? WTF bring me my money back dude i'm already bad at the game and just play for the and giggle by playing hide and seek with the enemies and i cant do that anymore? THIS GAME ALREADY SUFFERS FROM GUN RECOIL Apparently using the the uzi gives you perfect shot to your enemy from like close to lets say accross the road with like zero gun vertical recoil than an assault rifle with complete set of attachment to increase weapon stability. It even shows that the m4a1 has better recoil management than uzi but the uzi has perfect recoil than an assault rifle with grips and Trust me an uzi is suppose to have the iest recoil manage management than an assault rifle in full spray with complete recoil reduction attachments. Well guess its time to say goodbye to it anyway I was just using it to gain money buy selling cheap crates in the steam market anyways. If you have this game and you love it i hope you dont come accross this bug cause it'll make it unplayable. I've tried to log out and log in again only to see that it says the game is running when its cleary not also if you think i've gave free access of my account to other users then i'll tell you that i dont because that risks my account not being returned to me 2nd restarting the computer doesnt fix the issue with the steam getting this bug where it thinks im in the game when i'm not it doesnt show in the steam that i'm playing it but when i click the game and get to the main screen it says "unauthorized access to steam" which clearly thinks my account is in the game and log in and thinks that a 2nd computer is trying to log in to the game and the steam then gives unauthorization to it which results to the situation i am in it's not something that i can fix with reinstalling steam or the game since its a server bs or steam bs either its not something a user can fix. 3rd reinstalling the game will result with you being unable to completely install it because of this data inside the game files which doesnt allow the game to be edited which means its a data for stopping editing of the game which has a connection to cheating i assure i've never done cheating on any games connected to online gameplay because getting banned in a game i payed is really as it means i just wasted my money for something stupid. It results in content lock since the bug of the steam/pubg server thinking im in the game when i'm not results in me not being able to install/play the game. If it gets fixed then thats nice but if itsn't then i guess im not returning to a game or community that doesn't see me as a relevent person though if i was a person who advertise the game lets say shroud then it gives high chance of this situation getting an attention but i guess not. Well bye anyways i probably look like a toxic player cheater or some person who just wants to complain but i assure you i'm not the toxic player and cheater but i did complain in this review My main purpose though is to let everyone know of this new issue that has just arised and hope noone ends up in the same situation as i do.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I constantly change my review as the game evolves to match the current state of the game. As of now I still reccommend it because as it stands the past almost 800 hours of PUBG have been some of the best worst and most hilarious moments in gamin I have had with my friends and I wouldn't trade that for anything. The core game is still good old PUBG and if you want to experience this game like we have then it's best to dive right in and do just that.HOWEVER. Beyond good old PUBG this battle pass is trash the game is still buggy which is a good and bad thing (Good for the fun of the game) and although the hacking has been quelled the Chinese are still strung far and wide throughout the US servers. It's by far more common to find asians than americans on our own servers which is very aggravating when the community makes up 60% of the reason to play this game. The battlepass was a HUGE MISTAKE overall. You spend $10 so that you can stop playing good regular fun PUBG and instead do stupid chores like drive for hours on Miramar (The worst map it's a fact) and try and waste your time challenge running to pray that you can kill someone with your fists or wind up cheesing it with your friends. Thisi s NOT GAMEPLAY this is a CHORE. Don't do this again bluehole or I will totally lose interes t in playing like most all of my friends now have.

review: Don't get me wrong I've enjoyed most of my hours in this game playing with friends or even random squadmates is alot of fun. Unfortunately this game is still very buggy glitchy and filled with hackers which ruins the experience for me. I could overlook all of these things if I knew that the devs were genuinely working towards solutions for these problems. However that does not seem to be the case here. I absolutely one hundred percent will not support or recommend a game in which the developers continually push microtransactions or lootboxes or "event passes" or whatever you fancy instead of stabilizing the engine working out shoddy vehicle physics fixing microstutter lag and of course the icing on the cake the rampant hacking. I'm not confident that this will ever be resolved. I think the devs are going to milk this cashcow until she kills over. In summary PLEASE don't waste your money on this game. review: PUBG's premise (the battle royale game mode where a number of equally equipped players are dropped into an ever shrinking play zone and must scavange for resources weapons and the like) is ingenious in its entertainment potential. However no name developer Bunghole is... what? It's Bluehole? ...are you sure? Well I'll be you're right. As I was saying Bunghole's execution of Battle Royale is flawed beyond repair so as to attain the previously unattainable title that I've never once deemed upon any game before it in my 30+ years of gaming. And that is "The only game to be scored a 0/10". Congrats Bunghole you've earned it in spades.You're a warfare simulator and yet you couldn't program a hitbox (or the subsequent application of damage from it) if your life (or my digital life) depended on it. PUBG is consistently inconsistent in this regard. Flawless shots at point blank ranges or ones well within the area of effectiveness are constantly rendered as misses even on stationary targets yet the enemy is constantly able to acquire headshots on moving targets and completes 90% of their kills within the first 2 bullets each and every time.But if hitboxes aren't your thing (cause they sure aren't Bunghole's thing) what about the fact that here we are in 2018 and we have a game whose audio seems to only officially support 2.1. Audio I've taken you for granted never truly understanding your value as the other half of the coin in video games that looked great (which PUBG is not). But audio truly plays a pivotal role in determining enemy position and the geniuses at Bung spared no expense in supporting left and right channels just nothing more than that. I cannot count how many times I've just heard gunshots to the left or right and had to turn to attain additional information about front/rear only to be left in an audible hell where I cannot discern any useful information from the muddled sounds and take my hands off the controls out of pure frustration and fighting against the game more times than an enemy.To boot the UI and graphics are not localized well. "YOU died finally"? And the shills at Bunghole have made it painfully obvious that they're more interested in making content than fixing bugs. How do they reward players? With a 10% chance to earn a crate that ISN'T behind a paywall which has a 99.9% chance to drop duplicate useless cosmetics. Throw in the fact that service reliability is still alpha stage often having services go down for no apparent reason nor having a patched server environment at the ready whenever updates are pushed. You're often left without the ability to play the game for 1 4+ hours.And cheats. Wow. Even after tons of lip service from this no name no skilled developer they have done next to nothing (beyond providing false hope that they've done anything to put a dent in the online cheating) in fact PUBG is synonymous with cheating. To say it's rampant is an understatement. The deathcam (poorly) shows people track you through terrain and just snap the cursor to your head making all shots register as 1 hit kills. They can say they've banned X millions of players but there's always X million more cheats that their countermeasures are effectively missing. The game is on the way out they don't have the skill to take on dealing with this issue and the forever nickel and dimed community is the one paying for it.This all culminates in a game that I am ONLY playing because no other Co Op exists. But mark my words when even a subpar game comes out I will flush this turd of a game off my machine once and for all confident in the fact that "You don't have to make a quality product for it to be popular." Is PUBG popular? Absolutely. Heck PlayerUnknown cries like a baby each time someone talks about doing Battle Royale better (and that won't be hard giving how low the bar he set the mode). But is it quality? All different types of HELL. NO. This game is garbage and so are the devs who pander it.

review: The illusion of choice and lots of boredom.The game offers loads of weapons and items to find. There are many places to explore. You will quickly learn that most items and weapons are useless though. You will constantly visit the same areas because those places provide beat gear and you need best gear to have any chance of winning.The game ends up being repetitive and boring. Every game is the same. You can't play how you want to play. The bad weapons are so much worse than the few (maybe 4) good ones that you will completely ignore them. The player has no option to try going it with SMGs or one of the bad sniper rifles. You will die because the good weapons will kill you in as few as one shots or kill you much quicker than you can kill the enemy. Be prepared to pass up or drop supposedly uncommon weapons as they give you no chance at winning.Everything in the game screams developed and created by amateurs. It constantly crashes. The replay feature does not represent what just occurred. Hackers abound. Vehicles try to kill you and often succeed. "Loot" is poorly distributed around the map you can end up with two of the best weapons and no helmet or go through several buildings without finding any weapon.Only certain special streamers get private servers so prepare to play the same game over and over again. Sometimes you will play multiple consecutive games where the starting location and circles are the same. How fun!The game has improved since its release. It is still bad but in different ways.

review: A great game built off mods from ArmA 2.As a result it's clunky a bit awkward and somewhat unrefined though just like ArmA games it's still a blast and can definitely get the adrenaline pumping which is amazing for a video game.Landing right next to someone praying to RNJesus and trying to get a gun before they get one is always a thrill.Sadly not only is this game a bit awkward clunky and full of bugs (Version 1.0) it's overrun with cheaters.In the sense that there will be a cheater in each game and you'll probably die to a cheater at least 50 percent of the time. The inclusion of the Death Cam feature is welcome and really drives home how many cheaters there are which is really disheartening and as a result means I can't recommend this game.Before you purchase definitely keep this in mind and read forums to see if they have cleaned it up at all. Because despite all that it's really a good game.

review: I've played this game for more than a year now and it's my most played game on steam. This game gave me feelings and excitement in games that I've never yet experienced before in any other game! The rush of adrenalin when you get top 10 (especially your first few times) is just awesome!Although I play it most days still it's infuriating and has become just a money grab right now. Devs constant promises of fixing the servers and desync etc (or just completely ignoring it) has become too much for many. This game had such promise and to be honest still does if the devs work on the core issues rather than releasing new cosmetics and crates (that you need to pay for a key to open the crates in most cases!!). In summary Yes I've had some of my best gaming moments ever playing this game it is truly special experience. The game is well optimized in terms of FPS and smoothness compared to last year when it got a lot of (deserved) hate. But I cannot whole heatedly recommend it unless you have money to throw away. Not to mention the desync and server issues (dying behind a wall because your opponents still see you peeking etc.) Here's to hoping the devs can transform the game and restore it to it's former glory as there will never be another BR quite like this one.TLDR Buy it if you want a crazy adrenalin rush and have money to throw away but otherwise it's not worth the money in it's current state.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I used to say every update makes this game better but it doesn't anymore. It's just at the same point it has been for the last month only some gameplay changes but the game is not optimized at all.And now they are introducing more microtransactions battle passes crates you have to buy keys for and that's on top of the 30 price.They also removed proper map selection because some of the maps just didn't get picked enough. What a silly reason fix your game instead of removing a feature that confronts you with the hard truth.PUBG has been fun but it's become more stale every update. If you want to buy it now don't. Wait for some new games that'll do it better.So why am I still playing? It's the only game that scratches the itch I have.

review: I jump from a plane after chosing my landing spot. I find some gear and weapons enough to stop a small army. I exit my drop location...BLAM....head shot from across an open field by a Kar98. Game over. Aside from some frustrating moments this game is quite fun and addictive. Solo it only takes one second of losing focus to end your match. With friends you can storm a city and wipe out whole teams. Or die because 1 team mate needs their license revoked. Hours of fun never the same thing. A few bugs but what game doesn't have bugs. Worth the money? Moreso than H1Z1 or DayZ IMO.

review: Just buy it. Its in your cart RIGHT NOW! Buy the game and be happy with your new found human hunting skills. PUBG is a stright forward BR game. The idea is that you survive to be number 1 in a match. I made it to #2 yesterday but was killed in a amazingly stressfull fire fight ( Many new players will be slightly confused when they enter the match lobby. Its a great way to wait for the start of the game since you can run around and shoot people while they are in a queue. When the match starts you'll find your self in a flying c 130 with 100 other people waiting to parachute out. Once you've figured out where to jump out you'll get a nice view of the map and other players at 20 000 ft. Once you hit the ground you must find ANYthing that you think can help you win. How you play is up to you. Good luck out there!

review: At first I was kind of put off of this game because of the horrible optimization. But apparently it used to be worse so at least they're working on it. They also seem to actually want to finish the game and include more content which is refreshing for these types of early access games.If you enjoy semi realistic gunfights using strategy and patience looting and having to be constantly alert you'll like this game. Just make sure you don't have a potato GPU or CPU and make sure your power settings (in your Nvidia or AMD control panel) are set to maximum performance.And also use these launch options USEALLAVAILABLECORES MALLOC SYSTEMIf you don't want to deal with a little fiddling with settings to get the game running well or if you don't like frankly unfair odds against you in a game maybe wait until the game is finished or goes on sale. If you can handle those things you'll have a pretty great time.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: At first I hated this game the amount of t firefights I got into where I was just shot in the back or shot from someone I couldn't even see was ridiculous 9/10 fights I got into I didn't even get to fire a single shot back that is because third person makes the game extremely RNG and unfair. I counteracted this by playing the game with friends that way we would either spot the person shooting at us or if one of us got downed we could get eachother back up and actually have a chance at shooting back. I believe that if they added in a first person only gamemode not only would it make it much more fair and balanced but it would actually require you to have much more skill and the game would become much more competitive.Pros Fun game to play with friends Really intense at times Fun to just around in OR to be super competitive in whatever you feel like at the timeCons Parachuting to the ground at the start of the game is ing annoying No first person only gamemode Still a lot of bugs Eats up a LOT of RAM (uses over 8gb) Unoptimized (I get 50 100 FPS with a GTX1080 on max not good.) 9/10 fights are you just getting shot in the back or shot by someone you don't even seeOverall rating 7/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First off would totaly recomend this game. I was instantly hooked and round after round it keeps me coming back for more. I love the reward of getting a kill and the adrenalin that the game trips in you as you never know if you are the hunter or the hunted. I have to say though I hope that as they continue to develope the game they create some game modes that are longer rounds. I love the idea of the shrinking circle to move players together and to keep the rounds short but sometimes I really wish they had a game mode that was longer and not so rushed by the circle. All in all a great game and i am excited to see what else the devs bring to the table.

review: This might be a fun game to play with friends but on its own PUBG is literally one of the worst games I've played. I can't remember a game so full of bugs and glitches and random bullsh** happening. Seeing how this is a competitive multiplayer game it stands to reason that every player should enter the match without any (dis)advantages. Of course this isn't what usually happens. Here's some of the 'features' you should expect when playing this sad game Your parachute glitching out just 'hanging' there in mid air not letting you land long enough for someone to run by and finish you off. A piece of furniture not loading properly making you stuck or unable to move until someone else runs by... A vehicle glitching out throwing you out of your seat starting to flip like mad exploding or doing something similarly unpleasant. Hearing 'ghost' noises from time to time E.g. noises of people running by despite the fact there's no one there. Endless running In its core PUBG is a running/walking simulator. Expect to spend at least 3/4 of your game time walking/running around looking for loot/cover. Random game crashes 'Bad modules' have become the modus operandi in the business of PUBG. Cheaters The game has an insanely high amount of cheaters with just a million banned in January alone. Expect to run into them regularly. Conclusion The game is absolute cancer. If you're thinking of buying it think again.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Update as of 12/22/2017 The game has recieved significant improvements on launch. It is still definitely flawed and suffers from a myriad of issues but I believe it's stable enough to be worth the price regardless. I'm too burned out on the game to enjoy it at this point but if I was a brand new player I'm sure it'd be fun for at least a few weeks. Hopefully I'll be able to enjoy it again personally with future updates.Previous review below Yikes what a mess lmao. I've played a decent amount of this game and I will likely play it for many more hours purely because it is something easy to play with friends. But I cannot pretend this game is good or recommend it in its current state. The optimization is terrible and the game has become increasingly unstable and frustrating to play. I know this game is in early access and the devs were (understandably) not prepared for the number of people that ended up playing it but that doesn't change the fact that the game is just an absolute mess at the moment. The transparency from the devs also leaves much to be desired imo. I'd like this game to be good. I think in time it might be. But it is not currently. I'll update my review if that ever changes.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I wanted to leave a review on PUBG. This will be my first one but I just wanted to say if you enjoy FPS/TPS then you will enjoy this game. The survival aspect will get you feeling a little anxious at times but that's what will make you come back to play it. The community isn't terrible the 100 people wait at the start can be a little absurd due to the immaturity and racial callouts but none the less it's a game with quite an age range. The Devs take team killing serious which is nice ofc if it is only done on purpose. I've been killed in a squad for grabbing a sniper rifle and so on. The DEVS have done a great job at expanding the game thus far. When I first played it was nowhere near optimized ( yes still needs optimization). The game I can now play on higher settings with less lag which they've fixed the lag post parachute etc as well. Guns feel well balanced I have maybe ran into 1 2 people cheating and that's it. They have added guns vehicles and mized up vehicle spawns. They fixed crates etc as well. They are implementing better jump mechanics( before you couldn't jump over a fance etc) and adding vaulting adding sliding over cars and jumping out of windows (excited for) So needless to say if you like early access and although most really don't feel you should have to play to test a game and have people "fix it" when you notice everything that is wrong b/c DEVS may you..This is one game DEVS have proven they are working on it and doing well at listening to the community while mkaing a good name for themselves. 10/10. Although game is till being worked on I can only hope more positivity from the work DEVS have done. I am excited to see what customization you guys add since it's been lacking but I prefer what you've been doing game optimization etc then customization. Customization means nothing if the game blows. So keep it up thanks for the game!

review: Battlegrounds wastes no time putting you right in the middle of the action as up to 100 players join a server and pick their moment to jump out of a plane and parachute onto a large 8x8 km island. Even this first act is a critical decision and must be part of your strategy jumping early lets you hit the ground first giving you a jump on the competition but may also place you farther from the center of the arena where the fighting must inevitably funnel towards. Jumping late might give you some distance from other players giving you some early breathing room before entering the fray. Jumping right into the center especially in large cities where most players drop will place you right in the middle of the action. THAT'S WHAT I ING LIKE

review: Ok update as of 4 26. The latest patch massively is changing the game and it's a ton better now. NICE WORK BLUEHOLE! Also glad I can stay dedicated on Mirimar now instead of campity camp es sitting in grass and bushes in the old map. I will keep my old review below but the game is a lot better now guys. Thanks!________________________There was a 2 week period where the anti cheat patch was in effect and the game was AWESOME. Unfortunately every single N1GG3R cheater (any chinese or Twitch streamer names are guaranteed cheaters) will auto kill you. I only play FPP and the cheats are just as bad there as TPP but marginally better at least in FPP. NA region by the way. Once they rolled the anti cheat patch back to allow cheaters to re buy the game and make more money for themselves the game went back to its status. They definitely could of solved the cheater problems if they wanted to but that would lose them money from all those that re buy the game. 16% or more of the population cheats in this game that's insane considering it's not including all undetected cheaters and those that macro script cheat. Advice ADD RANDOM VERTICAL RECOIL. At least no recoil would disappear if auto spray was entirely random after shot 2 or 3. The guaranteed death AR spray will get you instantly with lvl 3 armor helm at long range. Even driving or behind walls from a split second peek they instant spam mini14 sks or any AR and you die. I kill maybe 1 or 2 every 100 times a car drives by (not talking about buggies or bikes here but trucks/buses/dacias) but hackers kill you instantly outright even in trucks or dacias at full speed while swerving. Damn shame because the content was reallly well done in this mirimar desert map was so much fun without hackers ruining it. Dead game. I gave it a few months but it is not improved. Fixes have to come before content. Anti cheat should be #1 but it's not and those that claim "it's not easy to stop cheats" are probably cheaters because it is easy to determine them. Over 1 million cheat bans in a month... That's insane... Better games on the way. Region lock might be coming and that wont save the situation. At least if they did that early on it would of alleviated most of the hackers out of american servers but they would lose income. Notice this folks once the new crates and skins (cosmetics you can purchase) hit the market they mention region locking. Once they replace the "re purchasers" (i.e. hackers who keep getting banned and return) then they MAY finally go after the hackers and I'll change my review. Money is understandable for motivation but ethics and quality should always come first. It's been a year no excuse for not exterminating most or all hacking. Worst I've seen in any game and I've been around gaming since the 80's. Beautiful game ruined by greed. If they at least re input the anti cheat patch they rolled back that would help quite a bit. Don't roll it back because you want to milk more money from cheaters. Those that complain either have awful computers and/or cheats and should not be allowed to play. NO EXCEPTIONS. Anyways better and grander BR style games are on the way and I won't be alone in dropping this game once they hit. It would be a dream to prosecute those that cheat and require gov ID to buy these kind of games but I doubt that will ever occur. Props to china gov for at least trying to combat hackers slightly. Fortnite has too many colors for me and I hate TPP (I'm very old). Hopefully I can change my review in the future but DO NOT BUY this game for the time being.

review: It is fun if you just don't give a fu ck about the following.Forget Stats and loot crates. Stats are usless because of the cheaters and loot crates with anything interesting is ultra rare. The idea of this game is get in get out fun and it is until... The Asian horde invades the NA server. The amount of hackers caught now exceeds 1.5 MILLION. It is sadly only a drop in the bucket because we see blatant and suspicious activity in 1 in 3 games now. ESP / Aimbot/ No recoil/ Healt generation / no armor damage cheats are the most common. Days or weeks later battleeye places a ban they buy another game for $5 to $15 and they are back online. Lag factors are still a thing ( bullet hit registration) and optimization is still far from optimal. It's fine if you want to lower all your settings and run in 1080. I run on a GTX 1080 at 2560 or 3840 res and well it averages about 42 to 62 frames. Details RNG damage that is Hackers new hacks each week blatant and not so blatant.BugsPoor optimizationTeaming Silly physics for vehiclesEvery updated causes server side connection issues.For a shooter it has some serious issue with players being able to actually connect bullets to each other. Serious Latency issues.Guns are only visually represented but not realistically correct ( recoil ballistics ammunition general function damage to target) and bent with a Dev hammer to fit a spot on the list.Sad thing is it seems to be vastly popular even though you can see all these things on players streams and or you tube on a daily basis. Popularity might be due to it is the only decent looking massive multiplayer shooter out there. Additionally it views well on twitch so viewers are entertained by consistant player action. Redeeming value is that you can opt out any time and walk away from it.Save your money until they fix this hot mess and then buy it. Or buy it now be aggrivated and un install. Wait 6 to 12 months and try it again.

review: Here's the deal with this game. It's great fun when you aren't fighting against people with 2000+ ping from china or people that hack the games weird third person coding. If you don't want to play with cheaters play in first person. PUBG Corp implement a ping limit so that if you have higher than 150 ping for longer than 2 minutes you get kicked from the game. I don't want to be at a disadvantage because some Chinese guy can't play on his own servers so he comes to ours. To all the people who say you need a god tier rig to play the game update your I have a gtx1060 and 16 gb of ram. I have an I5 core. I have some basic case. In total it's costed me 500$ over 4 years. If you are complaining about not being able to run the game buy new that isnt from 2012.

review: This game is dead to me loot crates lack of actual content the insane number of cheaters the lack of transparency with the community the shady company ethics that can be summed up with this (money &gt what players want) player unknown himself is now nothing more then a shill for anyone willing to throw money his way. the vague lawsuit threats the extreme butt hurt and the fact that player unknown has come out and called everyone essentially a racist for wanting to play with people that speak their own language is not only disgusting but so ignorant and short sighted that i believe steam should go as far as pulling this game entirely and forcing blue hole to offer refunds to players that have since quit because of this controversy. brendan greene has ruined his own game by ignoring the player base and milking gamers for their money. player unknown is nothing more than a hot pile of garbage and blue hole studio while maybe talented has enabled this by not addressing ANY of the concerns or issues that the player base has raised. Typical blue hole business practice "hey so when can we play with players in our own area? i really want a team i can understand and communicate with!" Blue hole "shut up you filthy racist also buy our lootbox keys and give us more money! oh and if you die from a cheater you can report them ingame now! this means we get to double dip by not only charging legit players for keys but now when we ban an account for cheating players can then buy a new copy and just continue to ruin the game for millions of players! thank you for you money and dont let the door hit you in the on the way out." TL DR this game is hot garbage and honestly i would rather play rust then play this game.

review: Switched to negative. They are adding a microtransaction system for cosmetics that offers no alternatives to earning items and costs $2.50 a pop for keys to gamble on crates for a piece of clothing which isn't even guaranteed to not be a duplicate.************************************************************************************************************************************Most of the bad reviews are about performance which is dumb considering this has already been acknowledged and addressed by the dev team and that optimizations will be a major focus while in EA. Secondly with a few config tweaks and startup options which you can find under the guides section for the game on Steam I went from it not really being very playable to getting a steady 60fps.A lot of these reviews are from people who have bought the game played 1 round died in a few minutes then exited left a bad review and refunded which means their negative reviews will not change even if all of their issues are solved in the next few weeks and I believe under Steam's upcoming review changes their reviews won't even count towards the game's score soon.Aside from that the game is really fun its quite steep at the price it is (I was expecting more around 20 than 26.99 and it is more expensive for the UK than most other places) but it has a lot of potential Pros Familiar controls Low time to kill for sniper rifles only the heaviest/rarest of head armor will protect against a single headshot headshots with assault rifles on unarmored targets seem to kill instantly Cool way of distributing players (Cargo plane with all 100 players flies in a straight line across part of the island players can jump out skydive and parachute at any point over the island) Plenty of loot every building has a whole bunch of loot spawns and you rarely aren't able to find any weapons and when you start to learn certain buildings have better or more spawns than others you start to strategize while still in the plane Vehicles aren't insanely rare but they aren't literally everywhere either Nice and easy to use UI inventory management isn't a nightmare and you have to spend very little time looking at the inventory screen overall Solo duo and squad queues for teamplay Queue time is usually 5s for games and had very few server issues means you can launch up and get into a game in less than a minute.Cons Serious performance issues (Which the dev claims are a big focus right now) Sound design could use some work it can often be very hard to tell the direction noises are coming from and there doesn't seem to be any kind of sound occlusion so even if you are deep inside a house you can hear footsteps outside as though they were right next to you. Quite expensive for a single gamemode game with limited content overall

review: Earlier review left at bottom for reference my opinion since writing the original review has since changed. Previously I found that the game was a cool concept hamstrung by a few obnoxious flaws but worth the half AAA game price for the time that you would get out of it.Unfortunately for me and for this game I feel that the devs have added to these issues instead of fixing them.I made 3 points in my original review1) when you get shot it is extremely difficult to figure out where the shots came from before you die (this has not been tweaked but is only personal preference)2)the game needed a killer POV deathcam (this has been added YAY 1/3)3) Team play offeres very little in the way of rewards (this has been made EXPONENTIALLY worse with the advent of the greediest loot box scheme I have ever seen more below)so as you can see one of my problems went almost unaddressed the most minor of my complaints (one not affecting rewards or gameplay) was fixed and the rewards system was gutted into the ground by the 1.0 patch.TO CLARIFYthe greedy loot box practice i am talking about is not the practice of the loot boxes themselves but the fact that loot boxes are now ONLY avalible through payment. the old system had loot boxes with (admittedly crappier) gear avalible to STICKER PRICE players which allowed them some level of customizability. Now the ONLY way to get loot boxes is to earn them in game THEN shell out $2.50 each for keys to open them no free option no nothing.In addition this game's cheating has gotten out of control. especially because region locking would simply fix the problem. At this point the cheaters are making enough money opening loot boxes that the expense of their accounts being banned can be easily written off as the cost of doing business we need better anti cheat on top of that they only allow players to report for snap aiming move speed hacks and other aimbots there is no option for HP hacking or other exploits.for these reasons my solid reccomendation is turned to a no go bring back free lootboxes and make the cheaters lives at least a bit harder and I will address this review again. Old review for the record I cant say much about this that everybody else has not the game is amazing with a couple caviats. it SERIOUSLY needs better indicators of where you have been shot from at least in single player. I would suggest a classic "blood splatter points in the direction you are shot from" system to accompany shot noises with things like flash hiders and suppressors making the indicator less clear.I would love to see a kill cam from the POV of the person who killed you at least in solos.Better rewards in team mode would also be great.

review: I love this game a ton. Some people REALLY want to play this but can't. I'm glad I found a way to...With my late 2013 iMac I'm able to play this game using Boot Camp &amp Windows 10. To get it to work smoothly I have to have game settings at 1280x720 fullscreen Windowed Everything on Very Low &amp I'm averaging 21 24 FPS. I know some people are over 60FPS &amp that would be epic but thats not happening on my iMac but I'm still happy I can finally play without buying a gaming PC.My only Complaint is after the parachute flight all the buildings take 1 4 min for them to fully load (The Tab trick doesn't work for me probably because I'm running into performance issues with Mac hardware) Once the buildings load it runs great but before they do its nothing but glitching lagging &amp me trying to do my best and gear up in the shell of buildings &amp invisible obsticals then being screwed once everything loads. At that point the energy feild usually takes me out before players do.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Fix the latencey issues PLEASE. Let players pick a server to join based on their individual pings like other online games do. Use an actual server lobby or whatever. If not then auto kick people from match servers when their ping is over 300ms. Its not fair for anyone when pings are so wack between players. I have 100MB internet and more than capable PC its not my hardware! Nothing more frustrating than shots that dont register on the player you are firing at. I mean point blank on full auto and no hit points at all? Next round my shots fired with an M16 and 4x scope pinpointed on a player standing still 50 meters away his body filled practically 1/2 my eyepiece and repeatedly firing single round pops and not a single shot hits? The latest update (09/14/2017) made latencey problems worse than ever game is now broken and nothing but frustratiung to play. FIX THE SERVER ISSUES BEFORE ADDING ANYTHING ELSE NEW PLEASE!!! Make the ping/latency as even as possible for everyone in the same game! This game is otherwise really fun when your shots actually register and servers arent lagging up.

review: The game was great at launch and then the massive cheater wave began. The problem is how the game is monetized on the steam market. Hackers just cheese the game so much and get so many points to buy massive amounts of crates. Then they sell the rare loot on the crates on the steam market and just buy a new key. The currency system can remain but it needs to be de monitized. In addition people just mask their IPS/use VPN/etc and just change their IPs so the bans are never permanent (because again they just buy new keys). I've seen speed hacks wall hacks aimbots instant 1 shot through level three helmet with a pistol and to be honest the game is almost unplayable now because of it. I avoid PC shooters for this very reason. Perhaps when it comes to Xbox it won't be as riddled with problems but PUBG needs to get this under control because until it does I'm telling all my buddies STAY AWAY FROM THIS GAME.

review: PUBG is one of the biggest games in 2017. This game is very fun and you can play it with your friends. You can do anything in the map go to big cities kill people drive vehicles loot and much more. BUT THERE IS ONE IMPORTANT THINGthis game is hard to learn. What I mean by that is this game is not like the other games you see in the market and its mechanics and stuff is hard to learn and you learn it by playing for hours and experiencing. For example if your target is moving the bullets wont hit your target if you shoot when the aim is directly at it. You have to shoot forward. Its very complex I cant explain that but you will learn that by playing. Also I recommend buying this game if you HAVE A GOOD PC search if your PC can run this game and then buy it. The negative side of this game is the driving and cars are really buggy. The cars can get stuck through walls and explode. IN CONCLUSION if you buy this game there is a new adventure waiting for you where you fight 100 people in a island and the last one stands WINS. I rate this game 8/10 WINNER WINNER CHICKEN DINNER

review: This game is genuinly terrible. Let us start with the most obvious problem of all. Its performance issue. For a relatively simple game in terms of graphics and gameplay this game is barely playable and I use barely generously on a lightweight rig. If you don't have a good laptop or desktop that cost you at least 1k then you might as well not buy this game which is why I am really upset because this game shouldn't require that. This games graphics are almost 8 years out of date a decent $700 computer should be able to play this on the low settings but it doesn't. Hell a 1 1.2k computer will barely run it. Second lets talk about the other obvious problem with this game. It isn't fun. It is boring as hell. And to top it off it is simply a bad remake of Battlefield 3. A game that is 6 years old. The only difference is that this game sucks.

review: This Battle Royale runs choppier than most shooters has bad loot/inventory mechanics glitchy movement horrid driving poor shooting and lacks basic positional awareness tools like HUD hit direction. The chance to win is too heavily determined by RNG for guns optics and backpacks. Oh and what little character customization exists is from loot boxes crammed to the gills with duplicates of bland items.Any of these could be forgiven save that the game has brought the developer warehouses filled to the roof of money for many months now yet so little has gone back into actually improving obvious Quality of Life issues.The Battle Royale genre is great. Due to that there is still a lot fun to be had with the game. But other BR games exist that are cheaper (or free) higher quality and have more polish.
