review: Update2 2 months later. I wanted to give it another try after a patch. 1st game laggy as hell. 2nd game crash. 3rd game crash with message "corrupted data verify your installation". Can't play it after that. So far it's terrible piece of garbage.//Update1 It crashed my pc with red scren (no BSOD but RSOD) first time in my life... And my pc haven't crashed for quite some time (months). Won't run it again for quite some time....//For me personally total waste of money.I spent first few hours trying to fix their bugs with UI and controls still couldn't work around everything (I can't alt tab nor play it borderless fullscreen). All of these are easily fixable yet they remain there for quite some time. X Funny thing if you put windowed in start options it actually switches to fullscreen (in my case?) but still works better than when I set the fullscreen in UI in config menu.. I also couldn't fire in few games...Also the movement and jumping for example feels slugish and laggy a lot.I got to top 10 twice (2x 6th place) but I have it counted just once in stats. X And I haven't shot anyone for the whole time because it can happen you won't meet anyone. )I got impression from the streams that it's more shooting and less camping and laying in high grass but unless you rock 2 4 man well managed squad that's totally not the case.And then it's just dying to camping people after running to get in circle for 10 minutes... Or being constantly bombed under red zone for 3rd time (no kiding!).And maybe the most con for me is the lack of some training mode in which you could train with weaspons or vehicles (the pre match isn't enough as the weapons despawn on pickup another easily fixable thing).The other important aspect is that's too luck/random dependent your landing spot vs circle gun spawn (especially if you land in more crowded area) vehicle spawn (vehicles are more relevant than you might think).And the last optimalization I got 40fps staring into wall. ))) Even BF1 runs better and looks awesome (and is more fun).So don't expect shooter and bug free experience. And definitely don't expect them to finish it anytime soon. From uptill now development it seems more likely they will hold onto early access as long as possible. But if you like camping for 20 minutes go for it! D
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Just for the Steam Awards
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game was so great when it first came out... Now it just feels totally different. New content takes weeks upon weeks to release and when it finally is released it is so miniscule that it doesn't make a difference in the grand scheme of things. There are tremendous issues with player movement loot loot boxes lag directional sound etc. The list could go on and on of things that should have been fixed before full release. I played this game from the beginning and I even played the original ArmA 2 Battlegrounds mod which i think had more substance and replayability than this sorry excuse for a full game. Rarely do I ever write reviews this long but this game was such a let down to me that I felt it necessary to share my thoughts on it. If you got this far into reading my suggestion for you is to not give any more money to these greedy developers.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is now completely over run by hackers and Blue Hole is either complacent or too incompetent to make any meaningful changes to combat this. review: Once upon a time this was an incredibly promising game with a relatively untouched concept. based on a mod for one of the greatest mil sims of all time. But overtime Strangled by poor coding and a less than ideal engine. Bad design choices Catering to E sports over making a fun experience. An overwhelmingly poor willingness to do anything about the majority of problems. The game's ineffective multi layer anti cheat is best summed up in the immortal words of Forest Gump "Life's like an onion. you peal it back a layer at a time...Sometimes you cry" Well Crying is something you can expect to do a lot in this game because when you get through the layer after layer of pointless and ineffective cheat prevention You just find a rotten onion at the middle. Nothing that seems worth your time. It's potential has been squandered and it teetered on a slippery slope for some time. The most fun to be had was an event that was ended less than 24 hours after it began because said event exposed just too many flaws of the game for it to keep going. It has sadly fallen down that slippery slope and shows no signs of slowing down. Attempt after attempt to bring this game back from the brink have failed and an obvious misunderstanding of what players want mean that this game has no chance.It honestly seems like the game is just made up of hundreds of store assets chosen with little regard for their compatibility The code is made of angry spaghetti and won t be a good experience without re codding huge parts of the experience. Sadly I see PUBG going on to be the worlds most famous and successful asset flip. The developers have let us down and it is depressingIf I could go back and refund this game I would in a heartbeat. It has failed to hit it s mark and isn t just a bad game but a poor experience overall with no respect for it s players. If someone tries to convince you to play this game because at this point I doubt you would try it on your own. Stay far away it s an experience rotten to it s core with corruption cheaters bugs and a lack of any sort of development vision. Stay far away and avoid this game At any price. Sales will do nothing for this game but make it worse as cheaters flood back in to get a cheap fix.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I never played H1Z1 it looked too arcadey for me and the developers didn't seem to care about the game.I never played Battle Royale on ARMA because I felt the controls were too clunky to actually make it enjoyable.This game is really really good. If you never played a Battle Royale game before it feels like the intense moments of DayZ back when it was popular where you'd see people and had to plan out what your attack would be. However this game is smooth and easy controls but not arcadey where it just feels cheap.I haven't encountered any hackers and the devs seem competent and open with everything that they plan on doing. If this game interests you and you have friends to play it with definitely get it. Solo is okay but communication is key so friends is a definite.

review: If like me you never really played DayZ or any other battle royale style game. Your first foray into this game will be a mixed bag. When you eventually start to grasp looting and the general dos and don'ts you will start to enjoy this game. It will keep you coming back for one more go as you start to rack up some kills. But give it a month or so and when you have a few games of getting awesome loot only to be one shotted from nowhere. You will question why you bother. Add that to how poor this game plays and it can be highly infuriating. The bullet simulation is hit and miss. Some games you shoot and people die. Other times you can shoot someone who is prone and nothing happens. You can tactically outwit a player only to open fire and then they spin round one shot you and then teabag your body.It's these annoyances with the game that mean I can't recommend it. For all the great moments you have on this game you have about 3 tedious moments. I had a break and came back to it and it only seems to have got worse. Hopefully they can iron things out. Until then I would hold off.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 104 hours into the game now. Having paid a retail price for an early access game my expectations are comiserate with the cost. In other words I'm finding the game to be sorely wanting at this point. The word "repetitive" doesn't do justice to the amount of one dimensional rinse and repeat gameplay this game delivers. The first 100 drops or so are fun and can be entertaining but it then goes down hill from there. One of the first frustrating elements you will notice is that the pros and the hackers have the same superhuman ability. Be it 10 feet or 1000 yards on the move or not they will not miss....ever. It's the Matrix or Dead Pool physics only you are on the receiving end. Next you'll begin to notice that in close quarters the player who is moving and shoots first will have all of his/her hits register long before you have time to shoot back or move to cover. Regardless of the armor you so painstakingly collected you will die instantly to multiple headshots before you can even pull the trigger. In tech terms they see you they move and they shoot and their shots register at the same time your client is being told by the server that they are moving and shooting. So by the time you actually see them on screen their bullets are already hitting you. This is a common problem with FPS games but there is better algorithyms out there than what is in this game. Noting this is dramatically exacerbated by the inhuman accuracy decribed above. Lastly there are a lot of cheaters in this game. Not the blatent kind but the ones who know batter than to be too obvious. I believe this because 1 in 5 games I will have an apposing player know exactly where I am and what direction I am facing without me making a sound and of course they put a full auto burst right into my noggin every time. There are other shortfalls in the game mechanics that I will simply attribute to this being early access. Like the game placing way too much emphasis on "the circle of doom". It feels like the devs are so proud of this construct they've made it THE centerpiece of gameplay. It is all powerful and the main opponent in every end game with the main tactic being to not get screwed (forced to make a sucide run) by the circle. Instead of "Battlegrounds" they should have called this game "Battle Circle" or "Circle Jerk" or some such thing. One other thing I noticed about the game. Once you win your first Chicken Dinner you get a kind of "Lord of the Flies" feel. Meaning the combat feels so unrewarding and luck based i.e who gets seen and who doesn't who finds good stuff and who doesn't who shoots first and who doesn't who had better ping and who doesn't and the rewards for winning are so pathetic you just don't feel any sense of achievment. This is my 2 cents ATM. It might get better but I don't see them adding different game modes anytime soon. If they are smart they will release the server to the public for private hosting very soon so players and create the variaty in game types and modes that is needed to keep this game fresh.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is the most unstable and poorly optimized game I have ever ran on my pc. I can run some high end games but this one on medium settings crashes constantly. I read the negative reviews and I thought that it was exaggerated and I could still have fun on this game. I was wrong. I'm highly contemplating refunding this and getting it off my drive so that it won't take up any valuable space. It would be a really fun game if Blue Hole wasn't going for the money grab. They stopped caring about the game and community entirely and are just in it for the money with their loot boxes and not fixing the game breaking bugs. It's a cool idea. It's too bad that they were the first to really take off with the idea of current battle royale mechanics and now they're in last place from all of the people that are copying Blue Hole are doing it better. Save your money and go get Fortnite for free their servers work it doesn't crash constantly and it's well optimized. Blue Hole has no intentions of fixing their game so don't buy it thinking it'll get better. What you buy is what you get.

review: This game is fun especially with friends but personally it could benefit from two things (for me personally) at the time of writing this1) A training ground I think itd be greatly useful for players to be able to get to know how shooting works in this game without only getting the chance of one gunfight a game to get used to shooting. If you could boot up an offline server to try the weapons and work out how best to use them or maybe a tutorial it would be helpful.2) Some more scoping options I'm sure i won't be the only one but i personally like to hold down the right mouse button to scope yet there is no option for this. Instead i can only toggle or double click and hold the button which I dislike. this is a minute point but it feels somewhat major for me personally.Even without these two things solved i can have some good games and get a few good shots but it would be a bunch more fun for me if these two things were implemented.

review: As it stands avoid the game. I have played since June and have loved it up until about 3 4 weeks ago. One of the best games in recent years however it is over run with hackers. Aimbot/wallhack/speed hack it's all there. It is not enjoyable at the minute you either die really early due to hackers or you have a really good game but die in the last 10 players due to hackers. The hacking is obvious too there is a pattern to bullets that hit you and speed hack speaks for itself. If they manage the hackers then I would say 100% pick the game up but wait until there is more news or reviews saying it's been sorted. I fear it never will be as the hackers will now be one step ahead of each ant cheat method. I am currently NOT recommending the game based on that.I will edit my review accordingly when the time comes. I feel the game grew too big too quickly for the current studio. Another mistake was taking it to a competative level when it isn't even out of alpha stage yet. Also with the upcoming XBOX release I feel their resources were stretched too far to concentrate on the development optimisation and cheat free game that this was in early access season 1 and early access season 2.

review: After passing 100 hours in this game and having both good and bad times in it I thought I was qualified to give a review. Short version +concept+weapon variety optimization major server lag due to inadequate servers and excessive traffic from overseas graphics while passable at high would pass for an early 2000s game at a playable framerate if you live in a rural area chances are your internet cannot run this. Regardless of ping dependent on download and upload speeds. Personally I've had many cases where 15 20 bullets out of 30 miss at point blank range. gunplay feels incredibly clunky movement feels incredibly clunky unfixed exploits/cheats/hacks allow you to be headshotted anywhere which the overly sensitive banning system hasn't been able to fixOverall I love the concept of this game. However I think the developers haven't implemented it well enough to actually recommend this game. I may be biased as I'm used to other games but the guns feel terrible. They're unlike any other game that I've played and that's not a good thing in this case. Emptying 20 30 bullets at point blank range (aiming down sights) and hitting the enemy twice isn't exactly a hallmark of good gameplay... and that wasn't an isolated incident. It's happened with nearly every gun for me. I've played shooters for 8 10 years and this isn't a problem with most other games I've played.As much as I want to I have to recommend against getting this game. I praise those who become skilled at it but I think most people have neither the location the hardware nor the patience to get a reasonable amount of enjoyment out of it.On a final note fix the Chinese servers before doing huge updates to the game. Nearly every time I join a game there are many many overseas players... which doesn't do favours for anyone's ping serverwide.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Do not buy it. I repeat do not buy it if you want to be addicted to it.Review Update Apparently the negative review that I jokingly created has become true. The servers the glitch the optimization the cheaters/hackers you name it and you'll find it in this games. Despite the promises the developer has made there's nothing really get into the game (things that we can see actual performance increased in game)Update 1.0Finally we have the update that we hope for although there is still some of the problem like the rubber banding and some bug happened. It is actually not so bad.Update for Jan '18The rubberbanding isnt that bad like it used to be. The game definitely progressing in a good way but still the cheaters is still all around . I hope they can fight those guys. Lets get your fingers crossed

review: Decent game for what it is. Simple easy to hop in and out of. Not denying it's popularity and that it has given life to the Battle Royale genre in a way.However it's still not optimised and runs terribly even with the Game ready drivers from Nvidia. I'm not surprised about that personally.Region lock needs to be a thing or a decent anti cheat measure because whatever this game has in place right now is either garbage or close to nonexistant.I would recommend this game if you just want something to kill time with but with the current state of optimisation and cheaters/hackers running about I wouldn't personally. Admittedly I have to say one of my more regretted purchases of 2017 and has made me think twice about dabbling in Early Access in the future.

review: This game is fantastic. Its still early Access so it has problems but there has been some mega hate on the game for almost no reason. People complain that updates are coming to fast and so they slow it down and then people complain that the updates are to slow. you can't please them. The game has exploded so of course the servers are laggy becuase it went from 300k players in july to 2.5 million in November. It still needs work obviously becuase its early access but all these negative reviews are completely unjustified. The reviews about getting banned for stream sniping doesnt happen. I have KILLED several of the top streamers (mostly because I drop at popular places) 365 hours and never been banned despite playing against streamers quite a bit. Stream honking is also some sort of meme becuase the same people were following streamers honking every day once honking released and people got banned. There are videos of people with the names "DrDasrespect and NinjaIsGay" stream honking DrDisrespect and Ninja for HOURS but people still try and deny that stream sniping is a thing. Hacking has become somewhat of a problem but the claims that BH is purposely not doing anything so they can make more money is rediculous. They aren't doing anything different than anybody else with hacking. They claim that they need to be Banning Hardware or IPs but no other game banns Hardware or IPs. Also the hacks that these people are buying allow for you to change the hardware ID of your systems and they also come with VPN services so the IP ban don't work either. Somehow this company is being held to a higher standard than any other company. All in all. Bluehole is doing a perfectly fine job. Its a good game thats fun as with friends. Vaulting is on the test servers and they just announced that they are working on their own Anti Cheat stuff rather than working with BattleEye forever.

review: Despite its many faults PUBG was a lot of fun for several months as the game grew. Recently however the insurgence of Chinese players across all region servers has pretty muched ruined the game due to cheating. Until Bluehole can figure out how to curtail cheating either via region lock better anti cheat tools etc. this game is an exercise in frustration.Unfortunately I wouldn't hold out hope in the short term that they actually have the organization manpower or even desire to do much about it. As with other aspects of the game that have been issues for many many months without remediation I expect Bluehole to casually make an attempt at doing something and then move on to adding more features or content instead of solidifying the base content they already have in place.In short Bluehole is completely and totally amateur. Hold off on buying until cheating is solved and the developer gets out of the growing pains stage as a company.

review: The concept of this game is extremely fun yet i cannot recommend this game. The game has so many issues but the last meaningful patch was 4 months ago. Pretty much everything you can think of is broken in some way and no fixes have been released for them.The devs seem to be really incompetent and just riding the hype for some extra cash. They promised weekly and monthly patches yet you are lucky to see a patch every month by now and if a patch comes out it does nothing to fix the core issues.If i still could refund this game I would....Again this game is really fun as a concept and i believe everyone wants to play the concept but its just not executed well and due to that the game is extremely frustrating due to massive FPS drops Bad hitreg and latency. The FPS drops are so bad that people pick up the useless stun grenade just for the fact that it drops people's fps to single digits. The grenade itself is useless. Just an example of how bad things are.tldr Game looks like preforms like but has a good concept. It just wont ever reach that concept with these devs

review: Great idea for a game but ruined by a few things.Firstly the lag issue I have a pretty good set up to game on and fibre optic broadband but even if I reduce the graphics quality until it looks like the Lego movie there is still about a minute after the game starts where a whoile bunch of players are standing still and being picked off because of lag issues.Secondly the bizzare way they make players bunch together by closing an arbitrary circle on a map that everyone has to stay inside or thaey start to die. What is that? Is this a military geme or a sci fi? As a result if you do make it to the last ten there is the lucky sod who happened to land in the right spot in the only building within the playing area and the rest arriving in cars and driving in circles trying not to be the next one killed. Lastly this isn't a free early acces game in fact as they go it's a damn expensive one and on top of that they expect you to pay real money to access crates that you've already wasted 'in game' money buying. So that's cash up front game credits payed out for playing and helping to develop the game and more real world cash afterwards. All that for a game that is Beta at best.

review: Product received for free. I just read a ton of the bad reviews of people getting "auto banned". I personally cannot attest to those since as my current standing is that I have 130 hours played.Though my copy was indeed a gift from a friend I have recomended this game to several of my friends and they have bought it with NO RAGRETTS.Pros . You'll have a great time. feels real enough to draw you in but fake enough to create the line between a game and simulator. decent survival feeling. many ways to play the game (survivalist run and gun first person third person)cons it's early access and anything that's wrong with the game WILL be worked out.not many cons. anything I could choose to whine about would be irrelevant in about a month or so.Buy this game quit being bags of sh*t who whine about it being broken.IF YOU CANNOT RUN GAMES FROM 2015 AND UP DO NOT BUY THIS IT IS NOT OPTIMIZED VERY WELL BUT IT GETS MORE STABLE WITH EVERY UPDATE.THIS GAME WILL STRESS YOUR SYSTEM OUT! UPGRADE OR LEAVE IT ALONE!IF YOU BUY THIS EXPECTING A PERFECTLY GREAT WORKING PRODUCT YOU WILL BE UNSATISFIED.IT IS EARLY ACCESS SHUT UP AND ENJOY YOURSELVES!!

review: I tried I tried very hard to like this game. There are many good points for example when you can play the game with friends it is quite fun. However when the first thing on the game the UI doesn't load properly you get annoyed. So you refresh and it works ok then you join a game and you get booted from the server again annoyed. Then you get into a game but it is so laggy that you can't find anything annoyed. Then you finally find a good server in a good game mode and have a few friends only to be team killed because some little wants to be the only person in a team game instead of going solo ANNOYED. There are many points that I can see this game may one day reach but for now considering the amount of money they have squeezed from people you would think they could do better.I will check back with this game in a year but for now it is not worth my time.

review: 这是一个非常神奇的世界 在里面会遇到各路神仙大显神通 堪比封神时期 他们均来自不同的修真门派 天眼宗 独门秘术 天神之眼 神识覆盖整座岛屿 活人死人 枪支弹药尽收眼底 无视任何掩体及障碍物 死射门 独门秘技 死亡锁定 遇人秒锁 开抢即爆 指哪打哪 无论是头还是心脏 无论目标是在高速移动 还是在千里之外 阅后即秒 冷酷无情 神拳寺 独门秘技 无影神拳 无论目标身在何方 或身在何种掩体保护中 击拳即可命中 敌人只能在绝望中哀嚎 在哀嚎中被拳打成盒 人无处可寻 己无处可逃 风行阁 独门身法 凌波微步 百米一秒八 谜踪身法秀遍全场 子弹射速再快 永远无法触及他们的身影 瑜伽派 独门身法 橡胶之体 可让四肢躯干无限伸缩 杀人角度堪称刁钻至极 若幸运 也许在你倒地的一瞬间 你可以看到他们诡异且漫长的双手拿着枪对着你 法宝门 独门秘术 地爆天星 以咒术催动手雷变大 直至顶破苍穹 众人目睹后无一不瞠目结舌 随之引爆 其威力大过原子弹数倍不止 顷刻间全岛生灵灰飞烟灭 黑洞门 独门秘术 万象天引 以秘术将全岛所有人吸附到自己面前 无视距离 并将其定住屠杀之 堪称惨绝人寰 灭绝人性 由于修仙界向来以造福修真者为道 且所有的修真者都刻守此道 顾各大门派之间从未有过门派之别 所以各路修真人士都汇集各家所长 熟练运用各门各派之秘术 秘技及身法 以至融会贯通 其中以天眼宗和死射门为首 入门门槛最低 秘术也最容易精通 顾人数最多 因此大部分修真者至少都会 天神之眼 和 死亡锁定 而少数天赋异禀的修真者除了这两项秘术以外 还会一些其他门派的秘技 更有不出世大罗神仙所有秘术 秘技及身法全部精通 其通天彻地之能 堪称比创世之神 蓝洞 所以再此奉劝各位妄想踏足修仙界的麻瓜和无灵根者 趁早悬崖勒马 切勿误入歧途

review: I find this game as a mixed flavored package. Although the game can be fun especially with friends within your squad. It is also addicting aswell but i find it to be very flawed in certain area's. I find the game to have sloppy development i know it's considered early access but for development terms it has way too many zfighting which bugs me as i see it so much within the game. Then their is the issue of poor optimization even for those using low settings its very CPU heavy. I dislike how the game determines distance with models i could physically see the shift of the model taking place and it looks completely different it's not even a low to high poly adjustment but a completely new concept altogether. As a nit picking to level development grass growing through the floors of buildings tree's and foliage being obviously above ground with some distance of levitation. It becomes irritating to look at when all you notice are these things even amongst casual gaming sessions. The only positive thing i could really talk about is it's gameplay.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Thinggs like the texture not properly loading and freezing happens all the time one time I was playing with my friend and I couldn't see any houses. At the end of the day it is still better than Arma 3 battle royal and better than H1Z1 but if they don't fix the fps problems I am done with this game.

review: Best Battle Royale on the market at the moment. Realistic slow paced game with lots of weapons and attachments 2 maps 3rd coming soon and pretty solid netcode at the moment. Of course it has it's faults some bugs haven't been fixed and after 200 hours it's getting boring without friends. Still one of my favourite games. Only thing I really don't like is microtransactions in paid game but it's still not even close to being as bad as in games like Battlefront 2 or sportsgames like Fifa or NHL. I rarely die to t and I feel like this game would be really good experience to all people if it was optimized better and if it had better terrain hitboxes and bit better netcode. There is enough weapons in this game and enough attachments in my opinion and I think this is like only one really good balanced BR just because first person game mode and every gun feels just really good not too much recoil on the weapons like there shouldn't be but still bit too much to be fully realistic game.I would rate 7/10 would play with friends but alone played this game is pretty boring (like 90% of other games as well).But you know everything is way funner with few friends.

But i came back and noticed a new map guns sights attachments and even achievments. I realized that even though the game came out it still was not finished. Is the game perfect? No. But they are slowly fixing gliches and expanding it making it playable. I remember back when these Gamecoms crates came out and i basically made all my money back and then some extra. It's a really fun game to play with your friends and i would recommend it. (or you could go play fortnite for free like the noob you are)

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is a very mixed game in terms of pro's and cons.It's an incredibly fun game IF you're planning to play with friends and is intense and rewarding when playing solo but the real fun comes when you play with friends. This game is filled with so many problems as much as the average early access game.Lots of people complain about this due to the fact they have sold over 25 million copies and took it out of early access.A large majority of the reviews here will not recommend this game due to the fact it's riddled with bugs and the developers are very slow in terms of fixing these bugs. But the pro's and the fun that comes out of this game makes it so easy to stop caring and forget about the problems at the end of the day especially when winning. But although I am recommending this game Playerunknown's can be so frustrating at some points and can make you think what s can't fix the simplest problems with the millions and millions of dollars they've recieved selling this game. You'll enjoy playing this especially if you don't take it too seriously but don't expect to be impressed the whole time you're playing this game.lets hope it doesnt die lol

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDSThe game is created by an experienced developer in the genre. Contrary to popular belief this game is nothing like its competitor H1Z1. Yes the goal is the same. Parachute down into a dangerous map loot weapons avoid the circle and be the last man alive. However the game provides a very different experience than it's counterpart in many ways. There is a lot more customization of weapon loadouts different vehichle options and slower paced tacitcal gameplay. Some might describe PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS as the more realistic option for gamers interested in battle royale gameplay. I would find this to be an accurate statement as H1Z1 provides a much more arcade like experience. If you're looking for a more optimized version of the Arma3 battle royale mod then just plant your right here and enjoy the ride. Just remember the game is in early accesss and the Devs are constantly hard at work improving and finishing this game.

review: I'll admit I have a bit of a bias here.Thanks to this game and their lootbox event from the summer I was able to make enough money to buy 3 other $40 games with nothing out of pocket instead of trying to keep the items for myself.Putting that aside after you've done some customization work to make the game perform better it's great. But you will have to do some tweaking in some form or another to get it running "properly."Gun battles feel super precise updates have been coming out weekly which they should considering how many copies this game has sold. But since the early beta I've had fun. Just gotta tweak some things to make it run better first.Out of all of the Battle Royale games this has been my favorite since it has control schemes that make sense and has been (comparatively) more stable than other games of this ilk (pre Fortnite).Also you should try Fortnite's Battle Royale if you're unsure about this. It's free more arcadey more "user friendly." If you like that and want more precision come back to this.

review: I would not pay $30 for this game. Maybe $10? There are several main problems. The first being the lag. I typically do not lag on video games while on high settings although there is a decent amount of sputtering going on in this game. SEcondly you are going to spend 20 minutes running around the map for a 20 second fight where you will die. Its very common that you will not even see your killer. Third the recoil on weapons is insane. It should be reduced drastically. Lastly there is no tutorial? how are new players suppose to learn to play when you throw them into guys who have hours and hours of game time. They do not even teach you controls? This was a sad purchase so far to say the least.Yeah this is a terrible purchase...

review: UPDATE After the addition of FPP the pushing of the new map to test servers along with the included performance updates and optimization as a result of the new Engine being used for the upcoming 1.0 release I have changed my review to POSITIVE. Blueballs stepped up big after everyone gave them and rightfully so as the original PUBG was clunky and an unoptimized mess that needed a lot of work to bring out the core gameplay that had a lot of potential and that's what they've done. I congratulate the Dev team of PUBG Corp for this insane amount of work they've done in spite of all the doubt and all the problems they faced going from an indie game company practically to the BIGGEST game on steam by a longshot. WELL DONE.This game seems fun and certainly the gameplay in itself is fun I cannot lie. The premise of finding weapons and items and duking it out in a play area that's constantly shrinking is a great concept and it could definitely work and be a successful game. However due to the nature of the game players are greatly rewarded for camping (which is further enabled by third person camera angles) and greatly punished for being aggressive or taking risks. Whoever sits in one spot and waits the longest wins and it makes for very boring gameplay. I would like to see some changes be made to punish slow playstyle and reward aggressive/risk taking behavior as currently it is WAY too powerful to get a gun of any kind and sit and watch an area with third person camera to get free kills.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Not a hardcore fps gamer but some friends got me into this game and I thank them for it. For me the game runs fairly well considering its still in development. Some lag ive noticed latley and have met some undesirable players but im glad to hear that the devs are taking action. Im hearing some awsome features are coming down the line and am excited to check them out on live servers. Seems ALOT of Asians play on NA servers but as long as they are not cheating just more fodder for my ammo. Although the communications on team modes can be frustrating. I would like to see a way to save default server/teammode and maybe more game modes and maps. There is alot of game mechanics to learn but not too complex to pickup new and have fun. Overall i would recomend this game and hope the developers stay relevent to fanbase and inovative enough to bring in new players.

review: 8/10 This TPS/FPS game is honestly one of the best shooter games out right now but with freedom to switch regions it can be a pain in the a**. There is just too many players from other regions(specifically China) who are hard to communicate with when playing in teams. Its not enjoyable when you hope to play with a random team and they're not able to talk to you or vice versa. The U.S. servers are overwhelmed with this type of issue and its quite annoying. Otherwise if you play solo its a pretty fun game of gathering weapons and armor to fight off 99 other players to be the last one standing.

review: The game principle and setup is great weapons are quite balanced and it is definately a lot of fun to play.This said at this point I cannot recommend this game at all due to incredible lags. Put aside the fact that textures take forever to load and sometimes you might not be able to enter a house because it was simply not rendered yet there is also the issue of not hitting an enemy you clearly have your crosshair on and should at small distances make a clean hit. Too often this game at it s stage right now disappoints with unaccounted hits and therefore seems quite unfair to the players.As soon as servers are reliable and processing time is minimized it will be a great game to play until now however it is okay at best.

review: I dont really write many reviews on Steam but since this game has become very popular with the masses I felt compelled to write a very honest and impartial review.I have played this game for a few weeks now and for the most part I have extrememly enjoyed it. For me it isnt a game that you can play for hours and hours on end as its just far to repetative but I guess thats the whole nature of this game.I havent had any of the issues that other people are tlaking about with regards to being banned after being accuses of "Stream Sniping" and I certainly havent seen any players hacking the game to cheat. This is all after playing a total of 37.8 hours up until writing this review. This is my view obviously and this is not me saying that it doesnt happen because it obviously does. Im just saying that it hasnt been a problem for me and I always play on the EU servers for those who may be wondering.For the gameplay itself I would say that the mechanics still need a lot of improvment along with game stability. Over the past week whenever I laucnh the game for the fist time it almost always launches me right into a game where a battle is already talking place either that or it crashed completely and I have to ctrl alt + del to stop the game and restart.Within the game itself sometimes when I land after jumping from the plane the buildings havent correctly loaded and I can freely walk around without opening any doors etc and picl up weapons but again this is usually just the first time I load up the game and play the first round. It usually corrects within a minute or two .One thing very positive I will say about this game is that its amazingly addictive and frustrating at the same only Fifa has ever made me want to smash up my controller haha p The amount of times I have been within the last 10 to survive or even got to 2nd or 3rd place and been killed by a uness sniper is so damn annoying but also fun )The loot boxes that you can buy with experience points are t Ive lost count of how many red jumpers ive gotten or black jeans. I suppose when they start adding more items though that this may improve. Who knows!The negative for me has to be the price... 26.99 for a very unfinished game with relatively poor graphics is a bit of a rip off. But I guess it is what it is. If you arent desperate to play then I would recommend trying another game of the similar type until they bring down the price. It just isnt worth it for the money they are asking and I wish I had waited.Overall I give this game a 6.5/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: In the current state of this game (Yes 1.0) I cannot reccomend this game at all. First off the Chinese players and subsequently the hackers from that region and Russia too are just ruining the experience. BlueHole needs to region lock servers. Seriously. Region lock Asia from accessing US servers. Secondly I take pride in overclocking my hardware which I can say PUBG does not like one bit. I've never had a game crash my PC as much as this one does. It's absolutely terrible when it happens. No I don't have defective hardware. Yes I've ran extended stability benchmarks with AIDA64 Prime95 and Superposition for 2 18 hours at a time and never overheat never crash and never have any problems with pushing hardware to its limits but when I play this game every single time my PC crashes. Fix your BlueHole. I'm seriously regretting this purchase but I do hope it gets better moving forward. I'll revise my review at a later date when the game has been built on more.

review: I wanted to like PUBG as I thought the concept of gradually forcing players to move into smaller and smaller areas was interesting. However after spending a fair bit of time playing I ve come to the conclusion that there is not much on offer with this game. The gameplay is shallow and much of how a match turns out is based on luck. The shooting mechanics are strange and no matter what settings I changed I could not get the mouse movements to work in a manner I am comfortable with. The map is boring in design and lacks detail making it feel very empty and sparse. The weapons are arbitrary and don t behave anything like you would expect based on their calibre. The frame rate performance is pretty bad given how basic the game looks it seems to be a common theme with recent Unreal Engine based games. At this stageI simply cannot recommend PUBG to anyone. 3/10.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I love this game I have been stuck on playing nothing but league of legends for about 2 years now and i havent really had anything that made me want to play anything else other than the occasional game of HoTS. but this has really converted me ill usually play a few rounds get killed in the 20's 30s occasionally 10's then rage quit for an hour and wish i was playing this again.Pros ing intense i havent played a game in a loooong time that actually makes my heart race. You feel like an absolute savage if someone gets the jump on you and you pick up the kill. quick matchmaking you die you immediatly start a new match. Duo/squads is the most fun ive had with friends in a game in a long time. nothing beats coordinatiing with your friends when storming a small group. not sure if its a pro or a con but the gun play is actually difficult there is a real learning curve to simply just shooting.Cons its slow pace at times can be a major turn off for some players this isnt a game where most players can walk in and run n gun. early access so sometimes you get slapped with some nasty bugs (not to big a deal i mean its early access.) many are upset at microtransactions which dont really bother me much so long as its kept to purely cosmetics and not gameplay changing. RNG not sure if this is a pro or con either. On one hand i love the RNG factor because no game is going to be the same.....on the other hand nothing will make you more furious/mad/tilted/ than finding two snipers but not a single scope accept 1 red dot in 12+ houses. did i mention RNG? sometimes you will play everything as well as you could have with the information you have but just by dumbluck someone will stumble on you without you noticing and your round is up. maybe its a problem unique to myself but i have alot of trouble finding scopes which at the end game are borderline necassary (notice i said borderline because ive made it into the top 4 with nothing but a holo scope on a kar98 sniper). If you are ok with a slow paced game that you probably wont win (1v100) that requires thought/planning on every move then this is the game for you).

review: I just wanna start off by saying that back on march I gave this game a thumbs down for outright refusing to work at all on my rig. I don't have a beast of a computer but I still run pretty much everything there is to play well enough only having to tweak options down for a handful of games that are either particularly demanding... or plainly bad optimized. And this game had that issue back then and still does big time. It's without a doubt the single most broken game I've ever played when it comes down to optimization and performance. The way I have to play it with every graphical option turned down to the bare minimum it makes it look very poorly. And still this game is definitely a thumbs up for me. Why's that? Simply put it's one of the most thrilling engaging and intense games I've ever played. The shooting feels amazing. Animations are beautiful. The driving is a good enough blend of realistic(ish) physics and plain fun. Playing solo can be tense AF and playing squad is a blast (when you don't get paired with people who play on a server they can't speak the language of). Sound is also quite impressive this game + headphones is a very immersive experience. To sum it up If you can spare the 20 bucks it's a fantastic addition to your steam library. It comes at only a fraction of the cost of some AAA titles and even on early access it's well worth it.Little side note FFS people need to get it together and review the game fairly. Reviewing a game is not about blackmailing the developer with the threat of a cascade of bad reviews if everything doesn't go exactly as you intend. I don't like many things in this game but it's undeniable that it's great fun. And the fact that some people downvote it when they're well past 100 or 200 hours into it (and still play it) is very telling.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is a little buggy and a lot buggy some times. With frequent server lag unable to pick up items and items not looking like what they actually are. For example picking up a white shirt on the ground then it turns out to be a black shirt when you put it on. Getting your parachute caught on nothing so I'm just stuck in the air with my finger up my butt. I don't see why the game should be as glitched out as it is. Its the number one played game on steam with a peak of 2 279 084 players according to the steamcharts website on 10/24/2017. It placed at number 5 just below CSGO on Newzoo.com The game is a lot of fun and I enjoy it a lot. But the game developers really need to step it up. PUBG is one of the top played games of all time so I think the developers should want to take care of what they have before a bigger company makes a better faster smoother battle royale game with the same play style and game principles.

review: This is a great game. It reminds us slavs of our childhood. But all jokes aside the game is really good. The thing that I am most impressed with is how the developers have been listening to the community. As of me writing this review they're adding vaulting systems and making "the blue zone" much deadlier. Which are two of the three main problems I had with this game. Jumping was really loud and clumsy and they are currently working on fixing it. And at one point of the game the only way you could die to a blue zone was by not being able to open the map and wee where it was. Now it is more balanced. The game currently has a great feel to it. If you loose you don't feel so bad and if you win you get the same adreneline rush you would as if you were running from a bear. The game is not too competetive. I don't get frustrated if I have to leave a match but yet it incourages you to do your best. The updates seem to just keep coming and coming. The developers release somewhat balanced guns at a very steady rate. The looting system is very good. It pushes you to get better loot by facing other players off in a city prison or military base. You don't have to go for the more popular drop points but if you do it is very awarding. I also love the map i think the graphics and environment are beautiful.I only have one major problem with this game it's the games optimization. It is horrendous and absolutely a thing that needs to be fixed in the future. I personally dont have a problem running it but anything below 12GB of ram won't get you the 60FPS you need. You also want one hell of a graphics card if you are playing it.The game is a huge blast with friends.I highly suggest this game to anyone that wants to have fun in a tactical shooter with the slight mix of survival. I apologize for any stupid spelling or grammar mistakes...
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: i Buy the game just like everybody els but they dont cater for people who struggle with high latency. i play on a server with 200 ping how is that fair towards me facing a player who has 30 ping..... its not FAIR at all! he gets amazing ping and i dont but we both paid the same price for the game.... how do i enjoy a game like this if i am already at a disadvantage everytime i play the game. Why dont you do a servey and see how many people bought the game from Africa and give them a server too... its just fair!!! oh and please fix the jumping in this game its horrible i cant even jump over walls or the gaps the walls have the jumping is just horrible!

review: PUBG is probably one of the better battle royale games out at the moment however by no means does that make it a "Good Game". Here are my pros and and cons list of the game then I'll summerize it.Pros Large playerbase Fun Gun play Large diversee map(soon to be mapS) Engaged gameplay that allows for a variety of playstylesCons Non optomized piece of garbage community People not playing on the servers they should be (i.e. Getting chinese players on american servers) Games can last long periods of time where you dont see anyone then die to some guy with a sniper from a mile away Bad servers in general Circle RNG Bad frame Drops Overpriced for how much content NOT ESPORTS READYThe game does have a lot going for it and has a large player base that doesnt seem to be going anywhere however people who are picky about preformance and aren't running with a 1080 will probably notice some frame issues and/or stuttering at times. This game can be very frustrating to play and I wouldnt reccemend getting this if you dont have friends to play it with. But i can say with good concious if you have friends to play with and are willing to spend the price this game probably wont dissappoint too much. Overall score 6/10

review: Great concept for a game. Even though this game is alpha they are fixing to release full game PC 1.0 it is no where near ready for actual sale. Servers are trash with constant disconnects and massive lag regardless of which server you choose or internet connection. Graphics are okay at best animations are horrible at best the sounds are suppose to be getting updated and hackers run rampant throughout the game on every server and they dont even try to hide the fact that they are hacking. I have had 3 people admit to me that they are hacking and dont care because they will just buy the game again and again. Blue hole says they are fighting the hackers but yet after they patch the servers there are more hackers than ever. easiest way to spot hackers are on the test servers using the kill cam. I doubt that blue hole will ever upgrade their servers so that the game may actually run properly. Purchase this game at your own risk because the game is nowhere near finished.

review: Positive Heart pounding excitement. I have been gaming for about 30 years and have never seen anything like this. In Single player you decide how you want to play...Jump into a city and go crazy and try to go for the kills or jump into a remote area and be stealthy. The choice is yours.Negatives In Duo (2 player team) you have a 50/50 chance of ending up with someone who doesn't have a mic or who speaks your language. And it's really really tough to do good that way In Squad (4 player team) your chances are a little better but you'll still probably end up with 1 out of 4 without a mic. I ended up on a team with 3 Chinese players (I speak ONLY English) only 1 of whom spoke very little English and WE WON !!!! So I guess sometimes you really don't need to understand each other. But my biggest complaint BY FAR is that IMHO there is some if not a LOT of cheating going on. I could give endless examples of why I believe there is cheating but I'll spare you. Supposedly they are beginning to crack down on the cheating so we'll see. Until I am 100% sure there is no cheating I would not recommend this game to anyone.

review: PUBG is dead to me here is why. I remember being so excited about PUBG because they would update their game regularly adding new cool things and consistently making the game better. Those days are long behind it. I thought they were the ones that were gonna listen to their customers and do it differently. Instead they have been working on a pile of steaming crap lawsuit against Fortnite rather then working on their bug filled patch lacking game. Fortnite has updates every week adding new items game modes guns changes to the map that make it evolve. What happened to you PUBG. It honestly started when they added the loot crates before the game even released like they said they would NOT do. Then they released their game and nothing has really happened since. Its horrific watching my once loved game die right in front of me. Get your crap together Blue Balls you are literally going in the disastrous road DayZ went down did you just make this game for a quick payout like Dean Hall did? Sure looks like it cause now on top of the $30 game and $2.50 keys you can buy they are adding a event pass that you will have to pay for too. Fortnite does this but its not as much a slap in the face because the game is FREE TO PLAY! review: This game is great! I love it's background story as well started as a ARMA 2 mod 'DayZ Battle Royale' into it's own full fleshed game. Reminds me of how League of Legends and Dota started as a Starcraft and Warcraft 3 mod.&gt However the unreal engine was only designed for a max of 60 players so that 100 player push really does push your computer no matter what settings you play with since learning that i kept everything maxed out and realized that it played the same when I downscaled everything. So fixing that 100 man issue should be 1st priority in development before moving onto story and zombie modes. None the less i can't wait until the game itself is refined and optimized and available on Xbox so i can play with more of my friends because most of my friends including myself are console gamers.Love M2AF Gaming! Thank you Bluehole for a great game please dont change the core of the game its a really great concept!

review: tThe game is great but....... ing hackers are everywhere and the lag is real. the game started out really well with just a few hackers here and there. over the past couple months hackers have become more and more frequent. i used to play this game for hours nonstop but now i play 1 game and within the first half of the match im getting shot at or killed by hackers. the people hacking are blatantly doing it too. as if they dont care if they get caught or they're just dumb and think they wont get reported and caught. the anti cheat for this game obviously isnt doing the job. most of the hackers i see are asian too when i play on US servers which is my next complaint. the servers need to be region locked or ping locked. there is nothing more frustrating than joing a US server and hearing nothing but chinese in voice chat. its also frustrating trying to play squads and picking up a random player just to find out.......they dont speak any english. as much as i dont want region locked servers because i have friends in the EU that i like to play with i believe it needs to be done. if they dont region lock servers they need to implement ping locks. for example there are some online games that the server will auto kick you if youre ping is too high to reduce the lag. bewteen this games dsync and players running around with 200+ ping over in china it makes it very miserable to play. you can say im wrong but the ratings and reviews for this game speak for itself. the reviews went from positive to mixed in a few months. i really do enjoy playing this game and im affraid if the company doesnt make a decision fast then this game will die off and become just another abandoned game on steam.

review: Going into PUBG I was hesitant. It was like no game I had played before sure it was a shooter but it has this sort of raw thrill that makes this game stand out from the rest. The game puts you on a remote island with 99 other online players in a large open world free for all style of combat that re defines 'last one standing'. As you watch the counter of players left slowly fall off as you remain the stakes grow higher as you inch your way to being the last alive. Much like Richard Connells book 'The Most Dangerous Game' players 'hunt' each other down until only the best 'hunter' survives giving the winner a satifising rush of adrenilne and pure energy as the last player falls at your feet. Although there is a lot of positives to talk about when reviewing PUBG its good to remind yourself that this is in early development there are some kinks glitches and bugs that you will find in every game at this stage. But putting that aside Bluehole developers have given us with a new genre of fast paced thrilling entertainment that is easy to drop into time and time again. 8/10.

review: I honestly can't remember the last time I enjoyed a game as much as this one. I saw the ridiculous amounts of negative reviews recently and felt compelled to post a short review.I wouldn't complain if the servers ran a bit better (at least early on in the games) and if I never saw a hacker again. I've seen two legit hackers with aimbot/speed/kill through walls and I might have grouped with one hacker the other day (I should have clipped him earlier but it's hard not to identify someone as a hacker with 55 k/d ratio). WIth over 200 hours played I can't complain too much about the hackers.That being said I'm having a blast. I try to avoid the most heavily populated areas in the beginning because I know that you may get screwed over with server lag early on. The salt in the other reviews will sustain me for decades.

review: Okay this game gets a lot of flak probably because it's so immeasurably popular right now. I watched an inordinate amount of gameplay before buying this game and I still feel like it was a good purchase.If I get banned for stream sniping (which is apparently a thing) even though I don't will I be angry? Sure.Will I go and flame Bluehole for making that design choice? No.That's because when you peel away the hype and you peel away the "It's early access therefore X" or "Everybody loves it and they just seem to ignore Y" comments and just look at it as a game...It's almost bafflingly fun. In my first few matches I was shaking like a leaf and I had to stop because I felt like I was gonna get a heart attack I was so tense. Sure I'm not the kind of person who plays PVP games like this so maybe that's not surprising but it's a point in the "engaging" column for sure.Is it annoying how I've yet to win a game? Yeah. Does it suck to get sniped out of nowhere or get the bejesus scared out of me by a "clever" player? Sure does.Am I gonna rip on the game for that? No. Because it's fun. It's even tense and exciting when you're dead and you're watching your teammate trundle along to their all too probable doom.Because I don't care about the microtransactions. I don't care about the crazy odds for winning.I had fun. A lot of fun and my friends enjoy it too.It's a game and I enjoy the time I spend playing it. That's good enough for me.

review: Brilliant game and an amazing concept executed correctly. The game is crazy addictive and provides super intense moments that you are rare to find anywhere else. In comparison to other similar games (H1z1 King of the kill) it destroys it completly and does it right. The combat is far superior with gunplay feeling much more satisfying and realistic and gameplay on the whole is very satisfying balanced and enjoyable. Consdering this is newly released in early access it is off to a very good start and is easily the best battle royale style game out there.UPDATE scratch all what i said before this game is just a messy cash grab that is poorly optimised and constantly making bad decisions. i do not think the devlopers deserve support for this game and have neglected the opprutinty to have an amazing game. too many issues with the game that dont get fixed or take far too long to fix such as massive server issues poor netcode cheaters etc yet lootboxes galore and paid season passes keep coming.well done pubg corp messed up such an easy game

review: EDIT They need to fix their ing game. The optimization is absolute garbage which causes it to run like on some rigs while not all exactly. I have a above average rig yet get many problems with network lag etc. However Its Early Access so such is life. I set my rating to Not Recommended only as a warning to those that should know that it may not run well on your setup. Be wary as it takes a huge amount of the fun away from the game when it really doesn't want to work. I can have a streak of amazing no lag games and have it drop to immediate horsewallop in an instant. Second EDIT Turns out you cannot play this game with only 8gb of ram. Who knew. Still can't recommend it but get it if your friends get it because the more the merrier to be frank.Issa great ing game with a great concept behind it that can really make a Friday night with some of your boi's and some greasy cold ones to crack open. Gunplay is neat the map is rad (they probably will make more?) and the power of Russian Industry could never be more powerful (all hail the Iron Pan Gods).One thing I could completely say that is negative is that this game is poor in optimization. What could work flawlessly with no lag spikes etc on one rig could run like absolute monkey on the same exact rig that you might own. It is a fickle beast and you never know what could be ing causing it until you are like me and decide to run the numbers from the top in solutions for stable FPS (which I finally achieved after a week of trial and error). HOWEVER the devs have stated and commited to weekly updates that could very well fix the gross optimization issues while they add content monthly.Overall I'd recommend this game with your friends if you got a better than average PC. I have a 950 for example but a CPU so I have spotty results vs a compatriot with a 970 and a better CPU who has no lag at all with his rig.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: game would be fun if they focused on their netcode and fixed server problems. The game is basically a looting simulator I drop loot a bunch of guns and armor just to have my game disconnect from the server " 25 Client Not Responding" 15 minutes into my game every game. There's no chance of rejoining either. I've tried reinstalling uninstalling Reshade and verifying game cache and to no avail I've come to the conclusion it's the servers kicking me every game. It's fun but not fun if you don't like finishing any of your games and not getting BP.

review: Ya know I really wanted to like this game I really did but with proformance bad textures Hackers D Sync greedy devs and MUCH more I cant take it anymore.Now before you say ANYTHING i need to say this I got recommended this game by alot of my friends and one day I decided to get it and you know what I loved it it was probably one of the best games I have ever played in a long time and was better than most of the crap coming out at the time I loved the thrill that you get when your with friends and you get that sweet winnner winner chicken dinner or you pull a hard play and to be honest I thought this game was going to be the next big thing that would last for YEARS to come I WAS HOPEFUL.But then IT happend the 1.0 update I thought it would finally get rid of the bugs that somewhat broke the game... NOPE.I get into a game only to notice that my fps counter went from the 70 90 fps that I always got on high settings to 10 25 fps LOW SETTINGS I thought ok thats not normal but they might fix it (remember this) drop down and I see nothing but house mesh and I couldn't enter any house after like 30 seconds of wondering what the actual hell is going on they render in I go in and get loot and 10 minutes of wondering im near the ruins and I see someone sneek my way up there shoot him pretty much 10 times and he kills me turns out only 1 SHOT REGISTERED OF THAT 10 that hit him I get my bp and go to the store and to be fair I got a RARE unlocked crate and got a crappy skin but what ya gonna do right its RNG.(im just gonna skip the bulls*** crate system they have because you guys have heard that so many times and its pretty much set in stone what everyone thinks of it including me)Play a few more games see if my eyes dident deceive then I realize somthing this update made the game run like a pile of dog s*** the fact that my game went from 70 90 fps pre release to 10 25 fps post 1.0 is nothing short of BULLS*** and you know what they STILL have not fixed this crap at all (they made 700 million off this game and never bothered to fix something that NEEDS to be fixed).Now lets talk about the hackers Honestly bluehole JUST EN REGON LOCK CHINA ALREADY.YES I know there are alot of players from china and alot are not hackers but if you take a close look 99% of PUBG hackers are. from. CHINA!!!!!!..........And they have come back stronger than ever because bluehole is more obsessed with sueing Epic Games and making more loot crates instead of fixing there own problems.Now after 7 months after 1.0 update and no sign of this game getting better and STILL having HORRIBLE preformance lag issues bad hit detection D Sync and MANY hackers I can say this game had sealed its fate and is gone down the deepest hole any game had ever gone down and I give this game another year at best before it dies a very gruesome death I have lost faith in it.I wish the devs would fix the game but... at this point I dont think soSo its with the bottem of my heart that I say...I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS GAME!!!

Extremely addictive high stakes TPP/FPP MMO shooter.Cannot recommend until PUBG * Restricts player ping when joining a server to under 110* Increases the server refresh rate* Reduction in character d syncThese factors alone make the overall experience infuriating especially when each match requires a considerable time investment compared to BF or COD.

review: Great game it has its problems of course two of the biggest for me are it seems like many of the rules/laws of the game are ...sometiming (sometimes you cant shoot between staircase railing and windows with bars (but sometimes you can) ALOT of things like that. but w/e the game is still fun. THE BIGGEST PROBLEM are the chinese players that dont stay on their own servers and the english speaking players that either dont use mics or join squad games (4 player team) with 2 3 friends and use discord leaving you without communication in a game where communication is KEY. So unless you have dedicated 3 other players to play this game with your stuck 90% of the time with chinese players who sometimes speak broken english on an english server or 10% of the time with players using discord so they dont bother communicating with you. Sure they do have 2 other modes you can play (every man for himself or groups which is just squads of 2 instead of 4) but in my opinion the games BEST and most enjoyable part is you and your squad(4 player teams) (or whats left of it)communicating and sharing items and calling out targets/threats and kills as the match winds down and the last few squads or people to kill are only a few steps away hiding at every corner struggling to survive. Ive unfortunately now have stoped playing this until they ban players to play on their own servers which is most likely never lol. Of course like most other pc game the hacking/cheating is there but i dont find it to be bad enough to where its game breaking like ahem GTA5 online. Bottom line if you got people to play with GET IT if your playing by yourself joining random squads DONT GET IT.

review: Battle Royal that has guns with attachments ranging from scopes magazines stocks for a M416/Tommy Gun three different muzzles and grips. They spawn all over the place along with the guns and if you find the right combo for your play style you might just take home that chicken dinner at the end of the match! I enjoy this game mostly with friends so playing duos or squads makes it a lot of fun if we all are able to communicate together! The in game mics aren't terrible and they have directional functionality but you can make it so only your team hears you if you don't want others to be listening in on your conversations. THOUGH I use 3rd party V.O.I.P. (Voice Over I.P.) and makes it so we can just mute the game com's completely. That way we can all just have a blast. Few things are a tad touchy but what do you expect from an early access game? They are updating almost weekly so you know they are on top of their game of trying to make sure everything is running smoothly. P.U.B.G. is even coming out with a new map soon! Even new guns as they have the ability to add them.All in all I really like this game.

review: PlayerUnknowns battlegrounds in other words running simulator 2k17 is a great and fun game with friends who are not totally braindead. IF YOU ARE ACCTUALLY IN ZONE. But beware because most of the time if you land in the same area as a few or even one other guy they will get a scar right off the bat whilst you have a crowbar or revolver. This game is also packed with a whopping 1 map and about 20 guns and the odd update every 4 months which gets pushed back on the day it comes out. But overall if you want to do more running then a olympic gold medalist does then buy playerunknowns battlegroundsJust a little side note about 100 hours of this game is just you running. Have a great time running people.

review: I've been a gamer most of my life. I've played everything from pong to Pacman to Player Unknown Battlegrounds. I will tell you that this game is perhaps the best fps game I've ever played. I've played a fair number of fps games since Escape from Castle Wolfenstein and I've put more time in this one in a month than I've put into many others. This game has singlehandedly made me stop playing my other fps games like Fallout and Battlefield. While there are some ssues with the game it is constantly improving. My only complaint is that the game does crash often especially when exiting or loading a map. I would say that these crashes and freezes seem to occur more frequently since I started playing a couple of months ago. The in game playing is pretty good and I rarely have issues with the exception of some lag from time to time. Overall I'd recommend this game highly but would say to temper expectations of crashes since it is not a final copy.

review: PUBG is one of the few games that I supported during early access and returned to after its full release. There are many reasons to enjoy the game but something that has completed enraged me is the lack of response coming from community of gamers that participated in the creation of this game regarding hackers. I don't care about blue wall adjustments weapon updates or new maps. I want to be able to enjoy playing a game using the mechanics intened for the players. Due to the lack of response from the game developers coupled with the overall success of PUBG I can't help but wonder if the devs actually care about the community they originally designed for or if they are only in it to make money from hackers that get banned and rebuy the game. Until this issue is properly addressed I do not recommend this game. I'll just got back to playing Getting Over It instead.

PUBG is supposed to be a somewhat realistic shooter where you fight for survival for that sweet sweet chicken dinner. If you play properly and invest your time into it. review: I think the game is ok at its current stage. I did not have any lag (related to the internet) nor did I experience any fps drop (but this is due to my good gpu D). Indeed the game can be improved on the system requirements part on some aspects. The game is fun and so far I did not meet any cheaters or hackers to ruin my game (played around 8 9 matches). If you enjoyed ARMA2 like games in the past and want to play something similar and with a bit of Hunger Games ideea you should try this out. A match in this game lasts around 30 minutes (this can vary depending on how you play). It can become anyoing at times if you are not carefull with your surroundings but every match is different from the other and that makes the game enjoyable. Also you always are on the run due to the fact that the playzone map shrinks every 2 4 minutes and you have to get on your way. I will update my review if anything pops up.UPDATE So far so good still not complaining about the game at around 60h of gameplay.

review: This game found perhaps accidentally an addictive recipe at its core. The gun play + movement planning to get yourself in the best possible position for a win is really rewarding.But sadly it comes with lots of issues random crashes de sync lagging hit boxes getting stuck on badly modeled points on the maps vehicle physics that resemble a spastic balloon with wheels.There is allot of work still needed to take this game from very appealing to great. Other companies have seen the BR genre success. If another game comes out with a similar chemistry but is more polished overall it might prove this game to be nothing more than a "start of a new FPS sub genre" bubble. I'd hate to see them lose allot of active players over time due to optimization and server/network faults. Despite my ing I'm still playing. Guess I just like chicken...

review: Extremely addictive gameplay or at least for me it is. I don't play the game by myself so I can't review solo queue but I think duo and squad are extremely fun.. I love third person shooters. I love picking different places to land. I love the scavenging and basic weapon customization. I love the teamwork and I love the shenanigians that ensue. Even some of the bad things about the game are just funny. The gun play is very good for the most part. There are problems with the game but for early access I'd say it is ahead of the curve. I will warn the sweaty try hards to either steer clear or try to chill out. You will die a lot. You will often die to some sniper on a hill or roof. You will die because you didn't find a gun right away and another player did. Here's the thing though it doesn't matter. you just requeue nearly instantly and start over. You lose absolutely nothing. Winning gets you a bit more in game credits that you can spend on that doesn't matter like hats. Just chill out and embrace whatever the game hands you.

review: It's hard to overstate what a magnificent exploration and adventure game Subnautica is.What really stands out to me is that experience not an XP bar but the accumulation of knowledge about the game world its locations and its inhabitants is the most powerful weapon in a player's arsenal.Take Stalkers for example They're the first large predators a player will meet and initially they're annoying and seem quite threatening. An experienced player will ignore them though or at most circle and poke them with a knife to make them go away while at the same time stealing all of their scrap. It helps to have upgraded swim fins upgraded O2 and other advantages but if you took upgraded fins and O2 tanks away from experienced players they still wouldn't have any issues with Stalkers.There's a lot to find and a lot to do in this game. The need to unravel the game's central mysteries and to obtain blueprint fragments salvage and rare materials from wrecks grottoes and strange installations will force you to leave your comfort zone time and again. First you'll crawl out of the Safe Shallows then you'll creep further and deeper then you'll swim further still until one day you'll be amazed at how far away from Lifepod 5 you've gone at the readout on your depth meter and you'll wonder how you ever thought that the seaweed areas just outside of the Safe Shallows were in any way scary.Sustenance is a challenge at first and you'll scramble to get enough food and water but later on they become a matter of management and planning ahead. If you're going on a long expedition you'll want enough supplies to last for the duration but not so many that you can't haul a goodly amount of salvage back to base.As for fiddly stuff you can spend hours building and customizing your underwater habitat customize the look and module loadout of the various vehicles you can build (once you've got the complete blueprints and necessary materials) and have a lot of fun with the wide array of gadgets and Portal/Half Life style "techno guns" the game has to offer. There's a lot of meat there but the true meal lies in exploration.Even at the very end of the game though armed with all the technology you've spent hours pulling out of wrecks and scanning (typically while watching your O2 meter like a hawk and listening nervously to that angry predator thrashing around outside) you'll never feel completely safe or at ease. There are great dangers lying in wait and you'd better hope you spot them on your sonar before their sonar catches wind of you....

review: honestly a really fun game but there are a couple of tweaks that need to be changed in order for it to become my main game...1. let us pick which map they said they will impliment this in a future patch but they should have done it as soon as there was more than 1 map2. let us host our own private servers. every other game lets us host out own servers to practice without becoming a partner not really sure why we cant on this game3. there are bugs where deathcam doesnt work right i think they are working on this now.4. 4x scopes are really weird to get used to especially for the ak and dp 285. car physics on the new map are really annoying. the old physics would have been much worse but it seems like every car you get into is going to tumble down evey hill dealing insane damage to both you and your car that is unavoidable. I found that the 2 person bike is insanely good on the new map because you control how the bike rotates. making this bike more common on the new map would be a really good improvement.6. boosting in some cars makes it sound like somebody is in another car chasing you7. visibility is most cars is rediculus when trying to locate air drops you need to stop the car and get out just to get your bearings8. i think they should release the specific gun stats but i guess this one isnt as important as the other oneshaving that been said there is a lot of really good things that the devs do well that you do not oftern see in other games 1. anti cheat this is huge for me and is one of the main reasons i still play this game. the devs have absolutly no tolerance for cheating. seeing them keep us updated on their anti cheat process makes me know they care about the integrity of the game. i used to play counter strike where they barely even mention their anti cheat system so this is a giant upgrade2. the server size of 100 is perfect. i tried playing h1z1 before this game came into beta and to have 150 people in a server was way too much for me to handle3. they are constantly improving the game doesnt really get stale. at least for me
