review: Bugs and issues with optimization are so common and expected that no one bothers to bring is up except in the form of a joke. Even though things are so bad the developers keep finding ways to make it worse and with recent attempts at anti cheat they did exactly that. A program I commonly use for the work I do from home is now prohibited by the anti cheat. VMWare Workstation creates virtual computers/machines which can be used for a number of things like setting up a web server to test your code on trying out a new operating system running an old operating system so you can use an old program that does not work well on new systems or to keep software isolated from your network and host operating system.This software is very common among IT professionals and many other programs do the same thing but from what I can tell only VMware is prohibited. Cheaters that are using vmware virtual machines to cheat could just as easily use other virtualization software like the one built into Windows 10 Pro or they could literally just use a 2nd computer!These developers are not making any real effort to fix cheating if they think this is a solution.The game does offer something unique and I'll keep playing it with friends when they want to but the quality of the game is not what I'm here for and you shouldn't have any expectations in that regard.

review: What else to say? This game rocks. Sure it's early access and things are buggy and broken as all hell and sure it has it's fair share of cheaters and hackers like any other game but trust me when I say it rocks. Pros and Cons of this kick game.Cons Obviously bugs that need to be patched cheaters/hackers Asian country advertizers AFKs who farm for cash and for some reason people don't read that CPU and GPU requirements and get all pissy about it. That is their fault. Not really a con but make sure your PC can run the game!Pros ENDLESS hours of play each game is different winning a game is an actual accomplishment (even if some people have won 300 and I've only won 3) lots of different start locations this game requires tactics and planning to win instead of CoD run and gun play by yourself with a friend or a group(!) $29.99USD and it doesn't cost any more for any maps they will release or guns they add or anything (unlike a certain Electronic Arts game dev team (COUGH COUGH))All in all I give this game a 9/10. Some problems with this game PUBG Corp. cant fix but the ones they can they are really working hard to fix...Why are you still reading this? Buy the game already and 1v1 me m8!

review: The game PUBG is a very fun game at times. IN my near 500 hours of experience I've had many great moments with my friends and overall it isn't the worst game ever (better than fortnite). That being said it's a mess. I have died numerous times to the new "vaulting" added to the game. Typically I would vault over a small fence or sandbags only to fall through the ground. Speaking of falling I have also lost due to teleporting down a somewhat steep mountain and dying with no teamates near to revive me. More often then not it is very steep and is my fault but 30% of the time I am thrown down the mountain to my death. Another huge fault is hackers. I will admit to previously making false cheatong claims in many games such as Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege and other such games but this game has a genuine problem. In my last game I was head locked 3 times and my friend calmed me down seeing my death in his death cam. However my friend said and I quote "Wait what the hell" as I was traced by a red dot sight down a wall him being unable to see me due to the thickness of the dot. My final issue is the new map or if you're reading this later Miramar. This map is a huge wasteland of terribly designed copy paste buildings that are so repetitive that after at least 100 hours I can't name even half of the cities. If you're being shot he could either be in the mountains in front of you the mountains behind you the mountains on your left or the 19 story 72 windowed apartment complex and you'll have no idea due to the immense size and absurd blending of people and objects. Also the revolvers are sh*t but that doesn't matter. Despite all of this I still give it a 7.5/10 because at its core its an incredible game of skill but as you play more you experience the problems that I have listed and many more. Again is better than Fortnite so buy it.

review: The good Shooting mechanic feel pretty good. Its a great 100 player survival deathmatch but an even better duo or squad team based tactical shooter. There is many ways to play and enjoy it. The bad Despite all the success improvements to the game have been very underwhelming and I suspect the team behind it is either very small or of questionable skill. Not only that but they are very greedy and have diverted alot of ressources to micro transaction console versions and planned mobile versions and that before the game was even out of early access. Also every second game is filled with laggers and cheaters. The NA servers are filled with high ping thirdworlders who don't speak a lick of english so you better have friends online or be ready to play nothing but solo.At this pont im just waiting for real developpers to come around and create a better battle royale so that I can jump ship.

review: I understand that this game is still in early access and therefore you should expect some inconveniences when it comes to gameplay etc. but this is a bit weird even when you take that in consideration.I can't compare my experience to the earlier stages when the game was still fresh on the market but i can't really recommend this game anyways and here is why Really low FPS (even though the setup was exceeding the recommended spec) even though the game is out for a relatively long time. Such things should have priority when it comes to fixing issues (instead of microtransactions (only cosmetic though but still microtransactions) Clunky interactions with objects (for example doors) Randomness (might actually be a + if you like that aspect) things are completely random when it comes to loot i was playing a couple of games searched 3 locations (houses) where at least 1 little ranged weapon should be present but no i only found ammo armor and melee weapons.I imagine that this game can be a lot of fun when you play with friends (not that much if you play solo) but currently i think there are better options on the market which can even be played for free.

If only they'd use the money from the income to mainly focus improvement it will do a great to its community.If you want to play a fun battle royal game and had the best rig i still recommend it. review: I am a Chinese player PUBG is a good game but I think it is a pity that it was developed by Blue Hole. I know that Chinese players are not popular in this game but I also hope that friends all over the world know that most Chinese players want to play games with foreign friends. Because the plug in rampant friends around me also started to use plug in which made me very sad I have heard that the plug in code used by Chinese players was stolen from foreign forums and sold to Chinese players after packaging. As a Chinese player I was ashamed and helpless for this kind of behavior by some Chinese players. Lock China is so popular abroad. As a Chinese player I believe it is understandable. Because the behavior of some Chinese players turns all Chinese players into people who can be discriminated against Tencent has represented this game in China. I only hope that Tencent can do anti plugging measures. I really like PUBG this game can get better and better But I don't want it to be run by a company like Blue Hole. Of course I know it's impossibleso YOU!Blue Hole

review: This game is one of my favorite games of all time. Some people hate on it just because of Fortnite or they actually have a reason to hate it. I love the fact that they have 2 maps to choose from (3rd one coming sone hopefully) And they also have a nice character customization. I dont want to have to bring Fortnite into this review but when talking about customization Fortnite is lacking alot of this. I like how you dont have to waste real money on currency in game just to by an outfit. In this game you can play get BP (battle points) And get crates. This game does have something that you can buy though with real money which is a key which works on 2 special crates. The gameplay needs a little bit more optimization but other than that it is perfect. I think it was a good idea to remove guns from spawn island (dont hate on me for saying this) because it now doesnt lag at all for me in spawn. Random spawn locations is another good part because it might give you an idea of where you want to go. This also helps with optimization. Now getting on to gameplay I like how certain guns have certain modes (single burst full auto) and the fact that you can find ammo without the gun just stitting there. I think one thing they need to fix is how you will sometimes randomly take damage after parachuting. Its not too big of a concern but a little bit more of health would be nice. It also concerns me that you will be reloading your gun and you do something minor and it cancels the reloading process. I support the fact that it does not tell you the certain flight path of the plane so you can make choises very quickly. Overall I think this is an amazing game and even though I rage sometimes I still get sucked back into it. 9.1/10

review: UPDATE I am still holding strong on my belief that Bluehole should implement Region Locks. Lets expand on why they have not done this for a moment....Bluehole is a business and their main focus is making money. With that said the RAMPANT problem with cheaters in this game has been showcased and advertised as a problem by Bluehole and the company has mentioned fighting cheaters almost weekly. Yet after banning almost 3 MILLION players in the last few months sales are still flooding in at 2.4 MILLION since the last wave of bans. The "Ban Repurchase" scheme is Bluehole's main source of revenue. Again with that said cheating still remains a HUGE issue on PC but the same problem is non existent on the XBOX One version of the game. Why is this?The XBOX One uses a closed source OS therefore has no cheaters and MOST IMPORTANTLY does not have a public market to sell cosmetic items earned in game. This market that exists on Steam is the number one reward for cheaters and a second source of revenue for Bluehole and Steam alike. Truth can be found in the simple fact that the PC version although it is in a "final release" state receives an enormous amount of attention/updates/hotfixes/advertisement from the Company while the XBOX version is in a "pre release alpha" stage and receives almost zero attention/updates/hotfixes/advertisement from the Company. This simple fact can be explained. The XBOX version has no cheaters therefore the main source of revenue is non existent and XBOX has no market to sell/purchase in game items. Not having these two main sources of revenue on the XBOX One version means the Company's resources do not focus on this version which is clearly seen.

review: We all learn to crawl before we can walk and walk before we can run. PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds takes this sentiment of natural improvement and deconstructs in a way that seems almost intentional. In the world of game development I believe there exists a naive assumption that (more $ faster improvement) and although that can be the case to a certain degree often the foundation of a game may be too rocky to fix quickly. For PUBG the highest selling game on Steam money must actually be the fuel for the Twilight Zone fire that exists at their development studio. There is no other explanation. "How harsh you are you must be a salty consumer!" I can hear being thought as you've made it this far into this review "What is the point you're trying to make give me specifics."Well let us go down the laundry list of things that BlueHole (not blue balls never utter those words) has accomplished.Since the game has been available Develop a great and interesting take on the Battle Royal Genre and become an insane best seller Add cosmetics to the game locked behind loot crates to increase revenue (reasonable if Version 1.0 was a complete game in my opinion) Refuse to region lock due to fear of "xenophobia" Attempt 'E sports' while changing core aspects of the game to induce better competitive play while not doing the same for the live game (removing the Red Zone from competitive that everyone loves) Mess with the gunplay net code optimization (good thing clothing is still everywhere on the map) to such a degree that I'm starting to believe that Ray Charles came back from the grave and got a degree in Game Development Rush a game to 1.0 although it is not even close to being finished Start to hemorrhage users to a free cartoon game which made a Battle Royal mode as an aside (and is actually quite fun) Push an untested update to both live and test servers that is horribly laggy for some users and makes the game literally un launchable for others (myself included) Ignore people on Reddit and Twitter voicing their concerns over not being able to play a game they paid money for and is in full release '1.0' Refuse to roll back the update because of this fantastic 'Anti Cheat' they've implemented and instead blame user's hardware and software for these issues. Honestly BlueBa...Bluehole this Anti Cheat better undo Dr. Disrespects infidelity and bring Jesus back from the grave because the level of ineptitude and brashness from a studio flush with that much cash is ing embarrassing. At this rate I expect version 2.0 to be 4fps still filled with cheaters and resemble Goldeneye 64 in terms of control and graphics (no disrespect to a great game from 20 years ago)Would I recommend? When it works absolutely.Do I trust Bluehole to stop collectively doing whippets and making the game worse with every update? I'm not so sureAm I being unreasonable for wanting to play a full release (1.0) game I haven't been able to launch for 4 days? You decide
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is unoptimised bullsh!t. It should stay in beta. Theyve come a long way but it's mnot geared or optimised at all to be released to the masses. The games now broken for me and many many others since their last update. Sure they were able to shorten load times and gain a significant amount of of performance a good deal of it actually. But now i'm left with "forced closes" damn near everygame at one point or another. if i get killed early yay for me because a game was concluded. but if i play and make it the long haul sure as sh!t. The game force closes. Sure it studdered before but at least i got to play FULL games and not get shut down either in the middle of a fight or while finding good LOOT. It never did this before and makes me want to punch the en screen with frustration. I've never had a PC game that ever forced closed like this EVER. maybe once or twice trying max settings with DOOM3 back in 2004. But never like this never every en game. The game and its mechanics are great absolutely fun and exiting. sometimes on the edge of your seat wracked with nervousnous as the game counts down to 5 to 10 players left and you can almost taste that "chicken dinner". It's amazingly done very very well. Hats off to Player Unknown (Brendan Greene) for an amazing job with game mechnics bringing Battle Royale style gameplay to the masses. I just wish you'd come back home and work with American developers and publishers because them Korean Bluehole(s) are running your game to The game functions to the point where i cant even say its playable anymore. it literally shuts down every game. This is and was a product that should not have ever been brought out of beta. I can't play until the next patch and by then i can only hope that the bug is identified but we all know one fix may possibly break another. The previous batch of players who complained and ed before are probably enjoying a great and fun optimised game for them. I'm part of the new batch of people who can no longer play and the viscious cycle contines. Until the next patch maybe YOU ARE NEXT!Great Game buy if you want to chance it. i'd say the game running well for you with no issues vs a completely wrecked prematurely developed alpha feeling game is about 50/50. Who knows? you could be part of the playing group. vent end

review: My personal system is a pc laptop 2.5/3.5ghz i5 quadcore (A10 5757M) with 6GB ram and a cooling pad. Other reviews suggested a solid state drive to run this game my system should at least load it up some error prevented me getting past the loading area. I got a refund.UPDATE Got a 2.8/3.8ghz i7 quadcore pc laptop (i7 4810MQ) with 32gb ram cooling pad and SSD. Gets past the loading screen still have to run on limited graphics options basically minimum everything.I'm 200hours in. It's fun but due to the massive amount of players who don't stay on their home servers it's not very fun.I would like there to be 2 major updates. I would like to be able to have ENGLISH SPEAKING TEAM SELECTION. Obviously NA/AS server selection is not enough. I want to be able to select my language and report players who are not on the same language. Also I would like to see AUTODETECT SERVER SETTINGS. Too many people who aren't from North America on the North America server. I shouldn't have to tolerate lag playing on the EU server just because I want an English team. There is only 2 native North American languages English and Spanish and the only nonEnglish language I hear is Chinese etc.I would like to choose more criteria for team selection. Language Age and Ping would be a good start.

review: Runs like sticky diarrhea oh a sweaty day looks as bland a wet cracker shooting in third person switches the view to first person and is jarring it's just not really a fun game. 3/10Everyone knows what the game is a 100 people drop into a map and fight to be the last alive and a circle shrinks forcing people together to fight of it kills them. I'm a fan of the idea but this game doesn't have anything special going for it. Yet it's made so much money and has a massive player base it hurts and I get regularly annoyed playing this game because it's just not fun don't feel like I'm getting my money s worth and am reminded at its undeserved success first game I felt strongly enough about to leave a negative review.Pros + some moments of suspense or action when playing with friends+ very big map+ finding a game is fast but still the game loads in very slowCons vehicles physics are cancer looks like aids no care art not doing it for me sluggish movement if bad breath could be converted into animations PUBG used that of a crackheads who drinks from toilets running around at the start of the game waiting for building LODs to load in unplayable can't distinguish guns/loot clearly slows down gameplay 90% of time running around for 10% of action or even rare suspense loot doesn't make sense pistol in a house next to shotgun choke next to shotgun choke next toMore Cons/possible glitches some games I only load in after everyone's left the plane on very low settings sometimes loading in happens after I hit the ground and the loading screen doesn't leave unplayable internet is fine on every other game but this most often unplayable

review: Ah PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds. What an exciting interesting and fun game. I have clocked in almost 186 hours into this game I've had it since it was a wee little game. Now if the topic of PUBG comes up I always say "Ya know it's a good game not a working game but a good one." No doubt in my mind that this game is fun and almost every round my friends and I get a good fight or have an amazing laugh. With the graphics wise I've always had to keep my graphics very low (I don't know my specs all I know it's an old all in one Asus desktop) the window shrunk down and screen scale down as well. Throughout my 186 hours of playing although the developers have made great strides and a few times have almost set themselves up for failure. For low budget crappy gamers like myself the optimization for our games has from what I've found is amazing. I went from having my window of the game no smaller than my phone with everything low to pull 15 20 FPS to having it about the size of a tablet low graphics decent screen scale and around 25 30 FPS. To put that in perspective I used to not be able to fire the micro uzi in full auto otherwise I'd drop to 2 FPS now I can fire it without any drop in FPS. For me that is amazing. The introduction of new weapons was amazing and by god do I remember the thrill of vaulting over a stone wall for the first time. It changed the dynamic of fighting so vastly I remember just jumping over a wall and killing 2 people who were after me. These things are what makes me want to recommend this game. Sadly there are other issues that if weren't there would make the price so worth it. The glitches and bugs first of all can ruin a whole game due to them. Glitching a motorcycle into a fence thus blowing up only 40 meters from a nearby crate with an M249 (which I highly recommend getting cause its just &lt 3 ). The introduction of the new map was good and bad. My friends and I we were excitied for this new map because it was different and promised new this and that and oh new guns and look at this sand ooooOooOo. What we got was either going to the middle of the desert not having a gun or having a crappy one with no sight for 200 meters then getting shot by someone who looted in that Hacienda not far from you. Seriously the lack of loot in the desert map makes it barely playable it forces you to fight over the P92 which for some people that's the best part and probably what was intended but it just isn't fun sometimes. Now the most frustrating irriating almost making me racially profile people issue are the Chinese hackers and players. They are swarming our servers making it impossible to say "Hey pal" without someone saying something back at you in Chinese..probably telling us "hah we hack your server get rekt". Yes I know the anti cheat is doing its best but there's gotta be something someone can do to stop this overpopulation of Chinese hackers and hackers in general. I've seen people teleporting away having no recoil aimbot shooting a M249 through mountains to kill the last 10 people alive god mode grenade resistance speed the list could go on and I bet you that the list could go on from other stories of hackers. It's just these things that screw up gameplay ruin the whole expirence which is why that if I had to recommend this game I believe I would but obviously with the warning THIS GAME IS FULL OF HACKERS BUGS GLITCHES UNFAIR LOOT AT TIMES ETC. review: PUBG is definitely a good game but the management of PUBG Corp. belonging to Bluehole offsets the advantages of PUBG. Many hackers will try to cheat and some players will try to team up in solo queue. PUBG Corp. does NOT deal with these people properly and innocent people (including you) will have to endure the damages. Optimization and server problems also prevent you from enjoying the game. If your PC is not good enough it will occasionally cause lag and bugs. Since lag is fatal to playing this game it may not be possible to play smoothly if there is any server delay. Someday if PUBG Corp.(or Bluehole) solve those problems I'd be glad to recommend you to play this game but not now.I am not a native speaker of English. But I wrote this in English because I hope that my review can be helpful for many people. So If there's anything that does not make sense please let me know. XD

review: Playerunknown's Battleground has a lot of interesting features that makes the game very immersive. For starters if you joke about kicking someone in the mouth IRL while playing this game you might get banned. This features let's you really feel like you're a part of the game and is a whole new take on modern gaming.Vehicles is very realistic. For example if you're driving on a dirt road and hit a small pebble you have a 50/50% chance to go from 60mph to a dead stop or just randomly take damage. As looting and parachuting as of now is all skill based and no RNG is involved what so ever I feel this was a nescessary step for the developers to take just so the skill roof can be lowered a little bit.BrownHole has also been very good at balancing the game. A few patches ago there was a huuuge improvement to the very overpowered performance imbalance. Many players with good computers suddenly experienced a huge FPS boost which I guess BrownHole thought was not fair for players with not so good computers so they implemented a few new memory leaks to the maps so you could not get a stable 60fps+ so it's fair for those who is rendering the game at ultra LOW settings.All in all this game feels very smooth if you generally don't mind a game that goes from 120fps out in the field to 30fps when you are about to engage a cowering foe in the city.This game does NOT feel like it's still an Early Access title and I'm thinking the developers did a good job finishing the game before they released it.Would recommend to friends? Yes. (Not really I'd rather eat my own off).

review: What can I say about this game? You can love it and then hate in a matter of minutes. Love how each kill can be very satisfying especially if you're one to fight at school and come out victorious. The other when you barely land down manage to get at least a hand gun and boom someone in full gear takes you out exaggerating but you get the point. There are a lot of things I would like to change in game like the drop rate on scopes if you're a player that likes to take it slow and stealthy in the game you sghould have that option. Instead players that are more aggressive that land at School or Military base always come out with high tier gear. I understand the reason but I go into a game with no scopes to be found even in big cities and get knocked out. This game is both based on skill and major RNG in the early game. I would still recommend this game to anyone that would like to purchase it. It is especially fun with friends and the idea of using tactics to approach your target and not mindlessly go and shoot people is a game worth playing. Now that Patch 1.0 is finally coming out we can finally get better quality of life changes in this game and cant wait to see for future changes to come.

review: I havent really had any problems with cheaters or crowding from other regions and the optimization is pretty good now in my eyes. The changes i wish for is in game mechanics 1. when you play with other people and are a passanger i wish the character would stay in the car after it gets knocked instead of falling out trough the door actually this goes for the driver too. having the option to exit a vehicle but not enter one.2. when being a passenger i wish the player could heal while the car is in motion but the driver cannot! except if heald by a teamate in the car! wich brings me to number 3.3. teamates can heal eachother instead of swapping loot for the same purpose4.If jumping from a speeding car you currently get knocked wich is fair ish. I wish there was a rolling animation that inhabilitated you from acting a certain amount of time up to a certain speed instead of being knocked unless the speed is too great.5. Bodyparts take damage effects. When shot in the leg added to hp loss i wish there was a physical animation and impaired movement same for arms when aiming untill healed or medicated.6. I wish the vehicle physics were better..7. I wish everything weren't so clean..8. I wish when aiming in a moving vehicle the movent would be less static compared to the car. i dont mind the difficulty aiming while driving i just wish it was more fluid or "damped" and delayed " you know... like more realistic P but still just as hard to aim though!!9. I wish vehicles spawned in more varied areas like in carages at cabins or just abandoned somewhere! These are my wishes for PUBG but not limited to this list DI think the game is great nevertheless!

review: What can I say about PUBG? the game is amazing.. hands down the best battle royale game out there. The Shooting mechanics are functional with plenty of guns to choose from all with realistic feel and various recoil patterns to get used to. Never a wait to get into a match wether it be solo duo or squad matches due to the unreal amount of players online at any given time. (usually 2mil+). Thats a nice change of pace when compared to other battle royal games out there that will have you waiting aroud 5 min or more to get into a match (H1Z1 erm...). The Graphics range from servicable to good depending on what part of the map your near and assuming you have the rediculously powered rig to play on ultra settings.. (game is still poorly optimized as of the 1.0 release leaving it unnecessarily demanding in the specs dept.) Immersion is key for this type of game and PUBG gets this rite every time. Wether your cornered in a building listening to every foot step the enemy makes to get a grip on the situation or going from compound to compound hunting players you feel like your there. Gettting that sought after chicken dinner after a hard fight feels great every time. The only major gripe i have with the game is the crazy amount of Asian players coming to the NA servers. Its to the point that i have gotten a non english speaking teamate 30/30 times when queing for a duo match. Kinda hard to stradegize with someone who doesnt speak your language. If that happened once or twice i wouldnt care but EVERY SINGLE TIME is rediculous and breaks the game for me. The only alternative is to play solo games but that gets boring real fast. Its because of this one issue that i cant reccomend this game as of now. Dont pay 30 bucks simply to be stuck playing nothing but solos because every time you join a duo or squad you get teamates that dont understand you on your own server.i7 7700k 4.2 GHZEVGA GTX 1080 8GB DDR532GB RAM1TB Samsung SSD

review: After 200 hours in this game I feel like I can leave a decent review. This game is an awesome Battle Royale experience with each game leaving you feeling exhilerated. There are a few issues with the game but that is because it is EARLY ACCESS... something which a lot of players cannot seem to grasp. The devs are constantly working on improving the game bringing new content and creating an outstanding overall experience. There is no such thing as pay to win with PUBG you win by being the best and choosing your positioning and shots carefully. I would highly recommend this game to anyone looking for an intense but enjoyable battle royale experience. However for those of you who like pro/con lists I'll leave one of my own.Pros highly active dev team is constantly working to improve the game rounds typically only last about 20 30 minutes TOPS gameplay is fun especially when you're trying to survive with friends HUGE adrenaline rush when you get into firefights or make top 10 there is nothing quite as rewarding as Chicken DinnerCons the game IS early access so it's still got issues and bugs that need ironing out from time to time a good bit of the game can be spent sprinting/looting if you're not running into people (or choosing not to engage) if you die early in the game during a squads match you may have to watch your friends play better than you (git gud scrub!)All this being said PUBG is a very enjoyable round based game that is great to play with friends or even solo (sometimes solo queue is easier because enemies die instantly but you can't play with yo frands). I will say that since it is early access and scheduled to go into full release in the future you'd be doing your wallet a favor by getting it now since the price will most likely change upon full release. But hey you do you man.

review: Gun play and overall game is really fun but doing solo games is real cancer. In solo everyone just hides and waits for you to cross their path. But doing duos or squads? that is fun everyone is out and about looting and real firefights break out. Its a shame though because you get the most rewards in solo mode.There is good variety in loot and more to come every month. The map is also the perfect size for a 100 person battle royal you'll usually go 5 minutes between encounters.UPDATE They have just introduced "keys" into the game... which you need to unlock the best kind o floot box. How do you get keys? you BUY them with REAL money. I know we usually never make a fuss over cosmetic micro trasnsactions but these crates are the only loot in the entire game. These are some greedy developers

review: First This game is a lot of fun it was hard at first getting over the fact that you don't have a 50% chance of winning. But even in losing you still feel accomplished often. Rarely has a game with 2 maps held my attention for this long.BUT (HUGE but) All of the North American (NA) servers are infested with Chinese players. And sadly a large proportion of the hacking/cheating seems to come from that region. Hence I can't get a squad together who I can talk to and I've lost several games in the last minutes to a random headshot from someone who was looking the other direction at 100+ meters. I do wish it was region locked for the language issue primarily. It seems cheaters are coming around faster than they can be banned so even if the developer is issuing lots of bans it feels like they aren't. And ultimately it's what we see in game that determines the amount of fun we can have. Bottom Line If I continue to see mostly chinese players and cannot communicate...I'm sure this games days are numbered for me.

review: So far during my 18 hours of gameplay I have really like this game. This has been my first experience with the battle royale genre but learing how to play the game wasn't that hard you eventually get the hang out it. My time with the game has overall been positive and it is enhanced when you get into a squad with friends you can have a lot of fun. Although there are some things that I gripe about this game they are very few. Rendering is sometimes really wonky but is usually only a problem for me when I barely start the game (for example in the starting zone when you wait for the match to start) optimization isn't the best but I at least get an average of 60 70fps on high settings keeping in mind that I have a pretty average pc build nothing too fancy. There are also some problems with hit detection as many people have been killed behind walls or you randomly get killed by a vehicle explosion even though you are far away from it. But even with this I overall really enjoyed the game even if it is early access I would recommend it to people who enjoy a game where you have every man for himself. I have yet to run into cheaters but I am bound to find some later on

review: I used to love this game. It ran well on my computer and was always really tense and captivating.However recently this game has skyrocketed into a burning fire of explosive death. By that I mean it got bad. Real bad.Hackers are everywhere and I always find myself being traced through a wall at long range or being instantly aimboted with absolutely no chance to defend myself.And that's not even the worst part.The servers. EVERY SINGLE KILLCAM only the first shot I take gets registered. Just recently i gunned down someone at point blank with four shots of the sk12 shotgun and the killcam revealed that only 1 had registered. But seriously. That was the last time I died.And EVERY SINGLE KILLCAM this week 90% of my shots fired haven't registered. THIS IS NOT AN EXAGGERATION. I couln't find A SINGLE KILLCAM whereas the rit registration was not broken.I know people want to region lock china to get rid of hackers but I think this is just blame coming from the awful servers this game has.Don't waste your money because your friends say the game is cool and it looks cool. Just don't. You'll only gain rage quits and eventually quit the game itself for good because it just doesn't function.P.S. as a top 2% solo FPP player don't just say I missed and it wasn't the servers. Because I would know.

review: I bought the game very recently and it started off fine. Just some long loading screens a couple of times but nothing too bad. Then the game all of a sudden started crashing every time I attempted to open it. It couldn't even stay full screen before my whole screen would go black and go back to the desktop. I uninstalled it twice and re downloaded it. I checked the integrity of the files to no avail and updated the game entirely. I wanna know if others are having the same problem. THIS GAME HAS SO MUCH POTENTIAL. So other than the fact I blew thirty dollars and within two days the game decided to stop working sucks. Other than that the game is very fun to play.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I really tried hard to like this game. I won't lie it was super fun playing this game in the beginning and winning a match for the first time was an amazing experience but the game just seemed to worsen. They added micro transactions and followed the greedy path of many game companies. They had this whole "stream honking" thing where a lot of innocent people would honk and get banned because they were accused of "stream honking" a streamer. Hackers. Hackers everywhere. Server lag. Ridiculously hard game to run unless you've got the ultimate $1500+ build. All of these things just overall ruined the experience for me. I don't ever play this game anymore unless I'm playing with a friend who wants me to play it. I hope they can fix their problems and shape this into the best battle royale experience it could possibly be. Don't go down the micro transaction road that H1Z1 did.

review: Incredible Game. Having played both the Test Server and Base Game I love this game. It's a fun mix of casual gameplay challenge and fun. The only problems I can see are the many glitches but luckily they do not happen often but a lot of them do cause you to have to exit a match or lose one early. I am hoping these glitches are gone in 1.0. The new map Miramir is an intresting mix of urban combat and vast open spaces. With the new vaulting and climbing animations being added the game is ironing itself out. Weapons are a definite mix of good and bad with luck and tactics being a massive part of finding the good weapons like a Kar98K or an M4. Overall The game is a masterpiece and is definitely (IMHO) better than Fortnite. (I have played Fortnite so I think I can make that Comparison). 9.7/10

review: For a game designed to be fair and esports friendly the inconsistencies ranging from server issues to ridiculous bugs leave a bitter taste that only gets worse. You will be more upset than happy more disappointed than satisfied more outraged than pleased while playing this game. The sole reason for the player count despite negative reviews is that the alternatives are far worse than PUBG. For any type of game I would overlook things like dying instantly while climbing a ledge a bike instantly killing you while trying to make it stand or people not dying despite 2 point blank hits to the belly with a shotgun because of abysmal tick rate and server capacity but not this game. This is a battle royale game and any unfair element can not be forgiven. Working your off for 20 minutes giving your all fully focused and then dying to uncontrollable flaws in the game is frankly a common experience in this game. I used to think the bugs and lag were exaggerated and the game was still pretty playable but after 100 hours when the joy of winning your first game or getting several kills in a game disappear I see the truth now. This is a game with great potential that tries it's absolute hardest to give the players a bad experience. You can make only a fraction of money as before crate prices dropped hard I'd much rather make money trading in tf2 than this. There isn't much reason to play this game you will hate this game more than you love it. Only buy it if you are into battle royale games &gt &gt &gt AND&lt &lt &lt have friends to play it with. Otherwise it's just not worth it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS You Start In a plane flying above an island later you jump out and start falling against the island I have played this game for about 55 hours and under this short time i have played a great game that i will love for along time. This game is like The Hunger Games you fight for your own life or maybe with some friends against 96 99 other players that have the same objective to be the The Last Man Standing Under the time this game has been out i have seen multiple copies of this game. But the other games never gets better Than Pubg. This game may not be so good optimized BUT everyone may not realize this game is still in Early Access The Textures are great and the servers are also great for dealing with 100 players at the same time the weapons are also realistic made meaning that suppressors dont to less damaged that others games do to balance the game. This is a game about the best and the strongest person that can be the last man standing.Originally posted by Gabriel Slayga

It is a very interesting concept and it is clear the devs care a lot about the game. however the netcode is pure the game is very unoptimized. Compared to a game like csgo this is filled with random bugs netcode errors disconnections crashes and a funamentally sort of bad engine under the game. The real problem with this is that the devs are focused on new maps and cosmetics more than fixing all the awful "little" things that make this game far more frustrating than it needs to be.

review: After about 100 hours on this game I may say that this is probably on my top 3 list of games.I love the fact that there is no tutorial so you are forced to learn from your mistakes. I won some times and the adrenaline rush in the end of the game when you suddenly notice it's just you and another person left or your team and another team.All the weapons are useable but some are ofcourse a must have. Like the Kar98k or the SKS. The loot you can get from crates could be worked on. I don't think there needs to be a tommygun. I would rather like it a lot more if it could spawn somewhere around the map.Speaking of map. I really like the map in the game. If there were no zone. Where you are forced to move to somewhere in the circle the map would have felt boring. There has been comfirmed that a new map will come I hope its soon )))
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game in its current state is highly recommended. I played it with my friends (double the fun) and solo and can honestly say its one of my all time favourite games. Rushing people while screaming ALLAHU AKBAR and throwing grenades through the window.9/10Pros + Giant map+ Tons of loot+ Always watching your back the thrill of it+ Developers working hard to fix any issues+ Can only camp for a little while before being forced to move by the circle+ Cirlce is random hard to guess where youll end up+ Can hide in plain open field in the grass and still hard to spot youCons Door sometimes look opened but you cant go through it (gotta open the opened door...glitchy) Main menu keeps getting stuck and have to re launch the game (especially when playing with friends) That bag Mark32 who teabagged my friend while making sexual noisesOverall the game is amazing and i love it! def worth the price!

review: Hello everyone considering to buy this I normally don't bother with steam reviews but this is one of the few I will bother writing. Honestly this game is a lot of fun and great to play with friends. The developers are pretty good about keeping things updated and adding new features to the game while failing in other areas.When this game was released I took the plunge as many others and graciously parted with money to support BlueHole. I am writing this review to warn everyone considering buying this to close up your wallet and do not support these developers. I logged in yesterday in quite a shock to find out I had a ban placed on my account. After settling down from the complete surprise/shock at this I began to think about how I possibly could have been banned as I am not a person that supports cheating and would never consider doing it in an online game. I contacted BlueHole through the forums to apply for a ban appeal. I received a reply fourteen (14) hours after my correspondence that supposedly they had found evidence of my supposed cheating? and the ban would not be repealed. Like I said before I have been playing this game since it came out and have been playing exactly the same way I have always played. The only thing unusual that has happened in a recent play experience is I was having lag issues and would keep getting those little teleport/stutterinig movements that everyone gets from time to time which I assume people thought I was speedhacking or something and so reported me.Long story short I have tried to resolve this unjust ban peacefully with BlueHole and they apparently don't seem to care. I am warning everyone that is considering buying this that to please think about what I have wrote and really consider if supporting these guys are worth it or not. They banned me without verifying any of their actual logs (which if they had they would have seen I was having latency issues) and proclaim to have seen evidence. THank you all for your time and I hope you don't end up in my same situation over no fault of your own.UPDATE Dec 20 2017So I am following up with this original post as the developers decided to remove the game ban they placed on my Steam account. Honestly how I feel about the game hasn't changed it is a good game and I will stand by it. I am also glad that the developers have at least granted my wish to remove the mark from my 10+ year steam account. You might be asking then why is this review still negative? I am reluctant to play again for the fear I might get falsely accused and banned again through no fault of my own and until this kind of treatment stops occuring to myself and others this review will stay the way it is.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Honestly this is my second account. I couldn't really suggest getting this game in the current state. I would feel comfortable saying that at least 3/10 deaths are due to hackers confirmed through death cam or replay mode. This game has literally never felt like it's gotten better only gotten worse. The new map is absolute trash you can just get on reddit and read how everyone is there isn't a map selection because a lot of people would prefer not to play that hole new map. I have 400 hours on another account plus what I have on this account and it's honestly to the point espcially with paid crates that the little bugs or quirks with the game are no longer funny. I would suggest just getting fortnite. It's cartoony but you're going to have a way better playing experience. I had a lot of high hopes for this game. I thought Greene would actually take care of his own game. After him calling the playerbase Xenophobes because we want china region locked because you can't even find a majority of english speaking players on the NA servers and the fact that most hacks are coming from china... I would say you couldn't honestly rely on greene to ever take a stance against the chinese playerbase since that is by far the largest in the community. Let them go ahead and ruin the NA servers and just wait for another battle royale game to come out.

Some of the mechanic's need to be addressed by the dev team they need to implement a ping lock or ping penalty for those playing the game with super high pings (giving them the advantage over everyone else). Other than that PUBG has a nice variety of weapons and attachments simple user interface and the objective isnt very easy to understand. The game is a lot more fun with a group of friends than it is solo but I find myself playing solo a lot anyways just to try and improve my skill.

review: My first day or two of playing this game was intense. It was something I'd never experienced and I quickly figured out that by being strategic with my movement spending about 50% of my game time crawling through the grass and getting a few lucky shotgun kills by surprising someone in a house I could make the top ten fairly well. In Solo FPS I ended up averaging a top 15% rating after a week. But sneaking around and waiting with baited breath for someone to eventually find me and headshot me lost it's enjoyment factor pretty quickly. I came to realize that with my setup combat was simply impossible and a purely hiding victory while possible was incredibly unlikely. I feel a big part of the problem is that this game is so incredibly poorly optimized. I have had to give up playing it. It has so many latency issues and is so incredibly demanding on your computer that if you don't have a top end system and bleeding fast internet it ends up just being incredibly frustrating. For reference I have a Dell XPS 15 16gb DDR5 Rame i7 NVIDIA 960 GTX... nothing great but above the minimum specs for sure. Yet I die time and time again to someone simply because my FPS freaks out or my lag is 100ms more than someone else. Especially frustrating is that there is no way to know in real time what your latency is. If this were possible you could at least know "Oh my latency is 450 ms at the moment I won't bother playing till the servers are working better." You can't even be sure whether it is actually latency or a graphics issue... Not having a high end graphics card means you end up shooting at bushes as much as people. Potentially a REALLY fun game but in reality a REALLY frustrating game if you don't have a bleeding edge gaming computer and a ridiculously fast internet connection. Got a 1080TI? Enjoy waiting in a corner of a roof for 5 minutes? You'll love this game. Other wise... pass.

review: Now that i have sufficient hardware (1080 i7) to run the game at ultra setings at an average 100 fps i can safely say thet while the game can be fun occasionly when i play alone however it only really shines when playing with others. i only have on freind who plays the game and even that gets old. the moment to moment game play of running in a straight line hoping you dont get instantly killed from some guy off in the hills far behind or to the side of you is just un fun and occasionaly just boring. i spent so much time with insufficient hardware and running the game was a dream for me but now that it is a reality i can easily see where the game in my opinion has its faults. review: Let me explain a situation Me and my duo mate were running Georgepool and were tearing it up. Great loot and we were in a fantasitc position to win. We got into the third zone with 15 people left. I went to equip a tac stock that my teammate gave me. The game then proceeded to freeze. Not only was I unable to quit the game but I was also unable to open the task manager in the foreground.. thus in order to re enter the game I had to restart my computer. Once restarted I was able to reload into the game and continue the game. However JUST AS THE GAME DOES 35 40% OF THE TIME... IT GOT STUCK ON THE LOADING SCREEN. THIS GAME IS THE MOST FRUSTRATING PIECE OF CRAP BUT IS SUPER ADDICTING. YOU WILL LOVE IT DESPISE IT AND REGRET THE $30 YOU SPENT BUT WILL ALSO NOT WANT TO STOP PLAYING. If there is a more optimised replacement to this game I will for sure start to play that over this garbage game. But until then PUBG is the ultimate love/hate relationship out there.

review: I had earlier reviewed when it was in early access and gave it a thumbs up. Now that it is out of early access I am changing that. As a full release I expected a lot more. It is still poorly optimized interfaces unintuitive and buggy. Additionally there are a high amount of cheaters. Following the introduction of deathcam replays I saw for myself actual cheaters kill me. I am not talking about lucky shots through walls or something but standing on hills miles from anyone just getting headshots within seconds from each other. It seems developer is trying to do something about this but it is too little in comparison to the high amount of cheating. Additionally there is still no ability to create custom matches unless you have a server with them. Also there is no ability to choose the map that you want (i cant stand Miramar). We still only have two maps available to choose from. The only thing that has kept the game going is the gameplay which is what attarcted me in the first play. Its strategic merciless and rewarding even when you lose. After all the sales and millions of millions of dollars this game has made I would expect a more fuller experience. But it seems the developer is currently unable to adapt. If it continues this way it will only be a matter of time before a more successful battle royal comes along to take its place as 'king of the hill'. Potentially Mavericks proving grounds. Already Fortnite has been giving it a run for its money with alot of the player base moving there.

review: Cant recommend this game because its unfinished and has countless gamebreaking issues. It wont run properly on mid mid high range PCs even on the lowest graphics settings because of poor optimization. It wont look like anything even resembling the advertised gameplay footage unless your running a top of the range PC.If you can get it running smoothly you will still experience frame drops which will result in death in many situations. More often than it should be 1v1 fights will be down to who has the best graphics performance during the fight.Finally the amount of content is poor one game mode either FPS or 3rd person two maps and thats it.It's really fun when working properly but it cant be recommended at this stage they've made more than enough money to justify fixing and polishing this game before its 1.0 release.

review: It is good. But it does not go to the extremes of the spectrum where the gunfights are not intense due to instant respawns or the game is a literal walking simulator where the looting period is freaking hours long. Guns are satisfying to shoot and require actual skill to wield. Great game to play with friends. Make sure to turn off voice chat with everyone in lobby to avoid the ridiculously expensive medical bills that accompany stage 4 brain cancer.

review: I love this game. Its fun its addicting its intense and its frusturating and its so damn satisfying. I'll go in order ) I find this game addicting because its action packed you decide your role you're the star! I also find it so intense playing it you play this and i think i see someone so i shove my face into the screen but when i decide its not someone i dont seem to move away. I enjoy having that feel that something could happen at any time anywhere. It might be confusing because youd think you dont want a game thats frusturating? Well its true when i get at this game i say i hate it and but thats because im then the next game i kill someone and am i frusturated still? No! You get frusturated so easily and that probably because you just played an hour long game to get 2nd. it happens. the same will happen to the 2nd person when you get first! ) But the fact is it happens. Accept it Move on Move foward. Win. But then its so god damn ing satisfying when you go in a fight kill someone and loot them. You just got 1/100 closer to 1st place ) then again by now 50 people are dead so your 49 closer right? Getting 2nd may be frusturating but then again.. You had a 2/100 chance to get 2nd right? So feel proud and happy that you got this far! But what i love MOST about this game is my first reason. Its addicting. For me? I love league its such a fun game for me ive always loved it for years. Recently i cant say the same and im sad to say that i want to find that love and joy for the game again to be honest. but the thing about league is.. If you get at league when your in a game.. You cant leave.. Youll get banned then be MORE When your having a bad game and you die you get and you keep dying you KEEP getting . You cant leave and your just digging a hole by being in that game.. It sucks although when you win its really nice.. But the thing about pubg is that.. you play it your way. You can decide how you play. Remember? YOU are the star of the show. You decide whether your going to play an hour long game where you play passive and get a high score.. or you decide where your having a 10 minute game where you just fight and try to survive as long as possible. This is saying your not ing shourd where you run face first into school with a pan and still come out on top. (Metaphor) In other words you decide where your going to have an action packed game or a safe game. ALSO!!!! YOU CAN LEAVE LOL So when you get Just leave! You wont get punished ) As far as i know lol but i really reccomend this game enjoy )

Is this really the finished product? If so this is the most clunky badly omptimized and all around messy made fully developed game that I've ever played. Less than satisfactory gunplay AWFUL hit registration and extremely gumpy movement mechanics. Again this game is all kinds of fun. But there's no way in hell that a game that has recieved this much publicity money and fame should have the plethora of issues that this game has.

review: This is in no way shape or form ready for the 1.0 release date.Simple reason This game is in ALPHA version and i'm being generious.Detailed reason Server broken teleportation and occasion shooting blanks Gun shoots but bullet never came out . UI looks like a game made in the very early 2000s Graphic Stupid settings that makes you choose between ADVANTAGE mode or early 2000s graphic mode.If this is suppose to be a competitive game every single information given to the each and every players HAVE to be CONSISTENT. Every single shadow and strand of grass should be identical. Or else what's the point of player when it's not even fair? Controles Crouch jumping shouldn't even be a thing. If it should then you SHOULDNT need to press c and space! It should be just space! "No we want to make it part of the gameplay" says devANYBODY can use third party keybinding! and i can bet that you will have NO WAY of banning or even detecting that.Audio Terrible volume all over the damn place!Content For 30$ this is a RIP OFF. Same damn unfinished and unpolished map with same guns etc etc over and over again! A 30$ game with one map and a dozen guns! Think about that!Speaking of RIP OFF when you buy this 30$ game they'll let you play for a while and then ban you for no valid reason. You gave them your money anyway so that's a big "F U" from Bluehole!Gameplay Has the potential to be VERY addictive. But sadly the gameplay is LACKING and BROKEN. 90% of the gameplay mechanics don't reliably work. So that chiken dinner well it's like buying a lottery ticket to win another lottery ticket! The game will let you win when it feels like it!so like i said lightyears away from being a finished 30$ game

But all these can be overlooked if you really like it the only problem that can't be is the cheaters. There are cheaters in all shooter games make no mistake BUT because of the battle royale nature of this game ( dying game over ) you'll have to start all over again looting until another cheaters kills you that ruins the game. On top of that now the crates you buy cosmetics require a real money key to unlock which is really pathetic and greedy the game already has 3+ million players clearly they don t need extra cash. If you don t mind all these problems i mention then i hope you enjoy it but careful not to regret it as i did. Remember that you can refund it if you play less than 2 hours.

review: You jump land and fight for your survival. No walking simulator. No grind. No progression. You land loot fight loot win/lose. Repeat.There's no 1 hour of walking through forests and plains to reach your destination.Relatively small map sprint without needing to rest. Lots of vechicles spawn all around the map and there's plenty of gascans if you need 'em.PROS I won't bother listing everything since there's so many positive things about this game. Just try it and refund if you dislike it.CONS You can't 1st person aim with your weapon if you're too near a tree/stone. Have to take a step back. Stiff characters. Only one map which can get a bit boring after you've sunk plenty of hours into it. I'm starting to feel it myself. A few bugs here and there graphical and sound. (Sound example had a sound bug that played the sound of "bullets falling/dropping to the floor" ceaselessly. You realise that you wasted so many hours in DayZ when you could've just waited for this game to come out. If there ever is a shop with skins your wallet will become start getting thinner.

review: Make no mistake this game is great.....................IF IT WOULD ING WORK HALF THE GOD DAMN TIMEI swear just about all the times I have died its been due to lag on the servers and games end. I know for a fact its not my PC its just that this game has some of the absolute WORST optimization performance and connection issues ive seen in a while. In its current state this game is flat out not worth the asking price.However lets talk positive. WHEN IT DOES WORK its easily the best Battle Royale out there. Its fun with friends or solo. Theres a million and one types of guns varying levels of armor and helmets random med supplies. All of this while it can seem unfair in the game if you get rolled by someone with better stuff than you its really not unless the game. Its luck. and thats part of the game and this genre. The graphics are nice if a bit unpolished and when it works everything looks as it shouldBUT. swinging right back around. notice how many times i had to add "if the game is working" or something along those lines before like HALF of the good things? Thats how serious this games issues are. The team is making steps in the right direction but as of right now theyre giant ink splotches on an otherwise decent paper.Do not buy this game. At least not yet. Wait a bit till it can run smoothly and the servers stop being Unless you know youll be playing it consistently and for a while its not worth your money.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I spent a couple of months debating on if I should get this game or not. It looked really fun but some of the reviews turned me away from making the purchase. Finally I decided to just go for it. In the nearly 30 hours I have played I have not regretted that for one second. The game has flaws and issues but in my opinion it is heavily outweighed by the amount of fun I have playing this game. It is not action packed and fast like a lot of games are and there are a lot of times where you will play a 20 minute game and not see a single person only to be killed by someone you never saw. However there have been plenty of moments where my adrenaline is pumping and my heart feels like it is beating out of my chest because of how intense of a moment I am in. If you are like me and going back and forth trying to decide if you want to spend your money on this game my recommendation is to go ahead and do it. I think you will get $30 of enjoyment and entertainment from this game.Update I can confirm that Asians do in fact play this game. After 35 hours I have not experienced a death where I felt the other player was cheating.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Satisfying shooting mechanics. However the technical aspect of the game is such a downside. Even since official launch of the game same issues remain from EA state. Such as desync server performance lag hit registration. Some other minor aspects I dislike is the size of the maps. I think it is too huge for what the gameplay is trying achieve. That result in lame game pace sometimes you just don't see opponents for 10 to 15 minutes.Briefly the overall idea and basic mechanics are great. But with all the downside it brings I give that review a thumbdown. I still think it can be improved but I doubt that's the direction it's taking...
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. Garbage engine garbage game. The input lag is terrible and loading is unoptimized. Don't buy this just to hop on the bandwagon. It isn't worth the money and I doubt it ever will be. A 4th Gen i7 and RX480 should be able to run current realeases at least on medium with no stutter/input lag (hint 99% still do!). The most recent patches seem to have made things go from hardly tolerable to much worse. All evidence of a company with too much money behind their briches and no idea what they are doing. Also the Unreal Engine is at least 40% to blame for this trainwreck. Unity (even as bad as that is) would have been leagues better performance wise for early access content like this.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It has a lot of potential but under no circumstances is it ready for an official release or a release on console. There are so many glitches it is unreal. The physics are extremely unconsistent. Driving is okay until you hit a small bump and flip your brand new car you took 5 minutes trying to find. The shooting mechanics are alright. The main thing that's bad is the optimization. You shouldn't need a 1080 graphics card to run high settings. The high settings don't even look that great compared to other games. Overall it's a fun game but the glitches and optimization need to be addressed before an official release is even thought about.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Although I dislike the way the shrinking borders are implemented such that you very frequently find yourself doing nothing but sprint towards the next play area for the entire duration of a round without stopping just to keep ahead of the encroaching border until you are finally one shot by an enemy who was waiting for you to arrive hiding in a location that made it impossible for you to even see them that isn't the reason why I'm giving it a negative review.Although I dislike the degree to which your success depends on getting lucky and finding one of the more powerful weapons (english for dummies "degree to which your success depends on luck" is not the same as saying "the game is entirely dependant on luck") and also getting a vehicle and also getting some kind of optics for your gun that lets you see another player before they see you that isn't the reason why I'm giving it a negative review.Although I dislike the fact that despite the map being truly enormous the game always plays out the same and the different areas of the map don't open up the possibility for new strategies hazards rewards or gameplay that isn't the reason why I'm giving it a negative review.Although I dislike the fact that there is only one map and there aren't different environments like deserts or snow or thick forests or swamps that have unique weather effects that impact the game in different ways and there is no night time scenario and in the 20 hours I've played I have only seen rain ONCE that isn't the reason why I'm giving it a negative review.And although I dislike the fact that in any given encounter between two players the third person perspective gives one of them a massive advantage over the other like how the player who is opening a door can see the player inside the room when that player can't see them or how positioning the camera correctly lets you see someone through a window who can't see you that isn't the reason why I'm giving it a negative review.No the reason I'm giving it a negative review is because this game has already sold over 5.5 million copies. This game is such a massive game changing phenomenon that it doesn't matter if I or even the entire userbase of Steam join in the chorus of negative reviews complaining about micro transactions and warning people not to buy it. It's like reviewing the Half Life series 20 years later and saying "Don't buy these games because Valve still hasn't made Half Life 3 and probably never will". You're a little late it's already a massive success. The people who are the type of gamer who would be interested in this game appear to have already bought it and any review at this point whether it is positive or negative is just whispers in the wind.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: TERRIBLE GAME MADE FROM A GOOD CONCEPT. As a competitive game it's incredibly important to make sure everyone sees the same things and has the same advantages and disadvantages. However PUBG allows players with Low and Very Low settings a MASSIVE advantage by removing grass cover. More than once my screen (set to high detail) has shown me in tall deep grass that would obscure me completely and then I'm shot dead. I watch the kill cam and the other player is using low settings and his screen SHOWS NO GRASS OR COVER AROUND MY CHARACTER. After spending 30 minutes carefully beating 95 other people I loose to a developers poor choice. If I could get a refund I would. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME UNTIL THIS IS FIXED!

review: I love PUBG but it has two problems right now. The first is hacking there are so many hackers/scripters who are making the experience terrible for legit players. Every second or third game I find myself fighting a hacker in squad mode on OCE. The second issue is people from other regions playing on servers on the other side of the world. They can't communicate with you they lag all over the place and I think depending on where they originate are responsbile for a majority of the hacking concerns I listed earlier. Implement tighter hacking detection and region lock/ping lock servers please!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After 224 hrs spent on this game I cannot recommend it to anybody. The game is in a very poor state. Most of the issues come from BlueHole's decision to utilize client side processing for practically everything fundamental to this game. Guys with technical know how can come bash me all they want about it but all i know is this. This game is ripe full of hackers and bugs that people exploit and ruin the gaming experience for everybody else almost exclusively due to the client side aspects of this game. For me i could care less about vaulting new maps new guns or graphical updates when the fundamental FPS aspect of this game is soo unwieldy and clumsy. From dying behind cover to out of region desyncers taking 4 5 shots on your screen only to turn around and two shot you. This game finds soo many ways to be completely abysmal even tho the underlying premise of the game has soo much potential. Maybe in the future I'll consider returning to this game when Bluehole decides to be a responsible game developer and focus on fixing current broken fundamental game mechanics instead of pushing out microtransactions superficial updates and claiming this game is ready for the Pro scene.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is a massive battle arena featuring 100 players who drop from an airplane at a time of their choosing on one of two massive maps. Once on the ground you must search houses police stations barns etc to find weapons armor ammunition first aid supplies and weapon attachments. As time goes on the play area continually shrinks until only a few hundred square meters of the tens of square kilometers map is available for play.Players can play in squads duos or solo in either first or third person perspective. The name of the game is survival you have one life and once it's gone it's back to the lobby. Permadeath and a massive world with countless hiding places creates unbelieveable tension. When the game is functioning properly it's a ton of fun!Lately this game has become overrun with cheaters (using OBVIOUS and BLATANT hacks) and people from distant regions which gain an advantage due to their higher ping. Aimbots ESP speed hacks etc abound. This game is a ton of fun but dying to someone who is obviously cheating every fifth game or so is not. Bluehole needs to fix this ASAP or I forsee that their meteoric rise will lead to a meteoric crash. Player numbers have already taken a dip and with problems like this it's not difficult to see the dip becoming a precipitious decline.Fix your game or there will be a mass exodus when someone like DICE gets their act together creates a less buggy and cheating infested battle arena game and blows you out of the water.

review: Gameplay 10/10Mechanics 3/10After playing this game for well over 500 hours I can safely say that this game depends a lot more on luck and experience than aiming. You could have the greatest aim in the world and still lose fights to people like me who don't have good aim but have a lot of experience game sense and most importantly luck. This game has a ing huge luck factor whether it is safe zones gun spawns or just positioning in general. This combined with the shooting mechanics and a horrendous D Sync issue just makes the game unplayable at times. Onto the less important more in depth stuff Hackers have always been a problem for this game but recently the amount of hackers just ing skyrocketed. Thankfully the team behind the game actually care about reports and even ban hackers from the footage you send them through their forums. Another issue I personally have is the balancing of some weapons if you get annoyed easily just don't read from this point on because it will be me ing. AKM is ing unplayable because of the recoil and isn't even worth mastering since it almost has the same DPS as the m4 and has less DPS than the m16. And the level 3 helmet should just be ing removed from the game I wouldn't be able to count how many games I lost because the last guy had a level 3 helmet and I couldn't one shot him.

review: This game is ok. I will say once the developers put more focus on response and stability to play (think of it as Battlefield 4 stability and smoothness needed) this will be a great game. I dont play it because everything i do is either glitchy the way i move feels weird or is problems with the game that cause it to crash all the time. Now let me clarify im not saying this isnt a title i wouldnt buy i DID buy it because my friends have it and so do my co workers and the times i looked passed all the bugs and glitches and performance issues i really did enjoy it but i feel if this game is going to truely succeed they need to make it more responsive.... a good example is when i walk up on a door and press E or a controller button (depending on how you play) it sometimes will fly open sometimes wont open at all or sometimes will open then close. This isnt a big issue but still i would like this game to have the "fluidness" of playing some big title like Battlefield 4 or COD. Those games you feel smooth when running and walking the game balances well with large numbers of players and it doesnt crash often...... so without furher gripe on my end i would say get the game the developers will probably fix all of these eventually and this has been one of the biggest games of 2017 so get it. be warned though its not the most fluid game out there but its still enjoyable with friends.

review: Update to my original review (which was positive) My original review was done with the hopes that the developers would get their stride following their overwhelming success. I hoped they would prioritize the bugs and hackers. Instead they implemented fog added a new weapon.... and thats it.In the time I've owned this game BlueBalls has become a $4B company and their development speed has slowed to a snail's pace.This is quickly turning into a prime example of why early access screws the consumer. Pubg is as popular now as it will ever be the amount of money that BlueBalls stands to make off Pubg by releasing it fully will be miniscule compared to what they could make if they say.... made another game and just leave pubg to rot.I have been sorely disappointed with the development of this game. Optimization is terrible there are so many bugs that you can go on youtube and find thousands of hilarious videos of people finding bugs in the game. Hackers... my god. In the past month alone BlueBalls has banned an excess of 300 000 accounts! Let that sink in... They have banned that many people and it still is completely unplayable from hackers. This coming from a game that wants to become an esport.. lmfao. I've consistently ranked top 1 000 in every ladder since the ladder systems first were implemented. The hacking has never been worse than it is now. Prior to about a month and a half ago I never accused anyone of cheating. Now I can't go a single game without feeling like I was screwed because of a hacker.Don't worry guys... vault will MAYBE be in the game before release.Too bad the servers will be empty cause people don't have time to deal with bugs and hackers waiting for a feature that should have been implemented 2 months ago.Positives A ton of fun to play with your friends (seriously the option to not queue with randoms in a competitive game and play at a disadvantage is something that every competitive game should consider) Lots of replayability Twitch was fun to watchCons Sells itself as a competitive game when you literally can't play two games in a row without running into a hacker Months after release simple bugs are still in the game. For example it took them a full month to fix the bug where NA players defaulted to Asia servers at the main menu Cross continent gameplay hackers galore Every other game is either fog or rain. What this means is that a game where there are 100 people before the first bullet is fired there will be less than 60 people in the game (because everyone leaves these games). Vehicle mechanics are hilariously bad Armor needs to be normalized or removed entirely. There will be game after game where you literally stop shooting people because you assume they can't possibly still be alive... and then they shoot you in the back. Shotguns are completely unreliable half the time I will shoot someone from 50 feet away and kill them instantly. The other half of the time I will point blank someone in the throat and there will be zero hit recognition. The game is an FPS yet its shooting system is mediocre at best flat out unplayable at worst The garbage servers... I won't even Early access cash grabOld Review For the love of God when is a AAA company going to make one of these games? Is the game fun? YeaShould you buy it to play with friends? Yea Is the combat garbage? AbsolutelyAre the servers complete dog sh*t? Every dayWill half of your deaths be completely bogus with no rhyme or reason as to why you died? Yep
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

I would be aiming across the window but the bullet would actually take half a second to shoot out of the ing gun at which point I'm already moving to cover which will then result in shooting the window sill. Just the overall connection is a mess and the mechanics are complete senseless. Plus why would you not give an option where we can just zero in instead of hipfire when pushing right mouse key? Give an OPTION so that we can play as we see fit.
