review: Based on 1.0Ok this Game has great graphic and the sound is just amazing. Like echoes silencer sounds and engines now with the new 1.0 update the horn of cars tho hopefully gets an update DThe best thing that really creates a good atmosphere is the sound and with it all around it like the new second map now that is huge and i like much better then the first one ( does not mean the first one is ). I love the vaulting feature where you can climb up things jump into buildings through windows you have more tactical choices in building battles then before.Now as it goes with those type of games finding good weapons and choosing your strategy accordingly is important but often it comes down to who has the ranged weapons in the end especially when it is an open field you have to run through to get to the safe zone. But thats part of the game and choosing the right terrain to go through is as important as positions to defend and luck sometimes with the zone especially towards the end.Now everybody plays this game differently most are for engangement others like to play safe to get to the end. You just have to find a way that works for you and when you get to #1 it feels like a good rush because in the end in a small area is hitting the fan and choices/no reaction will get you killed or not. From early access to now the game has just gotten better and with the new additions to it i will play more now then in ea because i like the new additions a lot.I can absolutely recommend this game especially when you have people to play it with.

Until China is region locked I give this game a well deserving 1/10 if and when China is region locked my review will turn positive and my enjoyment of the game will return. Failure to listen to your fans is the worst thing you can do as a game developer.

review: Concept wise this is the best battle royale game out there but if we look at everything else this game is the worst. I enjoyed it at first but the more you play the more you resent this game. It has endless graphics bugs sometimes you start the game with wallhack and no clip and you have an unfair advantage over other players. And theres even more ways to cheat your way through the game like removing fog so you can see further removing terrain textures so you can see better around trees and rocks.Furthermore the games engine is awfully unoptimized and you cannot run it on a decent gaming computer. I've got a high end gaming laptop and all i can squeeze is 40 fps at best with all settings on low and even some extra changes in my video card settings. If you want to run this smoothly on medium graphics youre laptop should be in the 1 5k 2k euro/dollar price range and for desktops it should be somewhere around 1k.Developer wise it seems that all they care about is making profit because they are rolling out these alpha at best game copies for 30 euros ( not including micro transactions for in game items that give you advantage in game) full of bugs. The game is worse now than it was 2 3 weeks ago. When i first bought this game i could run it kind of smoothly on 40 fps right now the average fps i get is 25 30. It seems that theyre breaking the game even more. Not to mention the game stutters that occur between updates. With one update they fix some stuff but they break something else. Theres endless audio/ voice glitches too. If you want to use the ingame communication you're out of luck. Your microphone sometimes stops working mid game and you have to restart it just to get it back going. Also the sound of the game cuts out but it usually comes back within couple of seconds.I WOULD NOT recommend you buying this game at the current state. Because this is the worst 30 euros i have spent on a game EVER! I really enjoyed playing this game at first but the bugs cheaters and developer attitude towards customers are making us furious. Hopefully something changes in the near future if not this game will die in a couple of months
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It seems like a lot of people are having performance issues so here are my specs before I talk about how it works well for meEVGA 1060AMD FX 835016GB RAMI play on high ultra settings excluding the AA or shadows. I get 60+ fps in most areas.The 1.0 release has made a huge difference in performance and I personally would recommend this game if you enjoy a pseudo realistic military sim battle royale.Pros Lots of fun especially with friends. Wide open environments and a high replay value.Cons Since the update I've had more problems with the vehicles clipping into the ground and damaging as if I had rammed straight into a rock. I can't matchmake with a teammate that speaks my language half the time. It seems like every other player on the NA server is from China.

review: Game crashed twice in full release for "bad module info". I don't know how to prevent it but it's not ready for full release. The introduction of mantle/climbing is great.Playing with Others Cons If you don't have friends find some. You're in for a world of hurt if you continue down the path of duos/squads by yourself since you won't hear English/Spanish/French on a NA server. Pros Playing with your friends is a lot of fun. Opens up a different style of gameplay compared to soloPlaying by yourself Pros You don't have to worry about language anymore because it's you vs the others. Cons Everyone likes to lay in the grass in this mode.Play skyrim if you want a true single player experience. If region lock is too xenophobic introduce a language preference so you can choose language and communication style(silent chatty) because you know... its 2018
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Bought the game during Early Access and this is the first game that I play like this. 100 people fighting to the death constantly having to move and pick up better gear and weapons in order to win. Solo is super intense can be a little slow at times depending how you play. Squad mode is pretty fun if you have a team that communicates with one another. Full version is out right now and I don't really experience "hackers" that most people are talking about but I play this game during my freetime which is inconsistent. The new map is pretty interesting and I like this game a lot I just wish I had more time to play this game (Damn Pre Med Student Life). Overall pretty damn good game just wish I was put together in a squad where the same language was common and yes I am picking my same Region! I would rate it 9/10? Not a fair rate since it is the only game I have played like this just going off my experience.

review: PUBG is the type of game where it starts off with not caring too much if you die in the first few minutes (approx 90 players alive) after a little while and some reasonable loot and gear has been found you would prefer not to die at this point but still not too fussed if you die (approx 60 70 players alive). After the 3rd/4th blue circle You start to believe that you can achieve the impossible...you could possibly win...you'll taste the sweet fruits of victory...(10 players remaining)...you've made it to top 10....but you still want more....no more mistakes or joking around now...you're close....(last 2 players)...you believe in this...you can win! But alas...you make an idiotic mistake. You end as #2.....that moment will haunt you forever...This is what will happen every game you'll feel rage anger and above all serenity when you die because you know that the game is over....until you start the next one. Welcome to the battleground.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Great game when you learn the ropes and even better with friends this game can be very rage inducing however in some situaions. This game is early access so expect bugs here and there. This game is still going through optimization upgrades so a strong computer is heavily recomended. I have a decent cpu and gpu and get between 50 70fps with an fps pack. the UI is decent and gunplay is alright solid but not the best.this game to me is20% skill 10% tactics 10%RNG(while looting)60% luckDue to the large map and large amount of players in a server literaly anything can happen in a split second that can kill you between walking into traps camping or getting sniped. That being said when you are the one doing the killing the kills feel very very rewarding. TLDR Buy it you cant go wrong for 30 bucks and its only getting better.EDIT modifying INI or game files can possibly result in getting a ban (fps packs possbly included)

review: A lot of games try to do the battle royale style thing this one just does it better 600% better. With a lot of things that add a bit of realism while not doing so annoyingly to its own detriment. Right now a lot of people are getting into the streamer politics nonsense and I won't delve into that. This is based on the game and associated content.Pros +Customizable weaponry (increasing combat effectiveness without getting annoying to the point of weapon skins like CS GO did)+Vehicles done mostly right (Tires can be popped people can be hit by shooting the vehicles. Thus your soviet era sedan is not the equivelent of an M1 Abrams.)+Bullet drop so you won't be headshotted from across the map by some kid who thinks this is COD who will then tell you to "get gud"+Hella fun to play in a squad with friends+Serious advantage given to players who actually communicate to accomplish specific objectives in an attack (As such going rambo because you don't think the team thing is gonna go your way likely won't work out.)+Rushing into a building and spraying everyone who is likely better equipped than you won't work out you have to behave like a person actually would in order to win.+Developers are absolutely dedicated and just plain awesome.+Second pro on the developers.+And a Third.+Seriously I've seen so many games abuse the "Early Access Game" title. They sell a metric ton of copies on empty promises then abandon the game. PUBG is an example of an Early Access Title progressing exactly as it's supposed to. It was extremely fun and playable upon initial release and it's only gotten better since then. The Developers seem to be pretty forward with the community and continue to improve and add content between large updates. This keeps the game from getting stale from the "same old same old" problem that games with a tri monthly update that crams all new content big and small into one load. Tl DR Dev's are upfront with the community and regularly add little things between big updates to keep the game fresh. They also don't abuse the "Early Access Game" title that so many other Developers have.Cons Randoms in matches both squad and solo are generally the purest and most refined forms of cancer known to man. (Don't get me wrong the're not all bad. But the good community members generaly aren't the ones you hear because they aren't spamming the mic.) The Vaulting animation has yet to come but it's in development so this con is essentially going to not be relevant when that particular update hits. Difficult to tell what content will be coming when. (Not complaining guns are being added. There are rumors of new maps and perhaps even a single player campaign. These things just aren't located on a standardized roadmap like with a lot of early access games.) Lobby takes A LONG FREAKIN' TIME TO LOAD ALWAYS. This has been improved 7 000 000%Final Verdict Fun solo or with friends. Better with friends though Well worth the money either way. Highly reccommended if you've got friends that play the game and you're looking for something to fill that void in your schedule. Because listen well This game can easily become an addiction.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: A day before the full game v1.0 officially releases on steam. I have to say I am very impressed with this game and especially the most recent updates. Sure there's quite a bit of glitches unregistered hits and LOTS of rubberbanding (Right when you land goes away after the first minute) in the test servers which will hopefully be fixed when it is on the official servers. Past those temporary problems this game is a near perfect Battle Royale experience. It can be a little slow paced at times but it always keeps you on your toes waiting to hear shots or to get shot when you are running in the open desert. No other game gives the same experience as this one and I highly recommend it in it's current state. (Oh and I don't recommend this game if you have anything less than a gtx 1060 and a recent recent generation core i5. You will get low framerates and sturrering on a low end system)

review: PUBG is the most fun game you should never buy. I can't really do anything more than reiterate what has been said a thousand times but please DON"T BUY THIS GAME. I've had it since about two months before 1.0. PUBG is probably the biggest game in the world right now and the developers could not care less about the community. Nothing has been done about region locking the game except for PlayerUnknown calling his playerbase racist for wanting to be able to communicate with one another. Cheating is rampant. The game still runs like garbage. Rather than taking the obscene fortune they have amassed from the millions of sales and using it to fix the game they implement a horrid new loot box system to milk even more money from players. And on top of all of that they have the audacity to call this broken mess a full release game. It was a ton of fun at first but it quickly became apparent that that fun came from the stolen game concept not from the passion of the developers. If this game hasn't gone full DAYZ within two years I'll be amazed.

review: It could be fun but it simply isn't after the initial gimmicks. It is one thing to enforce players to fight when they have gear such as with Archeage in high loot gear areas but it is another thing to play loot tag for a half an hour while praying on RNG to even give you simple items. It is simply not fun. There is a reason people rage quite easily in this game.Anarchy Reigns had a superior Battle Royale but it relied on Japanese sales so there were very few people to play with.I also take issue with this game stating they invented this genre. Sorry it's been out for years in varying formats all the way back to PS2 when one could connect it to the internet.This game is a waste of money and a waste of potential. The boats for example are very limited in their usage. This game could have easily had more advanced boots to have fights on. And even cruisers. But no the boat is mainly for transport which is silly and boring.

review: If you dont have any friends to play I'm sorry you most likely will not play it....There are CHINESE people everywhere (even South America servers) those that DO NOT SPEAK A WORD IN ENGLISH (at least) so they jump everywhere they want they mostly dont follow the group and so many things that ruins the SQUAD or DUO mode with random players (there are some exceptions but 90% does the described).BUGsEven after the so expected first real release there are still some strange bugs as invisible walls which your car can crash on it and take some damage (I didnt die yet luckly). Sometimes you get stuck with you parachute on the top of the buildings and suddenly you are dropped from there taking some damage...MACROsThis not only the chinese are using but A LOT OF PEOPLE from EVERYWHERE is using some macro which makes their game has NO RECOIL at all so if you are dumb as me and dont play using macros you are also left to the lucky!HACKERsI read some reviews before actually buying this game a lot of people saying ChinaRegionBlock etc... but just in the game you can see and feel what is going on with these chinese people...I've stopped playing 2 days ago after two hackers killed all my team in less than 30 seconds we were 3 the first 2 guys died in the car in movement (in the replay you can see NO RECOIL and SNAPPING between my two partners) I was the last one and managed to hide inside of a building the other hacker came from the other side of road and killed me THROUGH the WALL! All of this with NO RECOIL at all which makes me believe he and his friend were using some HACK AND MACRO!!! (I'm telling this based on the replays not only by what I felt on the game feel free to take a look on https //www.youtube.com/watch?v yQOKFB6RuN8 )These hackers were there just 3 days after the update which was supposed to have a better anti cheat system (#fail)...

review: I have played for 500+hrs and maybe around 100+ on test server. I can say this is one of the best games ! Honestly 1.0! AMAZING! Hands down.Don't let the reviews scare you. This is my honest feeling about the game.Solo Can be challenging You either die within the first 30sec or you end up killing some poor soul that is trying to enjoy the game but you ended up gunning him down anyways. So you made it past the first 2 min gun shots are popping off near you. People do one or two things.. 1) Aggressive player Follows the gun shots and attemps to kill everyone around ( About 15% of the people who try this can do it) 2) House Keeping The guy that waits till gun shots stop and goes in to clean the guy looting .. (Enough said with that one) Now at this point you are either in the Zone or Driving/Running to the Zone.. Those Driving or running 50% end up getting shot and killed. The other 50% make it to the middle of the zone camp in a house or are out looking for kills.After flipping your car.. Running a guy down Gunning someone down.. you are in the Top 10 and either you get picked out by a sniper or fragged... RIP... Chicken Dinner !! You won your first game.. Congrats.. you got 1kill ... Duo You cannot go wrong with Duo's .. The amount of enjoyment in duo is legit over 9000!! You guys play together calling shots kill everyone the millitary base! Load out with Silence M4 lvl 3 gear Both got a Kar98 8x Silenced man! life is good! Bang bang! you guys killing it both got 9 kills each reaching the end of the zone! Chicken Dinner.. EZPZ if you got a good friend or team8 its legit amazing!! ORYall s*** and ... well you know you made it half way but didnt win.. Don't worry keep at it legit everyone can get a win... okay not everyone..Squad Where do you start man... its so fun! gun shots everywhere 4 squads landing at the same spot! granades flying Bullets Smokes Beating people down with your fist or a PAN!! amazing. You got that one guy on your team.. he doesnt know how to drive so gets all you killed!! Then you make it and there is people already camping the middle of the circle! your team rolls up and just get's LIT UP! no return.. lol.. OR you and your friends actually good and take them out! ... Either way you guys are going to have so much fun.. But sometimes you got that one guy in your team and you guys are on discord flaming each other ... lul ( We do this all the time) But legit fun!I have shot a guy mid air with a Kar98 while he was doing a flip on a bike.. I have also shot a guy inside the 5th seat aiming down the bridge (fkn bridge campers) with a K98 + 8x while car moving!Legit I flipped crashed into a tree blew up my 4man squad.. Had my Retardo team8 shot our team8 while he was down begging for help.. lmao.. ( After he killed him" DUDE! i didnt know that was you!) Back flipping on a bike with your friend! Landing on a roof top! Done that! had a 8 man fist fight! its an experience ...Hacker's In all my hours on PUBG ( I only play NA) I have encounter i want to say 10 ? maybe less than 15 hackers.. I can't speak for all regions but NA I haven't seen a lot. Although.. its really annoying when you do get killed by one.This is my opinion on the game. I have had a lot of fun and a lot of games.. but you know it happens. I have gotten a lot better &amp I plan on enjoying the rest of the game. See you guys on 1.0 ! (sorry for my spelling mistakes I did see a few of them but honestly im sittinng here watching netflix at 1 30ish AM and I am not about to go back an correct them... Sorry lmao. I am lazy AF right now. ) Hope i helped at least 1 person if not then.. welph... Worth the try I love/hate the game.

review: Product received for free. The devs for this game originally did not seem too invested in the work but I have been slapped in the face with how false that assumption was 2 times in the past 2 weeks. First was when I played the Test Servers and the gameplay was much smoother than in the current build along with an insanely beautiful map. And now when the official release dropped and noticing how their servers could not handle the influx of players the devs took it down and delayed it to fix their server issues for everyone to have a pleasant gaming experience. I applaud and thank these devs for their dedication to the game and their consideration to the community. (But please crack down on hackers!)

review: edit 27 7 2017 updated review because of all the salt flowing in the review section about the microtransactions.they are COSMETICS only they dont break/change the game/gameplay/balance.people were simply waiting to jump onto something they can whine and scream about and this had to be the trigger. the game is fun the game is great the developers are great its not like they force you to spent a penny after the initial payment to buy the game you are not forced to buy these microtransactions in order to stay competitive they are purely cosmetic only if thats enough reason to downvote a great game.. then maybe just uninstall and leave you would be helping this community by NOT playing the game bye. original review.The game is made by awesome developers they really put their effort into updating this game and they listen well to the people playing it.its not a rip off of arma 3 battle royale or h1z1 king of the kill. it's already allot better + allot of extra potential if you liked those 2 mods.. or the idea of a fight to the death with plenty of weapons..do check this game out the price for early acces seems to be a problem point for some people but in my honest opinion its worth every penny.do keep in mind its early acces so its not a finished product but dayumn.. its already a very good game. ( they are working on optimisation... my pc is absolute potato atm but im having allot of fun in this game and it runs good enough )

review: Good game. Matches are long but not boring. It is really fast paced and it is sometimes full of action. 90 100 players sent to a map with a plane. You decide where to jump with your parachute and you try to survive to #1. While you make up your way to victory you will have to control your inventory find better weapons and kill the other opponents you face on the way. While the game's concept and gameplay is good of course there are some tiny problems.+Gameplay 8.5 9/10 while the gameplay is good there are problems To start with bugs. Black screens character doesn't responds see the guy's gun from the other side of the wall (happened a few times) disconnecting for no reason weird inventory / item glitches...+Graphics 8/10 This is personally my opinion. Graphics are kinda good to me could be better but is still good.(Important Note Here While the graphics are okay ish the game uses so much CPU and GPU compared to what you get.)+Concept 9 9.5/10 One of the best concepts I've seen for a few years. It kinda started a new game type. Games like Fortnite (by Epic Games) uses the same concept in their games.+Environment 9/10 Proper thought maps. Loots change everytime and can be very surprising. For an example in a big building you find nothing in a small wooden forest house you find an M4 or even a sniper. Overall 8.8/10

review: With version 1.0 releasing in a few hours I thought i would share my review.I have over 150 hours in this game so i can leave an honest review.I bought it on a whim after reading a few positive reviews I mean jumping out of an airplane with just your underwear on scavenging for weapons and fighting for your life sounds like a blast!All the negative reviews are mostly about game optimization in game purchases/ads/cheaters etc. I haven't seen cheaters for like a month so they are working on things the game is running smoother then ever (yes it still needs improvement) and for in game purchases it's just silly cosmetic items given the price point of the game im OK with that. Just remember every time you purchase DLC a loot box skin etc YOU ARE RUINING THE GAME INDUSTRY (look at the mobile game industry). I've gone the whole year just playing indie games and honestly after seeing the newest Call of Duty I'm glad for it the triple "A" studio's just keep re skinning the same old crap and selling you half a game for $79.99 CAD and expect you to pay extra for the whole thing.This game is very different from the run of the mill FPS game Every kill is meaningful and every death (almost physically) hurts. I give it a solid 2 thumbs up it'll probably win several game of the year awards and you should get on board... enough writing I'm getting hungry for a chicken dinner!

review: I have a lot of hours in this game because for a while it was the only decent mil sim battle royale in the space. It is plaqued with ridiculous desync issues lobbies that don't work half the time horrible friend/invite UI and a development team intent on adding content no one wants over fixing the glaring issues with this game. There shouldn't be a need for a #fixpubg campaign by the company that makes the game. You know what the issues are we have told you time and time again. The best thing that can happen with this game is for something better to come along and kill it and another title to learn from its mistakes.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have to give this game a negative rating which is truely sad. The game has so much potential.but the developers are too busy with new maps and skins and annecessary balancing updates to even be worried about fixing the real issues at hand. We living in South africa still have no server of our own which means you need to play EU servers which means your ping is avg 200. This means that you get headshot 2 seconds later after you stopped peaking already die ing and being shot around corners.. And dont let me even start about server lag...the have made so much money off the game but they cant fix basic issues like this. CSGO is most prob a better alternative game to this your just going to get frustrated. Plus the hackers are out of control..still !! They release numerous updates throughout the day which cause your game to crash while you are playing and when you try to reconnect and continue where you left off..if either says connection failed or the game crashes with a memory reference. I have alot of hours on the game was at on point top 0.84% on solo EU so im deff not a new player. All in all..great game+ developers shity experience not worth buying... Update the desync is so fu*ken bad i cant explain it. Loot takes time to spawn STILL!! WORST game on steam a.t.m would rather play Ring of Elysium free and much better. Leave this sh t game save your money!

review: Don't waste your time/money Pros it can feel fun when its good its REAL goodCons Rampant hackers always come back because game devs are money hungry and dont ip ban (idgaf about a internet cafe they shouldn't allow illegal activities if they care) despite a new server still lags 23/6 (aka most of the time) 30$ plus in game transactions if you actually want your character to not be another brown pants grey shoes newbie. regardless of hours do to the horrid drop rate of the good items. your mental sanity will go with your ability to process how this developer hasn't been sued for the three or four times they outright lied about an update that never came/ came without what they said it would. dying because of sound glitches dying to car glitches (your own or other players) dying to the mindnumbingly deadly first or second zone because of the lack of proper car spawns (RNG THX FOR THAT) dying to any of the other wall glitches or rack glitches which can leave you in an endless freefall an inch above the ground or a simple explosion from who knows where. (probably sound glitches again) So Dont waste your time or money this game is the only time I've ever snapped a keyboard in my life. and i dont break controllers from throwing them around because i dont want to have a controller that works only half the time So im uninstalling again with over 1600 hours. Dont think I'll reinstall this time though last time was purely to play with a friend who has uninstalled since. Dont waste your 30$PS. You'll never know if its a hacker or this broken game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is absolutely These dumbasses just cant get it right. Fix one problem and create two more. This game has literally got progessively worse. Desync is the worst ive ever played in any game. Every game you play you can be behind a wall and still be getting shot. Not to mention the creators are a bunch of scamming es. every little thing they try to make you pay for and instead of fixing whats wrong with the game they find more money schemes to try to make you spend money. "Oh you've unlocked this crate but you have to use real life money to open it". I hope this little scam of a game was worth it for the creators cause yall mother ers are going under. The numbers dont lie. No wonder over 3/4 of player base has left this game. Just another H1Z1 and DayZ. How ironic its from basically the same creator. No more buying games with his name on it.

review: PUBG is objectivelly a bad game. It's nothing but a lazy h1z1 mod put in a unreal 4 asset testing zone.Been playing this game for about 30 hours and I think I made my opinion about this game. Of all the 30 hours I spent (5% alone which was probably the worst experience ever) 90% of the times it was just me running around for 20 minutes just to be killed by some dude 5 miles away.Wouldn't be so bad if stuff actually happened along the way but it's just you in one of the most empty and unoriginal maps ever created picking up items for 30 minutes so then all of your precious time is wasted by a single 10 second moment of despair. An unaccounted variable.The maps are so god damn big and boring. Most of it is filled with the iest textures and models that would make a 12 year old browsing Unity Asset Store jealous.The only thing keeping this game alive is the same one as CS GO (A game that is gainning mold by this point) is in game bitcoin.Fortnite is a much better game in my opinion since the matches are much shorter and sweet. And overall a more acessible game (also it's free).

review: PlayerUnkown's Battlegrounds is a fantastic early access game I bought from day 1. On day 1 I bought it for myself along with 5 other copy's for my friends who I reguarly game with but who are a bit iffy about purchasing early access games due to being supporters of Day Z and Ark Survival Evolved.I have played for 175.5 hrs on record at the time of this review and have had loads of fun in the game. It is a very skill based game with luck and zone positioning being key in winning any game. Finding that rare sniper rifle or silencer can really get you excited for the win. The constant fear of not knowing where or how many people are nearby makes the gameplay in PlayerUnnknown's Battlegrounds a worthy experience.However I cannot support an early access game or in my opinion any game that locks content behind the anti consumer paywall that is the microtransaction crate system. I myself have spent over $150 USD on multiple copys of this game as I thought it was a great early access experience to be enjoyed by my friends and I. It is very dissapointing to see this game still in early access breaking its promise to not include DLC content until full release. DO NOT PAY FOR REAL MONEY KEYS! Especially on a game still in development.

review: Even though I meet minimum specs the game runs like a quadraplegic.Those .5hrs I have on record are from fiddling settings in a desperate hope to get more than 1fps.Literally 1 fps.This game is in dire need of some sort of optimization At least a little bit.Until that time I can't realistically recommend this game.****Edits/Additions****After a month and now around 65 hours it's time for an updated review.Vehicle physics very not good.Optimization They tried Definetly needs more.The hotfixes seem to break more than they fix requiring more hotfixes.My game runs slightly smoother due to their attempts at optimization and my new GPU (7770HD 1GB to an Rx 560 4GB)So far everything that's changed has been changed for the better yes even those microtransactions every other review is freaking out over the proceeds from it are being used to fund a tournament as well as a donation to charity. And the best part is they're optional all you get is clothing so if you don't want to spend more money you don't have to spend more money.

review: DO NOT WASTE your MONEY on this "Game" it's a scam.The idea for this game is great the implementation and mechanics would be better if you got a lobotomized chimanzee high on LSD and let them face roll a keyboard...wait that's insulting to the chimpanzee and a lot more credit than the Dev team deserves.Despite their "effort" to curb the MASSIVE cheating the numbers of people they have CAUGHT should suggest they made VERY VERY POOR design choices and stubbornly stick to them. It's not the cheaters fault (despite them being annoying) that the design and codng for the game ignores 20+ years of experience in FPS style games and cheating...Not to mention very often the cheats that are MOST DAMAGING to the game NEVER GET CAUGHT because they do things like let the player know where you are at all times where all the best gear is and many more. I wish I had known about the 5 hour Steam refund thing this game is a PoS covered in a turd sandwhich washed down with a cup of vomit. Ignore all the fanboi's who scream it's the greatest thing since sliced bread..like I said the idea is good the implementation could have been done better by a highly evolved ameoba.Oh yeah and this gem...if you design a game that ALLOWS friendly fire but then you implement a strict "no teamkilling" rule where you BAN people for it (see recent Steam news article)...I mean that should tell you the level of ignorance and stupidity by both "Playerunknown" and the entire development team...In recent patches things like vehicle physics and mechanics have somehow what I thought were the worst vehicle of any video game EVER got WORSE. No really...you now get randomly thrown from vehicles or you can be driing anywhere no ANYWHERE (it has happened on the paved roads more than once) hit a completely invisible "nothing" and come to a full stop and take damage like you rammed something...with nothing visible.The cheating hasn't gotten better the freezes are more common the lag continues to degrade (despite 'server optimization')...there are seriously too many problems to list I truly regret spending a single penny on this PoS

review: This game was and still is a fun game for me in the first 9 hours of game time I made it to top 10 and at one point ended up in 4th place. The learning curve isn t that difficult thanks to guides and streams and it was easy to understand the mechanics and strategy needed to get ahead and make it to the end. However I cannot recommend this game to everyone because of the following problems rampant cheaters botting monetization in the style of CSGO crates and lack of optimization for low end computers. Cheating is very rampant in this game speed hacks and wall hacks are common. As an anecdote I had to deal with a wall hacker who was able to kill me with an AKM behind a wall in a two story house he didn t even peek around the corner he simply shot me and that was it. There is also speed backs that let you run like Sonic the Hedgehog enabling you to easily get the loot you want and to waste teams out in the open. Fortunately for me I never spotted one of those users but streamers like Shroud can attest to this experience. But what makes this infuriating is that knowing that even if the cheater is banned by reports it will not stop the cheater from forking over $30 to get a new copy along with a new account. Botting makes it worse for those that need to farm BP the in game currency. Botting is an issue that affects squads and duos at the moment as someone who mainly plays solo those don t happen much on the NA solo matchmaking. But to those who do see it it s pretty straight forward afk during the plane drop and land in an area wait for the circle to close and die to being outside the play zone. During this time you can leave the game and reque for another match all the while receiving the small amount of BP. Many of these bot owners have a number of them on hand to keep farming BP is due to the monetization of these games in the form of loot crates which I will get to later. But all you need to know is that if you re in a squad or duo and that 99 100 player count suddenly drops to 30 or 40 before first circle than your match was probably full of bots. Taking the fun out of duos and squads. Now monetization is a whole other issue other because those who played CSGO will find this very familiar you get cosmetic items through crates that can make your character look badass or just plain silly. However the rarest items in these crates or the crates themselves hold a lot of value due to their rarity take for example miniskirts they are one of the hardest item to obtain from the crates and as a result they hold a lot of money that people are willing to fork over $100+. Now how do sellers get such an item? Either get lucky with a crate opening or use the bots mentioned in the previous paragraph and farm that BP. Other than this extreme example the rest of the market place has prices for certain clothing that can range from $1to $20. But keep in mind you can find most of those same items out in the field you just can t keep it after the match. That leaves us with my last pet peeve. Finally we have the game optimization. Now I understand that this is an early access game it s not fully optimized but I feel this is still worth a mention. If you have a budget PC like I do then your out of luck. This game hates lower end PC s especially those that use HDD 8 gigs of RAM and any graphics card below the NVIDIA GTX 1080. Now I understand that the Dev s are working to make this game more optimized but until then the worst thing you re going to have to do is either spend 6 hours of trouble shooting to get the game to run smoothly or spend a lot of money to either upgrade your PC or just build a new one at that point PUBG price of $30 might as well be $1000+ as that s the estimated price you re going to spend just to play this game. Until then you re going to have to deal with lots of lag poor rendering and even a freeze or blue screen of death when playing this game. In summary Player Unknowns Battlegrounds is a very fun game but it has so many issues that at the moment I can t endorse it to anyone who is interested. Right now this game is for only those that want to farm BP and make money on the steam market place cheaters and high end PC build that most of us can t afford. But should Bluehole Inc. decide to better optimize this game and deal with the exploits their userbase are using than I would give this game a full endorsement. For now it s not getting any from me.

review: I've only played a few games. All in which I have died. Once from a firefight. Twice from not paying attention to the Forcefield. Nonetheless I am really enjoying this game. I like the engine it runs off of and the open survival world. Stalking prey running for cover. The fact that you could roam for 5 minutes only to find yourself in an intense firefight is really cool. It keeps you on your toes. All in All I can only see this game getting better. One thing I definatly think should be implimented is a TUTORIALEdition #1 One thing I would also add to this is more vehicles. With only 3 to choose from it's not awful but a larger variety would be nice later on. Maybe a Pickup Truck and a more rare car that is always there but not as many. The buggy is nice for duo. The SUV is nice for squads and so is the sedan. But seeing as it is a pick up truck would be nice. Something like 2 seats in the cab and allowing one or two players in the bed. It could add a different twist to the game forsure. Or witha truck allow the bed to be used for storage and if you die then that could be looted.Edition #2 The game has crashed on me 3 times within the past two days. I do find it fun still yet upsetting that this is crashing so frequently. I do understand this will be fixed with time. A bug I would like to add is that every couple of games or so I have to leave because my F key to collect items will not let me collect items. Yes this persists after trying with 2 different keyboards.Edition #3 Now with almost 250 hours into the game (Yes I know that's not too many) I have noticed the bugs being fixed. One issue I have is the Optimization on Erangle. When parachuting in my game takes a while for buildings to fully render thus making it impossible for me to enter a building immediatley. Moving on the additions of weapons has been amazing. They add a different but nice feel. The desert map is simply amazing. It renders in immediatley for me but further more the new wepaons are fantastic! I never stray away from the new .45. I haven't found much use in the sawed off and the winchester but they are nice and fun to use. In Edition 1 I said it would be nice to get a truck and that has definatley been answered. I'm sure i'm not the only one who asked but it is still nice to see that it was implimented. The bronco is also amazing. I often find myself taking one of them over the buggy. All in all the new map was definaltey refreshing. My game does crash and I do experience lag a lot but I do understand that this is a work in progress. My client crashed twice today but it is understandable. 8/10

review: NETWORK LAG DETECTED. NETWORK LAG DETECTED. NETWORK LAG DETECTED.The above is pretty much the PUBG experience as it is now. When I started playing just before August the connection was absolutely great. Now expect either several network lag detected messages or rubberband events scattered throughout the match. My internet connection is great. My friends' connections are great. These network issues with PUBG started occurring much more frequently as of late and it's getting worse over time.This game is in early access we get it. But here's a few things that's been going on with Bluehole/PUBG Corp/whatever &gt Says they're working on servers and connection issues two weeks ago no fix&gt Makes announcement regarding the resetting of the leaderboard what a great thing to focus on (hint no one really cares)&gt No major gameplay update since 3 weeks ago which introduced loot crate changes (made Tommy Gun normal spawn) and weapon (Mini 14)&gt Stance on no paid cosmetics but brings out... Paid cosmetics.&gt Hit reg is pretty sketchy especially at point blankedit I love this game. I really do. No other shooter really gives me the thrills that PUBG does but it's getting harder and harder to actually play smoothly due to these issues.At least I can do hoodrat things with my friends like slamming the honk button on four separate vehicles

review: I heard there are some negative experiences in china as an european player I love this game and don't have any connectivity issues still it has some flaws as it is allowed heck even supposed to have as an early access game.Let's be honest the Menu/Lobby/character screen from which you start the game is It crashes non stop the equipment bugs around the server choice (EU AS NA etc... ) sucks (it somehow always changes to AS for no reason) and especially when you're playing in a squad it has some weird group glitches and bugs. But it's just the menu so I don't realy care/ it doesn't really matter that much.What bugs me the most about that menu are the statistics. I don't know what is wrong with them but they are not accurate at all. I wasn't sure until after I won a match and it's shown nowhere in the statistics.If we're talking about the whole wardrobe thing I don't know if I really care about it but it's really hard to get cool clothes without spending actual money. Let's be honest though they don't really give an advantage.I'd love if the game had some option to spectate freecam after dead in solo rounds or when your whole squad/duo died even if it's just to find out who killed you from where. Because especially if I'm second it really bugs me if I didn't even see or hear the winner shooting at me (which can happen a lot).To end the review... All I named here was the negative stuff. there's actually a lot way more than negative positive things I could tell about this piece but let's just say It's priceworthy and you can play it alone or up to four players and it's always fun. I never had a game that gave that much adrelanine especially if you're one of the last ten living players.All in all buy it and judge for yourself (unless you're chinese maybe). Oh yeah and don't forget that it's early access I know you're probalby sick of it by now but such a game can have bugs/unfinished content.Oh and if your pc can't handle it sucks to be you P

review: This is a fantastically fun game... at times. The rest of the time it is ridiculously laggy (to the point of barely being playable in the early part of the game) and infested by cheaters. Seriously the cheating is beyond ridiculous. There are aim bots speed run hacks/cheats invulnerability hacks/cheats and other fun to deal with for all the non cheating players. Reporting players who are cheating also doesn't seem to do anything and I wonder whether this reporting mechanic was included to make the victim feel better rather than to actually do anything.The fact that it is now a *finished* game with a 1.0 release and these problems have not only not been fixed but are actually worse than it was when I first started playing several months ago evidences that the priorities of the developers is not focused on improving the game for existing customers. The focus for the developers seems to simply be to sell as many copies as possible while they can. It's a shame.If you are going to buy this game then please do so with your eyes open and realise that these problems may never be fixed. If you are on the fence about buying then I would recommend holding off and seeing if these problems are ever fixed. I really hope they are.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I bought this game during the hype of the Battle Royal summer of 2017. It was the game to have and it was in many ways revolutionary. My squad of guys played hours upon hours and won a bunch of games and lost even more but never truly hated the game. It was clunky had terrible netcode and guns were very difficult to control and for all these reasons winning was that much more pleasurable for us we knew we had beaten all the odds. But after so many lackluster updates to try to get the game functional we finally had to say goodbye. The game is not taken care of and Bluehole is not a good enough studio to realize that they are killing their game by not acting time efficiently or implementing actual game fixing features. Each update holds no actual gameplay value and maps are not well created and at this point there should be at least six maps in the 4x4 size category. I could create better maps more frequently on the FarCry 3 map editor on my PS3 and they can only release 2 new maps within the span of nearly 2 years.Vehicles are also too scarce and the bluezone is too annoying a mechanic (in this game not others) to deal with since most of the time you'll be playing running simulator to get to the safe zone as cars are so infrequent.The gunplay is too complicated and too laggy for most to have a successful gunfight. Never in a game have I felt more unequiped even when I'm holding a fully automatic rifle in my hands.Expanded grievences Entering a vehicle does not default you to the drivers seat which will get you killed if you are trying to get away from a gunfight Ability to mute specific toxic teammates was only just implemented There are not enough real landmarks on the map to help guide teammates to enemy positions nor is there a spotting mechanic. This makes squad firefights extremely difficult to win because all you can do is say "He's behind the tree". I realize there's a compass but you try triangulating the position of an enemy in 5 seconds when your buddy says 355 which is actually 230 on your compass. Equiping gear and attachments to weapons is too clunky and unfluid. The click and drag approach could make sense if the gun slots were next to the ground slots in the tab menu but having to equip everything manually takes so much time and oftenn in the early game you don't have that time. Netcode is terrible and for a month or so it seemed like they fixed it. But then they reverted back to their old system and that's when I couldn't take the incompetance anymore. Not enough map variety and not enough real content for a $40 game (Canadian) The constant lying and inaction from Bluehole is too much to handle nowHonestly what drove me to even write this review of PUBG is the fact that Ring of Elysium recently launched and it is far and away the version of PUBG that everyone wanted PUBG to be. Everything I mentioned above is not an issue for RoE with exception to the map grievance which I'm sure will change. But even if it doesn't The game is FREE.In conclusion don't buy this now garbage game. It will bever be fixed only marketed to be. What you see on streamers channels is rare in this game and will very seldom actually happen to you. Save your money and come join me on Ring of Elysium where gunshots actually hit there is no lag ever that I noticed and you can actually kill people without the fear of cheaters or that the other person had better ping than you.

review: This game is very popular and has sold millions of copies and yet this game is completely unplayable. It's laggy. It's buggy. It's full of that scream on their microphones for no ing reason alright? The developers aren't doing to fix the issues that are plaguing the game. It gets boring really quickly. The weapons are not diverse. The doors don't open man. You press 'F' to open the door and you expect it to just open and it doesn't open. And then sometimes you pick up a weapon and it doesn't appear and you die. And I have a very powerful computer alright? I can run Witcher 3 on ULTRA. OK? And I get over 60 FPS. This unoptimized piece of poo poo barely runs even on the lowest settings and I can't get even 30 FPS out of it. Constant slideshows. The GPU gets so hot that I don't have to put the kettle on to make tea. I just put my cup on my computer and brew tea. That's a true fact. You play the same map over and over and over and like by the 10th playthrough you already know the map. The colors are gray and dull and depressing. And why is it in Russia? Why can't we have more colorful locations? Why can't we have a jungle map with like a volcano or something? Why not a desert map? A city? The arctic? Anything but gray dull decaying post Soviet Russia. I don't care man have Russia too but at least make it one of many maps not the only map in the game.These guys took Arma 3's engine did a few minor changes and are now selling tens of millions of copies reaping insane revenues and they can't even fix some basic stuff man. And I'm not even getting into the ripping off of Chinese players by forcing them to buy "network accelerators" instead of just getting dedicated Chinese servers and I'm not even getting into the whole "stream sniping" debacle. I can't recommend it for now. Just stay away from this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PlayerUnknowns Battlegrounds has come a long way from what it began as. There have been new guns added bettter optimization a new map among many other things. The devs seem to be striving to improve the optimization even further which is something nobody can really complain about however there are some other issues i still have with this game. The first thing is the net code. The netcode in PUBG is atrocious in comparison to bigger titles like Battlefield 1 and call of duty. This is very frustrating as the early game can be a laggy mess and it discourages players from landing in areas like the military base school po i etc. This is something BLUEHOLE needs to be working on. Another issue is the game is very unstable. Time and time again the game will crash during a match or the worst case scenario a gun fight. This gets very irritating as it happens far too often and it ruins the experience. Something that isn't really directly in the game but still affecting it is the PUBG Invitational Dreamhack coming soon and the other tournament based matches. The reality of these tournaments is they make the game look even more aweful than it already is. The spectating system needs an extreme aamount of fine tuning which is something we don't need right now. The devs need to work on enhancing the experience for the players not these stupid tournaments that chew up development time. The Invitational was enough it showed how much they needed to work on improving the game not throwing out more and more events. My final issue is how a match is played out. The early game like said earlier is a laggy mess but there are many other issues as well. An example of this is how slow the first zone moves. It feels like an eternity between the first zone and the second zone. The pacing is far too slow making the game far less immersive. The late game is the only time where you might start breaking a cold sweat which is not good at all. Players should be on the edge most of the time its a battle royal after all. To conclude Playerunknown's Battlegrounds still has a very long way to go before its smooth and well optimized. So if you feel like grabbing the game make sure your PC can handle the game in its current state. Also make sure your well aware of the bugginess and spaghetti net code in the game right now. I reccommend players should buy this game only when the 1.0 release comes out if they want a better experience off the top. So don't buy this game in its current state.

review: This game is fun. Plain and simple. I have been playing since mid August of 2017 and it hasnt lost its spark for me... untill now. This game is absolutley filled to the brim with hackers. We have people from countries all around the world playing on North American servers which makes everyone super and laggy. Hitboxes are client based as far as I'm aware of... So the millions of Chinese hackers can kill me when I'm behind cover because on their screen I'm standing next to a tree instead of behind it. Every single game since I've been playing this week has resulted in me dying from blatant auto lock headshots with crossbows kar98's with no sights or one time a guy headshotted me AND my duo member in two bullets from 50m away with the new revolver. The ammount of hackers in this game is a complete turn off for my and my group of friends who play this game. My review will become a positive one once they hackers a permanently dealth with and the servers are not flooded with people on the complete other side of the globe.

review: the idea of the game is fun and would be great if they fixed the bugs and got rid of the losers that make the game and not worth buying/playing.Lag I can play any other game fine I can shoot at a guy and get hit markers or the kill on PUBG I shoot at a guy and don't get any shots on him if he's moving even a little bit. there have been times where I snuck up behind someone and shot them in the back and they were able to get up spin and run a bit before turning around and killing me. kill cam shows me shooting and missing maybe one or two hitting them for a small amount of health then standing there while they run and kill me.the rubber banding is ridiculous and the worst i've seen/experienced in any game. just like the issue of shooting I don't have any rubber banding in any other game. i've tried to change around every setting I could to get smoother game play but nothing works. if it's not lag it's the cheats the worst part about trying to play is when you run for the white circle for 25+ minutes and die by a guy spam shooting in your direction and some how getting a kill.the cheaters... constantly seeing people jump out of the plane early before the option to jump is even there hearing people with automatic rifles and sniper rifles before you even land getting 10 plus kills. if you go to remote areas and loot and get good guns you're just going to get shot heading into center. a part of the lag if a person is walking or crouch walking it's hard enough to hit them if they're running and jumping or driving they're getting away but countless times while i'm running down the side of a mountain through a field or racing down the road in a buggy i'm getting shot at by people that don't miss a single shot every bullet hits the car or hits me until I die kill cam shows they're just aiming in my direction full automatic and kill me with a head shot...the game is broken my goal is to get a chicken dinner just like anyone else i'm consistently making it to top 5 but some how always get killed by a headshot from a kar98 or m4 while running for cover. the fact that i've had two chicken dinners and a bunch of second place finish's on PUBG Mobile in the week that i've had it and not only does it play better but there's less lag says a lot about how badly this game is run/optimized/utilizing any form of anticheat.

review: Ohh boy this game. Where do I begin? Well the game is broken. Just like ARK it was released at an expensive t price tag despite hardly even working. The games mechanics are broken! The hit reg makes Infinite Warfare look god tier the connections make Siege come off as the greatest experience ever. The North American servers are filled with asians who seem to have unbelievably high ping and can lag their way to safety and put you down like the poor confused bastard you are.The developers of this game are pretty laughable as well. They are infamous for banning players who never actually cheated. Whether it was from accusations of "streamsniping" to the developers just banning because this is now George Orwell's 1984 the devs are a total joke. The concept of this game is awesome and I really did want to love this game. But it was hard. I found myself getting extremely bored often and just not wanting to play the game. If the game was fixed had a better dev team etc I bet the game would be really enjoyable. But currently we have a team who doesn't listen to players and bans people for no reason. This game needs a lowered price for what the players are getting.

review: Do not try and run this on a toaster. Yes it has further optomisations to come but what game doesn't.? Ive had two crashes in 8 months. Game runs fine and more so with recent updates.Playing locally on the new FPP solo mode on OCE is brilliant. I get sub 30ms pings to Sydney servers and the game runs so well its not funny. Cheating is an issue they have been addressing and the recent announcement that they will be trialling the 'ping lock' method is great news. This means less access to those from distant lands and games more populated with players in a similar ping range i.e. LOCAL players this will be a good thing. It will help the netcode thoughput for all in game and also reduce the possibilitiy of the overtly active Chinese based cheaters from joining Aussie servers. Fingers crossed. So if you have a decent modern rig with a bit of grunt (SSD drives area good idea too) and a good internet connection you are getting a great game for $30 clams. It will suck you in spit you out and then suck you in again. You will love it.

review: Example I think PUBG is the best battle royal game you can play right now. It is not without its problems though hence Early Access Game. So basically stop complaining on a game that isnt finished yet. pros It is very fun. The gunplay feels great and the tension you get at endgame is unlike anything else. I love the variety of weapons as well. Vaulting in PTR is probably the best game play you can get hope it comes out soon.Lootcrates dont give player advanteges which is a plus its all strickly cosmetic.the pay for crates was to fund PUBG tournament.Massive community with lots of great people to play with.Constant updates especially in the PTR. cons 30 dollars is a bit much for an early access imoDevs have an unfortunate policy of banning for stream sniping even with lackluster proof. This is unfair to say least. People have been banned with no knowledge of the streamer they were sniping . Even if they did this isn t really something the devs should be responsible for imo. Optimization is a bit rough. It does run better in the ptr but in the main branch of the game I get around 20 40 fps with my (cpu and gpu and settings). I get around 60 to 100 in the ptr though so this will probably change. and buildings not loading in which is caused by veiw distance breaking.server lag yes this dose happen sometimes specailly when large amount of people landing in same area. (dosnt allways happen to me)A bit more of my thoughts Fortnite yes its free optimized nice dosnt have the same feel as PUBG seems way to silly and cartoony. I would like the mention that optimization isn t as bad as people make it out to be. I get 60 100 fps in the ptr which will be rolled out soon enough. Porting to Xbox one thoughts well the game isn't finished yet so I don't know why they chose that I hope they fix a lot of performance issues on it if so. Hackers/cheaters iv seen them constantly banning cheating/hacking on the servers so they are doing something. I hear they're adding a new anti cheats every major update. So that isnt to bad isnt it? last anti cheat banned 24000 people for using speed hacks and aimbots so it dose work.(just my opinion)The devs are doing a great impression of someway wanting the themselves though. They have silly rules regarding streamers which I am not a fan of and i think the money is getting to there heads plz dont become the new EA.Most rounds I just like fudging around cause I don't play seriously lol. like Hitman challenge I cannot overstate how fun this game is. The gunplay is great the community is huge and growing and the tension is second to none in endgame. the game has high replayability. This game is something special and i have high hope for it to do well in the future. One great game moment is when we wiped an entire squad by shooting there car to much and all died in firey explosion. Final final thoughts I would recommend this game only if you have a bunch of freinds to play with cause why not its allways better to play with others D wouldn't recommend for the price tag till full release. (steam did have a sale in fall so was alot cheaper)Basically this is balanced review has its pros and its cons. Sunk 250hours into the game so im quite happy with the review iv given.

review: Meh it used to be a good game but it seems that every time there's a new update another issue occurs with the game. My comp specs are AMD Ryzen 1600 nvidia gtx 970 16gb of ram and a 500gb ssd game still runs bad and I have to lower my settings all the way down to VERY LOW on 1080p. There's so much stutter and fps drops everywhere I understand its a beta but shouldn't the game start seeing way more improvements by now? Another issue is the amount of hackers. There is an astronomical amount of speed hackers and aim bots running around. I wouldn't bother getting the game honestly because you're going to keep getting frustrated by the hackers and lag spikes.

review: This game had a lot of potential and has fun moments. But now that the game is in official release it is clear that the developers are unwilling or incapable of improving the perforamance and experience in game. This game appears to have no anti cheat since hackers are everywhere. I have spent a lot of tiem playing this game over the past year and it really has not gotten any better over time. Here are my biggest complaints 1) The new map sucks (way to big/ its boring)2) Loot is way to random and the looting process takes way too long Boring3) The framerate and general performance is terrible4) server lag and desync is a continual problem.If you have never played a battle royal game there is fun to be had here. But the game lacks polish and general performance is very poor. If looting for 20 minutes running for 10 minutes and fighting for 5 seconds dying and starting over again sounds like fun Then this might be your game.There is fun to be had here and I still play the game with friends... However it is a rage enducing mess of a game that still feels like early access.

review: I've played this game for over a three hundred hours at this point and within the last few months I've run into cheaters on a concistent level beyond the realms of CSGO and other popular games cheaters frequent. I mean three to four games in a row level of cheating. '99%' of my public matches level of incompetence and it's become absolutely ridiculous at this point.I don't write many reviews as you can see from my public profile and I wish this was an exageration but quite frankly I don't think I could sink anymore time into this game whether it'd be casually or competitively without feeling like it's completely in vain. How a game with (3 million) concurrent players can suffer from such a blatant rampant unsavory predicament is beyond me and I fail to see the benefits of such behavior in your game. I haven't experienced cheaters at this magnitude since Counter Strike Source... Beyond the excessive cheater dilemma there are just large unresolved server wide issues still present in the game and it has become apparent to me and many others that players from the other side of the globe not only ruins the smooth gaming experience (If you could really call it anything near at this point.) the game is trying to offer on it's official release but completely renders this game unplayable at any competitive level in the foreseeable future. The net code is an absolute mess and I cannot see this game returning to my library of games if these issues persist throughout its future updates and versions of the game's release. Like many others I gave PUBG the benefit of the doubt with their pre release early access game releases but seeing as the game has been launched for about a month now and has officially released on other platforms I do not understand how these issues are so prevalent amoungst EVERY possible facet this game tries to offer its player base. The faulty net code and faulty matchmaking system with inconsistent gameplay and hit registration could be managed and can warrant some level of playability at a casual level sure. But this level of egregious blantant cheating is beyond a dilemma at this point and should be top priority to any company small or large to eradicate from their game's official servers immidiately without hesitation but I continue to feel the need to update my review every couple of months to ensure players that this issue &gt &gt HAS NOT GOTTEN BETTER &lt &lt but worse in fact.Currently at this state in early access and now on official 1.0 release this game remains unplayable and I refuse to re install this game until I see documentation and publication that there is action being taken in these parts of the game (outlined above.) and the neglect our complaints have received over the last few months are dealt with properly.This is coming from someone who is in the top 3% in North America currently on both solo and squad playlists. This is unacceptable and I'm embarrassed this game has become such a P.C gaming phenomenon at its current and continuing state. If these problems persist any longer this game will have without a doubt a short lived negligible success and an unlikely future. hollow
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'll keep this short. The hackers are winning. Teleporting players aimbots all of it. It's too much. I've held off my review but now that the game is "released" it's fair game. More than half of my deaths are now due to blatantly obvious hackers. Deathcam was a great step towards validating that. Everytime I've loaded into a lobby with Chinese players yelling it's a guarantee to be aimbotted. The community has cried out pleading for the game to be region locked keep chinese hackers on chinese servers. However PUBG Corp doesn't get it and views it as "reactive".Quotes from the Developer on Hackers and the outcry for region lock "Yes the majority of cheaters come out of China but that doesn't mean all Chinese players are cheaters. This idea that just because you've got a few bad eggs you've got to ban a whole country is a bit reactive " he said. "They love the game. Why would we restrict them from playing on servers? I just don't get the attitude of some people."In other words Yes we know its a problem and Why would we want to fix it when banned accounts make us money?I'll update my review if the problem is fixed.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Early access bla bla game is due to change bla bla... My review is early access too is due to change when released. Considering the developer has been doing this battleroyale mode mods / games for a long time I don't forgive game mechanic failures as "early access". This game is all about luck. Everything inside is RNG and that is ed up. Looting You may be searching 10 houses and not find anything else than a pistol and shotgun while the other guy finds m16 ak47 with good scopes best protection gear first 2 3 house he enters. (and this can happen at same house in the same spot of the map not like he goes to a military base or some sort of thing)Gunplay Gun handling and recoil is pure RNG too... you maybe full auto shooting 30 bullets to 10 feet distance and not get more than 2 bullet hit while the other guy sprays same gun same distance same style and get 15 out of 30 bullets hit you. Because in every bullet there is RNG modifier for recoil which gets pretty ed up after the first bullet. ("shoot / wait / shoot so you land every shot noob" ? yea tell that to the guy who sprays you 10 feet distance and insta kills you before you can even land the 2nd bullet) some say people use no recoil hacks... I don't want to sound like cry baby but yes I saw quite a lot of hackers they exist...Battleroyale experience Map is way too big and there is so little time between zone restriction circle. If you cant find a car &amp RNG decides to make you walk to the otherside of the world.. just quit.. game becomes very annoying running simulator. Forcing you to run for 15 20 minutes doing nothing but sprinting &amp trying to heal. Probably will be killed while trying to run too since you are obvious target while rushing. Tactics &amp fun is non existent when you are forced to run non stop for whole match. Oh and yes the circle comes like 3 4x faster than your running speed so before you even reach to safety it starts moving to even further leaving you in constant death zone goodluck with that.

review: This game is great and very addicting. I'm not even good in this game but wasted already over 100h in it.I really recommend to play that game with a squad or duo. The best experience I had is with friends.But yeah you totally need a good CPU and Graphics Card.I play this game on "high" about 90 30 Frames. So there are massive drops sometimes.So if you are in citys or houses everything will be fine. But open fild with a lot is going on and fast movement your FPS will drop. And yeah 30 Frames are still OKAY. But the drops make it hard sometimes to aim etc.Also a few glitches happens every now and then. But yeah it is an alpha.We already saw some cheaters and hackers unfortunately and weird stuff happens sometimes.Like you hit the enemy already 8 times and they are still fine. But they only need one shoot to kill you etc.Sometimes I don't even know where they are shooting from etc. (maybe I'm just to bad in it.)Overall I love to play that game with my friends and had some good time. Hopefully this game won't die soon.

It is a bit clunky but nothing bad enough to ruin the experience. Some of the interactions are a bit delayed or sensitive to where you are aiming (doors etc..) The weapons are great. review: PUBG is a game that I've played quite a bit of and I've enjoyed almost all of what I've played. But the problem is almost all of that enjoyment has come from playing with friends. Solo this is one of the worst multiplayer games I've played. Weapons I've realized after playing for a while that there is really not that much variety in weapons. Basically you can use either a shotgun (which are all the same) an assault rifle (which are all the same) or a sniper rifle (which to be fair actually have variances in feel between the 3 available). There are technically also pistols melee weapons smg's and a crossbow but they're all useless. Melee is broken pistols do nothing the crossbow is just like a sniper rifle that can't use a good scope and smg's are just worse assault rifles. "But" I hear you asking "what if you can't find a good gun then you could use one of those." No. If you land in an area with more than 1 house 9 times out of 10 you'll find at least a rifle and a shotgun. Speaking of which there isn't really ever a reason to use anything other than 1 shotgun and 1 sniper or if you can't find one an AR. Loot The loot system is more than anything frustrating. Most of any given game will turn into looking through houses to find the 1 or 2 pieces of usable loot per house. A gun here some meds there maybe you get lucky and get that elusive level 3 helmet or vest but it's never exciting because you know that by the end of the game your loot's probably going to be the exact same as it always is give or take a few meds that you won't need because you already hgave so many. The game just throws loot at you to the point that you will always have everything as long as you don't die within the first 3 or 4 minutes. The only real difference from game to game is your scopes. To the game's credit scopes can make a huge difference and are relatively rare. If you get near the end and you have a x8 scope and the other team only has a x4 you'll have a big advantage.Combat Like I said earlier melee combat is completely broken. If you land near somebody it will every time turn into both of you jumping around hitting each other hoping that you get lucky and your hits actually register. In actual gunfights this is much better but the problem is that if you're only in solos you'll rarely actually have these. Most games in solos and many games in duos end with you getting shot from someone you can't see and dying before you can tell where they are. Only in squads where you have 3 or preferably 4 pairs of eyes to look will you get into full fledged coordinated fights. On the plus side shooting is the one thing in this game that actually feels smooth and responsive. Also as much as I'm painting a picture of the game being all luck there are still always a decent amount of head on shootouts in most games. And when you're in squads the gunplay and fights are as much fun as you'll ever have in a game.General Complaints The game is incredibly clunky. Every single thing you do other than shooting feels like it should feel better to do. Especially noteworthy are parachuting down jumping driving moving and looting. These things happpen to encompass most of the game. Which brings me to the core problem of the game you don't really do anything most of the time. This is the biggest reason you need friends to play with for the game to be any good because if you don't the game will just be one big slog where you're running on autopillot until you see another person. You drop down look for a gun kill anyone near you once you find one continue looking for scopes and armor and meds go to wherever the zone goes and then repeat steps 3 and 4 until there are less than 10 people left and the zone's small. At that point it's a toss up wether you'll have a super fun intense few minutes while you fight to the death or you'll get shot in the back of the head by a sniper rifle and die before you can do anything. Overall I'd say only buy this game if you have good friends who you are 100% sure you can and will play with for a while.

review: The basics are deceptively simple but there s a level of mastery that can be attained in PUBG and I can t write that off. The more I play the more I appreciate the depth of the game. It s exhilarating to pick off an enemy running across a field and it s terrifying to be that person running across the field. There are a million different scenarios similar to this that unfold in every match of PUBG.For a game that s still in Alpha it s almost a pleasant surprise that server stability is one of the biggest issues facing the game. Desync is a bigger killer than any gun. Servers and netcode can be upgraded and improved thankfully. It s a pity that players have to butt heads with uncooperate internet tubes but Bluehole Studios have made an immersive and energizing game that improves upon nearly every aspect of the budding survival arena genre. 9/10
