review: Product received for free. Update (Mild Language) This game has become trash once it improves I will remove this &amp revert my review back to its original state. My one message to the devs is try and actually IMPROVE the game instead of SUING other companies! LIKE COME ON ITS BEEN 14 PATCHES SINCE 1.0 AND NOW YOU FINALLY DECIDE TO OPTIMIZE THE GAME AFTER MESSING WITH EVERY WEAPON AND ADDING A MAP THAT NO ONE REALLY ASKED FOR LIKE COME ON BLUEHOLE GET YOUR TOGETHER! Breif Overview "No matter how much I try &amp hate this game I always come back."That is a recent statement I made when talking about PUBG for non players this game may seem insane as most people are playing it but dont let this fool you. I may have 80 hours in the game making it like the 3rd most played game on my account but that doesnt mean I enjoy it. Far from it most times. This game is complete t half the time getting shot from across a hill by a player who may be a bush but your not sure because every cluster of pixels looks like one. Then again it has its moments where it shines so brightly you can help but press search because you have a "good feeling about this one" or something so funny so random just happened you cant help but recreate it. These are the reasons I made that statement because this game is a mixed bag. Sometimes its great &amp other times its a 50 tonne wrecking ball smashing through your hope in humanity. Graphics They're ok. They are not great but they certainly aren't unity level crap. The higher graphics settings add antialiasing which all games have it just smooths pixels and improve more lighting effects such as SSAO/HBAO (Ambient Occlusion) but even then you still need a pc thats permanently pumped with steroids just to run the game at this slight graphical improvement.Texture wise I really see no difference between each level except above medium takes my fps to a steady cinematic 24. This being said you really dont look at the textures all that much during gameplay due to the insane concerntration to every little sound or pixel around you. The only time I really notice these textures is when looking at my guns even then its mostly when aiming. Performance This really is where PUBG goes into a league of its own I genuinly do not think I have played such an unoptimised game. Honestly patch #1.0 was meant to bring optimisation and really it didnt. What brought optimisation for me was a well timed christmas present of a GPU from myself to myself. Even then my GT 1030 (yes its a budget card and yes for it being entry level its pretty decent) even then my card still cant play it steadily granted its nowhere near my AMD HD 6570 but even so its still shockingly bad especially since Fortnite runs on the same engine and is 100 times more optimised. Gameplay "Is that a player or a bush?"Jokes aside the gameplay is stellar you're dropped onto either an ex soviet era island with 100 players or a Btec desert with a few houses massive open areas &amp 100 other people. This makes for exciting matches honestly I dont believe how much I enjoy this game. Im not really one for PvP etc but this game has had me hooked for months. The first game is always rough for me but then on my second or thrid match I kinda come into my element usually ranking 10th 15th now by no means is this "good" but its a real sense of acheivement to know that 90 85 other players have died for you to get to where you are.The blue zones are good not much to say because they are simple. It really is as easy as moving from one zone to another to stop you from dying. Red zones are simillar if you're caught in one just walk away from it you really shouldnt die in a red zone they're more there for aesthetic reasons such as audio cover and being cool to look at than to wipe you out.My main tip gameplay wise is be attentive &amp always check a distant bush twice. Final Verdict Very enjoyable whilst staying very dislikable. 27 is quite a lot of money (idk about your currency) but honestly its a worthy investment. Not only can crates help to make that money back the game is just fun because it has the right amount of edge and thrill and action to keep you hooked. And because of that I am writting this review to hopefully entice some more new players like me.So yea final verdict Enjoyable whilst staying easy to dislike but never become bored of due to its sporadic gameplay &amp attributes. (ps if you liked this pls drop a like or what ever the rating system is here &amp I hope this was helpful)

review: If I go to school at least I'll be getting shot by something I can see.Joke review aside this is a pretty good game with active developers. Cheating is not much of a problem at all anymore and the developers are actively working on cutting it down even more. Just this week 15 arrests of hack developers were confirmed by the game developers.The first thing you do in this game is drop from a plane which flies in a randomly placed straight line on the map. You can either drop in the middle of nowhere and have less items to pick up or right in the middle of a city and have more items to pick up. Those items are typically better so there will be several people also dropping there who are willing to fight you over them.You also have vehicles gun attachments and gear to wear. Vehicles include motorcycles vans trucks and cars. They will protect you and help you get to places faster but they are also loud and can flip over if you're a dumb driver. Gun attachments will improve your gun's stats and will also include scopes and sights which don't directly improve the gun's visible stats but will improve your aim. Wearable gear will protect you and increase your carrying capacity.You may play in solo duos or squads. Voice chat is your only form of communication with other players on your team and text chat does not exist. You will only play with people using your preferred perspective which can be TPP or FPP.Finally there are three circles in this game red white and blue. Blue will slowly consume the entire map and slowly kill you and white is where it will stop for the time being. Always be travelling to the white as to avoid being killed by the blue. Vehicles are the only things faster than the blue zone. You will be given notifications and warnings of when the blue will start consuming the map again. The red zone indicates that explosives are dropping in the area and the only way to not be killed by them is to either leave the red zone or get inside of a building.That's what this game is. If I have missed anything please comment on my review and let me know so I can add it.EDIT I'm going to go all YELP on this review and unrecommend it. This is NOT something I would usually do as I usually base my reviews on whether or not I'd actually recommend it. I **do** recommend it but I feel that sending this game's score down is the only way to get Bluehole to actually listen to the community about this one issue bugs. We need improved netcode and optimization rather than more crates. They **are** working on this but it never seemed to be their top priority as it should be. This new update worsened things and now it feels *literally unplayable*.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Had a lot of potential and promise early but the games meteoric rise in popularity clouded the devs eyes with dollar signs and they havent in over a year fixed a single one of the glaring bugs and problems that were in present in extreme alpha. If you get out of a vehicle going even 1mph you almost die and the movement is clunky and not fluid at all. Also no region locking leads to swarms of 2 300 ping players lagging all over the place in an already pathetically coded game to begin with. If you can get past that which lets be honest you kind of have to with the current options on the market its a decently fun game with friends. Solo though tends to just be a running simulator that always leaves more to be desired like maybe a ing smaller map already?

review: I have very mixed feelings about this game. The concept is great gameplay gets better with every update but there are some HUGE issues some of them are deal breakers. First of all shooting you have to randomly think if your ping is ok if yes then at target if not then shoot 2m before/after target... Cheaters? A TON and they don't do anything with them. You spend 20 minutes playing top 10 then get aimbot headshot from behind a stone without LoS great. Idiotic grass you zoom in having clear view grass in your scope can't see anything. Sound is all wrong on stereo can't EVER hear from where the car is coming from. The game would be great if it were a finished product not what it's now.Edit Added over 100 hours of gameplay review along about 2 patches The game is gettiing even worse. There is a huge desync between players IN THE SAME GAME. Where you shoot them and miss (regardless of seeing your aim on their head) and then hide behind a rock to die of a headshot while already being hidden. Sound is still a huge issue but guess what they added weather (again). Doesn't matter than it's screwed up they added it. So when it rains you can't hear when it's sunset you can't see Game is about 60% running 20% loading and waiting for a full minute with 100 other people and 15% looting and about 5% of real tactics and fighting. Loot and vehicle spawn is ridiculous. Can't find a backpack for half of the game caus eyou picked the wrong house apparently. Landed in the south side of the map? Great all vehicles are in the norht side now you have to run there for about 5 minutes.Fun fact you can't mute people in your team when in a random team. So you get idiots yelling full volume and the only thing to do is turn off the chat itself smart.Another game where devs focus more on getting money from idiotic lootboxes than on actually getting the game in shape. Strongly advise against buying this.EDIT A guy just shot me THORUGH a tree (which normally block shots). This game is ing utter

(Did you hear that EA?)I still think that's pretty dumb. People are paying hundreds of pounds so that you can show off your clothing in the pregame lobby. wow gr8.Weapons skins are also now being added ok cool.Desperately looking forward to the new map and new content.P.S

review: Game keeps crashing and is extremely buggy. Hit detection seems unreliable at times cars can flip over a goddamn pebble and you can get stuck for ages if your parachute clips an invisible object. The game has potential but they need to fix so much that it might be years before it's even remotely playable. Just play fortnite it's free and ing works.

review: Not a fun game. The game consists of either being able to see people ever or see 20 people all with weapons and scopes you don't have. Not a fun solo game to play. Groups with friends is the only way to enjoy the game. There are plenty of bullets that never hit disconnecting and horrible optimization. RNG decides whether you win or lose every single game..Other than that it is just like sitting in a chatroom with friends. Not really much going on for most of the game. I suggest looking up some conversation starters to keep the chatroom fun and lighthearted. One thing I have tried is to name the cars that appear on the maps the driving is BY FAR the funnest thing in the game. PUBG does a great job at making a car simulator with a little work could be considered average. My names for the hippy van is Bertha the car is Klaus the dune buggy is Darryl the boat is Angus.Don't buy this game this ain't fun.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Overall Rating 6.5/10Overall I think it is fun but I think it is also very frustrating. I don't know if Bluehole intentionally design this game to be a camper fest but that is what it is right now. The game rewards players very significantly for camping and is strongly reinforced in core gameplay. At this point in time I think most people or those who are already interested in the game know how the genre battle royale works and so I will skip over explaining those details. The general consensus of how players play ultimately rip the "fun" out of the game. Other players avoid fights in order to survive (makes sense but follow me here) so they usually hide and run away at the first contact of a fight. These players march on from circle to circle avoiding any gun battles. For a shooter game I feel the core gameplay is more like island adventure where you skip from house to house rather than exciting gun fights which provide an enjoyable gaming experience. Players value winning over everything else rather than having fun at least in the region I player in is like that (NA region). Another point I'd like to come across are the air drop crates. These crates seem to have items that I feel are unusuable at times. For a crate that comes with "supplies" I feel would come with more quanity of medics. The only time I am comfortable with trekking for these crates are usually when I already am geared and go there picking fights rather than getting the drop. The drop is generally a added bonus to the murder spree that entails it. So this brings me to my next point why this game is a camp fest. These drops that incentivize players into not camping do not reward players enough to go for them. It contains a gun possibly a one or even a gun you cannot use because of ammo restriction i.e. you are carrying an M4 and Mini14 and it drops a Groza with like 60 bullets. Alright? Not a good option to really take it and note that this is after a deadly gun fight with others seeking this same drop. I often feel not rewarded for winning these fights and at times I may not even have an opportunity to loot the others I have killed due to circle restriction or just the danger of even looting them to preying eyes. So I go on my merry way leaving the drop with LESS supplies than I came with. Over time after contesting many drops I've come to the conclusion that the only time I ever go to drops are not for the supplies in the drop but to pick off kills or pick a fight with other players because the match became stagnant and I cannot find a single soul to fight. A third point I'd like to make is the red zone. Why is this here? PUBG developers have little to say about this "feature" and only made a mark saying that the red zone is random. Other players seem to suggest that it is NOT random and may hint that a player is in the area. Some may argue that this mechanic in the game forces player out of camping but does it really? Personally I think it reinforces the need to stay in building or basically camping. The only place you are guaranteed safe from the red zone are in buildings or just out of it. However if you are running (no vehicle) and the red zone spawns on top of you what are you chances? You basically just sprint out of it or to the closest building in hopes it doesn't blow you up. This mechanic reinforces the need to stay indoors and camp. Even in PUBG tournaments Bluehole hosted tournaments as well the red zone is turned off. They turned it off because they know it reinforces camping and they want the gameplay to be more action pack to make the stream more enjoyable to watch but if you watch PUBG tournament and most notoriously the Gamescon Invitation Tournament you can see that even in higher level player it's just a camp fest. Yes this is realistic. Yes this makes sense. BUT! This is a video game and overall I don't care if I win. This shouldn't be an esport title. It should be played to have fun and I really don't care if I die often as long as it's fun. But too many of my games the only fights I get into are at the first drop in major areas or the fights that I painstakingly roam the map to find. So Bluehole I hope that you aren't intentionally making this game a camp fest to feed it's realism which I feel you may be and I hope that you see my perspective and try to make the game more fun rather than more realistic. I do have plenty of suggestions on how I believe you can change game design to make it less camperish and I look forward to future updates.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: See my April review below....But for now I have over 1000 hours in game. I run 1080 Ti's in Sli and get 140 fps 4k. Sometimes fps drops to 95 but still bearable. The game runs very well on high end machines dont listen to all the whiners on console priced PC's.. If you have money and a good rig you will love the game if you enjoy this play style..If you have a great PC like I do then the game actually plays surprisingly well ! I have had 1 crash in 100+ hours of game time and hardly any in game glitches nor lag. Now on to the good stuff heart pounding action with nice feeling weapons and a fantastic variety of attachements. Gameplay feels fun and thrilling can only highly recommend to play as a 4 man squad and wreck people together. Game play feels much more fun and balanced than H1Z1. R!P

review: The developers recently announced that they are introducing marketable microtransactions and DLC in the game during early access despite prior promises not to do so. Given that they have not finished developing the core game they should not be busy putting bilking more money from their customers over actually finishing the core game. Their claim is that the revenue generated from the microtransactions will be used to help things like development costs and tournament hosting but given that this is a game that players already paid to play and millions of dollars at that this argument doesn't float. This sort of thing is only acceptable in free to play games that do not have an initial point of sale to generate revenue. In addition though these items are "cosmetic" in nature I feel the need to remind folks that in highly competitive games like this any potential camouflage is NOT cosmetic it's pay to win. In summary I cannot possibly reccomend this game to anyone as the developers have shown that they have more interest in generating addional revenue over finishing their product. If you have bought this recently I strongly advise that you request a refund.(Update Oh yeah their ban policies are ridiculous as well. Do try not to accidentally kill or even mildly annoy any streamers lest you risk copping a ban for upsetting the sacred cow.)
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is literal trash do NOT buy it because you saw some funny streamers play it or because your friends told you to. It is bad the only reason I bought it is because of the stupid mistakes that I listed above. What you'll meet in game are a bunch of indian/russian/greek/polish people that are so incompotent that it's not even funny to joke about. They can't speak English and they are trash at the game. Oh you want to duo with a random teammate? Great idea! Here is your teammate! Good luck!Teammate Degenerate can't aim doesn't know how to speak English makes the whole situation cringey whenever you need to communicate whenever you are getting shot at or anything else that requires you to speak to one another.You A decent player not the best aimer but at least you know where to aim. Knows how to speak English is not cringey whatsoever.And then your opponents All they literally do is camp behind a stupid tree for 2 3 minutes waiting for someone to pass by oh look! The one that is passing by just happens to be you! And you don't suspect a random person to be behind a tree out in the abyss of nowhere to pop up and shoot at you? No you don't.All your time effort sprinting carrying all of your sweet items that you've gathered from so many different places ruined. By what? A random camping person behind a tree.Now this is just in game stuff don't mention the optimization this game has it's horrible. I have a good PC some of the latest parts that are out there on the market. The good stuff basically.I get actual horse radish 45 55 FPS on VERY LOW LOW Settings. I thought perhaps it's my PC being bad? So I looked up some other people on YouTube with almost the same PC as me and they also get the same FPS problem as me. So does streamers not to mention relatively famous streamers.And if you look for yourself incase you don't believe me the first key searches on YouTube or even Google when you search for ''PUBG How'' this is what's going to come up ''pubg how to increase fps''Oh and by the way the servers are pretty horse radish. You need to have a really good internet connection like me (100+ mbps) to get a decent ping at least a playable one.So now after you've read my lovely review it's up to you incase you want to spend money on this or not.Don't do it.

review: Röviden szól ez egy jó játék rossz szervereken.Mindegy hogy az ember a saját EU régiójában játszik e vagy megpbálkozik Amerikai/Ázsia/Oceánia/stb... szerverrel mert mindenhol teli van kínaiakkal (japán korea mind1).Mivel ez egy multiplayer játék ezért másokkal együtt szeretné az ember játszani. (solo játékra toljatok Sykrim et vagy valamit)Nah de amikor belépsz egy random Dou avgy Squad játékba ( mert a barátok melóznak és addig is gyakorolnál) akkor 20/19 alkalommal valami azsiai társasággal fogsz találkozni.A random ázsia csapattal 2 nagy gond van 1. csak a saját rizsa nyelvükön akarnak becsélni és a Push to talk felejtős számukra. Folyamatosan zúg valamelyik mikrofonja és közbe az egész internet kávézót hallod mögötte. Nyilván le némítod de ilyenkor egyből hátrányba vagy mert a squad innen től nem kommunikál...2. kb minden 3. alkalommal ugy gondolják a sárga barátaid hogy jobb a cuccod és kérdezés nélkül megölnek aztán viszik a loot ot.Nem mondom hogy a valóban EU játékosok hibátlanok de ha nagy ritkán összeakadsz velük akkor élmény a játék.Ameddig a regionális korlátozást nem teszik be addig nem tudom ajánlani csak ha meg van a fix csapatod mindnig.REGION LOCK PLEASE!!!

review: Game is fun and has a great concept behind it. It will be hard to find many people that disagree with that. That said the game is ed almost unplayable and i say this because in a shooter you require bullets to always hit their target and register. Not hit blood splatter and person take no damage (I ve emptied full clips and nothing also hit a people in the head with/without helmets multiple times and nothing). It has many performance issues which render it almost unplayable the game suffers major flaws bullets not registering constant drop outs desync glitches and more.I played it with the hope that the devs would eventually fix the issues that the game has. It has been quite a long time now. I keep seeing more and more content added yet none of the major bug fixes. You can read this and think that there are some people saying it's fine and performance isn't an issue. From my understanding these people are little fan boys that need to pull their head out of their Yes the devs post they have fixed bugs but with the money they have made any decent dev team who actually cared would have completely overhauled the code they used and developed a game worthy of the concept they have come up with. If you want to spend your money on a game that is far from finished and let s be honest will probably never be finished go ahead. But if you're having doubts then by all means go and buy something else that is proven to be good. This game still needs huge amounts of work but that goes with any game in early development. The reason I m giving this a negative review is because the devs continue to put hours of work into adding useless content to try and suck in more innocent people rather than actually fix what is wrong with the game. Devs should not betray their supporters they need to show appreciation by eliminating issues that cause bad gameplay rather than continually add content to a game which already has more than enough content for an early release. If the game runs there are a variety of items and in this case one working game mode that should suffice for testing purposes and devs should focus on making the game more playable/reliable. Obviously this wasn t the case with battlegrounds. What makes this even worse is there is a bunch of previously mentioned fan boys defending the game and its screwed up coding. They are saying things like It s expect of a game in early access or Devs are busy working on it or The game works fine for me . S the game doesn t run fine for anyone. Go watch live streamers and you will see at least one glitch every game. Stop defending a company that is robbing its supporters!TL DR in current state put simply the game is ed . Spend your money on something else. In the future this game might have all of its glitches fixed but I highly doubt it based on how the devs want to spend resources.

review: Good game but still haunted by some early access demons. Hopefully they overcome them it looks like they are gearing up to take the game seriously. As of now if you don't mind dropping the money for a good bit of fun gameplay with (or without ) friends then by all means get it. If you're looking for a completely finished game and aren't interested in random annoying bugs that sometimes may end a match for you then I would wait until it is fully released. I have some hope for the game its a great battle royale game and the best out imo. But early access is still a scary thing so beware. If you were into DayZ and are thirsting for a game like it I highly recommend it. It doesn't have the super nitty gritty aspects of DayZ but in my humble opinion it cuts all of the worst parts of DayZ while keeping some of the best. The games dont take all day and the loot isn't impossible to find. Its a good game its just unfinished.

review: PUBG When I first played this game my thoughts were like "Wow that's kind a hard to get a freaking chicken dinner here". I started to get better and better while playing with my friends and killing more and more people. Now I can say it's so far the best multiplayer surival game (King of the Hill game) I've played. I recommend the DUO Mode because there you have just one mate and it's mostly guaranteed that you find nice waepons and armour if you pick a good place to land with your chute. All in all I can say that every mode in this game makes fun and the switch between FPP and TPP is the best variety a game can have. So even if you don't like FPP or TPP there is basically a mode wich is designed for you.If you buy this game make sure not to rage in the first rounds and keep playing to get your first "chicken dinner". 9/10 Points

review: Product received for free. To begin a friend got me this game. Despite it being fun for a few laughts and palying with a group of friends originally I would not reccomend this game. It had serious flaws arounf launch however I would now reccomend this game since the devs have put great effort into patching the game. It can be extreamly frustrating or really fun. Im glad they have put work and effort into this game and at its current state it is quite fun!pros cool conceptlarge map / player poollots of customizationbig communitydevs seem to care and support the gameCons frustrating (the netcode for this game is horrible and servers often have tons of lag) They could still work on thisoptimization (this game has horrible optimization and i get the same framerate of 30 45 on low very low medium and high) Still a problem!They have put quite a bit of effort to improve the environment and have made object to my knowelde not have texture missing.Lag can still be an issue on certain environments for exmaple the rain however with the amount of effort being put into this game I can see this issue being fixed.

Also you do need a pretty fast computer to run the game otherwise you'd have a higher chance of crashing right as the game starts.Overall I definitely reccomend this game to everyone. It's addicting and it just gets better by the updates coming in.

review: Devs clearly care about this game and are doing early access the right way. This is a super fun battle royale style game. There's no waiting to join a game you press queue and you're in. Then you and 98 other players get dropped a large island littered with loot and weapons that you then collect and shoot each other with. It's very tactical and the gun play is fairly realistic (without being tiresome and annoying with the realism). It's a fantastic game and there's a reason why it's so popular right now.

review: Ugh this game. I love it I suck at it hardcore but I love it. PUBG is a simple battle royal style game where you just need to kill other people and survive to number one. Easy? Not at all. You winning is as hard as It comes and even the game is against you initially.It's not well optimized it isn't. It's better now than it was before (much better) but at first I had to do a lot of googling and sleuthing to even get it to run without severe sound glitches and screen tearing. Hopefully further patches will save people that time in the future.Gameplay is fun and tense from the very start all the way to the last second and every move matters. You never know who's posting up in a house or behind a tree so observance is key. I suck at this so I suck at this game. You need good eyes.I would reccomend it 100% well worth the money and entertaining despite performance issues. Had some great moments in the small time I've played.

review: New Review I had an incredible amount of fun with this game for quite a while. I loved the tactics the challenge and that delicious chicken dinner. Yeah there were bugs but it was in Early Access. Then it was fully released and it got worse. The devs spent all their time on eSports and cosmetics instead of improving the core of a really fun game. Then even the cosmetics would expire! I bought the Sanhok pass only to find out the jacket I unlocked lasted for 3 weeks. This game is just squandered potential now. It could've been great but it'll just end up being the game we all thank for kicking off the Battle Royale craze rather than the champion of it.Old Positive Review from a year ago One of the more tense and tactical squad games I've ever played. There's nothing like trying to take a building from another squad with your friends or trying to defend a house you're setting up in for a few minutes. Sure it's got some bugs. And yes some people love to cheat. But neither of those are prevalent enough to affect most players. I've only come across two suspected cheaters in almost 200 hours of gameplay and with the new death cam and built in reporting tools it's getting better.

Players must fight to locate weapons and supplies in a massive 8x8 km island to be the lone survivor. This is BATTLE ROYALE." No this is NOT battle royal and No you don't have to fight for loot you can if you want but it will probably spawn in right near you Skill or no Skill you too can win unless you have Skill forgot about Skill not being a factor like a real shooter game where it is Skill based. review: Nvidia geforce GTX 860 intel i7 8 gb ram. Can't run the game even though the requirements are lower. The few times it did run before nearly setting my PC on fire though were solid just gotta wait for optimization updates.EditPeople are being banned because the developers won't or haven't yet fixed bugs that are well known. For instance if you kill someone who is experiencing the issue where buildings have not yet rendered you will be banned permanently from the game.Video games are not just a mode of entertainment nowadays it's part of our culture. Friends and family play video games together it's become commonplace and even replaced card or board game nights in many family units. The Developer thinks they can just effectively and permanently remove people from a very trending video game because of bugs they should be fixing? No.This is getting out of hand. There needs to be a union where gamers stand against this BS I and many others are tired of being treated like wallet waiting to be emptied by these fools who think they can throw whomever they please to the sidewalk and continue on without implication. PubG I cannot recommend to anyone until I am certain that justice is done PROPER and not SWIFTLY.It's starting to look like a cash grab game the developer is showing signs that many other Early Access titles have of preparing abandonment and callous disregard to it's community.When something becomes successful others will look to it and see how it succeeded. This attitude is not acceptable and this practice is already becoming a norm if it is not stopped here and now then it will become the norm. Many of us are already treated like garbage because we are not wealthy in the workplace and sometimes at home. Let's not allow this to continue.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is a great model for early access games but it's not without flaws. The shooter mechanics in the game are fun and incredibly rewarding wandering around can range from a snooze fest to hair raising firefights and the diversity of weaponry puts this game one bar over H1Z1 in my opinion. However the game has a laundry list of bugs and glitches as well as performance related issues. Buildings not rendering Dacias falling through bridges server lag among a few others that I've experienced. One of the minor annoyances I've experienced is the BattleEye client not closing after exiting the game. No real issue there just Task Manager it and move on. My biggest issue is the game not updating properly and the only solution I've found is reinstalling it which can be a real pain when I just want to hop on with friends. Everything considered it's a great game. I feel like the devs could be a bit less Nazi about their code of conduct but oh well. Once the bugs are all buffed out and streamers aren't banned for a combination of vehicle manslaughter and game breaking bugs I'm sure this game will be a model for EA. 8/10 would recommend )
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've been trying to like this game a lot of my friends are playing and it continues to rise on the charts but every time I walk away from it I hate myself for wasting my time.It's not an enjoyable world to play in. Movement is jenky and takes a lot of getting used to. The weight of your character makes it hard to do otherwise simple things like run through a doorway or down a narrow hallway. A lot is done in the spirit of simulation that directly opposes fun. Stand next to a window and your gun shoots at the ceiling because you can't get the gun between you and the window. Maybe that's real but it's also annoying. You wouldn't fire a gun at the ceiling but there's a disconnect from what your avatar does and what you think you're trying to do. It ruins the game. And don't get me started on the general delayed (because it's server side) opening of doors and interacting with objects...But even if you play a lot and start to get used to these quirks what's the game really? You drop into a big map and run around picking up stuff until you die. Most of the game is just running around not interacting with people. Not shooting just walking and looking at the ground. If you're lucky or good you get to shoot and kill people. If you're average or bad then you get killed often without even seeing who shot you. And the game doesn't show you what happened you just die and see your body and it's like okay now it's time to play again.The gameplay loop of running around for 30 minutes looking at the ground picking up stuff for a minute of firefight at the end doesn't pay off. And then there's the circle. The circle that keeps people moving I feel is both a clever and poorly implemented feature. Half the time it's a massive penalty to you and half the time it's a non factor. In the end the game is a weird mess of trying not to die to radiation whilst being forced into bad positions and hoping to be the lucky last person to have to move. It's very much a lottery system and I have no respect for it.The only plus is I didn't spend $60 on the game. I don't recommend it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is definitely going somewhere. Let's be real though it requires a fairly decent system if you want respectable frames. Community isn't the best but I just play with friends so it doesn't bother me much. Super addicting and really makes you test your wits. Kills are rewarding and I feel like overall the weapon balancing is about right EXCEPT with shotguns. So many times have I shot an unarmed enemy at point blank range (mind you either head or torso shots) to neither kill or knock them down. Shotguns got nerfed down in a previous update hopefully they can be fixed. With over 200 hours I'm still looking for some more chicken dinners. I've followed the guide I've linked below and my frames haven't gotten much better but they are a lot more consistent. With the system specs and settings listed below I average around 107 fps dipping down into the 70's while driving/flying. Hope this helps someone!System i5 6600k 3.5ghz16gb DDR4 3000mhzGTX 980 Strix 1200mhz base clockIn game settings Screen Scale 100Anti Aliasing UltraPost Processing HighShadows LowTextures HighEffects MediumFoiliage Very LowView Distance UltraMotion Blur NoFPS increase &gt http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 966154176
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is pretty much all I want to play these days (and I just picked up the excellent Torment Tides of Numenera so that's saying a lot.). But there's nothing more terrifying and compelling than dealing with other people. I play PUBG mostly as a stealth game and it allows me to picture myself as the hero of my own narrative. I think that's kind of what everyone else is doing too(picturing themself as hero not necessarily playing like I do) so each 30 minute run is an intense joy and between the tough shooting mechanics rickety vehicles and ratcheting tension from the wall of death the game creates a lof of cool space for emergent storytelling.Best moment so far scavenging on the edge of the zone with a car parked near some buildings. I hear someone arrive and run for my car. They've gotten in too close already and are firing with a submachine gun. I'm barely armed and have no good cover so I jump into the car and floor it in their general direction. I have probably 10 meters or less to accelerate so when the car hits it's not an instant kill and they continue firing as they are pushed along by the vehicle. A harrowing second or so later they expire against a wall and I get out of the car to scavenge bandages and weapons from their pack bandage myself up and prepare for the next encounter. Just a great game with so many meaningful choices and so many different ways to approach. I don't need a good KD ratio or a consistent strategy to enjoy the hell out of it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I do like PUBG it's really good and fun. Takes practice to get better but this ios a great Battle Royale.My only concern is with the damage to players and the aiming placement.I've shot players 4 times with a Shotgun saw the blood and everything but they never went down.I've been at full HP with a Lv.2 Helmet and body armor and got one shot by a close range player with an UMP.Aimed directly at a guy and shot at him only for it to hit the tree by me or the car by me even tho the crosshair was aimed at him and not showing that small red one anywhere.But all in all game is great and worth the $30Gameplay 7Graphics 8Replay 10Addiction 10Servers 5 (Lots of connection and lag issues and not on my part)Controls 8Keep up the good work and I look forward to working with y'all on this Early Access.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Okay so this game is extremely fantastic and gets your heart pumping. HOWEVER once you get to high ranks the number of hackers is so terrible. There is a hacker in everygame and now you can even see it in the deathcam. I have had multiple times where someone would be scoped in on the ground and then snap to my head then killing me ruining my duos and solos. Not to mention I have qued into duos and squad and have gotten 2 people that spoke english in my whole time playing PUBG. Sometimes you will have lag and hit reg problems but those problems seem to be dwarfed by the hackers/cheaters. I want to love this game and I do love it but I can't recommend this game until they fix the major problem which imo is the cheaters. Only then can they start to fix the hit reg and lag issues that are present.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So far I've been playing a lot of PUBG with my friends with the U.S while I'm in Brazil and while I understand that regionlocking would prevent cheaters (apparently most of them are from the Asia server) from infesting every server I appreciate being able to play in a different server with my friends with very little delay. In this regard I feel like Bluehole has done an amazing job.As far as meeting cheaters go I haven't met one yet or maybe I don't have high enough rating to meet cheaters so in my 113 hours so far I believe I have met 0 cheaters.I think the game has a fair pricing in regards of the amount of content you get. The replayability is insane given that each match is completely different from the other. For the price that it is marketed at I think its a steal.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Well well well you've decided that its time to see what all the fuss is about. Let me be the first one to tell you that this is the best game on steam right now. There's no better and more fulfilling feeling like some Popeyes at the end of a match here. It's the most fun I've had with new gen games in a very long time. Full of content and variety in the gameplay the only thing that drags this game down is the hacks and the occasionally poor netcode. Believe me you will experience aimbots. Then you'll experience hackers. But you won't care. Simply because the game is that good. Do not fret fellow frustrated gamers Bluehole will fix the hacks... eventually. When they do I will fall in love with this game all over again. Don't expect to be #1 no matter how good you are bc/ the hackers will claim that in a heartbeat. That's why China is #1. PPL have been suggesting a gridlock for the chinese or regions in general but honestly this game just needs a better anticheat. Desperately. That is the only way the issue can be reasonably fixed. It's a 10/10 game that is being ruined by the overabundance of hackers in the top 5 percentile primarilly in third person but first is no exception. So just do the community a favor Keep Playing. kill the aimbotters and show them de wei. If they do not know de wei then you must spit on their gameplay. It will help you get better for when the game gets competitive and they fix the issue. review: I had an AMD FX 6300 + GTX 970 and I could barely run this game 50 ish FPS and the poorest quality. I couldn't tell the difference between a pixel and a player. Constant FPS drops to around 30 40 FPS. This was after the performance patch. I hear Intel users where doing much much better on a similar platform so I ugpraded.Now on a GTX 1080 + i7 7700k processor I'm doing 60+ FPS no problems.Pros This gameplay is crack. Some people fight and constantly keep moving. Unreal engine 4Cons Some people think this is an ARPG. They gear up to max ammo + armor + weapons and THEN fight. Most people KoS or shoot on sight. You are supposed to hold your fire comunicate the enemys position then take the KILL SHOT. Shooting to make noise and miss is a good way to get your hole squad killed. Looting. Most people are when it comes to this. They risk their lives and their hole squad just for loot. Doesn't even matter that they are geared. They want LOOT. They also keep looting while an enemy is engaging your team and / or killing your team mates. So yeah. I mean.... at the start of the game you get a gun and go kill someone but after that... loot. Get it from the corps of your enemies. Stability issues Server lag spikes sometimes

review: This is already a solid fun game. There are glitches yes. Hopefully these are resolved by launch though. It is still early access but at least there is a gameplan to get out of early access unlike many others. Playing this game solo keeps me on edge in a good way. It is some of the most tense gameplay I have experienced. If I see a person running at 200 meters I need to decide whether to take a shot and give up my location. Playing this with friends is an even better experience. I find it frees me up to enjoy a high risk/high reward gameplay style. Either way there are many strategies to use. Just make sure you do not spend too much time making these decisions as the game does not reward an indecisive player. All in all it is definitely worth $30.

review: Battlegrounds has the potential to grow into a true masterpiece of multiplayer gaming. It perfectly balances the feel of its gameplay between stretches of quiet downtime and moments of incredibly high adrenaline and intensity. Every match tells a story and every win feels like a huge accomplishment. The gunplay feels fantastic with heavy recoil shot leading and bullet drop so nailing a sniper headshot is extremely satisfying. The game looks pretty nice but hopefully graphics and optimization may improve over time right now framerates aren't great. The sound engine is fantastically immersive with sounds changing in their sharpness and tonality depending on direction and distance allowing you to pinpoint where shots or cars are coming from. There are even 3D sound effects for bullets whizzing past your character a really nice touch for an early alpha game. The whole package looks really promising right now and I hope the developers continue to make it even better. Right now it scores 86/100.

review: The idea of the game is good there's definitetly playability and fun things about the game. However this game was RELEASED as a paid game to the public in a very ALPHA state. The shooting mechanics are broken and if you're coming from ANY real shooter you'll be frustrated that bullet registering is non existent. The net code is very bad and you'll frequently die from lagging thru the terrain or unable to pick up anything from the ground. You'll warp and rubber band around. If you do manage to survive odds are you'll be killed by someone with a string of random numbers for a name that aimed at you across 10km and instantly headshot you. They don't do anything to prevent hackers like any real competitive game. Overall its fun at first but then you'll grow to quickly resent the game when you spend 15 minutes just picking up items just to die and do it again because of game engine problems. What's worse is that the developers have made it clear they arent focused on fixing any issues. They will not introduce region locking and the North American server is just all Chinese players which completely defeats the purpose of having a team game (can't communicate with any players). Also lag favors the person lagging since hit registration etc is client side so the same overseas people intentionally choosing a bad server for them will kill you before you can even see them on your screen. Besides this the developers have already been forcing paid loot boxes down our throats before fixing ANY issues. With the latest batch of updates ("optimizations") the render distance of terrain has become pathetic. Render distance of grass has become a joke. You can no longer lay down in a field because you are seen from anything beyond 150m (easily red dot range...). Cheaters have went down a fair amount but I am still running into them on a regular basis. I can deal with cheaters for the most part. I would rather have a well made game but thats just me.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Pretty good game i guess if you like building for 30 minutes and then loosing it right away

review: Upon entering my first game after launching My team of friends is deciding where to drop. Meanwhile all I see is the loading screen.My team drops on the map no idea where I'm still blind. Finally get sound and can tell I'm now skydiving. Team is asking where I'm going my only response can be "I don't Know." Finally load in to see I had died...PUBG had updated to where if you afk on the plane it usually brings you over a body of water and you drown if still AFK. Due to BP farmers trying to make quick cash in the steam communinty market. Only issue is I was never AFK.I used to really enjoy this game Now everytime I play all I see is new cosmetics. Bluehole removed cosmetic clothing from the map because it's non essential. If it's non essential why does the dev team only seem to be working on microtranactions? The game is dying and Bluehole is trying to milk every penny.

review: I have been playing this game on and off since it was in early access. Being in school and working doesn't allow much time for games. That being said when I had a half hour or so to have some fun whether I am skilled or not this was the my go to. Even when the bugs were running rampant it was fun as hell to play. I don't think I had ever run into someone cheating. Every time I have turned it on now there is weird going on . The last few weeks I haven't even thought about turning it on. Unless the cheating problem is somehow fixed I highly doubt I will ever play this game again. It simply isn't fun anymore. Because of all the hacking t I don't even have time to practice and weed out my bad actions. If you don't want to region lock china fine. I get not everyone in that region is a cheater and I'm sure there are cheaters in every other region including my own. give us a server that people can choose to play on if they don't want to run into cheaters. Like I said there is no reason for me to turn this on anymore.

There's 2 regions dedicated to them why do i have to consistenly play with people who dont speak a common language in the eu region in a team based game?Almost immediately i just do solo because it's annoying listening to someone spam " your mother" over and over on voice in some or other asian accent.Basically if you dont have friends to play with don't bother auto matchmaking. I can't reccomend this game to anyone other than non english speaking asians since every region is over populated with them making a team based game rather redundant for english speakers...I'm not a fan of region locking and never have been but this game is something special i can't even... China #1

review: I'm going to give this a positive review now because of the contraversy. Game is fun for the parts of it that represent a game. Microtransactions are not a part of the game they're a separate thing altogether to make your game pretty.There are lots of great games with these things like CS Dota and OW and even KF2. If I don't want them I don't buy them it really doesn't phase me regardless of what promises were made and when. You see business's need money to get bigger and better. So if a business has reached a target and have grown then they'll set another target to grow so they can reach their bigger goals. There's chance that PUBG has reached a point where it could start either getting steady or start declining. Do I know? No. I'm just thinking outside the box. But what if devs have come to understand that maybe not now but in the future to come they need to back themselves as much as possible for when it does inevitably happen? What if they want to start making more games and become a more serious company?But what this could mean is that they need to find a way to make more money so they can support this game in a bigger and better way. Me personally? I support that 'type' of thinking where their intention is legitimatly to improve and not just for their own selves but for their devoted fans. I don't agree with it if they don't put the money to improving the experience.If someone bought a piece of clothing and made the company an extra $5 which allowed them to reach a goal to improve their game in a certain way that helps most everyone who still plays the game then good on them for helping the company grow and good on the company for giving the player that 'choice' to make in supporting them for further growth.We're all human we all have bills to pay and families to feed we all have goals. If you don't support someone elses goal that's fine that's also what makes us human but this is my own personal opinion on the matter and I hope I can change the way 'some' people think about it. Even if it doesn't change their mind entirely it's a good thing to put into perspective before casting the final judgment.

review: THIS GAME IS A DRUG!!!!!Regardless of the recent s crying over micro transactions PUBG is a very fun and exciting game to play. I have way too much fun with this game and sometimes have to use the girlfriend as a foot rest as i spend lots of time playing the game late at night. So far i have found nothing wrong with this game it's fast slow enticing and a DRUG. Team work is amazing and the game provides players the scenario to be team leaders in your groups. It's fun to see a game bring back teamwork so well wether it was the point of some of the gameplay or not it's one of the main points to why i play this game a lot. I would reconmend this game to people who love intense gun fights close quaters or far. You arent safe anywhere on this hole of an island )What i would change is the physics and realism mostly the physics as some cars can spaz out harder than a COD player.Secondly this game could improve with future maps free to the community and none of this mainstream DLC Keep your game cooler than ice and give your growing fan base the respect of a true game developer should!Although there is word of a desert map coming i think we all want to see a Jungle map with all veiw distance and an Urban map for the campers to live in p Good game overall and would love to see more maps and content!

review: The game as a whole is a great experience. There is a small learning curve and not as user friendly to new players as it could be. If you don't let yourself get discouraged from not finding good loot your first time around and actually get a couple of games in I guarantee you'll find something you really love about this game. The weekly and monthly updates are a good sign that this game won't be abandoned by devs like other early access titles. My only complaint is around the graphics issues you'll face ie buildings spawning slowly and frame drops on landing unless you have a high end build but this is becoming less of an issue with fixes and tweaks in recent updates.On a side note many people are giving bad reviews because of the new payable crates that were added even though the devs said they were going to avoid this sorta thing. I understand people are upset about the paid crates but they are for a good cause as the pay for the new tournament and goes partially to charity.

review: This is like a dumbed down survival game. Now what do I mean by that is it's pretty much a survival game but your only objective is to kill or hide no temperature no hunger no resource management(except for your weapons and healing of course) only killing and being the last one alive. Pros It is pretty realistic in the killing aspect when you don't have armor on you can be killed with a couple of shots or you can get ran over by someone in a vehicle get bombarded by the incoming missiles inside the danger zone or you could be punched to death.There is a huge player base so you'll never be waiting for an eternity for someone to play with(for now anyway)Cons This game is boring quite more so if you don't have a group or someone to play with. You spend most of your time running around gathering weapons then you can choose to either run guns blazing or stealth through it. For me that is pretty dull gameplay wise I don't want to be camping waiting for people and if I go running guns blazing there's a huge chance I'm dead and that's it game over. This game is not for everyone especially with casuals is what I'm getting at if you want to enjoy this be competitive and that's not the game I'm looking for but if you are competitive by all means get this game. With that being said I refunded this game I no longer want to play it even if I do get people to play with it's just too bland for my taste. I'm not sure if they'll be adding anything new to this game as it is Early Access but I've never been so bored with a game that I bought.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have played it for a bit now and I can tell you why I didn't play more. I broke my headset while dying 2nd at the last standoff. This happens when you are a toxic player and sooooo I have to wait to buy a new one.Other than that.The game is this currently very popular King of the Hill type of game as "H1Z1 King of the Kill" "Arma 3 Battle Royal" and "The Culling". It is still released in Early Access which I didn't like about the other games aswell because there might be a lot of bugs occuring but this game does it WAY BETTER than all the others I mentioned. The service team is top and they have no real downtimes only maybe some connection probs (but not as much as in the others above). PUBG runs smoothly and is a very tactical shooter. The game is very well designed and balanced. There are very rarely times when you feel that a weapon is not as well designed as others. The newly introduced FIRST PERSON MODE really got me into playing even without headphones. I like it very much and I think this is one of the first one where the First person mode looks as good and feels as good as in PUBG. Overall if you like Battle Royal Shooter in Third Person or in First Person this is the game to go. A lot of players. Evergrowing community and overall very positive feedback.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: As a person who not that interested in multiplayer games this one got potential. Now most of the good things has been said by everyone so I'm not gonna bother saying the pros anymore. Instead I would like to share some of the things I would like to see the dev add/do to this game Add a first person only gamemode (Not saying third person is bad I just think adding this mode would add some variety to the game) Freeroam mode that lets you get familar with the map (Or just enjoy the scenery) The ability to create private server for everyone Optimize the performance More stable server (To put it kindly Asia servers aren't just the most stable thing in the world) I know this is getting old but a zombie mode would be fun (Edit With auto matchmaking system)And most importantly get rid of those microtransaction bs. Seriously look at the recent review ratio dev the community aren't pleased with your scheme and for good reason. Just remove these pointless bs for the sake of your own reputation (Though we all know at this point this would never happen).Btw don't give me excuses that this is just a small dev team that need more funding to improve the game or all the profit made from microtransaction will go to charity or something something. This game sells like freaking hotcake and the team is basically showering with freaking money at this point.But overall even with these annoying microtransactions the gameplay still doesn't suffer from it and from my point of view if a game got good gameplay that's all it needs to be recommanded and played.

review: After roughly 95 hours worth of playing PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS my thoughts and views on this game are solid.First off if you are a child adult or parent wanting buy this game make sure that you are not buying this game on any laptop unless it is built for gaming. PC is advised as this game is large and will require a good graphics card to run all settings well. My current GPU which is being used to run this game is a GeForce GTX 750 Ti although I can only run the game at 45FPS on very low settings. This game requires a lot when it comes to being able to run it. GAMEPLAY Currently there are solo duo and squads. You choose one of these modes whether you want to play with a friend or by yourself or not and then you select what camera perspective you will be in. The two options are FPP (first person) or TPP (third person). For a beginner buying this game start of TPP. After selecting out of those options you will load into a starting island on one of the two maps. The only available maps to play currently are the original green forest type map and desert rugged map. Your lobby will fill up to 100 players or near that and then you will spawn into an aircraft which will fly over the map from random angles each new game you play. There will be hotspots where there is good loot and most people will parachute out of the plane. After doing so you will parachute to your selected destination on the map this is where you need to start scavenging fast for loot. Guns medicine attatchments and gear will be spread out across the map for you to scavenge for and find. During this stage there will be a circle that appears and you need to get into it before the time limit otherwise you will take damage from the blue. The circle will appear again and smaller this time. Around this stage you will encounter other enemies and be forced to attack or run. After surviving these stages the number of people alive will drop and you will be ina very small circle eventually.... This is grind time and you need to survive to win. Sound is key in this game so make sure you have headphones or speakers to listen to gun shots and footsteps. After roughly 20 40 minutes the game will be done if you have survived this far. And you will recieve BP a currency used in game.This game is not like Fortnite please to do not think that it is this game you can drive vehicles and marine craft also you can damage other teammates compared to Fortnite. This game is very realistic and I recommend if you are going to play with friends from time to time or all the time as it makes the game more enjoyable. Survival is key. Its every man for himself sometimes so always remember that. OVERALL This game is enjoyable and far more realistic which adds challenges to how you play and where you go. Make sure you have a strong powerful computer if you would like to run this game smoothly otherwise its a total waste of money. Enjoy!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Amazing game. Great graphics fun mechanics satisfying kills adrenaline pumping ends of matches great gunplay and fun vehicles. Although buggy it is to be expected from a non full release yet and playerunknown and his team are great about always adding and improving. Of course there is the hacker problem but they have taken steps to stop them and ive only come across one. Well worth the $30 now and if i needed to i would pay $60 in the future.

review: So if you think this is a skill based game... Well it just isn't because of this reasons 1st You drop from a plane wich randomly spawns on any part of the map making so each match is a totally different thing with random facts like airdrops and loot.2nd Loot is totally random what i mean is that even if you drop on a high loot zone theres a high chance of enering a house and getting nothing (pistols or even a melee weapon)3rd My third point is positioning what i mean with this is that you could've killed 20 guys but at the end if you dont have a good positioning (hill building trees etc) you will end up losing. Ex On my last match i got 12 kills most of them with the AWM but at the end we were 4 and i ended on an open field with no trees or anything to cover with and a guy who i didn't see came behind me and insta killed me with a mini14 so wheres's the skill on that kill huh.(real case)

review: Maybe not the cleanest battle royale game out there but playing PUBG feels nice. The gameplay and controls feel impactful and not at all arcade like which for me is probably the most important when it comes to enjoying any shooter. Bugs or hackers or not PUBG is without a doubt fun to play.In spite of the "REGION LOCK CHINA" circlejerk playing in North America is virtually hacker free since they started matching players by ping. I had seen definitely 1 maybe 2 hackers since I bought the game no hackers in the last couple months.As for bugs the game fails to load in a timely manner fairly frequently for me which is annoying but it's usually only the first game. It has also crashed 3 or 4 times when alt tabbing since the last patch.Updates are coming at a decent pace I think. So long as the game's not abandoned I think they'll keep churning out content.Is it perfect? No. Is the experience worth $30 (to me)? definitely.

review: Great fun game can be somewhat slow at times unless you drop into an area where more players are likely to be. The FPP Server have been a great addition and I like to play on them rather than the original third person servers. This is a great game.Ignore the people complaining out micro transactions as they are only for cosmetic items that don't serve a real ingame purpose. Besides the money raised from this current first wave of paid for crates is going to support the prize pool at the gamescon event and also to charity. *IF* they ever added the ability to arm yourself up before dropping into the playzone via micro transactionns *then* we would be right to complain as it would make the game pay to win. As it stands it's for cosmetic items and doesn't ruin in the game for me.

review: Overall the game plays really well if you have the system specs and internet conection for it.That being said.....There is alot of problems with this game that make it not as fun as it could be.I wanted to give this a positive review I really did. After the amount of hacking I have seen and the Devs. stance on certain key issues ( being banned for unknowingly exploiting a glitch or accidently team killing too many times ) along with making loot crates monitized I cant in good concious give this game a positive review. The fact i bought this on my birthday ( end of june) and they STILL have not bothered to fix the steam friends list issue is a gross over sight by the Devs. Its an even bigger slap in the face when you stop to account for having microtransactions ( cosmetic only but still !!! the game is in beta !!!! ) it really shows where their head is at in this $$$$$$$$$$

review: Mixed review here. Mostly positive though. Obviously the game is good so rather than posting what's good about it I'm going to post a few things that may make you regret buying it 1) Gold is determined strictly on how many kills you get NOT how long you survive. You can be the 2nd person alive out of the 100 but if you only have 1 kill because you played stealthily all game you get next to no gold.2) The main menu is all kinds of buggy graphically. Do NOT leave the game open the kind of issue the game is having will caused burned images on your screen.3) There is not a wide variety of weapons but it's a good medium.

review: Game crashes every 2 seconds cars flip on nothing half the time you're getting shot at you have no idea where the shots are coming from. When you drop at a very populated area you have to pray to god almighty you get a gun before your opponents. In a scenario where two players are both holding the same shotgun aiming at each other in the chest from about 10 meters it's literally just rng who dies because since the shotguns are buckshot the pellet spread is random. In the very late game everything comes down to the randomness of where the circle closes in because if it circles in on your opponent they can chill behind a rock pressing e and q to see past it while yo uhave to run it through what is usually little to no cover. The game is so rng that on the leaderboards even the BEST players have a winrate of at most 25%. People so good at aiming and strategical play that they can have the highest win rating and end games with 20+ kills e.g grimmmz will still lose 3/4 games because the computer said so. This game is so actually unfun with the way you die half the time its from your car flipping on terrain that i assume was made in unity with blocks and semicircles and and the other half its from the circle being a tumor and you getting 1 shot from the dude with the awm who got the easiest shot on you while you had to run from tree to tree to get cover. I can only imagine people "like" this game because of the hype train and I only play it cause its the only game that me and a couple of my friends all have. Seriously if you want a battle royale game that won't make you want to commit 7 types of suicide go download h1z1 cause its so much better than this.1 Comments Subscribe t
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: In the current state this game is awful. I feel like they haven't made any sort of progress graphics wise. They expect you to spend all your BP on a box that was spent probably 3 hours on and all I get are a pair of sunglasses. The lag issues are terrible currently. I just got out of a game and while I was driving a Dacia around the buildies decided to disappear with only the stairs and window frames visible so I actually saw 2 people camping in the building. Sometimes point blank shots with a shotgun do not hit but in a replay I have they clearly did so the bullets don't register. This game is very much in the Alpha stages apparently and I would not recommend putting money into this game until it is finally stable. If I hadn't already put the time in that would make the customer service reject my ticket I would put in for a refund.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I highly recommend this game for players who are in the market for boatloads of heartache followed by moments of brief joy.Overall a fairly solid game and of course there are bugs. Some of you will whine and cry about it. Some might even quit playing but the bugs are not bad enough to ruin all your matches. Then after you win a match you will keep playing cause this game sucks you in like that but it is worth buying and playing. Just dont quit before you win atleast one match. thats when you wont be able to stop trying to win again.Also try not to be sucked into the bad reviews because of people who are upset about paid DLC. honeslty i would rather play a game that gives me the option to buy stuff (which as of right now is clothing) then play a game like battlefield that forces me to drop an additional $60 bucks just to be able to stay in the game long enough to enjoy it. I know they lied and said they wouldnt but you all know it could be worse and they could make you pay out the for in game advantages. When that happens i will gladly switch this to a thumbs down and jump on that wagon with you.

review: PUBG. I ignored this title for all these months because I thought the name sucked. Now I am sorry I waited so long. I have owned the game for three days and only played solo trying to git gud. System 4970 4.5ghz 2xgtx970s sli 16gigs ram. I let the game adjust the settings and began the play and noticed that it was great until I had an encounter with another player. IT would lag and stutter while I am trying to shoot it out with someone. I being a gamer for the last 20 years readjusted the settings down a bit and got the right combo to eliminate any lag or stutter problems. Now the game is smooth as silk but Im still dying hehe. No chicken dinners yet but I have finished top ten several times now and consistent in top 20.Yes you can tell by the graphics that this isnt an AAA title but hey you are not paying AAA title prices either. The game play is a sheit load of fun. With just a couple different maps you could play this game forever. So get rid of the HAX let the complainers move on to other games and the core base can git gud together.You can go in for a mission and get out at any time. You can take as long as you want between missions. There is only a minute or less wait once you que up. This plays into the casual gamer for sure. Anyway this is now the 414 161 review.When a AAA game maker can make a game like this with top shelf graphics it will have my money.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playerunknown's Battlegrounds or "PUBG" Steam's most played game ever a sensation.But is it worth the money?First of all you do not find any tutorial in game or a testing ground like in Arma or Battlefield where youcould test weapons etc. So the first hours of play will be trial and error with a more less steep learning curve.The most important thing will be time management When do you loot? Where do you loot (avoidance of dangerousand popular loot spots)? When do you move to the circle? The Gunplay is a bit harder than in most shooter games since you have to lead your shots for moving targets and zeroing your weapon for longer shots. Nice mixture of good gunplay and tactics.The game principle is easy. A plane with round about 80 100 players flies on a straight line over the map. At each time you are able to eject from the plane. After you land you will make your way to a gradually shrinking area which is marked with a circle on your map. If you fail to enter the area within the countdown you will get constantly damage over time. To reach the destination you can use different vehicles spawned on the map. After the introduction of the new vaulting system you are now able to climb on cars walls and especiall through windows. This brings new CQC tactics into the game love it. The car physics is imo not that good. It is very easy to flip and die especially with the motorcycle because you hit a little tiny rock. With 1.0 release the car physics and vehicle sound got a bit better (i really like the new van found on the new desert map). Although there are only 2 maps available right now the game is not very repititive due to the fact that the plane flies different routes and that the circle ends up at a different location every game too every match you play feels different. However you can not choose between the 2 maps at the current state. The randomly chosen map leads to emptier rooms than usual caused by people who want to play one specific map and therefore leaving the lobby. The developer already rows back and said that you will be able to choose which map you want to play in the near future.The available mode variety is very big. You can play first or third person alone duo or as a squad on both maps.Most problem of the third person mode is the fact of house camping. That is why I recommend to play in first person mode where both sides have neither advantages nor disadvantages. There is also a good item variety. You can find 5 different assault rifles 5 different sniper rifles 3 different MP's and shotguns. All weapons are well balanced feel great and can be customized with a bunch of different attachments (can also be found on the map) as well. Nevertheless you can also find some op loot which is randomly getting dropped by a plane and is heavily contested. Beside weapons healing stuff and attachments there is also clothing loot available. Sometimes it lies directly under a weapon and you accidentally grab some shoes instead of the weapon in a dangerous situation. Imo clothing loot should be deleted.On graphics point of view the new desert map offers more variation of buildings better ground textures and more level details but is not comparable to e.g. GTA V. Biggest criticism is the distance visability of the environment. For example you are laying on the ground in thick grass and the enemy who is sitting 200m away from you just sees plain leafless ground instead and can easily spot and kill you.The servers are less laggy since the full release but optimization is still the biggest issue of the game. With a GTX 1070 and an i7 7700 I still only have a stable 40 fps or less on 1080p with low settings. Especially at the beginning of the match desync rubber banding lags and bugs are the daily agenda. You are getting stuck with the parachute and getting damage by landing. Or it is lagging so hard that you can not loot equipment and therefore you lose the first battle if someone drops near your landing zone. Furthermore I experienced a considerable increase of crashes after 1.0 release.Although PUBG is a well balanced game with great potential and a lot of fun especially with friends optimization is big problem in the current build. If you cope with that you will get a challenging and fun game. All others should definitely wait until the game is more optimizied.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 1) unoptimized2) updates are slow3) hackers4) so many hackers5) did i mention hackers?I've played 5 games in a row and only 1 game had no hackers. rest had silent aimbots (the type of aimbot where no matter where you're aiming the shot will land either on headshot or body shot. This can be applied to grenades as well) blatant rage hackers (aimbot speed hacks and no recoil hacks). I don't recommend this game in the state that it's in. Back when it was still in early access when i first played it was truly fun. But now it seems to be getting worse with hackers. every lobby is filled with them. I only bother playing now when my friends are on. If you play solo don't bother. Hackers will ruin your day
