review: I will start off by saying that I do recommend this game. However this game is far from perfect and I dont know how well it will fair over time because of certain gameplay elements but feel I should highlight some of the cons as well as pros after roughly 38 hours played.Pros The game creates very heart pounding moments especially near the end of the match. It has a pretty good asortment of weapons (a new weapon is added every month). The weapon attachment system is cool with lots of options on what loadout to run with assuming you can find the loot to do it. It is best when you play with a friend or in squads with multiple people. The game can be very tactical and that makes it satisfying to outplay enemies that way.Cons Since this game is early access it has a ton of bugs and glitches. (These are to be expected and if you can't deal with that then don't buy early access games). The game isn't very well optimized right now. I run at all very low settings except textures at high and get 40 60 fps on a 1060 graphics card. The game also stutters a lot especially at the beginning of a match. The ping feels like it really high at times. The sounds can sometimes be a bit off. The bullet sounds are a big complaint of mine at the moment. Specifically the sounds the bullets make when they fly past you. Everytime you are shot you will hear 2 sounds. The bullet flying past you making a "crack" sounds and the shot of the gun. However the sound of the bullet flying past is so loud and sudden that you often can't hear the actual gun shot so it leaves you not knowing where you are being shot from. Many times I have been either running or sitting at cover and start getting shot and have no idea where its from because I cant hear the shots and end of dying to somebody I never saw. And that brings up my next point. You can play a whole match spend about 20 to 30 minutes in a game and see not a single player and then end up dying to somebody you never saw because they happened to be hiding in the right bush. The games RNG elements can make it very unsatisfying sometimes. I have had games where this thing has happened and it just leaves me feeling like I just wasted a half an hour. A lot of these issues however are only in solo play as squads is a bit more forgiving in terms of getting into fire fights as you get put into a knock out stage before actaully dying. As I said before try to play in duos or squads.This game overall is good. I would rate it a 7/10. Once all of the performance issues are worked out I would give it an 8. This is mainly due to the gameplay issues I have mentioned as well as the whole premise of the game does not lend itself to a very skill based system. Sure its good to be skillful with guns and aim and knowing certain tactics but a big part of the game is completly random. Loot drops vehical spawns and most of all the circle and where it ends up. All of these limit how far skill can take you. Theres game where you can sit in a house for 20 minutes because the circle keeps spawning around you and other games where you have to traverse the whole map. However with all of that said I still do recommend this game just be aware that it has problems and you should be aware of them going into this game.EDIT I would not worry about the mirco transactions that have been added. They are completly cosmetic and have no actual gameplay effects. There is no pay to win.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: All I see are a bunch of haters. I don't think they hate the game but just need to be hating on something. Overall this game is fun for me. I get my kicked and sometimes I do the kicking. The game isn't perfect but it's still a great game that puts new content into it on a monthly basis. Playerunknown and PUBG are very active on Twiter informing everyone of good and bad news. This is what gamers want to see from a developer. Listening and communicating. This is an early access game and I only see it getting better. Custom Servers with game moding. The potential is huge for PUBG.Ignore the haters because who really cares if people buy gear. Yes it's out in Early Access but people want it. The number of people buying the gear are doing this because they really enjoy the game. I know for me it's worth it. If you like survival 3rd and 1st person shooters guns shooting guys in the head with a KAR98 strategy running idiots over blah blah blah get this game. Watch streamers play to see for yourself. It's a good game that is worth the $30 and more.

review: I think that this is actually a really good game however has a massive amount of issues. There are a lot of really bad things about this game. One of the more peresonal issues is the extremly quick time to kill (1 to the head without a helmet for most guns). I do not like many quick times to kill and I think that in PUBG it feels really bad as your 30 minute quest for loot can be ended by a single guy you didnt even see. Also the randomness. Now this is not as big of an issue for me but it very annoying when so much of the game is based off of randomness. Where the plane flys determines where you can drop. Random. What guns you can get is detrimened by RNG. Random. How many players you find throught the match. Random. Basiclly everything about your game is random. The movement system in this game might also be the worst movement system I have seen in any game. Ever. It feels clunky and slow and you often jump at things and just miss and then need to run 10 feet back so you can clear it. The whole things feels awful. That being said however the game itself is a lot of fun. It feels rewarding to get a kill and obtaining guns can be fun. I really like this game and for only $30 i feel like I have to reccomend it. The game is a lot of fun however the one thing that you need to be aware of is that it takes a long time to get good at this game. It probably took me around the 30 hour mark to be able to consistantly get even a single kill per game. That being said when you do get good at the game you can stomp on the lower players and win a large amount of the time. This game is best played with a group of your friends however it is still fun solo.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: ENGLISH At first they set a date for the end of the Early Access they promised not to monetize the game during this period and weekly updates after several million dollars won everything is a lie. They eliminated the end date of the Early Access the game gets worse with each new update while they focus on optimizing the box purchase system (with real money) and today they have eliminated the weekly updates. THEREFORE I DON'T RECOMMEND TO PURCHASE THIS GAME.ESPAÑOL Al principio pusieron una fecha para el fin del Early Access prometieron no monetizar el juego durante este periodo y actualizaciones semanales después de varios millones de dólares ganados todo es mentira. Han eliminado la fecha del fin de Early Access el juego empeora con cada nueva actualizacion mientras ellos se centran en optimizar el sistema de compra de cajas (con dinero real) y hoy han eliminado las actualizaciones semanales. POR TODO ESTO NO RECOMIENDO COMPRAR ESTE JUEGO.

review: To be honest the game as of the latest update is unplayable and the developers did something that they said they wouldn't do. But I also believe that most people are a little butt hurt. The game is fun I really do enjoy the game. This game has something that I haven't felt in a long time with most games. I don't know if it is the thrill of survival and killing other people or that every match is a different story that you as a player partake in.I do know that the developers are doing all they can to make this game fun and fix all the bugs that are in the game. Some things take a longer time to fix than others and I personally know that with fixing bugs you are likely to break something else. But I do believe that the game is going to be better in the future.If you want to buy the game stay in touch with the reddit page. There you can find everything you want to know and if the game is playable in the current state. As for me I enjoy the game and I think you will too. review: The idea to this game is incredinly simple. Kill everyone till you are the last alive. It really is a fun game if you are up for a challenge. I see many people buy the game cause there favorite youtuber plays it and they go into it shooting everything they see like they are playing Call of Duty. While you can find success just running and shooting the best game play comes from when you carefully plan an attack and it goes to plan. With that said when your plan goes south chaos quickly envolops everything and that is just as fun. The controls feel good and seem to get better with each update. It is still an early access game so do expect bugs. There are very frustrating times when you land and have to wait for the buildings to render in this is ecspecialy frusturating when you land near other people. With each update this problem seems to occur less and less for me personally. If you a looking for a good shooter that can go from everything being silent to everything around you erupting in a symphony of gun fire or having to make split second decisions that end in life or death than this game is for you.

review: For it's full release the game has improved quite a bit though it still has problems. The game is still horribly optimized and the minimum requirements listed on steam do not feel very accurate. With a gtx 1080 nvidia reccommends everything to be set on the lowest possible settings so I would ignore those suggestions if you are using the geforce experience so there is a disjoint in the settings with the driver as nvidia claims the game can be ran at ultimate settings on 1920x1080 on their website. So if you can handle the still constant crashing and a very vague 'optimal settings' from both the game and nvidia then you will be fine otherwise steer clear of this for a long while.

review: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is loosely based on the mechanics of CounterStrike combined with the world size of an RPG. Each match pits one hundred players against... each other. Last man standing wins! Of course the chance of you winning is so ridiculously low that it's a major challenge which is part of the fun. This is a hard game. You will die repeatedly starting out and rarely in a "fair fight". Except for this one time when a guy tried to box me when I had a shotgun in the first minute. That was a fair fight for me. Players can camp hide lay traps and hide sneak up on you etc. Unlike Counterstrike players can heal with first aid kits. But like Counterstrike when you die there are no continues the match is over and you can't even spectate.Players can camp in one area through most of the game but there is a circle of death that shrinks around the play area forcing firefights until only one player is left. Body armor reduces damage guns can be upgraded with sights and stabilizers backpacks let you carry more supplies energy drinks heal slowly over time and cars can be used to rapidly traverse terrain. Or run players over.9/10. Despite being an early access game it's very polished although it crashes whenever I try to overclock my graphics card.There is some controversy over in app purchases and I agree that they should be removed if they tilt the game in favor of people that buy them. But the rest of the game is very polished.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: While I like playing the game itself I can't recommend people buy it. The big reason why is that they introduced microtransactions into the game when the game itself is still early access. There are many other things that need fixed in the game for it to be considered ready for full release and what is being done instead? Paid crates and keys I tell you. Not only is it bad that you have to pay for them but I rarely see anyone get anything good out of them. I watch streams that open crates and they repeatedly get the same garbage items out of the crates. Velcro shoes anyone? Its just sad to see a game with so much potential and already making a bunch of money off of game sales itself go down this path. I hope they wise up but greed is often too hard to resist so they won't.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I do recommend this game but I do not recommend buying it in it's current state.This game can be a lot of fun and definitely rocket strapped the "Battle Royale" genre. I've had awesome times on here with my friends and even playing solo but I would not recommend it now to anyone who has no bought it yet. There are better alternatives out there now that run better and have dev's who actually care about the product.In the pre release it was understandable that the game had optimisation issues bugs all sorts of problems and that even made for some good laughs at times. But to release the game as "full version/official release" in the same condition with no real fixes was pretty bad. For the amount of money this game made the developing company they could've had hudreds of people working on it but Bluehole instead like so many other games decided micro transactions where more important than a playable game.Basically this game in it's current state is not worth $30USD you'd be better off playing Fortnite. Which just for the record I haven't played and probably won't. What I'm saying is you buy this game right now and you will be let down by poor optimisation bugs memory leaks and endless waves of hackers and cheaters. In the unlikely event that in the future these things are all fixed then I 100% recommend this game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Ram packed with cheaters at the moment! There's no possible way anyone can recommend spending so much money on this game in its current state even in early access. I play on a GTX 1080 on a decent system and only sometimes sit at a stable 60 fps with all my settings on LOW. But with other players and cars close i drop between 30 40. Whenever we seem to get into a gunfight i drop to sometimes 11fps or lower.So many bugs in this game need fixing and alot of improvements are being released slowly over time I will update this review as updates roll out but until server performance is improved and game stability is improved I do NOT reccomend this game.When you load into a game and finally find a decent team who communicate well and play well you spend half an hour struggling in in game voice chat trying to explain their steam profile links there isn't a way to report anyone theres no on site messaging system or anyway for you to simply click a button and be on their steam profile!All bugs and crashes aside and this game has a very big following with very many active players per week. I feel that once this game is fully optimized it'll truly be an awesome game but until then its a real waste of money.EDIT The game is finally some sorts of stable. You still get the occasional crash but nothing major.Only dissapointing thing is the fact the developer stated he wasn't going to add micro transactions till full release but has now brought in a crate and key type system. IS $150MILLION NOT ENOUGH?!

review: You'll probably enjoy it for the first week or so especially if you're playing with friends. After that the glaring problems really start to wear down the fun. The game has potential but I can't recommend this game until a few core issues are fixed. Cheating Horrrible. Unacceptable. Rampant. I'll admit region locking (see below) would help out but that's just a bandaid. I know they are trying but they need to do more. Region lock For the love of God please region lock the servers. No it isn't xenophobic to not want people on the other side of the planet playing on your data center. The netcode in this game is already terrible and people with a horrible ping make the problem so much worse. Sometimes you can't tell if your death cam is a result of cheating or because the enemy is physically 7000 miles away using a 28.8 modem. Engine It's pretty bad. I've never played such a clunky iteration of the Unreal engine before. Performance is sketchy even on decent rigs. Movement feels really wonky sometimes especially when you're landing your parachute or driving a vehicle. Riding your motorcycle over rock at the wrong angle can quickly turn your bike into space vehicle. Trying to shoot through things like windows with bars or railings is frustrating. I love unloading my magazine into a player only to realize every bullet was stopped by an invisible force field surrounding the railing on a stairwell. Loot boxes This is really minor but still kinda boggles my mind. Why bother putting reward crates in your game if 99% of them contain duplicates of the same ragged beige pants or grey shirt? I'd prefer the crate system just be removed entirely. Removing the incentive to farm that super rare miniskirt that sells on Steam for like $400 might just clean out a few of the farming cheaters.Overall thoughts is that the game is a solid idea with poor execution. I look forward to when someone else comes along and executes the genre with a level of Blizzard polish. Fortnite is already pretty close even though I'm not a huge fan of the game's art style.

review: This game is by far the worst of the "Early Access" generation. Although now considered "released" this game is by far no where near in a playable state. With Constant Netcode issues lag cheaters and overall poor performance hindering what the game could be. This generation of just throwing your literal at the screen and releasing it to the public has become a blight on the video game community.The pros Fun game to play with friends Battle Royale Better than H1Z1 by farThe cons Sounds are extremely wonky Driving into a tiny rock and taking half your health in damage Play for 25 minutes to get shot and killed while behind cover Close Quarters is extremely inconsistant It's RNG if you're going to win a gun fight Cheaters by the boat loads Horrible netcode issues Extremely poor performance Unprofessional DevelopersWhile this game could be fun and has a lot of fun elements it simply feels like high school programming class project. The sheer levels of unprofessionalism coming from the developers and the release of 1.0 is just abhorred. To consider this game a fully released game is simply wrong it is not a finished product and you should know you are still buying an early access indie game.

review: I just started playing this game and am really enjoying it so far. I have less than 10 hours into it and have already made it to the top 10 in a couple of matches. I'm not quite at 1 1 due to spending the first couple of matches figuring out the controls and the gameplay dynamics.The game rewards tactical game play more so than run and gun. Someone on reddit pointed out "The only fight that matters is the last one." While it is fun to dive into the middle of a city and gun it out with a couple other people the real key to winning seems to be taking a more laid back approach stalking your targets and only fighting when you absolutely have to.The voice comms during pre game are pretty annoying but those seem to end once the game starts. I'm not sure if that is by design but I think it is. Voice comm does not seem to be server wide. At least it does not seem like the same people who are spamming music and whatever during the lobby are doing it during the game.I hope that this game takes off and becomes a major success. The premise is a great one.

review: Finally my first steam review ever! After 200+ hours on the main build and 30 or so more on the test server I can say that I'm incredibly proud of Bluehole for using early access the way that it was meant to be used. The only time I think the negative early access reviews were accurate were when paid keys were introduced after they promised none of that until 1.0 and when Tencent stepped in and put in advertisements over the chinese players screens. All the other negative feedback prior to the 1.0 launch is completely bogus if you ask me. This game got better and better every early access patch that came out because it was being co developed by the community and now here at 1.0 we have reached a very well polished and well optimized build of the game Bluehole didn't do what so many developers do nowadays by launching early access making a lot of money and cashing out. They had their minds set and they made it reality and wow did they do a good job.As for the game itself There's a very fine line that realistic shooters need to dance on in terms realism and determining what realistic elements need to go in order to make the game enjoyable and this game does this perfectly. For example the bullets coming out of the barrel forcing you to take a step back from a window if you're too close LOVE IT! but also sacrifices realistic elements like backpack space and unlimited sprint I wouldn't want to play a game where I could literally only hold what would realistically fit in my backpack and thank god all players are triathalon athletes because when I can't find a vehicle I set my auto run and head for the hills the maps are huge after all. The gunfights feel so good and so fair you will feel yourself getting better the more you play this game your combat techniques will improve your looting techniques will improve and you'll learn intriquite little things that all add up to make you a better player rewarding you for the hundreds of hours you have put into the game while still giving you that high adrenaline octane feeling when you've made it to the endgame and you're battleing players the blue zone and strategy all in a short amount of time. There are little things that I get annoyed with at this game like waiting for a game to start all to land and get my head blown off by a shotgun meanwhile I'm fully kitted with some fingerless gloves but for the first time in a long time I've been excited to come home to this game and have designated full days to play this with my friends and have lost countless hours because that "one more game" went all the way to the wire or just because it turns into multiple games.Overall get this game. $30 is well worth this masterpiece and you'll have fun playing it no doubt and the best part is that this is only the beginning! Your $30 investment will grow as more content gets added to the game and gets even furthur optimized. Again thank you Bluehole/PUBGcorp/Greene for not letting the community down with a quickly thrown together early access title. Expect hundreds and hundreds moure hours out of me both on PC and Xbox. See you on the Battleground.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS
